review_content: Bottle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is grainy, a bit papery. Taste is the same, not much there, but no real flaws either. Oily mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Not terrible.
Clear golden color. Topical mass product beer. Very dry with high carbonation. Very light aroma and light taste of wheat. Can be drunk like water.

0,5 l can. Pours crystal clear light yellow with big, quickly and loudly disappearing white head. Aroma is very light, just some faint cardboard. Taste is medium sweet and very light bitter. Body is light, carbonation lively. Finish is short and unremarkable. Pointless, but not overly offensive.

Dorada, transparente, brillante, clara, espuma de muy poca duración, poco carbonatada, muy aguada, es difícil percibir aromas, huele levemente a Malta y hierbas, levemente dulce, no es amarga, en todo caso mejor que la bbc honey
Clear yellow colored beer with a small white head, that quickly disapears. Taste is verry sweet, watery, low bitternes.

The only reason I scored it 0.5 is because the website didn't let me put all ratings to 0. Just plain disgusting. If horrible is a tase, then that's what it tastes like. Can't even finish a 355ml can. Aroma: crap, Appearance: morning pee, Tast: aweful, Mouthfeel: like throwing-up, Overall: I will never buy this. The Bud Light is even worse, might as well drink water. I think any of the Labatt's or Molson products all have about the same level of poor quality beer.

Color amarillo pálido transparente con espuma medio-alta blanca de poca retención y residuo nulo. Aroma a arroz y metal con notas a lúpulo noble y minerales. Sabor a cereal o maíz y arroz con notas a lúpulo noble y minerales. Dulzor medio, alcohol medio-ligero y amargor ligero con regusto corto. Textura acuosa, cuerpo ligero y carbonatación media. Una American Lager de apariencia aguada, sabor a arroz y poca malta, además de olor a lata. Despropósito.
Aroma hint of malt, grain and corn but not a lot else. Taste of nothing really and moderate carbonation. Palate cleanser at best.
Tastes of literally nothing, quite impressive. In a crowded field it manages to be the worst lager. Dreadful.
Aroma 4. Appearance 3. Taste 3. Palate 2. Overall 7. Malt and sweet aroma. Taste of water with a hint of crisp. "You cannot taste bad if you have no taste".

355ml can @ Casa de Mi Polola. Pours a clear golden colour with a medium white head. Nose is very light malts. Flavour is very much as the nose, sweet light malt. Light bodied, good carbonation, and a moderate sweetness with an lasting malt flavour on the palate. Sweetened beer water.

While having an Indian meal in bring your own bottle restaurant, the couple next to me had to leave to go to a theatre performance. The man had 2 Budweisers left over and asked if I wanted them.  I said I was not a fan of lager but I could find somewone who would like them maybe.  When leaving the restaurant I passed some homeless people and asked if they would like the beers.  They said yes please but when they saw it was Budweiser, they said no thanks, saying that they were not that desperate!  I apologised for insulting them and went to a local shop and bought them a few decent beers which were appreciated.  As far as I am aware the 2 cans of Bud are still in my brother in law's cupboard, several years later.  True story.
Old rating from 2014 - 330ml bottle, pours dark golden with a white head. Aromas & tastes of corn, grain, cereal & flora. Moderate body. Sweet malty finish
Generally of a corn flavor. But be shot for everything can be related to a beer. Not a good beer because we are not factoring in price here :>

Cerveza amarilla muy pálida y muy brillante, una de las cervezas más transparentes que he probado. Espuma blanca y poco persistente.
En aroma, verdura cocida y masa de pan. Algo dulce y un recuerdo a manzana.
Sabor bastante dulce con amargor casi inapreciable.
Burbuja gruesa y bastante carbonatada. El final no es muy seco para una Pale Lager. Se queda un regusto dulce.
Una cerveza para todos los públicos pero pobre en muchos aspectos.
Bottle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is grainy, a bit papery. Taste is the same, not much there, but no real flaws either. Oily mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Not terrible.
Clear golden color. Topical mass product beer. Very dry with high carbonation. Very light aroma and light taste of wheat. Can be drunk like water.

0,5 l can. Pours crystal clear light yellow with big, quickly and loudly disappearing white head. Aroma is very light, just some faint cardboard. Taste is medium sweet and very light bitter. Body is light, carbonation lively. Finish is short and unremarkable.…

Dorada, transparente, brillante, clara, espuma de muy poca duración, poco carbonatada, muy aguada, es difícil percibir aromas, huele levemente a Malta y hierbas, levemente dulce, no es amarga, en todo caso mejor que la bbc honey
Clear yellow colored beer with a small white head, that quickly disapears. Taste is verry sweet, watery, low bitternes.

The only reason I scored it 0.5 is because the website didn't let me put all ratings to 0. Just plain disgusting. If horrible is a tase, then that's what it tastes like. Can't even finish a 355ml can. Aroma: crap, Appearance: morning pee, Tast: aweful, Mouthfeel: like…

Aroma hint of malt, grain and corn but not a lot else. Taste of nothing really and moderate carbonation. Palate cleanser at best.
Tastes of literally nothing, quite impressive. In a crowded field it manages to be the worst lager. Dreadful.
Aroma 4. Appearance 3. Taste 3. Palate 2. Overall 7. Malt and sweet aroma. Taste of water with a hint of crisp. "You cannot taste bad if you have no taste".

355ml can @ Casa de Mi Polola. Pours a clear golden colour with a medium white head. Nose is very light malts. Flavour is very much as the nose, sweet light malt. Light bodied, good carbonation, and a moderate sweetness with an lasting malt flavour on…

While having an Indian meal in bring your own bottle restaurant, the couple next to me had to leave to go to a theatre performance. The man had 2 Budweisers left over and asked if I wanted them. I said I was not a fan of lager but I could find somewone who…
Old rating from 2014 - 330ml bottle, pours dark golden with a white head. Aromas & tastes of corn, grain, cereal & flora. Moderate body. Sweet malty finish
Generally of a corn flavor. But be shot for everything can be related to a beer. Not a good beer because we are not factoring in price here :>

Cerveza amarilla muy pálida y muy brillante, una de las cervezas más transparentes que he probado. Espuma blanca y poco persistente. En aroma, verdura cocida y masa de pan. Algo dulce y un recuerdo a manzana.…

Hard not to root for the Anheuser-Busch brand being from the St Louis area, but this one isn't one of my favorites of theirs. Not terrible by any means, and is easy to drink, but man this one just doesn't really stand out in any interesting way. The "easy bet" beer as I would say, as if I have a get together and beers are involved, this one would be one that I could pick out and most everyone would at least be content with.

Originally designed from a strong Czech pilsner recipe, this beer has strayed far off the path.  Pours clear golden with a three finger, white head.  Aroma is corn and faint hope.  Taste is corn sweetness (which is at least a little better than corn syrup), moving to grassy hops.  Finish is corn and grass.

Inte mycket smak med de man känner är de Inge fel på. Servera gärna kyld.
Aningen för blaskig för mig.
Vattnig öl med lite smak men den smaken som fanns var det inget fel på vilket är en skam då den bara hade behövt lite mer fyllighet för att få högre betyg.

Color dorado claro, espuma delicada o fina de corta duración y poca altura. Tiene un aroma dulce que personalmente no me molesta. Su carbonatación no es alta, lo que ayuda a destacar ese cuerpo ligero. Es una típica cerveza refrescante para tomar de paso, sin complejidades.
Pale golden color, medium sized white head. Aromas of rice and malt. Crisp taste with rice and malt. One-dimensional, but ok for what it is.
Bière 33 cl obtenue dans une box. Elle est célèbre mais je ne sais pas bien pourquoi, elle n'a absolument rien de notable. Ça passe quand on a très soif et pas envie de bière. (M)
Bière inutile, une légère carbonatation et après c'est plat, j'aurais plutôt dit "kind of beer" plutôt que "king of beer"..

Blond pale limpide, fine mousse blanche abondante. Arômes : caramel, épices, poivre, agrume, amertume floral bien(trop) présente. Recette manque d'équilibre dans les saveurs, beaucoup trop sucré et manque de longueur.
Brewed in Russia. Sweet malt water. Better to drink mineral water or non-alcoholic beer instead!
Ahhh.. where it all began.. what can you say other than it’s a drinkable mainstream beer!!! No strong flavours or standout features... but can’t really knock it

Medium/light, averagely balanced nuances of sweetish corn malt and some German-like hops. Alcohol comes trough a bit. Medium/narrow taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with light corn. Light body with medium carbonation. Overall, bulk-like and sweet. 4 2 3 2 5
A starter beer! Not much taste! Easy to drink on long night out! Very basic & non offensive taste!

Botella 0,25L Dorada,clara,espuma blanca,fina,alta,retencion media.Aroma malta,herbal.Sabor ligero amargor,malta,herbal.Una lager industrial,corriente sin nada especial.
Earlier Rating: 2/16/2018 Total Score: 2
Botella 0,33l Color dorada con espuma blanca, alta, regular, media resistente.Aroma malta.Sabor malta,ligero amargor.

The aroma barely come out. You get some malty and some hops there. The taste was very sweet and the aftertaste give you some kind bittersweet finish. The beer is really very sweet. Is like they put many sugar or caramel in the beer and i don't enjoy that. The beer is slightly watery (but i have drink more watery beers). The carboration is very soft.
Overall not the best "Lager" i have drink but for sure i have drink worst "Lager beers".

APARÊNCIA
dourado, translúcido.
espuma branca de média formação e baixa persistência.
AROMA
cereais.
SABOR
cereais e dulçor moderado.
SENSAÇÃO
corpo baixo e média carbonatação.
A full-flavoured lager, aromas of honey and notes of malt and hops with crisp and clean finish
Lager, który jest do dupy. Słabiutkie, wodniste, nieprzyjemne, szmaciane. Nie pijcie.
Little Better than Bud light but still same taste like Bud light but it’s not too terrible thou
Notée 0 sur ce site, c'est vrai qu'elle est basique. Maintenant, j'ai vu pire, je l'ai bu quand même c'est la canicule.
Honestly, it's fine. Craft beer fans stay away, too basic for your civilized tastes. I prefer rolling rock or MGD if we're talking basic lagers, but this works.
Une petite bière surprenante avec un goût appréciable. Une bien belle découverte.
Plechovka Bud kupena u Waltera v Raci. Husto napenilo. Vona slaba sladova. Zlatista farba. Chut slaba nezaijimava vodovo sladova. Bleq.
From twist-top bottle (BB Nov'20) in shaker. Pours clear pale gold w/1 cm of foam that faded, almost no aroma. Still had forward CO2 body that masked a dull finish. Happy 4th!

20/11/20 Aromat zapach słodowy z lekkim chmielem nic specjalnego
Słomkowe klarowne, Piana biała, dość obfita opadająca.
Smak zbożowy słodki bez goryczki właściwie.
Nagazowanie duże, orzeźwiające, lekkie, finisz słodowy.
Ogólnie piwo jak iwo lagier jak się patrzy gładki bez udziwnień lekki i bez smaku schłodzony i świeży można wypić

I wish I liked it, but Bud heavy is awful.  It is fairly light and not terribly tasting, but there are so many other options to choose besides this. This is also the only beer that gives me a sore throat and runny nose if I drink in any quantity.  Not worth it.

Aroma - slight honey and malt.
Basically it's hard to catch the aroma and flavor - a very light lager
Fine to be an everyday beer but you could've got a better option with the same price.
Very light pale colour. Medium carbonation. Sweet notes, rice and malt. Good thirst quencher but nothing else.

660ml bottle. Pours a weak gold moderate carbonation. Light aroma of malt and grain. Taste of malt, grain and sweetness but mostly water. Aftertaste of bitter hops. Seriously unbalanced lager. Its managed to lack flavour while not being that easy to drink which is the worst of both worlds.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Light golden with a white head. Aroma and some taste of hay. Balanced.

Color pis (lo siento, pero sí), como cerveza de trigo belga diluida. Mucha espuma, que se marcha enseguida, y mucha burbuja.
Olor casi inexistente, pero al menos no molesta.
Sabor ligero, como que estás bebiendo agua. Es recomendable para las tardes en la terraza del jardín en verano, muy fría. Aunque es más cara que las lager españolas y eso le resta puntos, al ser tan suave e insípida puede ser una buena opción porque gusta incluso a los que no toman cerveza. Al menos, no tiene demasiado gas.

Nice beer to have out in the garden when the sun is shinning. Strange rating for me, first sip I find can be quite nasty but then the 2nd sip, 3rd sip and rest of the bottle can taste glorious. 
A beer I can enjoy in a beer garden also.
Kolor jasniutki, piana znika błyskawicznie. Delikatny aromat, w smaku słodkawa woda. No cóż....

[Blind pilsner tasting - Beder]

Aroma: Hay, pineapple and nothing else

Appearance: Golden yellow with no head

Taste: Mildly sweet and bitter, hay and pineapple

Mouthfeel: Mouthfeel is watery with no carbonation

Overall: Insanely boring beer :)
Tasted this beer. Drinkable to Pink Floyd, Elbow and other great bands. Remember to enjoy your beer in company with good friends.

Nice beer i like it yes 
Very nice taste haha yes very good heheh niice funny
Ouch, not good... pale smell and taste. Artificial sweetness. Flat. Watery. Unbalanced. Not nice. "King of Beers"? Well, maybe in the land of the alcohol-free beers.
barwa jasno zlota piana skompa szybko znika do zera. aromat slodowy. smak slodowosc wodnisty. wysyceni zawysokie szczypie wjezyk. goryczka niska
En klassiker. Syntes nesten den hadde et hint av eple en liten periode der. Veldig god øl. Sikker. Og smaker som øl skal.
Probably a good beer to give to someone who says they don’t like beer. The bland, completely inoffensive taste will make them curious to try real beer.
SKÅL, CHEERS, SALUT, KIPPIS, YAMAS, L’CHAIM, PROOST,  SALUTE, KANPAI 🍻🙏😎

Barwa: słomkowa, klarowne. Piana średnia, szybko redukuje siędo zera.

Aromat: słodowe, chlebowe, niezbyt intensywnie, ale też bez wad.

Smak: woda, woda, woda...lekko zaznaczona słodowość. Wysycenie wysokie, wodniste, bez wyrazu, bez smaku, gazowana woda...

Bottle from Albert Heijn.
Beer is clear yellow golden colored with small, unstable foam. Average carbonation.
Aroma of malts, grains, bread, light hops, spices.
Taste is Sweet malts, grains and water. Leaves a light hop bitterness.
Finish is light bitter and lots of water. Mweh.

Słomkowe, klarowne piwo o średniej pianie, która dość szybko redukuje się do zera. Aromat i smak bardzo nikły, jedynie gdzieś w tle majaczy słód. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie piwu blisko w odbiorze do gazowanej wody, jedyna jego zaleta to, że nie ma wyczuwalnych wad.
Mad beer, would recommend drinking this stuff in the morning after a gnarly sesh, wicked stuff that

amber colour, white head that disappears quickly, leaves no residue
visible carbonation
caramel sweet nose, yeast, non-descript
oily mouthfeel, lightly carbonated
apple-sweet taste, very slight
can be drunk for the sake of drinking something alcoholic
Banana, light hoppyness, refreshing and sweet. This beer is completely drinkable and doesn't deserve this hate. A zero? No Lol...

Kolor słomkowy, klarowny. Piana biała, wysoka, średnio trwała.
Aromat delikatnie słodowy, nieco słodki.
Smak podobnie jak aromat słodowy i co najważniejsze nie śmierdzi.
Wysycenie średnie do wysokiego, Ciało na poziomie średnim.
Ocena taka ogólna wystawiona, bez żadnych dokładnych notatek. Do wypicia, ale tylko od biedy.
Jasnozłociste, klarowne piwo. Piana słaba. Aromat nikły, delikatna nuta kwiatów. W smaku wodniste, cienkie i bez wyrazu. Mocno nasycone, zapychające, goryczki brak.
Słabe, wodniste, bez nadzwyczajnego aromatu i smaku. Takie jakieś kukurydziane, chmiel praktycznie nie wyczuwalny. Bardzo jasne, mocno przefiltrowane. Piana ładna.

Nao sei o que aconteceu, antes da AmBev comprar tinha memorias da cerveja ser melhor, ou era porque estava adentrando nesse mundo das cervejas recentemente e tinha um olhar nostalgico. Muito aguada e sem nenhum gosto incomum, ta pau a pau com as nacionais
Nutka słodu i lekka siarka w zapachu. W smaku niewiele da się wskazać poza wodą, no może jakieś minimum słodowości. Nie będę nawet szukał goryczki. Jak piwo rozcieńczone wodą gazowaną

$3.50 bottle at an Inn in mid 2019. "King of beers"? No, it is simply corporate megaswill so it gets 0.5.

Honestly it is not too different from Aussie megaswill which you only drink when desperate.

Oko: bardzo jasne (2 EBC najwyżej). Piana obfita, ale nie utrzymuje się zbyt długo.        
Nos: słód, lekka siarka.         
Usta: jak w tym dowcipie: seks w kajaku. Słodycz i Pustka. Po prostu woda z maltozą.

There is no taste. Bland, boring, and forgettable. To be kind, there are no off flavours and there is nothing offensive. The cleanness is, however, not enough to remotely save this beer. There is lacing on the head, but it disappears so fast.
Very salty and appearance of plenty of sulfur. Is it devil's beer? Nausea introduced very shortly after a sip or two. Alarm bells go off. Must be Donald Trump's favorite piss.

From a can to a glass. Pours a crystal clear yellow color or very light gold color with a small foamy head. Aroma is very slight sweet malts. Taste follows the aroma with a medium silky smooth mouthfeel. The sip was a bit stronger then the aroma consisting of corn barley and slight rice or veggie just a decent amount of malt sweetness to make it taste good. No fowl notes in the aroma or taste. Very good Macro brewery beer!
Just a simple beautiful taste of freedom. This beer ain’t to expensive but gets the job done with a 5% content of the forbidden syrup.
The beer has little to no flavor, and no aroma. The one positive is its logo. The best way to describe this beer is it is meh

Slavena-Lux 14 lei - 0.5 l
Renumitul Lager BUD produs si de  SUN InBev Ukraine dezamăgeşte toate aşteptările.Şi doar preţul mic face să o serveşti o dată pentru a nu te mai întoarce la ea.

Saturday, November 2, 2019. Can 50cL. 5%. Gift from my dad ! Home. A sparkling golden clear beer ; medium white head ; short retention ; ok lacing ; a few bubbles. Light cereal, herbal note, water. Light sweet, medium dry SHORT refreshing, bitter note. Light body, thin oily texture, soft gaseous, no finish. Overall, poor. Very drinkable.
Açık renkli koku, keskin olmayan malt ve alkol tadı. içimi kolay. gövde sarı. köpük az. sulu gibi duruyor. Soğuk içilmeli.
what is there to say...If you've never had budweiser, You're not missing much...HOWEVER...The U.S.A., including me, drink it still.
Just because its popular doesnt mean its bad. Its a great beer and its a great price.
Suchy lager, nic w nim nadzwyczajnego, jasny czysty, piana szybko opada. W smaku i aromacie pustka

Bottle. Clear pale yellow with white head. The aroma has notes of grains, corn, vomit and minerals. The flavor is mild sweet and bitter with notes of corn, grains, minerals, black pepper. Light-bodied.
Barwa żółta, klarowne, piana biała, niezbyt obfita, niezbyt trwała. W aromacie nic się nie dzieje, lekka słodowość. W smaku wodniste, nijakie, znikoma słodowość, zero goryczki. Sikacz.
Ik ken de aversie tegen dit vlakke bier. Ik vind het een erg lekker biertje. Goed koud als pils, voor mij king of beers.

Blonde avec bulles, sans grand intérêt mais qui ce laisse boire.
Facile pour le repas ou en journée, pas de goût d'alcool ou de houblon d'ailleurs!
Correct tout de même.

C'est léger, ça n'a pas de goût particulier mais ça se boit bien. L'équivalent américain de notre kro national. De la bière de grande consommation honorable parfaite par temps chaud. Rien d'autre à ajouter
The everyday beer when I was in China. Best seller in industry lager. There is a theory that if the drink is more like water, it will be more popular worldwide.
Had to be done in my quest to drink one of every beer on the boat. Certainly not one I will repeat in a rush.

Having one at Five Guys in Luxembourg/Gare.
Light yellow appearance with a thin head.
Grainy smell. Bland taste with a taste of rice. Not recommandable.
This shouldn't be called lager. Watery, watery. So artificial beer. Price of it should be even lower.
Overall weak flavour. Has a simple taste, sweet and refreshing. Light malt flavour, but very yeasty. It's a basic, cheap lager.
The average rating is far too low. It is a pretty decent lager. Pours a clear golden colour with a thin white head. Good taste, very pleasant.

I don't understand the complaints. There are far worse beers out there. It's an average one. Light yellow color. Greatly carbonated. Watery. Yes. But I can feel a bit malt, and there are nothing irritating neither in the aroma nor the taste. Drinkable, average.
Esta é uma cerveja média, de sabor controlado. Cerveja de produção massiva.
Bevuta in bottiglia a Las Vegas.  Bionda industriale.  Niente di particolare da dire.

16 can at the house. Light scent of grain. Pale yellow in color. Not much head. No film on glass. Light tasting grain. Smooth and extremely light bodied. Not much to this. Just lawnmower, take to a party beer. Cheer!
Most lagers taste the same. Well, this one is the sourest one I ever drunk so I will probably recongnise it even without seeng the bottle. Not the best taste but still refreshing.
Bière sans mousse, pas transcendante mais pas mauvaise non plus. Pas de goût ou autre. Pas meilleure qu'une Heineken.
Cant really gone wrong with a Bud if you like lager. Cheap and easily available. Tastes the same the world over. Always reliable. Head disappears quickly, not much lacing from cans.

Pas plus mauvaise qu'Heineken mais pas meilleure non plus. Même pas de mousse. Heureusement que je l'ai bue un jour où j'avais vraiment une grande soif et qu'il avait fait 40°C ce jour-là. Donc à réserver pour les grandes occasions ! :-))

Une bière de soif sans arôme, à la robe jaunasse sans col mousseux. Pourtant, l’étiquette indique qu’il s’agit de la meilleure qualité possible, impossible à battre sur le marché. Alors sur le marché des sodas, peut être, mais dans le domaine brassicole c’est quand même de la pisse. Une pisse désaltérante, un Perrier alcoolisé. Son seul fait d’armes, la meilleure pisse devant carlsberg, heineken, 1664, et autres pépites

Aujourd’hui je note finalement cette bière iconique. Nul besoin de préciser ou je l’ai acheté puisqu’elle est disponible partout en Amérique du Nord et se trouve relativement facilement partout dans le monde. Je pourrais la noté les yeux fermé. Il s’agit d’une blonde très pâle et très peu mousseuse. Je ne note pas d’odeur distinctive. Au goût ce n’est pas recherché du tout mais c’est parfait si on ne veux pas se casser la tête. C’est mon premier amour. Elle est loin d’être parfaite mais je l’aimerai toujours.

%5 alkollü fena olmayan bir bira. Türkiye' de üretimi Efes yapıyor yani bira yurtdışından gelmiyor.
Hafif şekerimsi bir tad var ve sanırım mısırdan yapılıyor.

Quit hating it’s Budweiser you know what you’re getting is it amazing no but it gets the job done pretty similar in taste to other beers of the style but it also has this unique bud taste I reckon it’s from the rice overall there’s a reason everyone knows someone who drinks bud because it’s solid and consistent
Calificada como la peor cerveza del mundo por el contenido tan bajo de cereal cumple lo que promete
1 pint can from Manhattan. Better than expected. There wasn't any of that sweetness from rice, which I find annoying in lagers. Not rich in flavours either.

Appearance: light golden.
Body: cristal clear, carbonation in abundance.
Head: white, almost none.
Aroma: metallic, detergent, wet cardboard, corn, some malt, dry grass, some cereals, some rice.
Taste: watery, medium carbonation, very hard to define a taste, almost impossible, a bit sweetish, some malt.
Aftertaste: almost none, a bit sweet, very weak some malt.
Backlog. Drinking this, you can understand why the Americans let us brew their beer. Even more insipid than the average South African lager.

One of my favorite summer beers !!
An easy drinker and a killer of thirst !!

The elusive Bud Heavy, maybe the most white trash, trailer park beer that there ever was. Only the scumbags order this trash. Golden color with the worst lager notes u can expect. Painful stuff for the degenerates.

Brought a bottle from local corner shop, very nice beer, I no it’s gassy but the taste is good and I enjoyed it a lot ,  I’m looking forward to trying bud light as I’ve never tried this before, one more thing I must say is I’m
Not a fan of the screw top bottles I preferred the old bottle top.

Watery is the first word that comes up when I drink this beer. When you try really hard to taste something, there's a slight pleasant maltiness. Aroma is slightly hoppy. Refreshing beer, but extremely weak. Never had Bud Light and if that is more watery than this I'd better be drinking tap water.
Robe très pâle, nez inexistant, le goût aussi est assez neutre. Une bière de soif rien de plus.

A 4.5 % Budweiser , not a drink I normally drink as this pretty  much is water is all your drinking. I probably would only drink this if they ran out of my favourite drink at nightclub but not a drink I have normally.
NOT THE KING OF BEERS. Not a nice beer at all. So much better out there than this

My Favorite Go To Type Of Beer. Personally I Prefer Budweiser Select As My Number 1 Type But This Is Just As Fine. Pretty Easy To Drink Despite The Medium To High Carbonation Does Seem To Go Flat Kinda Fast Though Once Opened.... Towards The End Of The Bottle Or Can... I’m Literally Talkin Half Bottle Mark.

Pours clear gold with a thick white head. Extremely heavy carbonation. Aroma of sweet rice malt. Taste is light and contains sweet syrupy notes, floral in nature. Palate has sweet, artificial malt notes. Not terrible.

Ar: Lightly sweet, doughy malt; a little grassy; faint apple and blueberry. Ap: Golden and clear; medium white head with good retention, settling into a thin cap of fine bubbles and some gooey webbed foam along the glass sides. T: Clean, steely cracker malt; some grass and apple; a hint of minty and mossy hops; very low sweetness; bitterness is low; some chalk; finish is clean crackers and a touch of bitters. P: Medium-light body with high carbonation; crisp; finish is very dry. O: The prototype American industrial lager; well-made beer for what it is; unoffensive, if not particularly interesting.

Yellow water. It is absolutely hilarious that they brag about the cost of aging this beer. The reason it has rice in it, is because they use it to cheat the natural fermentation process. Normal and natural fermentation take time and therefore money. Using rice, which ferments rapidly, speeds the process up. Rice has no place in beer. But then this isn't really worthy of the name beer.

Bottle, 0.33cl. It would be nice to compare Budejovicky Budwar and Budweiser, because the American one gave the name after the Czech region. Anheuser–Busch has been involved in a trademark dispute with European beer companies, in particular the Budweiser Budvar Brewery of České Budějovice from Czech Republic, over the trademark rights to the name "Budweiser". Beer has been brewed in České Budějovice. The "American" name Budweiser is a derivative adjective, meaning "of Budweis". In 1876, Adolphus Busch and his friend Carl Conrad, a liquor importer, developed a "Bohemian-style" lager in the United States, inspired after a trip to the region. Also we have to add the fact that in the mid 18th century German refugees didn't like American lagers, so they started to produce their own beer. Everything was given except the good quality barley so they started to use rice (around 30%) to cover the lack of barley quality and to make clear wine (USA barley is very high in protein). The second problem was the yeast (it was quick so the lager didn't finish fermentation), so the breweries started to craft it. They produced very neutral wood chips which could help to finish the fermentation with their natural gaps inside. The beer is not a big deal anyway, the history is much more interesting. Semi-pale golden colour, average foam, average CO2, rice can be discovered on the nose, watery palate with a bit of citrus note in the background. Not really exciting for me, quite average lager.

In this day of BLM, Democrats, and Antifa, AB expresses a basic patriotism missing in the aforementioned.  Bud will be here long after the IPA fad  that I think will fade :>). 24 ounce can into lager glass, best before 5/28/2018. Pours crystal clear pale golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense and rocky white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of cracker, white bread, light biscuit/dough, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness. A bit fruity aromas, but not overwhelming. Okay aromas with pale malt/grain and light earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, white bread, light biscuit/dough, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness. Very mild herbal, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, white bread, light biscuit/dough, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice robustness of pale malt/grain and light earthy hop flavors; with a nice malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Perfectly clean on lager flavors; with zero yeast notes present. Lightly increasing dryness from lingering bitterness and carbonation. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, fairly bready/grainy, and lightly sticky balanced mouthfeel that is good. A bit thin, but not watery. Zero warming alcohol for 5%. Overall this is a very solid pale adjunct lager style. All around good robustness of pale malt/grain and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. I liked that they don't use corn, so you don't get much fruitiness. Very clean barley/grain flavors and decent earthy hop presence/balance. An enjoyable offering, and very well made style example as expected.

O processo de produção da Budweiser é diferenciado, por utilizar lascas de Beechwood (madeira especial) durante os processos de fermentação e maturação. O resultado é um cerveja de sabor único e com equilíbrio perfeito: marcante no início e suave no final.

Cerveja leve e refrescante, feita para matar a sede e para ser bebida bem gelada. Varia do amarelo claro até dourado e possui espuma clara e aroma discreto. É o tipo de cerveja mais popular no Brasil e Estados Unidos.

As cervejas com sabor suave apresentam um equilíbrio entre malte, lúpulo e levedura, criando leveza no paladar sem deixar resíduos no retrogosto - ou seja, tem sabor que não perdura na boca.

Clearly the world needs another review of Budweiser. It's such a rare, hard-to-find beer that it is crucial that, having split a bottle at a whalez share, I pass on the findings of my particularly refined palate...

It's biggest crime is also probably it's biggest virtue. Budweiser is a masterclass in inoffensive blandness. It lacks all real flavor, with just a hint of cereal malt at the end, but it is brewed impeccably clean, with no off flavors or flaws, and that's constant between every batch and every bottle everywhere in the world. If you got into the beer scene to drink incredibly dull lagers made by mean-spirited industrial brewers, this may well be the beer for you.

Big ass can (1pint, 90z. / 25 fl. oz. / 739ml) from gas station near ATL airport.... because... I just got out of ATL from LAX, damned delayed flight, tired as hell and through the rental car hoopla and drove to the airport hotel and did I say that I was tired and thirsty? So I went to the gas station because there were no damned supermarkets or liquor stores in this lousy part of Atlanta and what did they have but a selection of cheapos, malt liquors, and other lousy stuff in six packs and a girl in front of me took out one of these huge cans and so I thought it must be time that I finally rated this bugger. Grabbed one and tried to weave my way through the older shakey guys buying one lotto ticket after another and put my $2.55 under the plexiglass window, jammed the can into the little brown paper bag the cashier gave me, and got the hell outta there..And here goes: Nose of light sweetish malt and corn. Color is red, white, and blue ... because I drank the fucker straight from the can .. you got a problem with that, Bubba? (Actually, I later poured some out into a cup, so ....Clear very thin pale straw color with with weird pockety-pock bubbles popping on the white foam.) Thin fruity initial flavor, and hey ... green apples! (just like Ken Wells says in his book, Travels with Barley). Very slight bitterness... well, almost none really. Light sweet finish. Thin body. Somehow I feel that this beer changed my normally calm, serious demeanor (maybe even my outlook on the world...). Oh, well. It’s great being back in ’merica. This is probably the classic poster boy for bad beer, but I’ve had worse. Oh yes, I’ve had a lot worse... But I doubt that I’ll ever buy another.

Everytime you dont drink a real american beer you are funding terrorist and planned parenthood. Behead those who dont recognize budweiser as the king of beers.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso finisce sul riso. L’intensità olfattiva è flebile e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma ha una discreta resistenza ed è formata da bollicine medie, con carbonazione media. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. Le bollicine sono medio-fini, spinte da una frizzantezza vivace. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è rotondo. Alla lingua risultano un dolce medio in equilibrio con un amaro medio. L’intensità gustativa è normale e la persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva. Il finale è semplice. Il retrogusto è sfuggente. L’aroma in bocca riporta sentori di pane, orzo e cereali.

Keg at The Hem Heath, Trentham (Hungry Horse) A clear pale golden colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of grain, rice and some bread. Taste of grain, rice, some bread and subtle lemon. The King of beers by arse.

Bière jaune pâle, parfaitement limpide, bonne effervescence, et surmontée d’un col blanc plutôt assez étroit mais tout de même assez dense, mousseux et résistant. Arômes de malt pâle, léger pain frais et pâtisserie, grain sucré et sirop de maïs, accompagné d’un certain houblon végétal. Nez sans intérêt, complexité et intensité particulièrement faible. En bouche, pétillement plutôt faible sur la langue, onctuosité moyenne-faible, on note un subtil velouté au palais. Au goût, léger pain frais et pâtisserie, céréale sucrée, sucre brut avec petite tendance vers les baies sucrées, houblon quasiment inexistant à part pour quelques touches végétales et citronnées, amertume minimale voire inexistante. Complexité en bouche tout de même pas si mal et goût quand même assez bon, mais le principal problème de cette bière est qu’elle ne goûte vraiment pas grand-chose, son intensité est médiocre. Pourquoi les bières les moins goûteuses sont celles qui se vendent le plus? Si les gens n’aiment pas la bière, qu’ils n’en achètent pas! La Budweiser, un impressionnant succès commercial, mais une déception claire sur le plan de la dégustation!

Pours light golden with a white fizzy head. Typical American lager. Great cold on a hot day. Easy to drink.
All medium: tap/can/bottle. Simple pale lager. Get a case and that is it. Tap is my fav. Burgers and Bud.

Good beer for warm summer days. Very light and easy to like. Even girls will like this

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle at home (19 III 2016), shared with friends. Had this as a "Bud". This is a European lager bottle, brewed by the Breweing Company LTD. London. Without wanting to be smug, this self-proclamed king of beers really is one of the most modest lagers I ever had. The looks are quite basic and even unappealing: A pale, straw-yellow pilsner with vivid carbonation and a weak white, minimum foam. The nose has keen APA hints, with American malts. This is a lager to be served fresh. The mouthfeel has lots of water and soda, with some wheat and bitterness. That’s about it. A great quencher for sure, but not tastefull at all. I prefer the European pale lagers without any doubt.

Won a case of this in a pub quiz - aren’t I the lucky one... Very pale with slight un-beer like aroma. The only flavour is a kind of slight sweetness but not much else. No evidence of hops and gone instantly you swallow. Although I’ve obviously drunk it before, what surprised me was that I can actually recall drinking worse beer, although it would take too long to work out when.

300ml bottle leftover after event - at least that’s my excuse! Pours fizzy pale greeny yellow without head. Aroma plastic and faint hay. Taste almost non existent, so watery and thin but with slight biscuit.

Aroma: citrus, Apple
Taste: numbing, watery
Body: light, very high carbonation
Ibu: low, 5
Finish: dry but thirst quenching
Pours clear yellow with white head. Highly carbonated. Some sweetness, barley malt, and inoffensive flavour. Needs to be cold. Very unremarkable.

Just accepted the surrender of the Japanese Imperial Army and the German Nazi party? Sounds like its time for a Bud. Just won the World Series? BUDWEISER TIME. Hot summer day and you finished mowing the lawn? Bud tallboy time.
Budweiser is beer flavored beer and its inexpensive. If you want to drink some beers, you cannot go wrong with a delightful, crisp, refreshing Budweiser. Drink it from a 12 ounce can from an ice cold cooler, if possible.
Una Lager corriente, pero que seguramente salga ganando con respecto a sus competidoras.

A fair malt and hop aroma

Very smooth as they say

Felt corn or rice flavour in the finish



Totally not bad as it’s been said

Despite being a fan of craft beer I can still appreciate a well made mass produced beer. Consistently pleasant to drink. Not a whole load of complexity but still a lovely drink. Great carbonation with a clean crisp flavour.
Pilsner agtig klassisk Budweiser til Superbowl. Jo jo - kan fint drikkes men er altså ikke noget specielt...
Pours yellow with thin white foam. Nose is neutral vague malt. Taste is sweet and almost like too thin juice.
33cl bottle. Pours a pale yellow, clear, with a white head with decent retention. Smells sweet and bland, with notes of boiled corn and sugar. The taste follows the same notes.
Denne Budweiser har et klart gyldent udseende med et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en maltet aroma og smager sødt med en bitter afrunding. Medium karbonering.
Aroma of malt. Pale and clear with a short lasting white head. Medium sweetness and not much bitterness. Average carbonation, watery texture.

Big can from Safeway in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is light fruitiness (maybe apple)...surprisingly no sweet corny funk (which is what I expected). Taste is very fresh and light. Incredibly fresh and clean. Not a ton of flavor but this beer far exceeded my expectations.
Ein sehr weiches bier, ich finde es ist ein wenig eindimensional, was mir gut gefällt ist der (bohnen)krautige hopfencharakter
You know what it is, there is no need to comment.......,,..................,,.................

Pours clear and yellow. Faint aroma of malts, grass and hay. Tastes light sweet and very light bitter. Light in body and thin in texture. Fizzy carbonation. The "King of Beers" is a joke, but it is at least refreshing.

Other than the beechwood "taste’ the king of beers in only a prince. Nothing much going on. At least no matter where you go in the world Budweiser is consistent. It tastes the same in the bottle, can, keg, in the USA or on a remote island anywhere.

If for me to choose between carlsberg, tiger and Budweiser in a local convienece store..

Budweiser is the choice most of the time.

Lack of taste, medium smell, but refreshing.

Going to refuse the beer snob notes. This is simple, Yes. Delicate malt and very yeast driven. Clean with a high carbonation brisk finish. With this day and age of craft getting "bought out" by a company that sells out to marketing, I really don’t care anymore about these bleeded lines. If it is produced consistent and well..I don’t care who makes it.

Lata del @Hipercor, Oviedo. 17/01/2016. BBD:24/11/16
Color amarillo, sabores maltoso, maiz, aromas bajos, cuerpo ligero.
Average pils beer, golden color and light taste, light on alcohol as well. The Czech Budweiser is certainly superior.
Decent American lager. Nothing special, but it has a very pleasant freshness that makes it drinkable.

Bottle poured to pint glass very cold beer Appearance: Light yellow head, a lot of lacing Aroma: scent smell of malt, nothing else Taste: not really great Mouth feel: very carbonated Overall: good beer for the hot weather, specially camping outdoors, nothing special
Pours a clear golden color with a white head. Little to no aroma slight hop but not much. Taste the same. Nothing special at all.
Same same, would drink it if had nothing else, doesn’t have enough beery taste for my own taste buds, but as the world’s most popular beer it must be doing something right
Jasnozolte o bialej pianie. Chmielona woda o chemiczno metalicznym posmaku. Zero zapachu.zero smaku
Clear golden color, average size white head. Aroma of malt and green apples. Taste is like an apple juice, some malt, straw, grain. Light body, average carbonation. Well, not that bad.
Can 0.33l. Pale clear liquid, looking like water, big white head. Light body, heavy carbonation. Watery, sweet, too carbonated.

Clear yellow color. Average carbonation. Light malty aroma. No hop aroma, ultimately bland. Has a corny, sweet flavor. There is some bitterness, but not really hoppy. Not really malty. Not really anything. It isn’t unpleasant, there just isn’t anything to like about it. Has a bad aftertaste.
Neus dicht en achterover, niet heel veel bijzonders. Backlog from 2014/12/20.
The already thin taste vanishes as soon as the beer leaves the mouth. Scentwise pretty much the same. Some beers are more intense after the glass has been rinsed once.

Coloração palha,creme alto e duradouro,média carbonatação;aroma suave de malte e lúpulo,sabor acompanha o aroma,cereais não maltados são notados mas não comprometem a drinkability,no geral sabor um pouco superior as de "massa";uma "SAL"mediana,passa longe de uma "Premium".

Bottle. Plenty of Bud haters out there but are they being fair? As far as American macro’s go it is reasonable. Sure there is a little corn syrup and it is a little thin, but compared to others out there it has a maltier flavour which others don’t. I’m not racing off to get one, but I don’t say "no" when someone hands me one and at some of those American style franchise steakhouses that pop up over here it is often the best choice of the mediocre beers on the menu.
When I first started drinking, I never really liked beer. Then I tried this and it was great. This is my all time favourite beer. Love the taste. Love the price ($39.95 for 28). Best. Beer. EVER!!!
Very little aroma. Definite golden color. A nutty flavor? Definite carbonated metallic taste palate. Cheap, high schooler beer.
Bottle in the cottage. Pours clear pale golden, nose is sweet toffee, floral, taste is sweet, grassy, floral.

Another can found at my parents house! Very wated wheet yellow color with quickly disapearing white foam. Aromas of malt but on the weak side, surprisingly does not have metalic smell to it. Palate, Light, no texture leaves minimal malt and metalic aftertaste. Taste of malt and water. Overall, just thinking what am I doing with my life? As they say thay are king of beers, so I dread to find out what they think is a bad beer?
Can on a plane. US brewed. And what’s to say? It was smoother and had less carbonation than any I’ve had before. Syrupy and sweet. It was free...
Lager scipita e slavata che sa quasi esclusivamente di riso bollito. Ci vuole un coraggio che trascende il marketing per coniare l’appellativo "King of Beers".
Bottle - Clear pale yellow colour, small white head with no retention. No aroma, no taste, comletely blank. Dont waste your time for this.

Paja claro sin espuma ni retención. Diacetilo, arroz moderado, oxidación, malta maltoso bajo, lúpulo herbal bajo. En boca oxidación, diacetilo, malta maltoso bajo, lúpulo herbal bajo. Final fresco herbal con amargor, cuerpo bajo, baja carbonatación.

Brilliant straw color with a golden hue. 2 finger head lasting a minute or two. Good lacing and activity.

Bitter flavors of corn. Slightly skunky and sugary. Very faint watery taste.

Light body with excessive carbonation. Short and faint bitter finish.

Overall : Extremely bland, but still feels kinda fresh.
Even when i was younger and broke i wouldnt buy budwiser, there are too many other beers out there that dont lead to nasty hangovers and a case of the runs. This beer is not for me.

(Bottle, Schiphol Airport, Amsterdam, 30 Aug 2015) Straw yellow colour with brief, white head. Malty nose with grain, rice, white bread and hay. Malty taste with notes of rice, grain, hay, canned fruit, boiled cauliflower and no traces of hops. Medium body, with a certain sugar sweetness. A fairly pointless waste of space. Vapid.
Bottle volume of 0.33 liters. There is absolutely nothing in this beer to talk about. Beer for deleting from my list
Light, amber pour. What a distinct, skunky flavor. Watery yet hopped. Carbonated. What else can you say.
Open bar at a wedding, drank a bunch of these. Smells and tastes like sweet wet cardboard. Gave me gut rot and a nasty hangover. Even for free this beer sucks.
Aus der Flasche und vom Fasd. Hellgelb, fast kein Schaum. Kein Aroma. Etwas herb. Geschmack ist dünn, leicht herb und gleich weg. Eiskalt aus der Flasche im Sommer ok
Een redelijk saaie pilsener. Dit bier heeft een aardige, frisse geur met duidelijke hopkenmerken. De smaak is wat vlak. Niets bijzonders.

Aroma? Hardly any at all, but a faint hoppy smell. Appearance? A thin golden appearance. Taste? One of the worst beers of all, having a taste of what I can be imagining as a small chunk of cardboard with a few drops of urine smeared on it, and add a glass of water to a blender and essentially drink it down. It does have a nice foam that lasts, but it’s not enough to redeem this so called ’king of beers’.

Right on the bottle it expresses that the makers know of no other brewers who use such an expensive and exclusive method to making their particular beer. Please. Just because it’s expensive doesn’t make it right, and in this case it’s very wrong.

On the high note, this beer is incredibly easy to drink. Perfect for cheap meals, ball games, or a hot day mowing the lawn, so it’s not all bad.

Russian BUD.
Bottle 0.5
Кроме как для утоления жажды летом подходит не очень.
В бокале выглядит при этом на удивление неплохо, пена держится долго.
На вкус - водичка, послевкусия никакого.
Bottle. Straw gold color with small white head. Watery body. Sweet taste. For a no taste macro it is ok.

Re-rate 2015-12-27: First time drinking in about 5 years but it’s still the same. 330ml bottle. Clear pale yellow piss colour with a medium sized white head, doesn’t last long. Aroma is almost nothing, really weak malty maybe corny notes. Flavour is also the same, really bland, nothing stands out and it’s far too watery yet quite heavily carbonated. Worsens as it warms up too. Honestly it’s not "bad" tasting, it’s just so bland you can barely tell it’s a lager. Just a really disappointing and boring drink. Giving same score as original rate.



Original rating (old, 2007ish): "The King of Beers" is quite a statement to live up to. Spoilers: it doesn’t. There just isn’t much to say about this. Really is just a bog standard lager, lacking any complexity, almost watery in fact. Drank this out the bottle so I can’t comment on appearance. Cheap, perhaps refreshing if there’s nothing else available. Described in one word: bland.
Het bier van Amerika, fletse smaak en weinig schuimkraag. De kleur zit wel goed.
Clear golden appearance with good carbonation. Beer smooth, fresh and easy going down. Afterwork beer, a staple.
Pretty much exactly what we expect of a boring American lager: easy, simple taste, no complexity, balanced. Good for a summer of yardwork and easy women

A beer that manages to be virtually flavourless and at the same time deeply unpleasant. Beechwood aged for a matter of minutes, with entire forests cultivated to feed this utterly futile process. I will hopefully never taste this beer again.
An excellent "last request" beer if one found oneself condemned (in that execution would be a relief). Otherwise abysmal.

If life gives you Budweiser, you say thanks and give it a try because hey, it’s not every day a 0 pt beer ends up on your table. 473 ml can ("proud partner of the Toronto Blue Jays"). It pours a very pale straw colour, it’s clear with a rather good white head that drops fast and leaves no lace. The nose is very grainy with a sweet undertone, and, well, not much else. Perhaps a bit of a honey-like note. The taste is surprisingly bitter, but it’s a shallow hop extract kind of bitterness. Malty sweet... Dry on the palate with rather aggressive carbonation. Hollow... It’s pretty bad, but I feared worse. Overall I’d say it’s not as horrific as some other pale lagers I’ve had.
Brazilian version brewed by Anbev. Light colored, pleasant sweet after taste. 5% alcohol, more than adequate for a tropical climate area.

Bottle from Seoul Plaza. Sweetish corny aroma, DMS. Clear pale yellow colour, white head, quickly disappearing. Taste sweetish, syrupy, with a hint of DMS, but otherwise pretty clean, even kind of enjoyable. Thin watery body and overall impression as well, nothing special, but also not bad. Average.
Normal beer nothing special. It’s not between My favourite because it’s a Too sparkling beer.
Clear yellow real clear but weird light yellow. Why it gets decent appearance rating. Very carbonated like some water. No aroma no flavor.

F: very average, white, quick diminishing to nothing.
C: pale straw, clear.
A: rice?, malt?
T: very sweet watery, crispy carbonation, also some sweetness on the palate, one of the worst beer I think.
Draft version just for the tick. Tastes like mild straw/hay soda with a touch of piss, gets worst as it warms, couldn’t finish it...
Has it’s place, among those bog-standard lagers the world obessess over. Just so average.

Bottiglia da 0,33. Birra senza particolari elementi caratterizzanti. Schiuma scarna e non persistente. Colore giallo paglierino. Media carbonatura. Gusto dolciastro con note di miele. Aroma poco definito con sentori di campo. Consiglio 5/10.
Straw colour with a decent head. Flavour strangely reminiscent of rice krispies. Little aroma to speak of. Overall very poor.
Seriously......what was i thinking!! Do yourself a favour and just drink something else!

Synthetic and watery and might be the worst beer I have ever tried.
Can’t be described but after trying it you won’t go back if you love beers.

Botella 33 cl en varias ocasiones, tal vez más de las que debiera. (r3884) lote 12A4 hasta 25-07-2003. Sin mucho que decir salvo lo refrescante que pueda ser y en caso de no haber ninguna opción mas. 5 vol que se bebe con facilidad. De lo más corriente y comercial del mundo.
A expensive water! If some one are out of water I can consider forcing this brew down. The Americans are great on many things but this so called beer is not one of there finest moments.

How: Can (355 ml) at home. Shared with the infamous Franky Boy. 



>>> Flavorless ultra clean and rather easy drinking macro lager. I would take this over many swilly spicy craft beers. 



+  It’s clean and tasteless, so it’s rather easy drinking 

+  It’s identical from can to can / bottle to bottle, you know what to expect 

− It’s flavorless, other than rice and mild herbal presence there’s nothing to see here 

−  The body is very light and watery 




Flavors:  Rice, herbal notes
Pale yellow with vanishing white head. Dazzling aroma. All you feel in your mouth is carbonation burst and lame rice flavor. No aftertaste.
8/8 Bottle - Hops aroma, clean golden appearance with good carbonation. Beer smooth, fresh and easy going down. Great with a meal or enjoying a summer day,

Pisse internationale... Quelle idée d’ avoir pris ça...
Aussi bon qu’ une Kronembourg, d’ ailleurs c’ est peut etre la meme...
12 oz. can at home. Only good thing was the can top opener was red and shaped like a crown. Have never cared for this "King".
Draft - Very sweet malts. Pale gold with a rich white head. Sweet light malts and a long sweet finish. Candy like sweetness.

Drank straight from the bottle at the Bansdale darts tournament - a night when I should have taken more beer. Instead I had to resort to drinking this. Truly an awful beer, even for a lager. The taste is fizzy water with some vague and unpleasant flavours of grain, straw and metal. Dire.
Sem aroma e sem sabor, somente para refrescar e ser bebida em quantidade pois não lembra em nada boas cervejas
Converting" from old excel scoresheet. So there is no comments on this beer.
Very watery with not much taste. It is my least favorite beer out of the American lagers.

Nahezu kein Aroma und Geschmack vorhanden. Goldenes Wasser mit klein wenig Malz und minimal Hopfen. 
Sehr wässrig, geradezu wie mildes Sprudelwasser. 
Im Geschmack etwas muffig, leicht süß, unangenehmer Hopfen. 
Getrunken zu einem doppelten Cheeseburger War es zwar typisch amerikanisch. Aber lecker War es nicht
Bottle 500 ml. Tasteless beer. Didn’t mind it that much when I drank it, but it’s no very tasty by any means.

If you imagine this is a light champagne, it actually looks quite pretty, with its faint yellow hue and tight carbonation. Then you remember that it’s supposed to be beer, even though it tastes like little more than seltzer with unpleasant flavoring added. The old package used to be the best thing about the beer, but they updated it to something uninspired, boring, and charmless.
Bottle. Clear golden golor. Aroma: malt, grain and corn. Taste: watery, malty, a bit creamy, soft and sad. Hren’.
It is not a cliche if the beer taste good. It might not be the politically correct beer but Bud simply taste good.

This is an average lager with a dense white, but rapidly diminishing foam. The aroma is limited to the hops. The flavor has a light malty character, rapidly changing to a hoppy bitterness. Quite a good average lager after all. The brewery itself calls this beer the ’King of Beers’ which in my view is a strong exaggeration. But taste is of course different.

It is what it is. Really nothing special. Only good after working your butt off in the blazing summer heat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Awful piss water that is so bad it has to be served nearly frozen to be able to drink it.
Not much aroma or taste really. The best thing it has going for it is that it’s easy drinking.
Great spicy lavender and coriander aroma along with Belgian yeasty toast character. Caramel medium malts spice all way through. Very nice quaffable beer.
Bottle, very light, aroma is almost nothing just stale beer, taste is similar, where is the beechwood

0.33L pour from chilled tap into pint glass at a 4th of July party in Austria. Very pretty and decent fluffy head, but the taste is off. The bitterness isn’t well balanced and it tastes a bit sharp. Not terrible, though. Refreshing enough.
Possibly unbeatable as the worst beer in the world. Pale appearance, no aroma, no taste (corn water), no mercy: terrible!

Bottle. Quite pale yellowish colour and an unstable head. The aroma is sweet and very light. The taste is predominantly corn, also sweetish. Both the body and the flavours are homeopathic, extremely watery -- in fact, the carbonation is more notable than its flavour. Meh.
Fľaša 330 ml zo Seoul Plaza. Svetložltá farba, biela bublinková pena, rýchlo opadla, ryžovo sladová aróma. Stredná rezkosť, nasládlá chuť, takmer žiadna horkosť. King of beers? :-D

The rating on these beers is deflated because of the name, otherwise this wouldn’t be getting 0.5s and 1.0s. It’s drinkable, which is more than you can say about some other beers. This is pure 19th century American tradition when beer was trying to resemble pure, filtered water. I think we all know what it tastes like.
Color amarillento. Espuma escasa y poco duradera. Olor dulzón. Sabor a malta y maíz. Ligera y dulzona, casi no amarga. Aguada...Olvidable.
At the Barcelona airport. Bottle says it has been brewed by Estrella Damm Barcelona. Estrella Damm is better. This one is quite bland. I don’t know if it is better or worse than Heineken.
Supe fizz bomb and pissy yellow, white head dissipates fast. Grain water and no hop flavor but some hop butterneess but no a good bitterness. Made me burp all day.
Cooked vegetables, basement aromas, basement aromas, alcohol, basement aromas, dough, banana
Clear yellow in color. Has consistent carbontation. Has a heavy rice flavor.
330ml bottle. Clear pale golden color with white head. Malty grainy cornish aroma. Sweet and light bitter taste. Light thin body with soft to average carbonation
Had this on draft after golf on a hot summer’s day. Smelled vaguely like beer, but there was no discernible hops or malt. Ample head without lace - definitely foaming agent. Don’t call it lager.
this king of beer if there is no other beers and this can be call a beer more like soapy water

Budweiser was one of my favorite macro brews for years. Sadly it’s gotten progressively worse over the past few years. Inbev has essentially destroyed America’s iconic lager through systematically cutting the quality of the ingredients used. Youngsters think Budweiser was always nasty. It used to be great.
Een erg standaard pils, smakeloos, geurloos, kleurloos, schuimkraag: snel verdwenen. Kortom: Nothing to see, move along!

tijdens de bbq, zwak/licht gouden met witte kraag. aroma van typische pilsmout en slap, dit komt ook terug in de smaken, uitzonderlijke slappe hap is dit eigenlijk maar. ’t is te drinken maar erg bijzonder is het niet.

Bottle. Golden body white head. I had to try this again had this I think 15 years ago in Arizona and didn’t really like it. I have to say that it’s not really bad but there is not much to become bad low malts nearly no hops and very thin. I prefer real beer or water.
330ml bottle 4.9% abv pours extremely pale with a light grainy malt aroma the taste is very mild watery faintly bitter sweet consistent not that good
"Golden suds" says the commercial. The golden suds I make in the bathroom smell and look a lot better than this stuff.
This beer is complete garbage...all 6 of my uncles drink this crap...flippin backwoods tools!i hate this yellow water...yuck!!!!!
The one word to best describe this beer is minimal. Body is extremely watery and flat. Couldn’t find any aroma. Minimal flavor, ever so slight sweetness and no bitterness. Overall extremely boring.

Bottle at home from the super market. This is the UK versions at 4.8%. Bright clear yellow coloured pour with a fading white frothy head. Aroma is fairly clean sweet grains, little corn, little green apple, little sweet on the nose. Flavour is compsoed of sweet light malts, corn, sweet corn, carbonaic acid, gassy. A little too sweet, could be crisper in the finish. Palate is very light and gassy, thin, semi-sweet. Drinks ok.

Hello?; Hey Lou, ’Sup? Nothin’ Pete, watchin’ the game, havin’ a Bud. ’Sup with you? Nothin’, watchin’ the game, havin’ a Bud. True, True. Wassup? Wassssup? Yo, who dat? Yo Yo, pick up the phone. Hello? Wasssup? Wassssup? Suuuppppp? Yo, where’s Dukey? Yo, Dukey. Yo. Wassup? Waaaaassssssuuupppp, wassssuuupppp, suuuuupppppppppp!!!!!!!! Aaaaaahhhhh!!!!!. Yo, hold on. Hello? WWWWWAAAAAASSSSSSZSUUUUUPPPPPPPPPP?????????? Wassssupppp, wasssuuujpppppp. AAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!! 
So, what’s up with you? Nothin’. Watching the game, havin’ a Bud. True, True.

lots of water, rice, sugar, too much carbonation and maybe a touch of hops. Bleh 

Rice instead of corn, but the same water-like lightly metallic taste. Light sweetness. A bit better than Miller/Corona as there is well bad metallic taste but it’s still ehh.
Do I really need to say much about this beer? It’s a Mass produced American light lager.
Dorée pale claire, peu goûteuse et plutôt aqueuse, rien d’intéressant sans être foncièrement mauvaise. Bue à la pression au Barclay center, New York, États Unis, le 01/05/2015.
355 ml can. Golden color with dizzy white head. Grass smell and a little sweet. Taste is flat and boring, waterish has well. Not nice aftertaste, quite fake and industrial.
As they say at Stone brewing. Fizzy yellow water. Even the yellow is putrid looking. No aroma to speak of and flavor is of just metallic crap. Even the metallic is faint.
It does the trick. Doesn’t taste too bad fresh while in STL. And taste even better at Busch stadium.
From bottle. Light aroma of corn and cane sugar, light apricot maybe. Bit of herbs in the middle. Medium sweet, no noticeable bitterness. Light bodied. Inoffensive lager.
Almost entirely void of taste. And aroma. Bland as all hell but at least it's easy to throw back.

I poured it into a pint glass from the can. The fizzy white head dissipated quickly. There was no lacing and almost no aroma. It’s an almost clear straw color. The taste is the usual for a bland macro. There was a metallic aftertaste to it.
citrus, golden, medium sweetness, thin feel, fizzy, Easy to drink for any occasion

So this beer doesn’t contain corn, which is a good thing, but it does contain cheap, white, stripped, GMO rice. AB is well known for using cheap ingredients and cutting corners for so many decades, but the fools keep buying this cheap excuse for a beer, and paying too much for it too, go figure. Taste: lots of water, rice, sugar, too much carbonation and maybe a touch of hops. Bleh
I can’t understand why so many people like this beer! A beer shall taste like beer not water!

22-11-2020; bottle; at the Swedish house (bought at Saveur Bière).
The beer looks simple. Golden yellow, pale, crustal clear with a weak rough white head. Foam retention is low, not even a drape is left.
The aroma is weak. Some malty grain notes, some herbal hops, but not much hop aroma. There isn't much, it is al very mild and thin.
The taste is weak too. Sweet malts, sweet adjunct, bitter hops. Hops only give bitterness, hardly any aroma. 
The palate is weak too. Light body, thin texture and medium-high carbonation. The finish of the beer is short and has just some bitterness. All in all, a very simple beer.

Better than cheap spanish beers, althought that isnt hard. Can be an option in stablishment swithout better alternatives. Avg 2.7

19 Nov 2016. In Teku glass. At lunch, with rice soup + nuggets. After futsal match. Dull and insipid but without anything unpleasant here. Avg 2.6

10 Mayo 2019. De Hipercor. En copa alargada de Hirsh. Jugando a Super Life of a Pixel. Nueva etiqueta. Correcta, con algo de sabor a malta agradable

Pours clear pale golden, white head.
Aroma equals nothing.
Watery, light as thin air, no bitterness at all. 
One of the worst beers available.
[2010-10-24] Todella vetistä jopa massalageriksi. Maussa maissisuutta. Lähinnä naurettavaa, että tämä oli puolivälinkankaan Onnen Päivät-pubissa ”kuukauden olut”.

The American "king of beers"! Pours golden with medium white head. Like most of industrial lager, aromas are simply sweet malts and grassy hops. Light body, fizzy carbonation. Abrupt slightly bitter finish. Nothing exceptionnal here. Perfect during a BBQ or a students party!

미국 버드와이저는 한국것보다 훨씬 맛있다. 프랑스-벨기에에서 먹은 호가든과 한국에서 먹은 호가든은 거꾸로 별차이가 없다. 두께감 있는 거품부터 맛의 변화까지 한국 버드와이저는 같은 수순을 밟지만 거의 만들다 만 물건임. 이정도면 하이네켄과 함께 글로벌 스텐다드 할 수 있겠다. 오클랜드, 미국

A good lager. Maybe it isn’t anything special, but it’s a good one to drink. Quite enjoyable
04-12-2015 - I was a bit disappointed because I thought it would taste better.

This is about one level away from being on the worst level. The only way I can drink this if it’s super super cold, and actually prefer it from the can because of that reason. Either way, from the can or bottle, it has that metallic taste...but it seems to work better from the can for me. Definitely lawn mower beer at best. Looks like pee.

Elle n’a pas vraiment de goût. J’ai bu cette bière, la dernière fois à Liverpool, cela a été une déception. Ni le malt, ni le houblon ressortent dans cette bière. Elle irait bien pour les limaces de mon jardin.

Bottle bought only because it was a nice looking limited edition version for World Cup 2014. Knew what to expect from the beer. Pale gold colour, decent white head for starters which soon disappeared. Aroma of cornstarch. Bitter sweet taste. Light body and thin texture, fizzy carbonation. Just not very nice
Seemingly watered down beer but distinct flavours. A little sweet, strong almost spicy flavour in the aftertaste. A good definitive ’American Beer’ indeed.
Point one better than bud light. Fizzy grain water. And poor grain flavor at best. Way too carbonated, gives me acid reflux. A lime doesn’t even cover up wet grain nonsense.

Well, what can one say about the self-proclaimed king of beers? Not much. No aroma but some corn with a watery yellow color. Very light and highly carbonated palate. More corny flavor with maybe some malt? More flavor in club soda.
So little flavor you cannot even call it bad. Now for sale in Dutch supermarkets everywhere!
Not good, but some people might like it. People are strange, but good for them. Is cheap and easy to find.
7 fl oz Flasche. Klar und golden. Ohne Krone. Absolut geschmacksneutral bis auf eine muffige Note. Schreckliches Bier.

Uitgeschonken in fluitglas, lichtgele lager, met witte schuimkraag die snel wegvalt. De geur valt niet tegen, eigenlijk het beste element van dit bier, iets van vers brood en appels. De smaak is vrij zoet en erg waterig, limonade, iets metalig, weinig mout, weinig hop. Toch is deze lager niet zo slecht als sommige mensen zeggen. Door de gebruikte rijst is het zacht en makkelijk drinkbaar, lijkt mij geen hoofdpijn biertje. De afdronk is waterig met iets van hop in de verte. Niet de beste lager, maar goed koud best wel drinkbaar voor bij de Barbecue of zo. Hier in Nederland zou ik Bud alleen niet snel voor dat doel aanschaffen, liever een kratje Warsteiner, Grolsch of Hertog Jan pilsener.

Reading the commercial description one might think that Ninkasi the Sumerian beer goddess came to earth and made a miraculous beer. I fail to see any plausible reason to buy it in Europe considering the price\ quality relationship. Just a basic corn and rice mash.

25 oz can (1 extra ounce!), for BJCP study group, 4 oz pour into sample glass



Aroma: corn-like, slight spicy hop, green apples



Appearance: Pale Straw, slightly more yellow than Bud Light, none persistent white head, crystal clear



Flavor: dry, crisp, corn flavor, sweet with very low bitterness, slight DMS within guidelines



Mouthfeel: Very light, less watery than Bud Light, slight carbonic bite



Overall: Slightly better than Bud Light, doesn’t taste as watery and has a tad more body and tast.
Weak aroma of malt, and yeast. Pale yellow with a white well laced head. Moderately carbonated with a light body. Subdued taste of malt, with a sweet malt finish.

Very slight malty nose, a bit of bubblegum ester as it warms up and breathes. Moderate bitterness, slight sweetness, no harshness. Slightly creamy body. Snappy and refreshing, but with no real character.

Bottle. Delivered with my pizza in san Francisco, can’t say that about many other beers. Pour looks looks like neon yellow mountain dew at least through this hotel glass. No head. Aroma is bready at best. Perhaps it’s the rice Budweiser uses. Tastes better than all the other NASCAR beers. Guess that’s why it’s the king. Water, but Damn it, it’s drinkable.
330cc bottle. Nice lager. Nose is hops and some malt. Taste is nicely balanced. Watery but nice for hot days as refreshment.

this has got to be the worst fear that has ever been made. it has absolutely no taste whatsoever. the only reason it is popular is for it’s horribly sexist television commercials depicting scantily clad women. this beer only appeals to the lowest common denominator, hillbillies and drunken frat boys. anybody that buys just beer gets absolutely what they paid for and there is absolutely nothing. it is ridiculous how such an awful beer has become so popular

Golf. This is what this beer says to me. I’ve enjoyed it during and after golf many times. People rate this so low, I’m not sure why....Immediately upon opening the bottle I get this spicy yeasty aroma. It’s actually quite nice, and welcoming.... I didn’t get a good pour, it has way too much head. That quickly goes away, I give it a swirl and the lacing it leaves goes away very quickly. I might be wrong, but it looks darker than Bud Light.....Taste is pretty much average. Not a lot going on here. It’s sweet, maybe a liittle too sweet. There’s some rice action in there, I think that helps it out a lot......It’s pretty smooth. It’s somewhat flat. Whatever . . . . But overall, it is a pretty good beer. It’s a safe beer.

Bottle .30. Light hoppy and ricy aroma. Lively carbonation and almost no lacing at all. Light to medium body. Nice contrast between sweet and bitter. Ricy flavor and surprisingly, a tad spicy. Quite unexpected.

Copenhagen 6/12 2014. 50 cl can from Netto (pretty cheap). Pours clear, pale yellow with white head. Dissipates quickly. Weak aroma of malts and grain. Medium low carbonation. Almost no taste at all. A little saltiness - not much else. The King of Beer - the King of nothing...

I’m not even going to comment on the liquid. The only impressive aspect of this product to me is the level of consistency the brewers achieve. It is amazing that they create the same known flavor profile enormous batch after enormous batch in several different locations. This is the science side and craft beer is the art.

Pours a very pale gold with a quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is almost non existent but is slightly sweet and malty. Clean, malty sweet flavor. My bottle is nearly a year old, but shows no signs of oxidation. Not quite watery body and a dry finish. Light yellow, almost transparent, pour. A flash of a white head. Nose is grain. Neither really sweet nor bitter. Middle is little hard fruit, grain. Finish is a little dry, more from carbonation than hop presence. Not much else to say.

Bottle. Pale golden color with small disappearing head. Aroma is toneless, with unpleasant notes of rice or corn. Taste is disbalanced, sweety with sourish notes. Aftertaste is absent. One of the worst beers in Russian shops.

Decided to take this beer for a test. A dull and watery beer, lacks body or flavour and does not live up to it’s slogan ’king of beers’.

The color is extremely light and transparent. The aroma is not overly complicated. The taste is disappointing. Rice with a corn sweetness and a sticky consistency. The finish is soap with a mild bitterness. The carbonation is strong.

Well, I decided after years of some of the most amazing beers and ales in the world, I’d give Budweiser a whirl just to see what I’m not missing! Colour...very pale yellow with no head. Nose...I think all I smell is my nose, but with a very faint smidgen of something hop like nearby. Palate...for a very brief moment, there was something slightly like honey and cut grass and then POOF; gone! Lightly fizzy hard water follows and a titch of salt. This is not really an offensive beer product substitute, it’s just quite meh. I hear that the unfiltered Bud actually has a bit more in terms of flavour.

By far the worst beer I have ever had (Comparing only to the classic "beers"). Horrible taste, not much aroma, and frankly not much of anything offered to attract me to drinking Bud. For long the "King of Beers" and for long overrated. Coors and Miller are by far superior. Stroh’s is favored.
Pale yellow pour, white head disappears a little fast, bitterless and a little bit sweet taste, soft pale body, light flavors of malt and rice, hop character is undetected.

Yep. King of beers. Of all the cheap pissy lagers I’ve drank over my lifetime, this one, Molson Canadian and PBR are the three I’ve consumed most. No, they aren’t quality, but fuck it -- this WAS ’beer’ when I was still drinking underage near 30 years ago and I won’t apologize for having a special, nostalgic spot for it in my alcoholic heart (but I realized tonight, after grabbing a 24 oz can at the Shell station on the way home from work, that I never rated it... so this one is for the Clydesdales. Merry Christmas!)
The ubiquitous ’King of Beers’ sampled in Chicago. Rather strange taste of syrup and cardboard, without much bitterness. Very bland favours. Not to my taste at all, I’m afraid.

medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, slick feel, lively, fizzy,

Transparent white/yellow appearance obstructed only by a significant amount of bubbles. Stunted aroma consisting of malt, grain, and a wee bit of honey. Some metallic notes as well. Thin, watery, and light. Initial tingly carbonation sensation is immediately enveloped by a mildly sweet grain taste, finishing with absolutely no hops and a rather dreadful lingering cardboard/corn taste. The King of Beers indeed.
Hmmm, is it good or bad that I have not rated this one yet? Or is it worse that for a night cap, all the store at my hotel had was a 6 pack of this? Or is it even worse that I bought it? Hmmm ...
What can be said about such an empty tasting beer? At least it was so cold you couldn’t taste quite how bad it was.

Over the last few years in the UK, respect for beer has increased exponentially. Even somewhere like a bad bar / nightclub / hotel / student union etc, will usually stock one or two drinkable bottles at a bare minimum. So it seemed almost an affront, when I found myself at a themed nightclub event in Shoreditch of all places, and the only beer available was canned Bud. I don’t think I’ve drunk this beer in at least 10 years. As expected: barely existent malt flavour, no hop character, very thin mouthfeel, little bitterness, little of anything except water and CO2. On the positive side, the extreme wateriness of this beer means that the cardboardy, skunky, metallic nastiness is also much less pronounced than in, for example, its European mass market competition like Stella and Heineken.

Can. Light yellow color. Small-medium white head. Of course, without lacing. In aroma corn, some pear and wood notes. Actually not so bad. And taste: yes it is empty ( some corn, metal notes) with some sweetness. Probably most neutral I had ever try. Crisp. Overall: it is classic macrobrew example. Not better, also not so worser.
Una delle peggiori birre commerciali in circolazione. Una birra che sa di artificiale in tutto, dagli aromi ai sapori
Another watery lager that tasted like water with little bit beer flavor. Unpleasant to drink. Dosen’t even have any aroma at all.

Yes, I’ve had this beer. You could really substitute virtually any macro lager rating here since the differences between the major brands relate more to the label and bottle style and the advertising campaigns than to the beers themselves. It’s clear golden with a fluffy white head. Aroma and flavor of lightly peppery and watery corn flakes.
"typical golden. what can i add that everyone doesn’t already know. slightly skunky and not very pleasing. for a cheap thirst quencher on a hot day, i’ll choose Coors."

It was better before InBev ruined Anheuser Busch. The Brazilians ruin everything. Cheap, corrupt and incompetent. 

Bud was a much better beer before the buyout. I’ve had beers from all over the world, all methods and styles, and I have a broad taste for beers....from Polish to Russian to Chinese to Japanese to Mexican to Canadian to American to Irish to Belgian to German to French to Italian to Dutch.

Bud was a thirst quencher, an old friend, dependable as Coke, and ALWAYS better out of a bottle than a tin can. But now they changed the recipe with much cheaper hops and ruined it. Pity. And yes I know that InBev owns a lot of foreign labels too. Including Stella Artois, one of my favorites. 

Bring back original Budweiser!
Bottle and tap. Better than some "heavy" domestics, but not as good as Hamms.

Tasted on 10/16/14 from a capped 24oz bottle purchased at the gas station. Pours clear straw with a thick, fizzy white head that quickly recedes to average, even lace. The nose is fairly balanced hay and bread malt with a bit of grassy green hops. The flavor is a bit more of the hops, but pretty bland sweetish corny bread malt otherwise. The body is light with fizzy, lively carbonation, and a short lightly grassy and bready finish.

330ml bottle served in a tumbler glass.
A: Pours the traditional adjunct later yellow-golden color. Clear. Medium bubbled white head. Small retention. No lacings left. 
S: Sweet pale malts and adjunct malts. Light notes of grassy and flowery hops. 
T: Slightly sweet pale malts in the upfront. Crispy. Light hops bitterness. Cardboard and corn
M: Very light and watery body. Medium carbonation. Adjunct malts in the aftertaste. 
O: Low drinkability. Extremely artificial taste. Mass production trash Lager.
[ BA Review @ 5/5/2011 ]
Oh dear. This is watered down with no smell, tastes of cheap malts and homoeopathic hops. Poor America - if this is what they drink, no wonder why they start wars all the time.

500 ml can, 4,4% version, given to me as a present 

Clear white golden beer with big white head leaving lacing. Aroma has light lemon, cardboard and starch. Flavor has light maltiness and light fruitiness, but mostly is just watery. Thin palate with strong carbonation. A short bite of bitterness. Not the most disgusting beer out there but very flavorless. I’m surprised about finding fruity notes from this. Perhaps I didn’t rinse the glass well enough after drinking an APA?
Bottle@ De Tolly Joogipood. Aroma of cheap lager. Everything is tasteless. Not for me.
Well, the world famous Budweiser. not bad if you’re out in a bar shooting pool or having a BBQ. There’s a reason its the best selling beer I guess so to each their own.
