There is absolutely nothing wrong with budweiser. It is what it is. It’s a mass produced lager with not much taste, not much aroma not much of anything. BUT it’s pretty damn good still. You can put these away with absolutely zero struggle and it’s a slice of americana. Just fine beer.
It’s not too awful. it’s an inoffensive lager but I can’t think of any reason you should drink it if there’s more on offer.
The King of Beers, is actually a not bad beer for a massed produced behemoth. It is everywhere and it actually has excellent color and goes down well. it pairs well with most food also!!
Can. Pours light yellow, small head. Faint aroma of hops, caramel. Taste: carbonated water, some malt.
Bottle. Straw-coloured. Corn and cereal in the aroma. Same thing in the taste, some malt is detectable, pretty smooth. Nothing special, unsurprisingly.

What to say other than it is the most popular beer in the world but I find Busch to be better and I don’t see what is so special about it. I don’t buy it unless I’m at a bar and don’t feel like asking whats on the list.

Pale golden blonde beer with very weak grainy aroma, some corn, low grassy hop bitterishness in the finish, otherwise rather watery profile. Thirst-quenching but not much more.

this one is easy go hangover，bitterness at the first beginning and last to the last drop but nothing else i can tasted，not a good plae lager，at least to me

The taste starts sweet, watery finishing without any real bitterness. No aftertaste. What to say - not much to this beer.

If rescued from a desert survival situation would drink over urine to survive other wise would not open my wallet for this

Price wise at $5.99 a six pack ,the national suggested price in bottles, Budweiser leaves one to consider a number of options at the same price range sold at Trader Joes. 

The company idea was to be able to taste a Budweiser at any one of their breweries and have the same exact product, meeting exact brewing standards however a St Louis bud actually tastes far better than one from Mandeville LA and both different than a Fairfield CA product which tasted like it was made from the local grown corn.

You know what you are getting with Budweiser. Consistently bland and water-like. Actually, there isn’t much bad you can say about it ... nothing offensive, no bad tastes. It’s just .... the beer is the king of un-beers.
  
(update: 500ml can, Kiev. 13 April 2021) 
AROMA: light lager nose, faint sweetness, maybe some corn/rice, wet paper bag.  suprisingly, there is a touch of woodiness. (2 -> 3)
APPEARANCE: pale straw yellow, fizzy like a soda pop, clean and clear, no residual (2 -> 1)
TASTE: tad sweet, a bit like sweetened dairy/yogurt, almost no malt upfront, some green grass, watermelon rind, faint grain and hops start about half way thru (3 -> 4)
PALATE: light body, fresh and fizzy, not much follow thru, maybe a tad of hoppy dryness at the end (2 -> 2)
  
OVERALL: as i wrote before, not very beer-ish. Nothing offensive about it, just too simple. If you like easy simplicity, then go for it. I actually think I would get bored if I tried to drink 2 or 3 in a row.  Better than Coors Light. (4 -> 5)

Review according to BJCP2008 Guidelines (style 1B). Bottle 30 cl - Batch 31/10/13 B03. AROMA: slight sweet grainy aroma. no hop aroma. Refreshing beer with other grains but barley. Cannot well be compared to German beers. Otherwise: American interpretation of a "Vollbier", what can go wrong if you take water, malted grains, hops and yeast. Taste: taste of beer - but with an own note by other grains. Refreshing, good.
(If you want to taste bananas, caramel, hazelnuts, strawberries, butterscotch etc. as many raters do - just put these together with beer in a blender. This is good beer, but due to other grains not to German law and standard. Very American!)

Poured from can into pint glass

Appearance –A very pale golden color with a big billowy pure white head. The head fades very fast giving almost no lacing.

Smell – Mainly corn in nature with an ever so light caramel aroma present within.

Taste – Some breadiness and maltier corn tastes are strong up front. As the taste advances it seems to sweeten some. More sweet corn and bits of caramel and white sugar sweetness bring the flavor to its end.

Mouthfeel –Thinner body with a higher level of carbonation. The carbonation fits the thin body nicely, providing something more refreshing then savory.

Overall –It is a classic, average and refreshing. It is not the most flavorful beer out there and is very standard, but as with any beer it has its place. This one is built for tailgating the like.

I poured a 25oz can into a shaker glass. It was canned on 28 December 2013 and cost $1.64 ($0.07 per ounce).



Appearance: Pretty shade of white gold, crystal clear with fine carbonation visible. Initially pours to a large, bright white, soapy head which mostly fizzles away and leaves little lacing on the glass.



Smell: Practically odorless. Only faint hint of malt and some acetaldehyde. 



Taste: There’s no beer that epitomizes the American adjunct macro lager more than Budweiser. The self-proclaimed "King of Beers" is merely the king of sales. Of course, popularity does not necessarily equal quality and this beer is proof of that. Frankly, it seems more bland than repulsive to me, but then again it’s extreme lack of genuine quality is what’s repulsive.



Drank cold the palette is virtually neutral tasting. A hint of pale malt character plus some starch character from the rice adjunct. If it warms to anything beyond fridge temp it begins to emit a distinct tanginess. Slightly metallic in nature as well as mealy green apple (a surefire indicator of acetaldehyde). For the most part, it’s ignorable, but that doesn’t change the fact there just isn’t anything in the genuine palette to enjoy. I’m offended by its inoffensiveness.



Drinkability: If there’s anything a beer like Budweiser ought to be good for, it’s drinkability. And indeed this beer excels in that area. The mouthfeel is thin with a consistent crispness that crackles across the tongue as it goes down. Sometime the carbonation gets stuck in the throat, but it’s always quaffable. It finishes mostly clean with just a slightly starchy aftertaste. For 5% ABV it definitely should have a lot more flavor than it does. It’s hard to believe the "light" version of this is even more popular.
Pours very light yellow with a white head that disappears very quickly. Sweet aroma, slight grain. Taste is subdued, sweet aftertaste, fairly watery.

The taste is mildly sweet throughout, with a little lemon bitterness to balance it out. The taste is smooth.
The texture is crisp with soft edges and moderate carbonation.
Besides not holding a head, this is a pretty good beer. The taste and texture are excellent. Smooth and flavorful; even more so considering the style.

Clear, pale yellow. No head to speak of, some small light lacing. Grainy aroma, slightly sweet. Metallic, sweet. Longish finish that is slightly stale tasting. Fairly carbonated, effervescent.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours clear yellow with a frothy white head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is slightly sweet with canned corn, cereal, overripe plums, watered down lemonade and hints of grass. Taste is sweet and tiny bitter with old white bread, canned corn, overripe plums, overripe persimmon and hints of grass and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is round, tiny cloying and light bodied. finish is sweet and tiny bitter with old bread, canned corn, overripe persimmon and hay. Not as bad as I expected but till pretty damn bad...

Slightly sweet malt flavor, with a corn backbone.  Well-built, simple, but could be more balanced.  Dominated by malt, as the brewer intended.

Light, smooth, and effervescent mouthfeel.

Overall, a simple, unoffensive beer that I would have again.

12 ounce bottle poured into a pilsner glass.

Appearance: clear pale yellow; white fizzy foam; light lacing; some carbonation.
Aroma: wet grainy cereal aroma; a trace of hop aroma in the background.
Taste: again just cereal and corn with little else to offer.
Palate: thin watery and slick however it was smooth with a decent finish.
Overall: advertised as the "King of Beers". I can get a Bud anywhere in the world on any day and it will always taste the same. The quality control for macro brews is outstanding on maintaining the same thing all the time. But it is not a king or a prince for that matter. It is something to drink when there is no other choice.

No canning information.

Appearance: The body is crystal clear with a golden hue, the head is white and rather short with poor retention. After it’s settled it leaves no indication there was a head.

Aroma: Mild malt sweetness, and a touch of noble hops. Very mild.

Taste: Slight malt sweetness with a light rice flavor. A touch of spicy and lemony noble hops is apparent. 

Palate: Crisp medium bodied.

Overall: This isn’t good, but it isn’t offensive. It’s just beer.

The taste is mildly sour, touch sweet, slightly salty, and the palate fuses a light body, thin texture, average carbonation, and an abrupt finish.
16 oz draft. Pours light yellow. Little to no head. Corn and starch aroma. Flat taste. Nothing going on here.

Smells slightly sweet and grainy, but pretty neutral for the most part. Tastes much on par with the nose. Slightly sweet and malty up front, but the flavor finishes fast. As soon as the carbonation swoops in, the flavor is lifted off the tongue for a very clean and mostly dry finish.

355ml can. Pale yellow colour, foam white head and aroma of malt & grain, straw, cardboard. Taste is sweet malty, grainy, with alittle grassy bitterness. Light bodied, high carbonation, some residual sweetness and earthy bitter finish. A very bland lager.

Aroma: Corn, light fruitiness (banana), light hops, 
Appearance: Very light yellow, clear, frothy head initially but it dies away to a thin line around the glass.
Taste: Light grainy, slightly sweet taste. Dry finish. Crisp, light bitterness, light citrus notes.
Palate: Medium high carbonation, light bodied, light hoppiness, 
Overall: It is a lightly flavoured beer with a light aroma. It is a beer that can be consumed large quantities and it is. I know this beer is not well liked, but it is exactly what it set out to be. I enjoyed the beer and I would not say no if offered one of these. I think I may be losing any credibility I ever had! :) This is a perfect example of an American Lager/Pale Lager.
PS. Will cause loads of burps! O_o

350 ml bottle, poured. Freshly imported from USA! Thanks Amanda and Wimpie!

I actually drank two of these that were left over in my fridge after the 4th. Don’t get me wrong, Bud was always my favorite College Keg Beer. If I were stranded on a desert island with a keg of Bud, I would be a very happy man, but would I ever buy another six pack of Bud Long Necks? Only if the other option was Busch Light.
What is there to say? It’s Bud Lights big brother. Everything is the same pretty much!

Pours a golden yellow with a white fluffy head that quickly dissipates. There is a fair amount of carbonation coming from the bottom of the glass. The nose is slightly grainy, maybe a clove hint from the yeast. Some decent lager esters, maybe a slight slight banana sweetness. Taste is more of the same. Nice carbonation pop, esters and clean finish. The King of Beers. Well American Adjunct lagers anyway.

Its Budweiser, I think anyone who drinks beer must of at some point in there life drank a Budweiser. Biggest mass produced beers in the world. Rather bland and tasteless. Just thrown in the low rankings among many other boring major bland labels.

Ah Budweiser...was in the fridge so here goes. Pour was watery-gold all the way through with a white head that disappeared after a short while. Aroma was of general beer, same with the taste. There are no overwhelming flavors (besides that of memories) or scents; actually, there’s nothing overwhelming after all...it’s just...Budweiser. It’s better than ozarka after a work day and there will probably always be some in my fridge. Wicked hangover if you decide to go varsity with this, though, and bonus points for the Stars and Stripes can...

Well, what can you say about budweiser? As one of my friends used to say "It’s just Beer." Better than light beers in that at least it offers some flavor, particularly its distinct beechwood finish. It’s a little watery but better than some other average beers. It may be the king of beers in sales but hardly in taste. Nothing comes across as artificial in this beer, so to me at least the claim of all-natural ingredients seems validated. Its nothing fancy, OK for what it is, probably better suited for the title of "plain old american beer."

Bottle - Pours clear yellow, then turns a shade darker in the glass. Theres a lot of foam that settles down to a small frothy head. The bubbles are plentiful in the beer. The aroma is of light, clean malt and hops. The flavor is slightly sweet and malty with a small hop finish.

It is what it is. I can think of many worse beers than Budweiser. Interestingly enough, this beer seems like Nickelback - apparently everyone hates it, but it’s one of the biggest-selling beers in the world. 
Regardless, I’ve always liked Budweiser as a standard cheap beer - in my region, I prefer it to Kokanee and Molson Canadian for sure. 
Aroma is not exactly enticing - alcohol and a bit of wood. Appearance is standard - minimal head, pale yellow colour, no lacing. Flavor is almost so subtle that it tastes like a liight beer, but still pleasant. Grain and cereal, with a bit of a sweet tone in the background that lingers a little. Palate is fine - not overly carbonated, leaves a decent sweet aftertaste. 
Honestly, for what it is, it’s good. I like it, always have. Refreshing, non-intrusive, just a basic lager.
Bottle at home, done from memory, rating is just for my own. I will edit if I drink it again, Nothing special, really just beer that needs to be drunk very cold, and if there is nothing else.
There is not much to say about this beer other than it is Bud. You know what it is and you know how it tastes. For beer drinkers, this is not a good or refreshing choice.
My palate says: "choose another beer!" I think it’s absolutely right. Surely, it won’t be my favourite one. However If you want to drink it, drink it very cold!

Bottle into a pint glass. Golden and lightly gassy, ok head. Malty but largely dull aroma. Metallic, watery and sweet - oh dear. I can’t detect any of the beechwood aging. Definately not the king of beers.
Bottle. A lot more worse compared to the original Budweiser from Budwar - for my taste. Pale golden color, weak white head, faint aroma, very thin-bodied.

Aroma has cereal malts mostly.
Flavor is bit malty, sugary. No bitternes or hop flavor.

Smells like a bowl of stale weetbix. Tastes like a glass of water strained through said weetbix with a drop of cooking oil added. The beer itself isn’t offensive per se, but the claim to be the king of beers is.

On draft @ sportsman pub
Aroma: no aroma whatsoever, water and maybe some malt sweetness..?
Appearance: gold, pale yellow, head dies down substantially with minimal lacing, somewhat soapy
Taste: malt sweetness, syrup, rice, barley, wheat, corn, minimal hops, watered down
Palate: slightly evident notes of wheat, barley, and rice, heavily carbonated

Golden to medium brown body, no head (fortunately, that would’ve been a bit disgusting). Strong and pleasant aroma with obvious roasted notes, faint but pleasant hints of lemon, basil, garlic and vague sweet pale malts. The flavours follow the aromas. Unusually juicy mouthfeel: yup, it was definitely a good idea to roast this chicken with a can of Budweiser up its behind, http://tinyurl.com/cvpz8z7 . Speaking of Budweiser, maybe I should rate the marinade as well? I actually tried to taste the so-called beer before it went into the oven with the chicken, and that was of course a very faint, thin, watery and uninteresting experience that I’ve no need to repeat. No obvious off-flavours, though. But you don’t want to drink this stuff, it should be used as marinade only.

I had my VERY FIRST Budweiser last night at Greektown Casino. A friend bought it for me, so I rolled with it.

I can’t speak for the appearance, since it was in a bottle, but I’m rating it with what my overall rating is.

The smell of this screams piss-poor quality. Like you’d expect from an adjunct ... corn. Almost like a rotted corn. Not pleasant.

The taste is about the same. Corn, and I really get nothing else. Essentially alcoholic corn water. It doesn’t make me gag, but I was already five beers deep, so I wasn’t exactly on top of my game.

Overall, the "King of Beers" isn’t even the king of macros. Budweiser is a sorry excuse of a beer. I used to say this before I had ever even had one, but now that I have, I can accurately say that THIS BEER SUCKS.

[Old rate]  - A decent lager - light and refreshing with subtle bitterness.  Very easy drinking.  Only good on tap though.  Bad out of a bottle.  Certainly not something to savour, but it’s not that bad either. 


July 2015 - Keg at a wedding.  Pint.  Drinkable, pleasant beer.  Went very well with all the courses of the meal, along with the red wine.  Yes it’s a little corny with soft hops but never insipid or metallic, which is what usually lets down macro-lagers.  Decent.  (3.0)

330ml can with abv 4.5 % bought at local 7-Eleven. Very pale yellow colour;  Half-finger head and white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Near zero lacing and active carbonation; Pungent smell of rice grain, malt, corn, and faint wet cardboard; Light sweet taste of weak malt, hint of wet cardboard, rice grains, and barely noticeable trace of grassy hops; Feather light body, watery palate (can I just say piss water?); Zero hop bitterness, with only barely noticeable astringency and has no finish. Slighty dry after taste, very easy to mouth.



Comments: I know one of these days I have to get serious and rate this universally denounced “King of Beer”, and now is the time: piss-like colours, looks and body; rice-laden smell and taste (if any); no hoppiness and no finishing. It epitomizes all the worst excess of modern day heavily-adjuncted, faceless, tasteless no-quality macro lagers, but guess what? It’s well produced, with no skunk / diacetyl / metallic / acetaldehyde or whatever faults you can think of, except the very faint wet cardboard. This is the standard bearer of all mediocre macro beer-waters, because I have tasted many others which are worse than this.

Surprised I have never reviewed this although this is the first Bud I have had in a very long time. Had on tap in a pint glass.

Pours a clear pale yellow with a one finger white head that fades to a thin cap over the beer. Ok lacing.

Aroma has tons of cooked vegetable/DMS and stale malt/corn. I can barely detect a little cut grass from the hops coming through.

Flavor is much the same. Stale cooked vegetables along with a light touch of grass. Mouthfeel is fairly full but at the same time is slightly sticky and sweet. Not as refreshing as I remebered.

Overall, this is a pretty crappy beer. Bad flavor and too sticky a mouthfeel. There are many cheaper AAL’s out there that taste much better.
There is something in the core there, at least of the UK  Bud’s I’ve tried, which almost suggests substance. But it’s gone quicker than you can say Michelob.

Overall - Smooth and drinkable is not an unfair description, but there’s nothing here. Nothing particularly good, and nothing particularly bad. The RateBeer score is unfairly low, likely due to this beer’s popularity and that it’s American (kind of). Scores this low should be reserved for something truly awful, like Tiger, Blatz, or Miller High Life.

Some of you people need to get out and experience the world.

This is the best selling beer in Canada.

Serving type: Can poured in a glass.

Brewed and sold since 1876, "The King of Beers" is the largest-selling beer in the world. Budweiser has been the world’s best-selling beer since 1957, and is distributed in more than 70 countries. Budweiser leads the U.S. Premium beer category, outselling all other domestic premium beers combined. In fact, one in almost every five beers sold in the United States today is a Budweiser.

nothing going on here at all!!! just pure nothing.  I’ve had better off batches of homebrew than this crap
"The king of beers" är i högsta grad självutnämnd och kronan sitter rejält på sniskan. Inget karraktärsdrag sticker ut särskilt förutom möjligtvis självförtroendet. Lika blaskig som ryktet säger.

Budweiser was never more than drinkable. But since the cost cutting measures have come into effect at Anheuser-Busch InBev this stuff has become trash. I drank a can of this recently and there is way too much rice adjunct. The beer is very unbalanced in terms of body and hop profile. It is no better on tap. When your light beer is better than your lager you have a problem: Budweiser.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Coop. This one has been brewed by Stag from London, England. Pale yellow with a thin white head. Grainy aroma. Frainy taste with some faint woodnotes. Not as bad as I expected actually. For a pale lager it’s even quite good. Nice carbonation.

It's not as bad as I remember. I remember it as absolutely awful. It's not. But it's not good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Another one included in the BEERS OF THE WORLD package. First time I had this beer was last March in Mexico, imported from the United States. This one I ’m having now was actually brewed in England and it has some differences from the "original", with the label being the main one, where it’s written Bud instead of Budweiser, to differentiate it from the czechish Budweiser I suppose.The one I had in Mexico, I had straight from the bottle, so this is a nice chance to re-review it, taking it’s actual smell and overal appearance into account this time.
Pale golden yellow colour, with two fingers of froathy head, with great retention. It surprised me here. Enormous activity in the glass, with a continuous stream of countless bubbles feeding the head.
Not much on the aroma front, not bad, but not anything notable either. Just, neutral, except from a faint rice smell.
Hmm, "meh" taste. I don’t mind the rice taste in a beer, on the contrary sometimes I like it, but this one has it so subtle and flat that goes almost unnoticeable.
Very thin on the body and very light carbonation.
Back in Mexico this beer was a great break from all those corn flavoured mexican beers. Back here though it’s just a below the average beer. I can see why it is so popular in some places though, it’s very drinkable on a hot day and if you just came back home from work on a summer evening, this is a great thirst quencher. If I was living in such a climate myself and the price was right, I would certainly keep a bunch of those in my fridge.
Bottle. Pours clear golden with unstable white head. Light aroma of hops. A hoppy taste with a slightly sweety finish. Nothing remarkable, to put it mildly.

Can. Well it's not the same beer as they have tweaked the recipe sine they care about profit. But in a pinch its better than the rest of BMC. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light straw color; Light to medium body; Aroma and flavor of malt, cereal and grain; Fairly bland and a little watery; What more to say - a basic macro lager.

Golden pale, lot of carbonation, no aroma at all, bitter metallic flavor. The only good thing about this beer is that it has a good head retention. In Ecuador we have only crappy beer, and some months ago the biggest beer duopoly decided to produce Budweiser and Miller...excellent choices.....
Almost no fæavor and very watery palate. Light amber in color with a white head.

Every experience ive ever had with this beer is the same, the initial mouthfull is suprisingly pleasant and then turns harsh and cheap leaving me with a headache every time.  Anyone who enjoys budweiser should check out the kona longboard which is a much better upgrade to bud and still stays within the same guidelines for a bud drinker.  Pay the extra dollar or two and be good to yourself im convinced the only reason people still drink this is because of the massive advertisement and image, it cant possibly be because of the quality.
Assaggiata in bottiglia da 33 cl. Scarsa nell’aspetto con zero schiuma e un anonimo colore giallo paglierino. Pochissimo aroma, zero corpo e gusto acquoso. Nient’altro da aggiungere
Hints of vomit, Musty basement, sour sink sponge, moth balls, battery acid, with a nice urine finish

Reviewed 9/15. 10 oz. can poured into a beer mug - this doesn’t deserve one of my better glasses.

A: Pours a light straw color typical of a macro lager. The head is a two finger white color. I’m actually somewhat impressed that the head hasn’t faded away to nothing in record time, but that just means retention is poor, rather than hilariously lousy.

S: Rice-y, grainy, and kind of sweet, though perhaps not quite as nastily so as others in the style. Still nothing you need to make a conscientious effort to smell, though.

T: Again, it’s not quite as nastily sweet and corny as others. If anything the rice (instead of corn) makes it less offensive and more flavorless. The lack of flavor means its pretty easy to drink, but then again, like sex in a canoe, and all that jazz.

M: The general feel is almost good, truth be told. Unlike a lot of bad macro lagers (looking at you, Miller Lite), this isn’t oppressively carbonated, rather it’s just fairly strong. It actually has the same level of carbonation that Parabola does! Goes down like water, then again, it may well be sweetened water.

O: I half expected this to taste like infected monkey anus with a side of pus (in other words, like BL Platinum), but it manages to be merely bad. If it’s offered to me freely at a party, without anything else there worthwhile, I’ll drink it with zero complaints. Still, it’ll never be my cheap beer fix, especially when Yuengling’s lager is slightly less expensive - and far superior in quality.
Light golden colour, white head. Both aroma and taste are sweet. Probably the rice working there...Not the best pilsener.
Watery, horrendous piss. Sweet flavour added to sugar. Its ubiquity adds to its poor rating however and it will do if necessary. Best avoided however.

Aroma:  seems to be vaporized cow penis and a hint of ram urine, but you can’t smell it really so I’m not sure.  Appearance:  It gave me the middle finger.  Taste:  After the first sip I blacked out, when I woke up there was a dead animal and a pile of my clothes that had recently been defecated on.  Palate:  Gave me AIDS.  Overall:  Also gave me cancer though, so I guess CAIDS?  AIDCER?

473 ml can. Pours clear pale yellow with a large thick foamy head. Aroma of mild rice, mild grassy hops, strong cardboard and harsh maize. Taste of cloying maize, rice and mild hops. Light bodied, watery mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Hay and maize in finish. Mild, cloying and boring with bad palate.
It’s Bud, it’s beer, in a pinch it will do. A typical macro brew. High on volume, mediocre on taste.

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors pale yellow with no head. 
Aroma little malt. 
Taste small bitter, bad sweet. 
Mouth-feel thin. 
Not good.
You know what you’re getting with Bud. It’s an American classic and has a clean, fresh flavor. An easy drink.
Only slightly more flavor than bud light.  If you are going to drink crap, might as well get a boast in ABV.

Close to my heart, as it is the first beer I ever had. Not a terrible beer for what it is, and I would go Bud before any other mainstream american ale.

Light yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma....? ehh Flavour.....? ehh...It is not bad, but.....it do not taste much either. Water with alcohol. What is the point?
[Sip stolen from my son’s can]
What’s the point?  If I’m drinking bud it’s either Christmas or 3am at a party and there is absolutely NOTHING left.  Sometimes I go to bed rather than drink bud.

Can enjoyed at my local eagles club. Served ice cold by a lady from Oklahoma. Can't rate the appearance of this one. No glass available. Scent  there is none. Taste is thin and watery. Hints of grass and other than that, it's flavorless. Medium carbonation. Light body. Like crappy sparkling water.
Tastes like hose water from what I remember of my child hood summers. Kind of rusty, dirty, earthy water. A typical American lager; piss.

330ml bottle.  Not much to this American classic.  Smell is pretty much non existent so I can’t mark it down that much.....it’s not bad but not good.  Typical macro lager appearance but boy does that head go down.  The taste is basic easy drinking beer but the mouth feel is surprisingly thicker than expected,  you could say slightly bready.  If you’re going for a big session chug away.
Boa cerveja para o dia a dia. Apesar de mais cara, está no nível da Brhama. Bia para um churrasco em família

Rated with a slight bias toward the American in me.  I love everything that this beer stands for; Red,White, and Blue, small towns, pickup trucks, and mommas.  The marketing is phenomenal.  The taste is not so great.  Smells of rice, grain, astringent.  Taste is rice, grain, and boring.  Come on AB put some effort into it.
Draught. One of the most tastless uninspiring beers I have drunk. Slightly floral but nothing else. To imagine I used to drink bottles of this in nightclubs when I was 16 and thought it was cool.
If I could give this beer a 0 I would.  Its not even lager its rice beer.  Chamagny pour into a a fst fizzling head.  tastes like leftovers from a month old keg.  yuck!!

Review from memory, can’t remember any noticeable aroma aside form the pale lager standard, consumed straight out of the bottle and ice cold. Suprisingly, this didn’t mask the nastiness of this stuff, the only flavor is a blast of metal and then absolutely nothing on top of a hugely light almost non existant body. King of beers? More like king of swill. I can imagine worse, but not by much.

Aroma: caramelos flores, arroz y hojas suaves toques de banana.

Yeah I have to admit ’" I was a Kool-aid drinker", I used to love this, for years. Then I was introduced to (CRAFT BEER) , she stole my heart away. For good. But sometimes you think about your Ex.  And sometimes you stray back, just to wonder. Wow budweiser was flat, LOL, empty and offered me nothin. What a cheap date !

One of the better commercial lagers out there. The aroma is light of stale caramel popcorn and the taste is almost so. Finishes crisp and dry, even a tad malty but there is nothing to really cling on to. Perhaps they could formulate this into some form of mouth wash.
This beer is all American but mostly good for football season..  I drink this a party’s but never at bar, why waist money there...!

12 oz. Bottle. This beer offends me. To call itself the King of Beers is just ludicrous. No scent. Godlen pour with no head. Light an crisp feel, fizz finish (the highpoint of the beer). Slight grain flavor with odd metallic aftertaste even though I poured this from a bottle. Good job, Budweiser. You made all your swill taste like it’s straight from a can. King of Crap.
440 (?) ml can. The can doesn’t even contain half a litre! Poor little thing, total lack of character. The only good thing about it is the cool brand name and the status as a classic beer.

Surprised to see the score zero. It just cannot be. OK, there’s very little to praise, starting from the soapy aroma, almost as if masking the scent of something that has been regurgiated. The beer is crisp, to be honest. Lightly malty, and that’s it. No finish or detectable bitterness. If taken terribly cold, it can be an acceptable refreshment.
Bottle bought at the local Lidl and shared with MichaelBruch. Okay kind of beer to drink beneath a hearty meal, but altogether too sweet and boring.

Bottle shared with McTapps. Look is usual lager. Nose says nothing. Tastes is even more nothing. Maybe some malt in it. Water with beer look and beer alcohol. Simple. Was not drunken enough to enjoy it.
terrible terrible beer rated only for numbers. at least you can taste a bit of corn in it, other than that, there is nothing here. awful skunky garbage.

Waited to review until I could try it for free - who would pay for Bud? Tap. Clear pale yellow, small fizzy white head, little lacing. Aroma of grain and corn syrup. Flavor is mildly sweet corn, grain, metal. No real bitterness.
Nothing special. Carb’d brew, clean, crisp and flavorless, kinda sweet and all rice hangover
Bottled. Pours pale yellow with a white head. Smells grassy malty. Tastes bubbly. sweet bread malty with a bitter sweet finish.
Better than the lite’s.  Many will disagree, but this still tastes like beer to me, so I will pick it up if need be.
Bottle 0,33ltr: So never rated this "Bud", golden coulerded beer with sweetcorn taste and not much bitternesh, truly the blandest of the world.

floral, citrus, golden, sparkling, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, lively, bitter, 

Delicious! This brew goes great with anything  anywhere, anytime. Smooth, crisp and very, VERY drinkable. Why do you want to force a beer down? This just disappears. The only real true american lager. Love that light bitter aftertaste that follows the slightly sweet but very light fruit flavor. Superb blend of all important components. My all time favorite by a long shot. It’s easy to see why this stuff sells.

No es como para tirar cohetes, pero si he de elegir una cerveza de importación tipo Pale (heineken, fosters, carlsberg...) me quedo sin dudarlo con Bud. Es la más refrescante y menos amarga de todas ellas, dato importante para este tipo de cervezas. Si buscara una trapense, esta sería el líquido para lavar el vaso...
Lousy beer, such a shame this is the #1 selling beer in america.  Probably the same reason that "call me maybe" was also number smh.
One of my least favorite beers of all-time. Cannot drink it. Terrible aftertaste, no real flavor, just a lousy beer.

First review, have drank some beers in my short lifetime. Seems natural I review this first. Bought bottled, pale, light sweetness, hardly any taste, a nice amount of froth. A hint of rice but mostly water. Easy to drink, must serve very cold. Refreshing. Cheap, gets the job done.

I feel Bud has been badly discriminated by most drinkers being the most mainstream macro lager you will ever find. I’ve had better global brands like hoegaarden and kilkenny, but suffice to say I’ve had a lot worse too in Australia and from my Asian travels, which are surprisingly better rated than Bud.

No one really thinks it’s good - but it’s far from the worst.
My first and only american beer. :-)  It has mild smell of wheat and corn. It’s weak and flavourless but refreshing. Average beer.

Aug 11 2012. I bought this because my local Labatts brewery brews more of this than my Blue now and had to give it a closer look. First off, all the (so called) beer snobs who berated it are doing so purely out of bias because of its macro identity. I dont believe these immature critics are confident in their own ability enough to give it a fair review. I am and do; so here is the truth: Bottle pours clear, straw yellow with an inch frothy head which settles to a cap and gives light lacing but lasts. Aroma is yeast with slight sweet fruit even almost floral. Taste is sweet malt caramel at start leading to a more fruity softness and a slight tart, bitter dry finish. All of this is extremely mild and easy drinking. Palate is crisp and clean with only slight tartness in finish. A premium pilsner. There is a reason this is the best selling beer worldwide. Its cheap, easy drinking, and good light flavour.
The original King of very weak beer. Will drink it any time there is not a craft beer on the taps

The destroyer, man.  12oz bottle, it didn’t deserve dirtying a glass in my opinion.  It’s interesting trying this beer again after tasting ~300 beers; my memory of it was actually better than reality.  There’s really no point in trying to describe it’s taste characteristics, you like it or you don’t.  I don’t.
Cooked vegetables, cough drop, barnyard, alcohol, cooked vegetables, chocolate, toast, dough, bubblegum
Budweiser is what I want when I don’t want a Pale Ale.  The American flag looking label just looks good in my fridge.
Whether straight out of a can, bottle, on tap, or poured, it’s still incomparable in its awfulness.

Tastes like carbonated water with hint of beer. No palate to speak of. Still when nothing good is available it’s refreshing when served ice cold.
Light wheat/sourdough taste.
Not to go off on a rant but I definitely wouldn’t call it a zero due to it tasting better than bud light (which is undrinkable even for an unwashed like me). Calling it a zero to me is just plain elitist. If you’ve got even a Sam Adams next to it, definitely go for the Sam’s but if it’s a warm summer day, they’ve only got Miller, Bud Light and Labbatt’s on tap, reach for this and drink it before it becomes warm and loses carbonation.

Light aroma is slightly sweet. Corn, rice, not much more. Very pale, straw, clear, bit sparkly, ok white frothy head but not for long. Taste is light and sweet also and has green apple mostly. Light body, thin feel, low carbonation, short finish. Not much of a palate. Overall seems bit watery and diluted. Not much character here. One of the shy ones that does not want to bother anyone but ends up irritating quite many by being so flat, plain, almost invisible. Hard to understand why this is so popular.

Belle couleur doré et très bon goût. C’est vraiment la meilleur bière qu’on peut trouver partout au quebec. C’est vraiment un classique et elle est facile a boire et ne donne pas de maux de tetes le lendemain. C’est une des bonnes bières et elle est aussi facile a boire que de boire de l’eau avec un gout de bière bien spécifique à cette bière. Bref très bonne bière.

Wow. this REALLY IS the King of Beers !!!!!.......no, just kidding.

Scent is weet corn malt.
Taste is watery, watery grain and rice.
It’s just simply not good. At all.
Virtually any other American pale lager is better than this.
I think the Clydesdales are more involved in the brewing process than perhaps we need to know.
so much better than bud light. when freezing cold this is tasty. not much else to say, basic beer with a standard alcohol level. there are many better ones out of there.

On draft at Busch Gardens in Williamsburg, VA.   OK, I’m not a fan of this beer or brewer, but I had to taste this on a very hot day at the park, being so close to the brewery.  It was clean tasting and highly carbonated.  Otherwise, not much flavor brought to the table.
Tastes of water, no really perhaps foysty water avoid like carling rubbish , utter rubbish

Disclamer: This is actually a 4.4% version from a can (but I didn’t think the world would be much better having yet another version of this beer in ratebeer, made according to some regional regulations). Yellow, pale with a frothy head. Nose has murky rice, lager esters. Taste is pretty much the same; rice (like smelling at a pot of freshly cooked rice, makes me think of sushi actually), slight butteryness. Soft mouthfeel, watery, easy to drink. Doesn’t taste like much. But I found it refreshing to try. Like most pale lagers, I think they should rename the genre ’yeast samplers’ or something similar. They don’t have really anything else to offer than what the yeast brings to it. It’s like drinking a carbonated yeast starter.
Very neutral taste, absolute nothing special, normal standardarized supermarket beer...
not my thing, a baw hair better than miller. if its a choice between these 2, get a vodka and tonic
Bottle.  Pale yellow boredom, whispy head.  Aroma mildly sweet.  Taste is initially crisp but very abrupt.  Sweet and fizzy.  No bitterness.  Very bland.  But you already knew that.
Bud é clássica. Bem gostosa com espuma no ponto. Pode ser impressao, mas a long neck é mais gostosa do q a lata.
Had a can on the patio at a party. Was worse than most macro lagers. Flavorless and fizzy, slightly refreshing. Take Coors Banquet over this, if you must.
On tap and on bottle. Typical macro brewed lager => tasteless. I don’t recommend it... avoid

Clear,very light yellow,frothy head ,light lacing.Head retention remains well with a layer of foam.

This is mildly pilsner sweet at first,mild apple,sorta grainy,with soft breadiness,there is a mild refined bitterness,with a drying  slight tart finishSlight floral quality about this..Light smooth,slightly chaulky,clean and mild. Why all the hate?Solid premium lager. Dont follow douch advice. There is a reason this sells,its mild drinkable  clean and mild and its a pale lager which people dont seem to fit in their brain what this style means.
0.3l bottle. A clear golden lager with very short-lived white head, poor aroma and watery taste. Drinkable but nothing more.
hard to hate this because it offers so little that it’s pretty inoffensive..american marketing genius has made this a giantbut,this is the beer equivalent to wonderbread

For a mass produced beer it delivers a consistent taste.The Bud I had in Qiqihar was the same as the Bud in Apia,Hong Kong ,Sydney  et al.When it is priced at a premium over the "knock -off" brewed under licence Euro lagers I shy away but when competitively priced I’m happy to make the purchase.It is what it is-I quite like the different flavour nuances[rice?] I have never had a draught Bud but suspect it would be a pretty good session beer.Why anyone in USA would prefer to drink Corona instead of this beggars belief.
Trying to find the taste but there is little. The little taste has a funky sour aftertaste. Pours pale yellow with little head. One beer I buy if it’s only on special.
Better that Heineken, good taste, a little bitter for a pilsen, but acceptable. Remindable taste and smell.
way too carbonated and a slight paper wet cardboard type flavor, no real hop flavors, not even saaz type hops. Actually really bad.
Horrible.  Odeur de sucre cheap (maïs), goùt trop sucré qui lève le coeur.  Dès que ça se réchauffe, le tout dégénère mais j’ai jeté la bière avant de la déguster dans toute son horreur.

Tasted both tap and bottled/canned versions but this refers purely to the bottles/cans. 750ml  bottles, 440ml cans. You know there are a lot of detractors of this beer. "Piss water" is a phrase i hear often, but you know what, on a hot summers day, at the end of the working day, there are few that are more refreshing. No its not the beer to wax lyrical about, but as good, inexpensive, mass produced refresher - it aint too bad at all. Its taste is subtle but it is there. and you know what? Its quite nice!!! My only problem is the gas levels- you just cant stop burping with the stuff.

Once I had a Bud that I found deep in a cabinet in a new apartment. God knows how long it was there. Since it is technically beer (it is, right?), I drank it. It was no worse than it is fresh. Really awful.

Surprisingly drinkable, for someone who hasn’t had a mass-brewed beer in years.  It was a hot day, and there was no other choice, but I didn’t object to it at all.  Refreshing more than ’tasty’, it serve its purpose for quenching a thirst, well.
One of the better American made beers....or wherever its made today. Great, relaxing to drink.
Palest lager, pissy-water with white-ish head. Sour grass corn aroma and taste. Pretty funky in not so nice a way, Some flavor there at leat.

Don’t expect to read any taste notes here! Because there is nothing to write! No aroma, hardly any taste to describe!  But there is something about this beer. Even though it does not have much taste, it is a beer that has made its place and i enjoy drinking it whenever iam not looking for anything tasty or fancy. Any person new to beer should have this 1st simply because it is very drinkable! Grab a bottle and then, a bunch of friends is all u need!

This was the first beer that I actually enjoyed. The classic light lager has a taste that shocks for how much budweiser is produced. As a St. Louis native, it is in my genes to enjoy the satisfying flavor of "the king."

Those knocking this beer should consider what this beer is, and isn’t.  This is not a small batch craft brew with unique grains or heavy hops.  This is a mass produced beer, and as they go, I think one of the better ones.  If that isn’t your thing, that’s ok.
Guess I should rate this eventually.  Bottle.  Pours pale straw.  Aroma and flavor are faint hops, a bit of sweet malt.  Not much here.  Amazed how little flavor it really does have.

Red/white/blue can proudly stating "King of all beers" poured into a glass.  Has a golden color with no head really.  No aroma either, maybe some malt and grain.  Taste is much the same, maybe some grains and corn.  I can’t really call this beer anything, it’s just there.  Guess no flavor and LOTS of marketing make this the giant it is.
It’s Budweiser and it is a very boring American lager. I can’t believe this type of beer is sold in the quantities it is when microbrews have so much personality.
Cerveza muy suave que se bebe muy fácil. No es tan mala como la nota que tiene, aunque supongo que llevar el nombre de "cerveza americana" por todo el mundo debe joder a los cerveceros yankis.
Bouteille 341ml. Bière d’un jaune très pâle. Arôme et goût absent. Aucun arrière-goût.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.

fizzy yellow beer, I would rather drink water thank you very much. 

I enjoy the commercials but that is as far as it goes.
This is a right of passage beer. The only way I can drink this is if it has a bomber of rootbeer in it. *shudder*
Golden/grey colour with almost no head. No bitterness. Watery, bland. Very similiar to water.
As much as I love craft beers, sometimes I just want a Budweiser. Not much more to say.
Good go to american brew. My favorite easy to find beer. The coca cola of beers. Great for all occasions
Great taste but slightly boring after a few, nice after taste.............................
I don’t really know what this is.. Water with alcohol? Even Heineken has more taste.

Draught at Olearys Visby.
Pours pale yellow with a white head.
Clean and light in every aspect, or in one word dull.
Carbonated, barely there, malt, barley taste.  Definitely a drinkable beer.. for activities like shot gunning and beer pong.

Pours a clear light yellow with a ruddy brown head. Light lacing. Half-decent crisp nose, punctuated with shoe leather and chocolate. Nightmarish maple taste, with notes of rosewater and hops. Mouth-filling mouthfeel and disappointing finish.
Cerveja ruimmm, fraca e feita com uma água gaseificada amarga ou algo assim...

Ugh, I cant really give this a 0.0, I mean Keystone is still on the market. This is the official beer of white trash NASCAR lovers...I can not drink this with out a gag reflex and that is not an exaggeration.
A nice smooth beer perfect to drink at home, my go-to beer by default. Very soft, easy to drink.
Banana, banana, banana, banana, banana, banana, banana, banana, banana, banana, banana

It not bad for what it is. Stale barley. Nice color.  Ok in a pinch.

Sample at a workshop.
Thin white head. Clear golden pour. Boring but not as bad as I expected.
Medium head with short duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are malt, grain, bread and hops.

Bote de 330ml. Vaso lager. Saboreada en sep´11. Color pajizo pálido y apariencia cristalina. Capa blanca, algodonosa con amplia burbuja y sobrecarbonatada. Aromas de levadura, ligero sulfuro y sutíl toque de miel. Entrada suave y dulce. Afrutada en el intermedio. Final de suave y seco amargor. Cuerpo ligero por lo que resulta de fácil asimilación.
330ml can. Lager glass. Enjoyed on sep´11. Pale straw color, crystal clear appearance. White, rocky, large bubbled, overcarbonated, head. Yeasty & slightly sulphur aromas, subtle honey touch. Enters smooth & sweet. Fruity in the middle. Smooth dry bitter finish. Light body resolves in an easy drinkability.

Watery, no real flavour, skunky, metallic aroma, no head, artificial carbonation.... I Hate this kind of shitty commercial beers and wish they all go to hell (which ain’t gonna happen unfortunately..)

I don’t like how they say it gives a "taste you will find in no other beer at any price" and think whoever wrote that has been lightning by now. Won’t let it spoil my ratings though... very very little hop flavour. Or malt flavour really. But there’s definitely flavour there, in small doses, more woody than grassy. Meh, lower than average for a beer but not for a pale lager. People are bringing emotion into it if they say it’s one of the worst they’ve ever had IMHO.

As far as macro brew beers go this is probably one of my favorite lagers. Its very grainy, with alot of corn taste, but its got a slight hoppy bite. Plain but better than most of the others of its kind, very drinkable.
Watery, slightly uriney, taste. Rice yeast leads to a quick fermentation, and a lackluster showing. To use an industry term: "Yuk"
Mild smell of hops, malts. Watery, fruity aroma, rubbery aftertaste. Lightly sweet. Very flat carbon. While it gives no surprises, it’s not displeasant either. Just superboring.
Original beer when I started. Probably still my choice for best macro brew but that?s not saying much. Very average, not much on taste, pours a decent head if done right.
Can. Highly-consumed  beer arond here. Relatively satisfying for its price. Nothing special, just a bit better than the average.
Thin, watery and characterless. Can be used as a substitute for Mexican beers.

There’s nothing wrong with the taste of this beer, it’s big problem is that it doesn’t have much flavor.  It is light and watery, but as far as the macro brews go, this is one of the better lagers.  I would say this is a good reliable beer for the people that don’t really enjoy beer.

Just your basic so called "premium lager"; watery, tasteless and with no defining aspects... perhaps the only redeeming factor of Budweiser over it’s similar lagers is that it is brown bottled and at least has a bottling date... for that reason I would likely pick this up over say Stella or Miller if I had to.
330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with small to average frothy white head. Flat typical pale lager "aroma". Taste is different from water. Next, please.

I can’t believe I am only just now rating Bud.  Well, there isn’t much to say that others haven’t.  It’s a light golden with a thin white head.  I really can’t smell anything.  Taste is grainy, a little grassy and just a little hoppy.   Not very good at all, but then again...to all the haters...there are some REALLY bad beers out there.  This one is only mediocre.  Really pretty decent for working on the car, mowing the lawn, etc.
Leve aroma a malta. Poca espuma, muy poco persistente. Cerveza de color pajizo muy clara.  Amargor casi nulo y final con tendencia seca. Suave

Last time I let my wifes friends pick the bar!  Fizzy yellow pour with little head.  Slightly more prominent in taste than aroma, but that’s hardly a win.  Rice, corn water, and grass in both the aroma and the flavor.  Watery mouthfeel, fizzy carbonation.  My sister in law (who loves San Miguel beer) drank under half a glass before switching to Rum and Cokes.

King of Beers!  Difficult for the head if have more than 2.  

Has that little sting of a bite. Smell is of metal cereal. 
Bland taste. Not a great buzz.
It is what it is.......king of Macro.....If faced with no other choice, I will drink as it is better than nothing.....I think?
Bottle at bar. Gold color, white head. Watery taste with almost no malts or hops. Pretty terrible beer.

So "King of Beers" steht auf der Flasche, dieser Spruch versaut schon jetzt meine Stimmung. Wässrig, säuerlich, ganz leicht Hopfen und Reis. Einen Tick nicht so schlecht wie Miller, aber auch nicht nicht schlecht. Fazit: Das Lieblingsbier so vieler Amerikaner, wie soll man da gegen das Aufkommen von Vorurteile ankommen? 
   
Test vom 25.4.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche  Noten: 4,2,3,3,5,2 - 2,65
Pours clear gold; no head or lacing. Aroma and taste of corn malts. It’s hard to make something with barley and hops that has this little flavor.

Even when I first started drinking beer I never liked Bud.  I always chose Coors Light or Miller Lite.  I still can’t drink it.  Almost no aroma.  Slightly sweet corn taste but really watery.  Bad aftertaste.  Can’t drink it.
330ml bottle, brewed and bottled in England. Clear golden color. Medium white head. Sweet watery aroma, corn. Taste is same. Too watery.
Pours a pale straw yellow with a diminishing white head and no lacing. Aroma of some corn and mild hops. Taste is some cereal with a mild bitter hop finish. Watery body.

This beer always gives me a headache. Don’t matter if it’s one or two. Someone told me it’s the rice in the formula that doesn’t agree with me. McDonald’s is number one in hamburgers. These guys are number one in beer sales. How about a cross breed? A beer that tastes like a bad hamburger, or a hamburger that tastes like a bad beer. That way we could eliminate one of these most popular products. Cheers with any other beer.

Original review: 6/6/11. Went to OBX for the week this last holiday, and cheap beer was the order for the week. Started with this one on-tap for lunch.

Came out the palest of yellows with a thin white head capping it off. No lace. Nose was dry and grainy. Faint citrus and husk. The mouth was crisp and refreshing. Excellent feel. Sweet corn, lemon zest, cheap grains make up the flavor profile. If ever I were to get this beer again, on-tap it would be. This was a refreshing and simple brew. Good one to wash down some wings...

Bottle to pint.  Looks solid; a transparent gold with white head. Some mild sweetness.  A solid beer for what it is.  It might get hated on by the craft beer community, but it’s got okay flavor and mouthfeel, and it’s a solid backyard brew that accompanies a burger or brat just fine.  My go-to macro.

I like Bud! He’s my bud! ha! But seriously I think too many people have gotten all caught up in the new trend of drinking high class beer and have forgotten that this was most likely the first beer they really liked.

Labelled as Bud: King of beers. Brewed in Barcelona. Normal Pale Lager. Nothing special. The ratings on this site for this one are hilarious. It’s not a good brew but it is drinkable. I would drink this anytime over a Corona Extra.
No aroma, or bad if any, no taste, or bad if any. Drink only if severely dehydrated and there is no water around.
From can, thus only taste and taste is metallic. Nothing much to say about this beer, a pilsener American style. (Houston, 201201)
Very pale apperance, hardly any taste. Feels like a 70/30 regular lager and water. Hard to find a situation that this one would be prefered, if there are any. I’ll rather drink water.
Pours a very pale yellow with a lot of carbonation, leaving a fizzy head and no lacing. Aroma and taste of adjunct. That’s about it.
Thin, pale, light, watery. Fresh but blech. The epitome of everything that went wrong with American beer. Trying to please every taste led to making something that is utterly tasteless. What a waste.
Piètre qualité, si c’est ça qu’on appelle de la bière... Pas grand chose à ajouter
About as ordinarily weak a beer as it can get - hard to believe it evolved from a European recipe.

Straw appearance. Very carbonated and slightly biscuit tasting. Fills the stomach quite quickly considering the lack of body. If its offered on a hot day I’d take it but otherwise its just a fine example of branding and mass marketing.
pours yellow/amber with basic white froth. aroma is cereal with not much of interest. taste is cereal, basic malt, pretty boring, avoid.
24oz can. Rating #3175. Pale golden pour with a quickly fading white head. Mild aroma, light grains and a little sweetness. Mild sweetness and some graininess, not much flavor, but it’s there. (2303)

Flavored water. Cannot not understand the appeal of this stuff. Only slightly better than the light version as this one does have a hint of flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nope, not much to write about. Pissy piss piss. Mneh Mneh Mneh Mneh........
Poured pale yellow with a white head and no lacing.  Smell of corn and adjunct. Tastes the same. Crisp finish though.
How is this so popular? It’s got the faint notes of urine and the feel that you’re drinking and extremely heavy beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Stingy on the nose with some chemical notes and sweet corn. Very light taste almost like carbonated water with a shot of light beer in it. Might work if you want some carbonated water with alcohol in it and prefer some chemical smells with that.
Well this beer is really not that good, but shockingly when I was in Europe recently, people in pubs thought this beer was great and couldn’t get enough of it. Weird!
Bottle in Aurangabad with Holger. Rubbish yellow lager, tasting of little other than corn and rice.

Bottle. Pours a yellow body, with a small to average head that quickly diminishes, leaving a good lacing. Weird aroma, bitter and watery taste. Very watery palate, medium carbonation, very thin body. Definitely not good.
Piss yellow.......no taste.....no smell....... Tastes like carbonated alcoholic water
May be this beer once was the king and the standard. But with the variety and the quality of beers now available, I don’t see why people still would buy this.
Piss yellow color with no aroma. Taste of corn and adjunct. Very bland and boring. Like the commercials though.
Yellow: check. Fizzy: check. Rice Adjunct: check. No hop flavor or aroma: check. Utterly disappointing: check.
Light yellow with a white foam head that goes down quickly. Smell of corn and mild hops. Taste is the same. light body.
Pils gedronken bij dutchdrebus uit een fles. Niet echt een geweldige smaak voor een pils
bought this today, sucks absolute donky dick. I’d rather have Tennents (brewed in glasgow) or any other alcohol material like frosty Bomb
Muito meh. Extremamente não original e sem nenhuma qualidade digna de uma boa cerveja. Parece água, porém não pior do que Skol.

Pours a very pale and clear golden brew with a one finger head with poor retention, weak aroma with note of citrus fruits (orange) and malt, very thin body, refreshing, the flavor has the same notes as the aroma with the addition of some metallic ones at the finish, high carbonatation, low swetness, medium to low bitterness, dry bitter short finish. Slightly better tahn some other macro pale lager shit.
Pale yellow with a fizzy white head. Malty aroma. Taste is watery, thin, and has the barest hint of a malt flavor at all. Boring and bland.
I gave this beer a 6 overall because this beer has a place in the market, but I do not like this beer.
Slightly fizzy yellow. Barely any smell. It feels okay in the mouth, and drinks easy, but there is something a little off in the taste.

Okay, if I’m at a party and there are several brands of Swill Beer... this would probably be the one I’d snatch out da cooler. Less toxic than the others. On a bike trip across the country, I actually stopped into the Bud factory at St. Louis for the tour and the "Beer School".  Very entertaining.  And it does go down a tad better from a clean glass. Well, that’s it.
Has a pale yellow color. Smell is of grains and malts. Taste is crisp, mild, slightly sweet. Overall a below average beer.

Used to love this beer in college, does it hold up now with my craft brew interest?

Pours a pale yellow color with a small white head that dissipates very fast.

No aroma.

Taste is kind of oily and watery.  Strange.  o_O

You can do a lot worse though, believe me.

Originally rated June 2005. Ahhhh.... the king of beer. So many reviews, and this is my first Anheuser-Busch one. The one we get here in Canada is brewed by Labatt’s and is a full 5% ABV. I also heard many times, that the one we get is less watered down. Some malt aromas are found. Pours a very pale yellow colour with a tin white head. Slight bitterness in the finish, but very watered down malt in the rest of the taste. A very boring brew, but found no corn. Seems at least real grain malt.
By far my favorite beer. Easy and smooth a little sweeter then bud light. Great for barbeque. Well priced

Pours light yellow low frizzy head. Aromas of nothing and maybe some corn?
Tastes nothing. Actually thought it might taste something. Ohh there might be hints of corn and carbonation. Was a while since I tasted this beer and it was before I started rating beers. I don’t know what this is but it certainly is not a beer.

12oz can poured into a shaker. Pours a clear pale yellow with some bright white fizzy head. Aroma of metal, corn and cooked rice. Taste is lightly bitter and light sweet. Rice water, corn, skunk and some wet cereal. Light bodied with a thin texture. Fizzy carbonation and not much of a finish. Overall, I’ve had worse. It’s beer for the unwashed masses.

Four version:
Budweiser from US (I don't remember where and how) It was about 15 years ago. Typowe, jasne jak sloma, srednia piana, nie trwala jak puch. zero posmaku i aromatu. wodniste.

BUD brewed in UK (From E. Leclerc). More than 10 years ago. Ciut lepsze, barwa nieco bardziej zlocista, piana ta sama, tylko lekko pozostawala po opadnieciu wewnatrz szklaneczki, ryzowy posmak. Ta wersja lepsza od orginalu, o dziwo ale i tak szalu nie ma.

BUD brewed in Ukraina (From Auchan). Tu zdecydowanie trwalsza piana, ciemniejsza barwa, zapach kartki papieru czyli nic sie nie wyczuwa, tu tez ciut pelniejsza jest slodowosc i lekka goryczka.

BUD brewed in Belgium (From E.Leclerc). Tu znow zero slodowosci chmielu brak, nadmierna wodnistosc, piana bardzo mala, bez koronki, bardzo jasniutkie. 

Wszystkie cztery byly w butelkach, odcien etykiet czy kapsli sie roznil, grawer na belgijskiej butelce i ksztalt tez inny niz w wersjach poprzednich. moze ciut bardziej wodniste to ostatnie zwlaszcza, reasumujac orginal z USA nie byl najlepszy wygral w mojej ocenie wersja z Ukrainy, nr 2 to UK, nr 3 to orginal z USA, a ostatnie miejsce nr 4 zajmuje wersja belgijska. Niby maja wszystkie smakowac tak samo, a kazde diametralnie inne, niewielkie roznice byly tylko w porownaniu orginal i belgijska wersja ale moze o to chodzi by sie zblizyc do wersji orginalnej, a nie kombinowac. Ogolnie wszystkie piwa nadaja sie tylko do popijania kielbasek z grila i innych nie zdrowych tlustych rzeczy dla wiekszosci to pewnie rarytas. Dla mnie nadaje sie tylko do gaszenia ognia nad weglem drzewnym lub to przeplukania kubkow, nie tylko smakowych po sytej uczcie.

Ogolnie moje oceny wypadly do najwyzszej 1,8 dla Ukrainy do 1,1 dla wersji belgijskiej. wiec sprawiedliwa srednia winna byc jakos na 1,4
golden appearance with minimal white head.  faintly hoppy aroma.  watered down, slightly metallic finish. not much else going on. boring and weak beer.
341ml bottle pours a pale golden color with a small white head and no lacing.  Aroma is cheap grains and hops.  Taste is also cheap grains and hops.  Just an average macro lager and not recommended.

12 oz bottle.  Tried it at friend’s Super Bowl party.  Pours pale straw with a white head.  Slight aroma is of rotten eggs.  Soda like body. There is not much taste here, but definitely it is not water. It went down the sink drain nicely.

Bottle or can; similarly very limited experience.  Lots of carbonation, faint hop aroma.  Very faint hop flavor.  Slightly bitter finish.  Not a beer to savor or to taste, per se.  Would not buy with my own $.

Drank this from a can as it was offered to me free on a boat tour. Smells like grains, and something funky. Taste like water, grain, and steel. Luckily this was served to me ice cold, and I was distracted by a nice view while I drank this. Although this was being offer free to me, I did not ask for a second one. Almost any lager is better than this one. My advise is choose something else. This is not beer.
Had to rate this slightly higher that budlight. At least this isnt as piss watered down as the light.

Bottle.....It pours clear yellow with a short lasting white head.... The aroma is corn, some malt and light metallic.....The flavor is thin, waterish, malt, corn and metallic... very thin body.....not to much to say .....
It’s the Ford truck of beer.. not flashy or particularly interesting, but gets the job done at an affordable price
Not the absolute worst beer you could drink, not by a long shot. Heavy corn flavor and a bit metallic, though not as bad as Bud Light. It’s sweet in a bad way. The aftertaste is unpleasant.
Simply the most underrated and brilliant beer in the world! Thumbs up!

Well, if you pour it in a glass, you must have dropped the pulltab into the can. At which point, it looks like apple juice, with a similar head. The taste, well you only drink it after your 6 pack of good beer is gone and your brother left it in your fridge. Once you do it is sweet, with straw and corn abound. I won’t call it beer, but it is better than bud light. Well no it isn’t it.
it’s wet and liquid and taste like piss with a hint of beech wood. I hope to never buy a case of bud again

My saga to lower my average score continues. Tallboy poured into a pilsner glass (this is a pilsner, right?).

3.5 A: Compared to the Bud Light I recently had, this looks like a stout. Noncomparatively, this is pale yellow and super clear. Nearly three fingers of frothy white head with average retention and a decent amount of lacing. 

2.0 S: Dry, dusty graininess with nothing else going on. Maybe some rice.

1.0 T: This is truly fucking awful. I can’t remember the last time I had this beer (it might have been while I was under age), but I never thought it would be so awful. It’s paradoxically tasteless and sickeningly sweet in a rice sort of way.

3.0 M: I can’t complain a whole lot about the mouthfeel. It’s crisp and light and not ridiculously overcarbonated like most of these types of beers.

1.5 D: The only reason this gets a 1.5 instead of a 1.0 is because the mouthfeel isn’t horrible. I can’t believe this is this bad though.

Serving type: can

Reviewed on: 12-09-2011 02:29:10

10 YEARS OF 2PAC "americans are fucked if they think this is a good beer. it tastes like piss, it looks like piss, it is fucken PISS. fucken american cunts" -2pac.  Wow.  How do you follow that review?  I’m going to have to agree with 2pac here, Americans ARE FUCKED if they think this is a good beer.  I’m not quite sure it tastes like piss, but it is swill.  fucken american cunts

Bottle 25cl.
Pours a clear golden colour with normal head and carbonation.
Hoppy, bitter aroma, nothing special there.
Taste is a bit off in my opinion, can’t really name it though.

I had a good Bud once. It was nearly 100 degrees and I’d been playing sand volleyball for a couple hours at a bar in Houston -- i.e. not on the beach. Walked up to the bar window and the cute li’l redheaded bartender had already set an ice cold one there for me. Chugged it down in about 10 seconds and it really hit the spot.
About as ordinarily weak a beer as it can get - hard to believe it evolved from a European recipe.
This is good and its the classic manly drink if you dont like Guinness.  A must serve as cold as possible, otherwise it is almost unbearable.
Really easy to find and easy to drink, but the taste gives no reason to it...
Basically a more flavorful version of bud light. Nothing to write home about. Drink it to get drunk
12 oz can pours golden with a white head.  When you drink a bud you know it, one of the better mass produced beers.
#1159 bottle; nose is sweet lemon and elderflower, almost cordial-like, late weak hops, feel is watery, carb is mediumweak, taste is sweet citrus and elderflower, weak late soap
It is what it is. Its super super easy to drink. Can find it anywhere & its cheap. To bad I can’t get yuengling in mass.

From a bottle. Desperate times..... Pours very pale yellow with a white head.  Weak aroma, little citrus, little bread, not much going on. Taste is very weak, bready yeast. Impressive how little flavour this has for 5%. cold one city, you guys.

You can actually taste white rice if you try.  Really grainy as you would expect.   Under the right circumstances, I could enjoy this.  But it’s definitely a take it or leave it beer.  There is a mildly offensive flavor on the finish.  A party beer, a BBQ beer, a relatively cheap beer.  It is what it is.

If this is the King of Beers, McDonald’s is gourmet dining.  
It is a liquid that you can drink and on warm summer days it will quench your thirst... but water tastes better and will do the same. If you want to get drunk Vodka is much more effective and has about the same amount of taste.  
Calling this a "pilsner" would get you thrown in jail in the Czech Republic where they have been making pilsners for 170 years.  This is not a pilsner but a watery, foul-tasting, American lager.  It proves that an abominable product with a multi-million dollar propaganda campaign can accomplish incredible things... Like make millions of Americans believe that they are drinking beer while they are actually drinking something closer to cow urine.

I gotta say.. It’s not the greatest beer to drink in terms of appearance and taste.
But when your at the bar and you need a cheap effective beer. Bud is the way to go.
I find alot of beers tend to give off a weird aftertaste after you drink them all night. But Bud goes down like soda water to me. Tastes best in Cans I think

Can. Clear light golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma is rice and tap water (dog piss my wife said on blind test). Not much taste. Watery texture. Usually lagers this watery are at least refreshing and easy to drink but not this one.
Bottle. A laughably poor beer. Feint to no aroma. Watery and flavourless. This beer is a travesty.
Pours a clear yellow with an instantaneously disappearing head. Aroma is faint malt. Taste is a little malt and that’s all. No body, no bitterness. Very watery! Really just, terrible.
Can. Really wanted to like this, tried being as objective as i could, but alas this beer just isn’t very good. Corny sour aroma, tastes tart, with corn and grain finish.  One is enough...

0.66L bottle, Italian version brewed in Massafra. Very pale yellow with a big white head quickly reducing to a tiny lacing. Strawy nose. Aroma almost inexistent, some woody and strawy notes. No bitterness, flat taste. Rice make it all smooth (i like rice beers) and has dry finish. Easy to drink like a soft drink. Completely flat, thin body, soft carbonation. There are less expensive brews much more interesting.
Water with an amber taste and a little bit of alcohol; style over substance - a poor beer however you look at it. Dreadful.
Coors is way better! Bud is just not that good of a beer, it has good appearance though

Well here we go.....Poured a super clear piss yellow from a can with big little bubbles with small white head that stayed around the outer circumfrence of the lttle hotel glass I’m using. Aroma is really faint with some corn and light malts with maybe a little bit of cracker (white cracker that is). Taste is barely better than the aroma. Very watery taste with some grainy/bready corny characteristics. The carbonation is nice and finishes a bit bitter and dry. Small taste was enough for me.

Poured from a tallboy (24 oz.) can into a pint glass. Color was very clear, pale ale. Maybe ¾ inches of head. Light lacing on the top that dissipated in roughly 10 minutes. Non-existent on the film.

Smelled of corn malts with some grains mixed in. Decent bite of alcohol that ended up dominating the aftertaste. 

Tasted of sweet, corn malts, a bit better than the smell. Rather smooth and watery. A bit metallic or canny, but it still worked.

Light body. Thin texture. Average carbonation. Abrupt finish.

Overall it was bit higher than I expected, but I knew I never had a problem with Budweiser. Something about Bud in a can seems pretty day manly.

bottle in a snifter (why not?) - pours pale yellow with quickly disappearing white head and no lacing, but quite bubbly.  Nose is yeast and rice.  Light body with watery texture.  Taste is ever-so slightly bitter.  High carbonation (BURP!).  Inoffensive and easy to drink.

Average in every sense of the word. I suppose it’s easy to drink - and it will quench your thirst on a hot day. And if you drink enough budweisers - the fact that they are completely devoid of flavor eventually doesn’t seem important. Having said that - I won’t turn one down if offered to me. The better of a bad bunch of North American Lagers.
Off tap at vines bar. Smells a little of trump. Too fizzy, no flavour whatsoever. Genuinely boring in terms of all senses.
Another light beer, very easy to drink. It’s nice in a hot summer, at times you are thirsty. Don’t forget to freeze it well before you drink it!

i don’t usually review lagers, i avoid it like the plague, unless they are exceptional lagers, which are really, really hard to find. unfortunately, and not surprisingly, this is not one of them. the overall score and comments i read made me roll on the floor.. doesn’t look very good for this one. BUT. yes, it is a lager. yes, it is basically "just for drinking, getting drunk". well, i find this beer hard to enjoy in any other sense. but, having said that, it is a good, stable, neutral, "without character"-beer that is just about one of the best you can find for that occasion, if you want a neutral lager. it doesn’t really taste like anything. again, having said this, in context it should score pretty well. still, it is very hard to say anything about a beer that is nothing, but serves a particular purpose in a decent way. let’s keep it in perspective still, it is not a good beer, just happens to serve me pretty well when the objective is to drink and mostly to sustain your alcohol levels.
The ultimate classic, prototypical macro lager. Not bad at all, just not that good either. Somewhat creamier, more carbonated than its counterparts, which might explain its success.

As far as cheap beers go this is my second choice. The flavor doesn’t change whether its warm, luke warm, cold or Ice cold.  If you get it in a can it does pick up a metallic taste. Great for college parties or parties with a tight budget and where the attendees are not beer fanatics.
no me gusta para nada, es agua con sabor a cerveza y alchool, king of beers??
barley/rice taste. Light yellow color. Carbonation too high. Small uninteresting head. Light bitterness. Thin texture.
I am not sure what is so appealing about this beer.  It is just like all of the other watered down beers to me.  I like it the least.

Watery start with a rice flavoured finish. As mentioned previously, tastes similar to soda water. Rating above a 1 is due to the fact that it’s easy to drink, but you can find so many better beers for the same price.
If its a very hot day and you only have a few bucks this is one way to go. NOT!!! At the same cost there are many better beers to pick up. Some cost less and are better.

#1163
"The King of Beers"
Unglaublich, diese gnadenlose Selbstüberschätzung! Bei mir ist dies allenfalls ein bierähnliches Getränk! Hier stimmt nichts: Süßliches Wasser mit nem Hauch von Hopfen!??
MacDonalds würde besseres Bier brauen...it sucks!!!

The absence of anything remotely special in this beer almost makes it not worth reviewing, but it is beer after all.  I do order this beer sometimes with a shot of Jack when I go out and and don’t want to pay bar prices for craft beer.  It has a weak, watery gold color to it with a sudsy white head.  It smells metallic and grainy.  It tastes like seltzer water, metal and grains with maybe the slightest bit of boring hops.  Overall, if you’re ordering a beer and don’t want to think about what you’re drinking, this works.  It is solidly below average though.
The king of beers is not so kingly. Adjuncts on the nose. The taste is watery, and the head is bone white, probably due to all the detergent agents they put in it. Avoid this beer.
A beer you can enjoy with friends in a bar. The bottle looks awesome and the taste is out of this world.
Pours yellow with a medium white head.  Almost no nose, but hints of soured rice/corn and hay.  Watery, soured cereal/corn taste, no bitterness and metallic finish.  Awful.

Drank from can on camping trip. Slightly more body and taste than the more popular Bud Light. Color and taste of straw, distant noble hops aroma, watery and thin due to adjunct rice. Super-fizzy with vaguely metallic aftertaste. Only the most powerful advertising agency in the world could make this the #1 beer.

awful.
pours a washed out straw colour with almost no head. no aroma. slight taste of rice. no bitterness. too fizzy.
i suppose their marketing people are correct - clean and crisp, but that doesn’t forgive the total lack of anything!  It also claims it is the most expensive beer to produce in the world,  i can believe they have the audacity to make that claim!

30/09/2011 12Fl. Oz. bottle @ Thomas’ place - bottled 14/9/11 (2011-472) Thanks to Thomas and Annelies for the bottle!

Clear yellow to light orange beer, aery white head, unstable, disappears completely. Aroma: sweet malts and corn, bit fruity, pineapple. MF: too much carbon, light body. Taste: come citrus, bit of malts. Aftertaste: some citrus, sweet almost. Very watery beer.
Like Bud Light with ever so slightly less water. Use only in an emergency. No beer snob about it, there’s just nothing here to complement

Can.  Doesn’t much live up to its name as the king of beers.  Pale yellow, stale aromas of malt, sugar, and adjunct.  Flavors of straw, sugar, and watered-down alcohol.  Easy enough to drink, but not really enjoyable.  [836]

On a golf course or in a pinch I’ve certainly had worse. Pours a thin gold with a fizzy head that leave little to no lacing. Nose and taste are of apples, pale mats and muted hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of apple, pear, light grass. Appearance is gold with quickly dissipating white head. Flavor of apple and pear with a touch of honey. Palate is bubbly and slightly chewy. Not bad, really. I wouldn’t pay for it, but not bad from my in-laws fridge.
Well, as far as beer goes, it sucks, like drinking beachwood aged piss!, but , looks like piss when poured, nice fluffy white head, perfect for the native in the beer world.
Doesn’t really have an aroma or any flavor. But its cheap and it will do the job if you are trying to get a buzz..

Is it outstanding? No, clearly it is not. Is it good? No to be honest it is not all that good. Is it drinkable? Yes, yes it is and it is cheep and will get you drunk and few will object to it.

So it does have one thing going for it, a massive market on a very, very simple flavor.

ALL HAIL THE KING OF ALL BEER! IT IS THE TRUE KING OF BEERS!
NONE MAY SURPASS IT EVER!
All I can say is yuck! Budweiser is horrible, Bud Light is amazingly worse, Bud Light Lime is an abomination. Sickening!
Botte.. Waste of my money. Very easy, nothing daring or exciting in this brew. Just a massive session beer and nothing more to it.

12 oz bottle...
