Smell there is no smell or aroma small hint of malt/hops taste was grainy and aluminum aftertaste I dont see how they call this the king of beers maybe caused its one of the only beers served at sporting events where there are thousands of consumers wanting to catch a buzz.Highly not recommended

Can at home

Very very pale, big white head. Aroma has some grass, and this is the best part of this beer by far. Accompanied with the grass there also is some alcohol and sweet corn. Thin taste, some sweetness maybe, not anything else. This is expected. I also sense the alcohol somewhere in taste. No finish. The high total here is based on the clean taste where there is no off flavors either.

(blind-sampled at Election Day Pale Lager Challenge) Pours a clear, pale golden with little, white head and lively carbonation. The aroma is very weakly malty with slight notes of cardboard and maybe something fruity? Weak-bodied, watery texture with a short, sweet finish. The taste is slightly sweet and mildly herbal. Girlfriend says: "Very flat and watery. A waste of time."
a pretty decent beer and although not very strong has a smooth taste and is recommended for social drinkers

Thirst quenching.  Not much else.  Good if you’re not concerned with the actual "taste", because it has very little.

Pours golden yellow with mild white head.  No offensive flavors or characteristics.  Definitely a beer for the masses.
Have had this beer plenty of times over the years.  Who hasn’t.  Never really liked it when I was younger.  Still don’t like it now.  Good carbonation, other than that really a hard beer to finish.

Surprisingly, this manages to be even more bland than MGD. There’s basically NO aroma, and taste is only remotely reminiscent of beer. This is as macro, and as bland, as it gets. Q: What does Budweiser and making love in a canoe have in common? A: they’re both fucking close to water.
This is the american classic beer and goes down like water only good for high quantity drinking

Tastes like tin without even the personality of a bit of rust.  I tasted a small two ounce shooter in the beer store and that’s more than enough to remind me of the ordeal of having to drink a whole can of the stuff.
Tap - Avg foamy head, very pale straw color, bland malt flavor - very basic macro, one step above water at best

12-oz can. Pours pale, almost transparent yellow with white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is musk and aluminum and as for the taste, the most I can say is that it’s not offensive. A little skunky, but overall just boring and watery which isn’t the worst thing in the world when you’re chilling with your bros.

Nothing special by any means this so called "King of Beers" may have that label is distribution and sales, but not in taste. Like so many American macrobrews, Budweiser pours a faint yellow color with little or no head. Tastes like any other watered down rice lager. My choice if I’m at a ball game and the other taps are light beers.

Pours clear sparkling yellow with an average sized white head.  Smells and tastes clean and crisp.  More tasty than its lighter counterpart (Bud Light), I would say it is not a great beer, but it surely doesn’t deserve the ridiculously low ratings that it has been receiving.
can’t say i was a huge fan of this very bad after taste stinks like skunk only tried because it was on sale oh well
I had a bottle after a round of golf on a hot day.  Not a bad macro, if you looking for something more, it won’t be here.  But, a cheap macro brew.
12 oz bottle that pours a straw yellow color with little head. Not much flavor, not much taste, but better than the light beers

I agree with cakanator. This is nothing special but doesn’t belong on the absolute bottom of the pile. Had this on a sunny day and it was quite refreshing. Poured a blonde colour with a thin white head. Aroma of yeast, caramel and barley. Similar flavours with very light hopping. Mildly bitter with high carbonation and a fair CO2 prickle. Quick, crisp finish.

from the 12oz american can!  Nothing special, but I’ve had Bud when its been ice cold on a sweltering day when it was my only option, and it was crisp clean and actually nice for the situation.  However its pretty basic, nothing stands out about it except that its very consistently made.  Medium bodied, but not really deserving a bottom of the bottom rating.

Just a regular pilsener to me. Light yellow colour, little to no head. Smells like pils malts. Tastes like a pilsener. Nothing wrong with it. Not something great, but every score below 1.5 seems like nonsense to me.
Thin rice beer. King of macros in size, but definitely not taste. What else to say?

Bomber that just so happened to fall into my possession. So this beer is terrible. It’s a hair better than bud light, but not much. It smells bad, tastes bad, and the lingering aftertaste is awful. Am I gonna buy this beer on regular occasion? Hell no. But will I drink if its the only available? Yes. I wouldn’t put it on par with the malt liquors or Ice beers that are even worse, that I would never be desperate enough to drink, but it’s still bad. Don’t let it warm up because it might wanna come back up, because this is not a beer that sits well warm at all. King of Beers? More like king of profit....but that would belong to it’s light version wouldn’t it? Hmmmm.....
If you want to play beer pong in a classy way this is your beer. If this is the king of beers than...I’m not feeling clever tonight sorry.
Bottle. Clear and golden. Watery and indistinct. Some bread notes. Moderately refreshing. Low end beer.
King of piss not a beer. But if its hot day and you need something to drink than this one is not a worst solution , there are much worse beers. Basically no taste and a little hop aftertaste.
I dont understand why this rank rotten lager is popular. this is no "king". This has to be one of the worst beers readily available anywhere in the world.
Can. Pours hazy gold with half inch white head. Aroma is hay. Flavor is stale cereal grains. Not good.
Damnnnnn, this sucks. Even when I was 16 this tasted like shit. Pretty much just a bang it down type of beer that you drink with a slightly agonised expression (due to the shitness)
It poured a clear golden color with a thin head.  The aroma and flavor was the same, not much going on here.
The most underated beer on ratebeer.  4% style percentage? There are far worse pale lagers than this.

well the old lady was bitchin jest as soon as she came in the door tonight.  see, she got to working down at the old folks home and she aint liking it too much anymore, what with all those smells that them oldens have.  its days like these that i reach for old reliable,  regular bud.  cant see much point in drinking it from the bottle though, im a can man myself.  it always tastes clean and crisp but the reason i cant rate it higher is because it jest dont have enough vodka in it to get e none too drunk.  i like malt liquor most times, but on the days when i can afford it ill reach for an 18 pack of bud cans down at valero if they are on sale.  its a good drink.

numerous occasions tap, bottle, can. may I start off nthis is my favorite American Macro brew
5% without being an ice beer. The color is a disgusting ultra pale yellow color (comes out the same color it goes in) If it is too cold there is no head and no lacing. Tap is the worst, but.... a little shake of pepper and a frosty mug is the best way to enjoy the "King of Beers" . What hops? There might be some finishing hops but the rice and other malts are completely fermented out. It is a very clean ridiculously (slam-able) drinkable beer. You forget the one you just had, the instant it is done.  Style points huge...real beer...not really

People can hate on mass market beer, because it’s mass marketed, but this isn’t that BAD.  Might be bland but it’s smooth enough, has some taste.  Way better than mexican piss beers, or some of the cheaper mass stuff.

Draught in a beer garden in Osaka. I think this one is made by Kirin, not imported. Pale gold. Creamy, fruity aroma, faint, no hops, grainy, but not off. Sweet and creamy flavor with fruity malts. No hop flavor noticed. Nothing really wrong, just too sweet and bland. Not all that bad, really, though this was the Japanese version on tap...
Nothing special, to me it’s just another mass produced pale lager/pilsener. Nice on occasion, but overall a bit watery with not enough flavor. Decent, but nothing special.

in Las Vegas when it is to hot a cold budweiser
in bottle is the solution to your problem.
from a tin. pale yellow with minimal white head. hay with light herbal notes, COCONUT, lightly sweet. aggressive carbonation, light body. the usual macro.

0,5 l can at home. Clear pale golden with a short lived, big bubbled, white head. Light floral, light perfumed, light grainy, light cardboard aroma. Taste is sweet with light malts and boiled rice. Light bodied. A tad over-carbonated. Not a good beer below 6 degrees Celsius; above it the beer becomes undrinkable. Perhaps the "freshness policy"-gimmick needs an exception: "none of the above applies if the beer is served warmer than 6 degrees Celsius".
355ml can. Light bland taste without being too sharp. Goes down smooth and easy, almost unnoticably. Very generic.

The only 2 things I can think about which are good about the American Budweiser are either the Appearance which is OK, and the lack of taste which means its atleast not disgusting.

But why bother buying this crap? because it has NO taste, even pure Vodka has more taste and atleast it gets u drunk, worst beer in terms of lack of taste.
Great Taste! Smooth Finish! It will give you a heck of a headache! its awsome! Ill drink it all day while floating on the river

Appearance - The beer pours an extremely pale yellow into a pint glass. Very little head (about one half a finger), with no lacing stuck to the sides of the glass as the beer is swirled around/agitated.

Smell - Faintest scents of grains and rice. This beer really has no smell to speak of being that it is a mass produced lager beer meant for availability rather than enjoyment of consumption.

Taste - Not much here either. It tastes like alcoholic water with a little grain and rice mixed in. Alcoholic content is barely noticeable and hardly enjoyable. Do not ever have this beer warm or you will regret it.

Mouthfeel - Some consistency as seltzer water. It basically is analogous to carbonated water on tongue.

Overall - One of my least favorite adjunct lagers and least favorite beer overall (next to Corona that is). Tasteless to a large degree and only good when you are looking for something cheap to play beer games with.
Doftar inget, ser inget vidare ut, men smaken har lite oförtjänt dåligt rykte. Till en räkmacka på en uteservering under en het sommarsol var den inte så dålig som många vill göra gällande.
Pours out pale yellow with a little head. Very light, sweet, lack of flavor.
Just a cheap beer cheaply made just nothing good bout this just a really crap beer
This is my favorite BLS, it is decent on draft for what it is.  Bud heavy over light always.
Some head, yellow. Almost no nose at all. Medium body and length. Sweet and fruity but light. Drinkable but uninspiring
Nothing but straw colored junk with corn and adjuncts. This isn’t a good choice.
better than the mass market light beer category, but not even close to poor for me to provide a serious comment.

Rating #597, can found in my parents’ basement 
 


Relatively light golden beer with no head at all. Aroma has some vague malts and ascorbic acid. Then the flavor is really bland. Overly sweet but really no malts and a weird burnt touch. Only light bitter. Palate is soft, but way too thin.

I love it how people rate this beer 0.9 and such. When there are a million beers worse than bud. All I can think is those that say it’s bad have not really had that much beer. Those that offer it has no flavour....compared to mainstream lagers like Fosters, Carlsberg and Stella .....it does indeed have flavor. 
   I live in Taiwan and Bud is hit and miss...the small cans are 4.5% and are horrid and bland. It tastes more like Coors light. The larger cans are still made in the USA and are very drinkable. When I lived in UK I used to get bud on draught in the local Barrets snooker club in Northants and it was worth the $3.50 ( that was a lot in those days). It had and still does .... a ricey sweet taste and went down well. Those who knock bud confuse me when it is better than most offerings in pubs. Sure it’s not a craft beer, but it isn’t trying to be.
Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours a clear pale yellow with small white head.  Low carbonation, thin body, and very little lacing.  Taste is light smooth malt.  Surprisingly good.

Sunny yellow in colour. Strong malt smell with grass and maybe corn. Thick foam head.  Palate is smooth and light carbonation - too watery. Taste is citric, grass, . Sour aftertaste and acid feel. Bitterness carries. Overall taste is fairly unpleasent. Some gutrot. I used to like this beer but now it just seems like dirty water.

Pale yellow, white head. Aroma quite sweet, cereal, corn. Taste is sweet, corn, some very light hops. Rather thin, not lasting long, though refreshing. Their sales strategy it seems to be working well though.

(From bottle)
just isnt a good beer may have a good story and franchise behind it but doesnt make up for the beer being awful
This beer i chose to go all out. In my opinion this beer deserves my utmost respect. This beer is my favorite, i love to relax to this beer as well as out on the night social drinking, and partying.

Can. Poured a clear pale gold with a bubbly white head that dissipated quickly to the edges. Aroma was sweet with adjuncts, mainly corn and sweet bread notes coming through. Flavor was similar sweet from corn and sweet grains and a bit thin. It does drink easy.

Quite pale in color - almost yellow like piss. White flat head with tiny bubbles. Almost no aroma, but smells faintly of sour dishrag. The taste is sweet and slightly sour. The rice can be felt clearly. Unpleasant grassy bitterness. Not exactly the King of Beer. Would rather drink skimmed milk ....
Enjoyed from can while watching the Cubs play the Brewers at Wrigley Field in Chicago, IL.  Tasted kind of tinney and more malty than watery.  It went down cold and smooth, can’t complain.

What bothers me most about this beer is that despite its working-class roots, target demographic, and culture, it still calls itself "The King of Beers" and prides itself of being a "premium" beer and of dominating the "premium" category. There is absolutely nothing wrong with being conceived for, and consumed by, the working-class man, so why do they advertise it as something that it isn’t? Why not take a little more pride in what we really are?

Look, I really don’t hate this beer that much. No, I don’t like it and I don’t enjoy drinking it, but it really isn’t as horrible as some claim. Whoever says this is the worst beer they’ve had really does not know the whole beer spectrum. There are far more tasteless things in the beer realm (Busch Light...) and overall far less palatable or digestible things (ahem! Natural Ice! ahem!). Still, it is pretty disagreeable and there are far better choices out there. 

Needless to say, this does NOT represent American beer. It is as wrong of Americans to be drinking this when their own country produces a majority of the world’s best beers as it is of foreigners (or even other Americans) to judge the entire American beer industry by this beer alone. It is tantamount to judging the German automotive industry by the Trabi. Or the Belgian beer industry by Stella Artois. 
P.S. I’m giving it a 2 out of 5 for palate because its overcarbonation actually masks the exceedingly watery body. So, in this case, two wrongs don’t make a double wrong, but a semi-wrong.

This is my standard for an average beer.  Ive had many, many are much better, many are much worse.  If I want to really enjoy one beer I reach for something else, if I just want to taste beer this is the best of the macros and is very reliable.
Watery yellow looking with minimal carbonation and a white head. Funky wheat smell. Empty, watery taste and a minimal wheat / yeast after taste.
The king of beers?  Not quite, but I do enjoy Budweiser on occasion.  Slight rice flavor keeps it crisp.  Best enjoyed very cold.

Sample from 0,5 l. can. Pours a pale, golden colour with very little head, lively carbonation. Almost no aroma and taste, some very weak notes of rice and malts. Would go for water next time, less alcohol, same taste.
What crap! My piss might taste better. Would never recommend this to anyone.
La piu’ celebre birra americana, va bene per rinfrescarsi la gola quando si ha sete, oppure per un aperitivino con patatine e simili, nient’ altro.

King of Beers, or so it claims. 12 oz can. Pours urine yellow with flagrant head because it sat at room temperature too long. Nose is of American macro; ’nuff said. Tastes like slightly bitter water that rapidly dissipates. It will get you drunk, even if your your lovely, ill-informed wife meant to purchase another beer. Better than Natty Light or the Beast.

Pretty standard macro lager.  Clear light appearance, tastes of pale malts lightened by rice, slight bit of hops or carbonation bite.  Classy label, industry best freshness dating system (born on date displayed clearly on bottle and 12 packs).  Great with fried chicken (Seriously, give it a try).  Iconic.  Nothing super great, but not bad when you’re in the mood/price range of an adjunct lager.  There are better adjunct lagers, but there are also worse ones.  Worth grabbing every once in a while for the sake of variety or when your options are limited (Whether do to money or lack of availability of better options).
Theres nothing wrong with this beer, its just not special.  Its not evil, its just a good drink on a hot day or if I only have $2 on me.  Its also always clean and clear.

Bouteille de 33cl. Blond assez pale, mousse moyenne de tenue moyenne. Absolument insipide, pas le moindre arôme, pas la moindre âme. La carbonnation était sympa au début mais s’est vite estompée. Servie à Buffalo.

12oz bottle. Color is a very clear and pale yellow, with maybe even a hue of green. Pretty much no aroma that I can detect, kind of like water that’s spent too much time in dirty pipes. Has a somewhat salty, slightly sour taste that isn’t very pleasant. Crisply carbonated, but the aftertaste is not brief enough. It’s unfortunate that so many people think this is what beer is supposed to taste like.
Pours almost clear with no head. Nothing much to the flavor here. Really no aroma to note.  Does finish pretty crisp. Alright beer to drink on a hot day while doing yard work.

On tap at Budweiser stadium club at St. Louis airport. Pours clear barely yellow. No hop flavor not much malt but still very clean and crisp. Not as bad as people claim. It just doesn’t taste like anything. Would probably be great after cutting the yard.

Recent wedding with beer choices of Budweiser and Coors Light. I had a friend administer a blind taste test. This beer was absolutely horrible. It tasted like sweet corn piss water. However, due to being the winner in the taste test it apparently could have been worse.

I’ll likely never drink it again. Save a stranded island type situation.
Well it’s better than Miller Lite, but what is that saying not much. Well it is beer.

Bottle.  Thought it would be fun to rate the farmed out European version constantly available to me while living in CH. Pure clearl light yellow color with a bright white head that disappears rapidly. Minerally hops in the aroma, characteristic bud flavors and aromas abound, but its really clean overall.  Definitely defines the style for me, fresh enough, balanced and certainly nothing ’off’ in terms of veg notes (well, I didn’t let it warm anywhere near regular tasting temp).  Light, refreshing, nothing for me to bitch about really.  Sure its light and watery, and the only other brew I would reach for before this (in the style) would be a PBR.  Hits the spot when I want it to.

straw colour, clear with limited carbonation. Frothy generous head. Citric yeasty smell, fresh. Taste is mainly watery with a homely base... like munching plain breab. Nothing special but nothing much wrong either.
Hard to really come up with a lot to say about this. It is what it is: alcohol delivery vehicle.

What’s to be said about this brew... not much. We have all had Budweiser at some point in our beer drinking lives and usually it is the stepping stone down a long path to "real’ beer to get away from products such as this. Not a bad example of the American Pale Lager that came to dominate the market at the end of Prohibition and capture the market during WW2. Light, slight floral notes, crisp and somewhat refreshing. At the center of every Bar fight.

This really isnt that bad.  Pours a fast and off centered orange.  Taste is stale malt, corn is bountiful.  Appears to be a lager, yet a substandard knock off of something good.  A substitute beer if you will.  When its your only choice its drinkable, better on tap or bottles, as the cans just look stupid.  but king of beers this is not.
16 oz tin bottle.  Pours the palest of yellows, barely any head.  Aroma and taste are almost non-existent.  Rice flavoured water.

Bottle. Innisfil, Ontario.
For what this is, it is a really nice example. It’s not a beer snob’s beer because it is a pale lager, but it is one of the best macro pale lagers out there. Easy drinking, clean, crips. My favorite beer? No. I’m an IPA guy. But if I’m going to drink a macro pale lager, this is the one I want to drink. great colour, decent head, excellent carbonation. Nose is pretty light - hard to pick up a lot off of it. Taste is exactly as you’d expect from a "premium" pale lager. Good.
Chugged straight out of the 40, thanks to drowland’s butch, tastes like water going down.... oh yea, grab some buds.
Bottle 330ml. Another boring pale lager. Aroma of corn; taste is sweet and light. Palate is thin and watery. Yellow, with a thin head that disappears.
Had it awhile ago, it is garbage. Pure diabolical adjunct in the taste and smell.
It’s commercials are better than the beer. I don’t turn it down when offered, but don’t buy in for my own fridge.

Can @ Hotelroom, Denver. Pours light yellow with a small white head. Aroma of ... . ..  . ? nothing. Or nearly, a few light hops at best. Taste is like water with hint of stray and very light hops. Thin watery body, medium carbonation. Best thing about this is = it dont taste really bad ( since it dont taste as much at all ) 
My friend who handed this to me, said this is a beer you can drink alot of, but the question is, why would i ? ( or anyone) 
Wasted way to much time trying to do a decent rate on this crap.160311

If you give budweiser a top rating on each category, it gets a 5.  If you give it the lowest rating, it gets a 0.5.  The lowest possible rating.  That is what it gets.  Terrible heartburn combined with the lack of flavor makes it less than beer.

bottle@bar: probably the most famous beer in the world, so given the fact that I had never tried it before, I decided to given the lack of other alternatives despite preparing myself for something horrible, didn’t turn out to be a catastrophe but it was, bland, watery with some vile hay taste, can’t imagine repeat drinking, it is a disgrace that American beer is associated with this
Pale straw colour. Plain, watery. Almost no flavour is present. Just a fizz with a slightly sweet aftertaste.
Oxidised nose. Over-carbonated in appearance with light gold. The palate is sweet but metallic.The finish is unpleasant and would be even worse if the beer had not been cold. Would not buy this ever!
And I hear some people in the Netherlands saying Heineken is bad..  Bud makes Heineken seem like a fine craft beer...  Hard to understand why anyone would drink it
It is still a mystery as how this is "the king of beers". I could see it being the king of flavorless carbonated piss, but not the king of beers.
Can only hope foreighners don’e think this is what America’s beer culture is all about. Straw taste. Watery style and aroma. Time togo out of business.
I am uncertain as to why they beer is being exported to Belgium. Doing this makes no sense.
Pale with very little head. Doesn’t have a very strong beer taste. Decent when had cold on a warm day, but not if you want to enjoy a beer.

The King of Beers..in sales.  Pour:  Dilute honey yellow,  Head:  white, fading quickly, Taste:  More full, notable from the light beers on mouthfeel as well as taste, which is mild sweet malts.  not terrible, but not great.  if offered for same price as bud light, a must go.

I don’t mind drinking bud if its given to me... but it is too expensive for what you get. I feel it really is a discount beer and should be sold as one. Goes down smooth and easy to drink a lot of if you don’t mind paying a little extra at the beerstore for it.
2011 - 02 - 14 330ml bottle.light yellow colour. small white fading head. hay, floral, round taste. not as bad as I was afraid of.

I’m kind of new to this large and vast beer world.  So I decided to start with Ol’ Yeller.  Not bad, I do enjoy the smell and overall presentation of Budweiser.  There is a bitterness to the flavor that I do enjoy, but others may shy away because of this.

Entirely transparent pale pale gold.  Aroma is faint and slightly sweet, most akin to corn flakes cereal.  Crisp and bubbly mouthfeel, quite delicate, but is so watery and light bodied its more like drinking flavored seltzer. And that flavor?  Barely there, and much like malty corn flake cereal.  No hop bitterness discernible.  A waste of my time and money.

Very little aroma and a mild foamy head that quickly goes away. Has a slight corn taste. Has a pale yellow color with a lot of carbonation. Very little after taste. It is the king of non-offensive tasting macro brewed beer. I haven’t had this in a long time and felt obliged to rate it here since it is the self proclaimed "King of Beers". Though beer snobs deride this beverage and I can see why. If your looking for an inexpensive beer for mass consumption than it serves the purpose. It’s the beer of frat parties, BBQ’s, gameday and other events that call for mass consumption of alcohol. This isn’t as bad as I thought it would be.

This shit is BEECHWOOD AGED.  Too many people forget that some beer is MADE FOR swilling.  They forget that they need to review what this beer IS, as opposed to what it IS NOT.  Completely inoffensive!!!  Crisp!  Tons of small, tongue and throat massaging bubbles!  Mild ricey flavor with a boost of organic heritage maize!  No hangover regardless of how many you drink (pbr and high life cannot make this claim.)  This crap is the KING OF BEERS for a reason!  LONG LIVE THE KING!!!
Bud.....wei......ser. Man I miss those commercials,that’s the only thing good  about this beer

Clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is light malty. Flavor is light sweet and no bitterness. Soft, light bodied and very watery. By no means a good beer but not as bad as it’s reputation. It seems like a bit of a sport on this site to give a 0.5 score to Budweiser, but I have certainly had worse beers. 191210

The king of beers is a joke.  I do not take lightly the use of the word king unless it is of regal quality.  This beer is far from anything regal or delicious.  Purely a foul smelling and tasting liquid.
Really boring pale lager. Tasteless and dull. At least carbonisation is good for a hot summer day.

330 ml bottle.

Clear golden colour with some visible bubbles. Small lacy head. Aroma of grainy malts and honey. Flavour of pale malts, weak hops, honey and hay. Light bodied, greasy finish. Just another pale lager.
This is a great beer, the taste and the appearance are perfect Its a perfect beer for men and I appreciate drinking it during drinks with friends
Pretty light in colour with virtually no aroma although there is a distinct corny aroma. Remarkably similar to a lot of the Australian style light lagers, pretty dull really.
Bland. Boring. Bad. How can it even aspire to carry the (respected) name of Budweiser? When you put it next to a Czech Budweiser Budvar, the difference is like night and day. Most embarrassing!

16th November 2008 
Can on a plane to somewhere. A can actually brewed in the USA. Very clean lager - filtered to death? Pretty bland but okay when very cold and you are very thirsty!

33cl bottle. This was one of the first 5 beers I’ve ever had. I used to drink either this, Becks, Heineken or Corona during high school days and my memories about this beer are as the best in that batch.

341 ml bottle. Decent white head that diminishes quite quickly. The aroma is sour and of sour fruit. Flavour is grainy while texture is watery while sticky from tye corn used.    It is so yellow and has very little flavour.
Pours a clear golden with a thin head, aroma and flavor is much of the same, boring with nothing to it, king of beers, ummm, pass.

Light yellow beer with weak and almost disappearing white head. Aroma is sweet and lightly malty, also hint of honey. Taste is slightly malty and hints of grass, but overally very light and short. Very light to drink with medium carbonation. There are nothing annoying, because all aromas are so light, still pure; very light and tasteless beer.
12 oz. Bottle.  Goldish color.  Grassy notes.  Not fresh.  Not very enjoyable.  You can tell this was mass produced,  ah the power of advertising
Twelve ounce aluminum can, foreign owned American lager, very low taste, goes down easy

This beer is wholly under appreciated beer, This beer is meant to drink about 20 or so while on the beach with your best girls. You should take a very large cooler and fill with an abundance of ice - add some salt to lower the temperature of what will become the icy-water-soup. This will bring your can of Bud to a degree that is close to the freezing temperature. Now that you are ready to go, you should place your cooler under an umbrella and have a seat in a well crafted beach chair. Since you have invited all of your best girls to the beach with you, make sure to have many games and other activities to play. My favorite is to gently pinch each of their glorious butt cheeks as they continue to come to the cooler for another fine tasteless but oh so refreshing Bud. This beer should be consumed when you are outdoors, on the beach and you need to stay hydrated while cooling ones mouth and spirit with an American staple that serves this purpose well. Not for beer snobs, just for the man who knows his women, appreciates fine butt cheeks and and is not afraid to be himself.
This used to be may favorite beer in college.  I guess it isnt even real beer.  Moving on up!
Se questa hanno il coraggio di chiamarla birra, io sono il bassista degli Zeppelin...

Poured from the can into my trusty Samuel Adams glass.  The color was on the yellow shade of clear with a generous, fluffy white head of foam, which is what I expect from a pale lager. The aroma is barely there with some light grain and some astringency. The taste is slightly sweet and lightly carbonated (which vanishes very quickly) with a very, very light palate.  Flavors are difficult to pick up, is basically flat, profile-wise, and ends with metallic aftertaste. 

I have had some offensive beers in my time, and Budweiser is not necessarily offensive, just meh.  I know what I’m getting with a Budweiser, which is more than I can say for some imports and craft beers I have tried.

Bottle. Brewed by Stag in London. Not totally horrendous like so many of you ramble here. Certainly not worth the 0,5 "hate rates". Aroma and taste are weak but there are no off-tastes. It’s too watery, that’s the only problem.
Flaske 33 cl.  Bleg gul farve, med et tynd hvid hoved, der hurtigt forsvindert. Mild og lidt vandet. Maltet aroma og smag.
Amber beer with white head. Smells sour. Not much taste. Unimpressive in every aspect. Bland.
Bottle at home. Clear golden - white head. Cornflakes. Corn. Light hoppy notes. Light light bitterness. Artificial and synthetic. Boring. Light sweetness.
Can 500ml. Pours like carbonated water with a pale tint of yellow with small white head. Aroma of sweet corn and grains. Tiny hint of madly in taste, but mostly nothing. Palate is fizzy water.
(bottled and drinked straight from bottle) helsingin (or vaasan) water is more tastier than budweiser but still this is refreshing beer.
If you want to get drunk, this drinks easy (although it will take a lot!).  Sweet corn and a little malt with heavy carbonation to balance.  Very little flavor, very little finish.

Bottle 330ml @ home

Pours pale yeller with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt and grain. Taste is very watery.

Bottle (30cl): Sweet, it smells of corn & rice but is very bland. Hard to smell really.   Incredibly pale, a light, light golden colour. Has a bubbly head that goes very fast.   The taste is very water like & bland, hardly any at all. Hints of bread and other grains.   Very thin bodied & watery. It is incredibly fizzy & not too smooth.   A very poor beer although it was drinkable.   (Visit my beer blog: )

Surprised that when tasting blind, I found it to be a compelling choice within the american lagers family.  People who "know beer" dismiss Budweiser but versus its peers I found it to be one of the better ones.
light and watery, all you need to know. i just wish someone would start mass producing good beer one of these days
The king of beers, ah ahahahahahaha. Well if you’ve been to anything country related you’ve had this brew. Basically water and grain.
12oz longneck at Cowboy’s Dance Hall San Antonio, TX.  Enjoyed straight outta the bottle!!  Pee yellow.  Fizzy.  Sweet.  Finishes like water.  There is no new news in this rate.
Pours out golden and pretty clear with obvious carbonation. Off white head and very little in the aroma and flavor department.
Certainly is not the King of Beers...except maybe in volume made (and spilled).  Never drink the stuff unless its the only thing on the shelf.
Pours golden with some off white head. Almost no flavour or aroma but nothin offensive either. Very light and watery.
taste like piss. smells like piss. makes you piss like a racehorse. in case of emergency break glass type of beer.  respect the king though, we’ve all drunk it.

Rating this for the purpose of getting to 200.

It is piss water with alcohol. End of story :)

Clear and light body. Sugar, mould, grass, basement. Lager that’s bitter and dry but without any real taste at all. Or rather: there’s taste but without being sweet or bitter or sour or salty. Almost like it’s water and chemicals only. Ah well, had to try it at least once on my FL trip.

G: Poured into a pint glass.

A: Pale and straw-colored, with quite a bit of white head. Head retention is not high.

S: Mostly grainy, although my nose tells me that there are some hops in there somewhere.

T: Pretty good tasting for the style. There is some malt; certainly more than is typical of the style. The residual adjunct is there of course. 

M: Light mouthfeel, although pretty heavy for an adjunct. Decent amount of carbonation--not severely over-carbonated like Bud Light.

D: As far as I’m concerned, by far the best of the macros, which doesn’t say much. Luckily there’s Yuengling on the East Coast for desperate situations.

Have not had a real Bud in years. Had this in Muskogee, OK, as there was not much choice at the steak house. Drank from mason jar, real classy for here I guess. Pours light golden color with a big foamy head that lasts quite well and some lacing. Faint malt and grain aroma. Not a lot going on here. Mild malt and grain taste, slight sweetness with a clean finish. Light body, quite smooth. Crisp & refreshing. Nice beer for the style. Easy drinker, best when served cold. Not as bad as some people advocate. A least it is a real beer and not some watered down light beer.

Tasted on tap in St. Louis, Missouri.  Pale, slightly grainy, light malty aroma with little hops in the aroma. Bland rice, pale malty flavor (though more than Bud Light). One of the easier American macros to drink but overall just boring and a waste of time.
Bottled. pours pale golden with a tiny fast disappearing head. Metallic nose with malt notes. Watery palate. Realy no bitterness in the end. Hmmm...

It was high time I did this.  ALL HAIL THE KING OF BEERS! OK.  Seriously. If it REALLY was super pissy, would it be so popular?  So lemme try to be OBJECTIVE.  Pours the color of piss... (just kidding).  Pour very, very pale yellow.  Nothing sexy about it but nothing gross either.  It’s so light, however, that it does act as a harbinger of mediocirty.  Smell is mostly a "non-smell".  A very slight sharpness in the nose.  I cannot differentiate corn / rice adjuncts or anything like that.  This simply smells like college and the ballpark.  Goes down easy... like water.  Not very good but not very offensive.  It’s baby beer.  It’s embryonic.  It’s like someone started brewing and then said, "Meh.  That’s enough.  Seinfeld re-runs are on."  And voila. McDonald’s isn’t really a hamburger.  But on occassion, I’ll have one.
So ein Bier will ich eigentlich nicht weiter kommentieren. Woher der süßliche Geschmack kommt, weiß ich nicht, nach echtem Gerstenmalz schmeckt es jedenfalls nicht...

I really like this beer, if the label was pulled from the bottle it would probably rate higher. I’m not a drinker of heavy crafty type beers. I like a lighter type beer, don’t want to ose a spoon to drink my beer.

Very clear, very yellow, but great carbonation.  Some malt taste with a touch of bitterness, but you need to look for flavor.  As a coworker said "after drinking so many good beers this last week, this one seems watery".   I agree.  It’s industrial lager, though arguably at its best.  It’s fun to visit the original brewery in St. Louis though.
300ml bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with a small head.  Aroma is sweet malt, a tiny bit of grass.  Slightly sweet start, nothing to finish.
Pours almost white with hints of yellow. Aroma is missing in action.  Some sugary sweetness but the primary taste is of water. Grain or corn is just absent. Even the carbonation is barely there.

terrible beer i would honestly rather buy malt liqour its cheaper gets you drunk quicker and has more taste 
$6 a six pack no thanks buy a couple of 40s of malt liqour bubba and cletus drinking this watching nascar they are all alone on that one
Light no smell.Taste light bitter,citric hints,corn,watery.This beer hasnt bad taste but has very light taste.So i can drink it very easy when i dont ask for specials flavor for example in a club.

Wow is this terrible.  Our nickname for it in college - when Old Style was the "get drunk" choice for my gang - was "piss water".  Of course,, that was when we thought Moosehead was super-great beer :)  I saw in another rating someone lamenting how this could be the top selling beer in the world - I agree, but I understand that LOTS of people drink beer to get drunk, not to enjoy the beer itself.  To quote Kurt Vonnegut - so it goes.

Thanks to the prohibition, this is America’s benchmark beer. Beechwood aging and rice gives this beer it’s nutty smooth flavor. I actually thought this was the best beer in my younger years, but after a couple microbrews from good ole Summit Brewery, I realized my error

Draught - Pale yellow, moderate to full carbonation with a medium disappearing creamy white head. Negligible aromas of sweet, grainy malt & cardboard. Veggy hop & grain, some subtle general sweetness. Thin, light palate, full carbonation with no real finish.

It’s really hard to rate such things as aroma and taste when the beer doesn’t have any at all. SThe joke about making love in a canoe is really right.
How this can be the most-selling beer in the world I’ll never understand. The water in the tap in my kitchen taste more beer than this.
(bottle) clear pale golden colour with small white head; fruity and floral aroma; simple, balanced taste, no finish; boring and not worth trying again  but not downright repulsive

I’m not sure what others are expecting when rating this beer.  This is a great beer for watching football and partying, but don’t expect a micro-brew taste or experience.  Refreshing feeling on the palate.  If expectations are adjusted for what you’re getting (a macro-brew domestic), this is an excellent classic that should not be forgotten.

12oz bottle.  Sure there are beers that are worse than this, but this gets the worst ranking possible because it’s so prevalent in the beer world.  I don’t get why people drink this awful, corn-and-tin-tasting lager.  Hopefully everyone on this site has moved on from drinking this beer, unless you’re going hiking and this is left over in your fridge from like 8 months ago.
This shit is terrible I would rather drink bud light atleast its a little bit healthier piss water

This beer is really horrible. It is overly carbinated and it tastes as if it is already a light beer and I mean by that it does have taste at all. In addition to all of this it is way over priced. There are many many better "premium" beers.
Its a classic beer, I still buy it when it goes on offer in the supermarket because it is ludicrously overpriced here in the UK, especially in pubs/clubs.
Not bad if you are in college and/or on a budget.  Otherwise, avoid this one.

pours a golden color with a big white carbonated head.  Absolutely no taste other than water and no depth.  

pint draft

Bottle 33cl. Pale yellow with a white shortlasting head. Quite tasteless, but you may detect some corn and metal. This beer is sweet and watery. Ok to drink if you are really thirsty since it is very close to being water.
Mmm. . .Rice and Corn.  I know it is a macro lager, I am not expecting that much, but what is that weird flavor? Serving: Bottle and Tap
50 cl can. Clear pale yellow with medium white head. Flavour is malt, corn and watery.
Pours medium pale yellow, nose is grainy and moldy. taste is mildly sweet with hints of bitterness and a gross chalky aftertaste.
Bottle 25cl. A clear yellow beer with hight carbonation. Aroma is mostly hopy, very basic lager, not unpleasant but less interesting, dry notes of rice.

Bottle. Golden pour, large quickly dissipating head.
Aroma of faint sweaty hops, some malt and hay.
Sweet watery malt flavour with faint hops.
Better than expected, but still quite poor.
I rate this 1 point less to bud light, because it defeats the purpose of what bud light pulls off.  Same poor flavor just heavier and full.

~Sour green apple, malty aroma with hay and light spicy hops.
~Pours a clear straw color with lots of bubbles and creamy white head.
~Light malty sour green apple flavor, no hops.
~Ligh body, high CO2, quick sour malt finish.
~It’s drinkable.

Can’t believe it’s taken me this long to review an actual "Bud Heavy". I like Bud, it’s not my first pick if given an extensive choice, but when it comes down to Bud Light, Miller Lite & Bud (as usually the case), it’s Bud all the way, as to quote the great Doug Heffernan, "I am who I am & light beer sucks". It looks & pours like a typical America macro lager because IT IS the typical American macro lager. Favor is light, hits of corn & bread, abit of a hoppy aftertaste. Easy drinkin’ & not bad to have on a hot summer day.

(cute little 8oz can thanks to ericandersnavy) pale yellow with very few bubbles. Nose of corn, diacetyl, apple, hairspray. Taste of grain, watery, apple, alcohol. Gross. Watery grainy. Just not good.
Très peu houblonné, très peu de goût..mais très pétillante et rafraichissante...c’est ma bière commerciale préféré!!!

The beer snob crowd always make me laugh.  This is not the number one beer in America because it tastes like dogshit.  This is a light, thirst quenching liquid that goes down good on a hot day.  The color is light yellow and is actually nice looking in a tall pilsner glass.  Yes, there is the typical corn aroma and taste but it goes down smooth and refreshing.  It is truly amazing to me that the AB boys have it down so much that each batch is the same as before.  This is not an experimental beer.  Raters need to get off their high horse and realize what they are drinking.  These beers didn’t make it to the top of the heap on advertising alone.  There has to be some merit to it.  Givem their due.

Actually I haven’t had this for Ages, but I did have quite a few of them in my youth.  I remember once actually getting some beechwood in the bottle.  Or am I dreaming that?  Haha, I think it really happened.  You all know how it tastes, so I’ll spare you the details.

Can at the Rogers Centre.  Pours a clear yellow gold with modest white head - doesn’t look good but not totally brutal.  Sadly that’s as good as it gets.  What little aroma there is is light grains.  Thin grainy taste.  Ultra watery.  It’s hard to even call this a beer it’s so thin and watery.

25cl bottle poured into glass. Wow, can it get any worse than this?!!??? The bottle I tasted was brewed under supervision of Budweiser by S.A. Damm in Spain. The bottled poured a very thin, yellow liquid reminiscent of urine. The head was there but disappeared right after I had poured the contents of the bottle in my glass (yes, the glass I used was clean). What I was left with, was a glass of carbonated, urine-like liquid. I did detect the smell of adjuncts right away, where other large corporate breweries use maize (corn), the brewers at Budweiser resort to an even cheaper ingredient; rice.  After three sips, I decided to dump the rest down the drain... Folks, this ain’t no beer....this is horrendous stuff best left to go bad on the shelves of your liquor store or supermarket.

There’s nothing wrong with Budwesier, ya beer snobs!  I’ve had many of the top 50 beers in the world, but when I’m not looking to pay $8/bottle for a world-class brew, I reach for a beer brewed in my home state of Missouri.  This is the famous Budweiser beer, and it’s amazingly consistent even though it has fillers and is a bit watery.  Extremely pale yellow with a small frothy white head that doesn’t cling or last.  Aroma and flavor are faint with a bit of bitterness and twang, little malt presence, but a nice crisp finish and refreshing after a hard day’s work.  Budweiser’s not craft beer or even above average, but it’s better than any other major brewer’s American lager, and better than some of the fancier experimental beers out there!
Clean and watery, with high carbonation. Adjunct flavors and sweetness. I get a little green apple and decent. Bready -like highly processed and bleached white bread.
12oz can.  What did I expect??  Watery, no flavor, aluminum taste. Ya, that’s what I got with this beer.  Only tried it and rated it because my brother was given a full case of this stuff.
Pours a very pale blonde with bright white head that fades quickly.  Corn and malt aromas.  Initial waterry sweet aroma which fades to a rice/corn finish, almost no hop flavors.  Really watery.

12 oz. can from my roommate (gee, thanks). Pours a pale yellow with a frothy head that dissipates almost immediately. I smells slightly of hops, with a little bread. The taste is mostly bitter, with a little sweetness that doesn’t balance it out. The body is thin and watery. I can see why this beer is popular. It’s nothing special, but it’s not strong, complex or demanding. Easy drinking and little flavor.

Bottle. Watery. Caramel, rice and cereal. Very weak hop. Thin white head, pale gold body. Light bodied. Tinge of bitterness. Sweet. watery finish. Nothing there. My girlfriend’s favourite beer, and she usually hates the stuff! This is because it tastes like beer watered down to within an inch of its life.

I heard a rumor that this is called the King of Beers because they had to shorten it somehow from "King of Beers for Americans who have ruined their palate by drinking Coke since they were 3 and would rather taste nothing than taste something that is not sugary sweet".  Apparently that wouldn’t fit on the bottle.  Perfect for those who scoff at guys drinking Bud Light and say "I only drink real beer, give me a Budweiser".
Slightly more taste than its light brother, but still lacking in bold flavor and an appealing smell. But "Hey", at least it has bubbles.
Pale gold in color.  Nice easy drinking brew, somewhat light on the body but not undrinkable, just basic and pleasant.

Bottle:
Have to rate it some day…
Boring beer! No real taste, just a slight hint of malts, but very light.
Like a well balanced mix of water and malts, though it’s not tasty…
Taste is very very light, no sugars, no hops (just a very very very light hint of some bitterness), no spices no hints of anything…
Story on the label is totally contrary.
This beer is supposed to be the king of beers?? I’m not so sure. Tastes ok, but it sure gave me a headache the next day. I’d pass on this one honestly.

From a 355ml bottle on 19/6/2010. Thought I’d give this a try so that I’m not just rating stuff that I expect to be good. Has a very faint sweet malt grain aroma. Taste wise, it’s just plain sweet, with the tiniest of hop finishes at the end. The most entertaining thing about it is the blurb on the bottle which talks about how they know of no other beer which costs so much to brew and age, and that the ageing process produces a result found in no other beer at any price. You’d be hard pressed to find a beer which is more ordinary than this.

I just can’t believe two beers that have nothing to do with each other are being produced under the same brand name.For Shame.Watery, with a mix of rice flavour that smells a loot like urine.Way below average.

This is proably one of the worlds most popular beers, but americans are really the only ones used to drinking it, so when I see bad ratings i see a lot of them are from australia, norway, etc, but anyway its a good strong beer that you can drink with friends and have a good time, has a bit of a strong taste at first as well as after taste, but last time i checked its called BEER!! not dr pepper!

pours a pale yellow colour with a non existant head. the king of beers? people are easily sold. no point in going into detail about the aroma, the taste and the mouthfeel since i’m sure every north american has had one (or many!) of these. all i can say is thank you budweiser for being so bad, that i was forced to discover the wonderful world of micro brewed beer!
Bevuta alla spina al fu Crazy Bull di Genova; zero schiuma, zero corpo, molte bollicine. Robaccia da americani (peraltro usurpatori di nomi)

Bottle @ home

An unholy abomination bottled, it is absolutely dreadful. Pours an absolutely vile pale yellow colour, with a weak white head. Smell is very artificial and has horrible rice notes. Unbearably watery and has no flavour whatsoever. Truly not the King of Beers, more like a filthy decrepit peasant wallowing in his own filth. Vile.

330ml bottle. Pours a wimpy pale gold, with a loosely packed head - like a cider, or maybe urine. It smells like slightly ricey nothing. The main flavour impression is similar to the unpleasant smell of urinal cakes. Vile and appalling.

What can you say about Budweiser? For years, this was my go-to for beer on a budget. Had it recently at a party, the night after drinking some Port Brewing Wipeout I.P.A., and I realized how unsatisfying it is. The taste is watery. The kicker, however, is the aftertaste, which I can only compare to Splenda and other artifical sweeteners. I am pleasantly buzzed, however.
Bottle. Yellow color, no head aroma almost nothing. Taste watery. Only one reason I tried It was, that I was curious, why almost all people say its bad beer. Now I know.
this beer is just like bud light. only it has possibly a little more flavor, not saying a good flavor.  but i really want to get my BS ratings out of the way.

Guess it’s time to rate the "King of Beers", the "true American beer" whose brand name was conveniently snatched from the Czech Republic with the rise of the Iron Curtain after WW2. Oh well - history aside, this is perhaps the most famous lager beer in the world and an appropriate milestone in my continual odyssey into commercial pale lagers (mostly for the sake of my acquired rating obsession, as there’s no way I’d otherwise drink that many crappy beers). Pours a classic pale lager body with lively carbonation and a thin, white head. My nose gives me the dreaded (in my book) cooked vegetables, corn syrup and sweet malts. Taste is pretty standard lager beer; some malt sweetness backed up by a low-impact hop tone. Pretty well tuned, and not at all as cooked-veggie-or-wet-cardboard-tainted as I’d expected, although there is a bit of it in the aftertaste. On average, it’s pretty low in taste throughout, and lives up to the cliche of being like "making love in a canoe"... :-P Boring stuff, but produced with enough professionalism to avoid the pitfalls of many cheap lagers, which actually taste bad. This is just refined blandism. But "King of Beers"? GTFO. "King of Sales" (due to poor taste and propaganda exposure in the general population) would be a more appropriate slogan.
At least it has more flavor than Bud Light... Easy to drink, but tastes like water...
Amazing! Not really. Pours golden yellow with aromas of ceral and grass. A slam beer.
Bud is an American classic. It’s as thick and rich as a cheap beer can get. It extremely filling--guaranteed to feel bloated.

12 oz can.
A light yellow gold, with medium creamy white head.
The head lasted almost till the end of the can once it was poured.
Not distinctive in taste, but not repulsive at all.
It lacks that overly sweet taste of many American mass produced lagers.
I was not overly disappointed with this bee, but I can not understand why it sells so well.

Bottle: Chilled down to 34 degrees, then poured into a chalice.  Pours gold with a nice, frothy white head that sticks to the sides of the glass.  The coldness of the beer actually made the chalice sweat a bit, adding to the aesthetic pleasure of the appearance.  Smells initially of corn, some dry rice elements, touches of a stray hop or two, some sweet, malty notes.  As the beer warms slightly, the familiar hint of spicy skunk common to this style starts to creep in a bit.  Tastes crisp, with some mild fusel elements, hints of bitterness, some sweet appley hints, some more of the familiar perfumy skunk.  Perfectly inoffensive.
It has to be a hot day and the beer has to be cold to make this one work for me. Little aroma or taste and an unattractive appearance. A trainer beer at best.

Bottle from the "Damm" at Barcelona Spain. Very light yellow color. Small, very small, almost no head. Disappears ver quick. Weird, unpleasant smell,Spices, even garlic? and some citrus. Taste... almost nothing... Drinkeable, that’s it...

Smell is extremely weak; so is color. Taste is barely there, but if I have to discern a flavor, I’d call it cheesy. Leaves a yeasty coating in the mouth. Very carbonated. More like beer-flavored carbonated water than anything else. Only drinking it because my roommate buys it, and I’m trying to get her back for drinking my beer. Not a good choice.

Aroma is almost nonexistent. The color is incredibly light. The beer has outstanding clarity, but I don’t really see this as an asset. Apparently the brewers have strove for clarity and have been successful in this attempt. Flavor? Maybe a light, acidic grass.  I really don’t understand why people drink this. Obviously not for the flavor. Some people say they drink it just for something cool to drink. Sorry. I would much rather have water or Gatoraide when I’m hot and looking for some cool refreshment.

"Limited Edition" Millennium bottle that they probably made about 300 million of. The "King of Beers" has been dethroned so many times I lost count. As someone pointed out, it smells like "wet dog." Taste is what I imagine toilet water to taste like. Very watery and metallic with something nasty I can’t quite place. Rated 1/24/2000
Grungy ass is how I would describe the taste and aroma. I know it’s a macro but that doesn’t excuse junk.

A’s The title says it, "King of Beer". Budweiser is the King in of beer, and if i should make a beer ther would go for America and The rest of The World   Is this a good shot/
The beer is light Spice but now special experience.

If the army were to standard issue a beer, then this would be it, its just beer, nothing too special, its a great fridge filler if you have folks comin over for a ball game or something, it pours with almost no foam, and is made from lesser ingredients. I’m surprised that the ingredients used came out to the flavor that it has. If you like this beer, then you are in luck, because virtually every alcohol selling establishment in america has it.

A little part of me dies every time I drink one of these, which isn’t very often, and avoided whenever possible.  Not really even going to justify it with a description other than to say, its sad that so many people actually consider this beer and buy it by choice.

From a bottle.  Pours crystal clear light yellow gold, with small creamy white head.  An actually bad aroma, no normal malt or hop aromas detectable, smells kind of like dirty socks, pocket lint, maybe slight corn malt, not really though.  Taste is only slightly better, just shitty flavors, I could get inventive describing them, but what’s the point.  This beer sucks, and it saddens me that it is acceptable in my country for this to represent our beer and that so many people will unthinkingly gulp it down.  Just bad.
Pours a nice golden color with not much head.  Has some good flavor, and is much better than the alternative light beers.  Definitely not the king of beers, but is good for the summer time cookouts.
tastes like crap.  Horrible, flavor, bad rice filling.  Not refreshing.  Rather drink camel urine.
there is very little to this beer but it still remainds to be my favorite domestic cheapy. nothing like a bud on a hot day. More taste then the lights yet less expensive then crafts and imports.
This is a meal in a bottle.  Too Heavy for me, but the commercials are pretty funny.  Golden brown color.
Bottle.  Golden light in color, clear, and a fizzy white head.  The smell is corn, malts, floral, and weak.  The taste is weak, corn, floral, and watery.

Pours golden yellow, lite foamy head that disapates quickly. Aroma of grain and slight pine. Palate is highly carbonated, but still manages to be smooth and refreshing. Not a ton of flavor slighty malty can almost taste a few hops trying to get out there. Let’s face it, its a macro and nothing fantastic but its easily my "throwdown" beer of choice compared to the others.

Budweiser-Millenium Commemorative 12 oz. Bottle.  1999 Release.  5.20% ABV.  (2.0 / 5.0)  Clear very light straw golden color.  Minimal light hop front.  Lightly sweet thin low malt body.  Smooth with distinctive lager flavor.  Finishes clean easy and rather bland with no hop flavor.  Sampled 11/25/1999.

Budweiser--2003 12 oz. Bottle.  5.20% ABV--15 IBU’s.?  (3.25 / 5.0)  Clear thin light straw golden color.  Fizzy mild lace head.  Minimal hop aroma.  Thin clean smooth very mild butter pilsner dry light sweet adjunct body.  CO2 tang in mild clean light citrus hop end.  Sampled 5/3/2004.

Budweiser--Bowling Pin Bottle--2004 16 oz. Bottle.  5.20% ABV--15 IBU’s.?  (3.5 / 5.0)  Clear thin light straw golden color.  Fizzy lacy head.  Bland light hop front.  Thin smooth light sweet butter CO2 body.  Clean adjunct taste.  Mild light citrus hop end.  Refreshing clean crisp but bland.  Sampled 5/1/2004.

Budweiser Happy Holidays Pack--2004 12 oz. Bottle.  5.20% ABV--10 IBU’s.?  (3.5 / 5.0)  Thin foamy snow white lacy head.  Clear very thin straw yellow color.  Non-existent hop front.  Bland smooth light Pils adjunct caramel body.  Mild CO2 tang.  Dry sweet clean mild citrus hop end.  Refreshing.  Easy.  Sampled 11/19/2004.

Budweiser--2005 Chinese 12 oz. Bottle.  4.40% ABV--10 IBU’s.?  (3.5 / 5.0)  Foamy thin no lace head.  Clear thin straw golden color.  Mild hop front.  Mild Pils malt body.  Crisp smooth mild caramel mild adjunct flavor.  Clean mild hop end.  Refreshing clean brew.  Sampled 4/24/2005.  Standards deteriorate rapidly after too much Chinese beer.

Budweiser Lager Beer--Vintage 1918 Label 12 oz. Bottle.  2005 Release.  5.00% ABV--15 IBU’s.?  (3.0 / 5.0)  Foamy mild lace sheet white head.  Clear thin very light straw yellow color.  No Hop front.  Clean watery mild malt flavorless adjunct body.  Clean refreshing mild butter hop end.  Smooth but very bland.  Sampled 2/4/2006.

0,33 literes üveges kiszerelés.
Gyantás, világos arany szín, szinte semmi illat. Íz: víz + valami… inkább semmi. Olyan mintha a balatoni világosunkkal próbáltak volna versenyezni.

I dusted off an old can that was in the back of the fridge, so it was a bit past the freshness date listed on it.  Overall, I was actually surprised.  There’s nothing really offensive, but this is just plain and uninteresting.  Pours a very light yellow body with white head.  Aroma of maybe some wheat/corn and not much else.  Flavor is rather pleasant with a mild corn flavor.  Very light-bodied and watery.  This would be thirst-quenching on a hot day, but I wouldn’t drink this everyday.

Pours pale brown/yellow with thin quickly vanishing head. Looks like a glass of dishwashing water. Artificial sweet aroma, no character at all. Artificial fruity sweet flavor, some sweetness from rice also, more like coolaid with some malty add-on flavor. Nothing on the palate and finish is .... where did it go?
Aromas of dough and office supplies. When you take a swig and can actually see past the beer through the bottom of the glass you know you’re part of something special. Fizzy, dry, and something else.

Light pale pour, very little head or nose to it. The flavor is weak (as is the carbonation), with what taste their is resembling corn chips (to me, anyway). Though completely unexceptional, it’s arguably the least offensive- and therefore the best- of the standard American marco brews.
Tasted blind. Straw color with excellent clarity and white head. Stanky skunky aroma. The only flavor is carbonation and grain, medium high carbonation.

Can.

A - Normal for the style, light yellow. Head dies quickly.

S - Also normal for the style, metallic and some corn. Lacking.

T - Pretty typical for style. Light malt and mostly grainy and corny taste/sweetness. Not bad or offensive but not great.

M - Light bodied and high carbonation.

D - Could drink lots of them if you wanted to. But that’s because it’s light with not a lot of flavor.

Notes: Well pretty typical for the style, not great but not offensive at least. Ok as far as the style goes and has its situations which it would be drank at.

Can, straw with small white head and light carb bubbles noted, fruit and corn aroma noted with zero hops on nose, sweet corn flavor with mild bready malt and high carbonation level, watery and clean crisp finish with no residual flavors

Golden with a small head. 

Very light aroma and very watery and boring taste. No aftertaste, nothing. How can they sell so much of this crap?
Tastes like a bit of nothing. Clear light yellow pour with a small head. Aroma is of a light ice water. I feel that this beer lacks quite a bit.
Mild sweet aroma.  Pale yellow colour with fast disappearing head. Tastes of rice / wheat.  Horrible on palate. Very crude.  How can this be so popular?

Clear yellow pour with large white head.  The aroma is fairly plain, with some wheat notes.   The taste is clean and mildly sweet.  It has a light to medium body with good carbonation and no aftertaste.  A refreshing hot weather brew.
Bottle. 12 oz. Standard, all around solid American pale lager. Not my first choice, but no shame in throwing back a few old fashioned Budwisers.

You bunch of beer snobs.  When you are hot and thirsty nothing is better than a bottle of cold Bud.  Get your head out of your microbrew butts and remember what you wished you could have been drinking in your youth- Pabst Blue Ribbon boy!
If you drink this, please do the world a favor and kill yourself.  The king of beers.... King of Skunkslyvania maybe.

Side by side with bud lite.  Larger bubbles.  Aroma is non existent but neutral so add a bit of score. I mean, you know what this beer is, and if you like craft beer this is the opposite of what you like.  However, this is a well made beer.  clear, crisp, neutral, won’t offend hardly anyone.  I gave this a poor score and it deserves it, I also only paid a dollar for it, but it is a perfectly made beer.  If I wanted some alcohol and wanted to pay less than a soda, this is a great beverage.

My least favorite American macro. It is a pale gold brew, no head, very light aroma. The taste is bitter and extremely watered down. I am not going to insult the beer and say it is terrible, but it is just insignificant. I want to drink something and enjoy it. This is forgettable at best. I like it with a burger though. When I do drink it, I have it in bottles or cans. A gateway beer I guess... gateway to even worse beer.

OK, I thought this was a heavy beer when I was younger??? I don’t know if they changed it or I just have better taste now? Anyway, it is better than Bud Lite & Miller Lite so, it could be worse... (I keep it in the fridge for my rookie fam & friends because they can’t handle my Sweetwater 420 ;-)
This beer is awesome.  I’m gonna buy a Budweiser jacket and wear my sunglasses indoors to let everyone know, that I know, what good beer really is!
For all the advertising, really didn’t like the taste. Almost like a cheap beer trying too hard.

Bottle @ Phillipe’s. Clear golden straw with a soapy white head. Grain, nice bready sweetness, rice, and a touch of biscuit. Mild soap and floral hop aromas. Moderate sweetness and overall just very easy to drink. Grain, rice, and biscuit. Slightly doughy. Hints of lemon along with soap and flowers. Good enough.
Me: What kind of beer do you have on tap? Waitress: Bud, Bud Light and Michelob Ultra. Me: I’ll have an Coke.
Don’t bother. This may be one of the highest selling beers in the world but it doesn’t count for nothing. Taste like stagnant water and corn.

My first experience with the "King" was fittingly at a Morcoccan buffet, in Abu Dhabi. Beer came with the buffet, and Bud was the only choice. At least it wasn’t a "light" beer. I’m not actually going to write anything about this beer, because, fuck, who cares? This beer has more to say with its label, its American-status symbol, and it’s history than the stale-hop alcohol-water in the bottle. Budweiser is the kind of beer that’s behind corporate-backed political campaigns. If craft beer geeks aren’t worried about the recent campaign-financed ruling, they should be. Get ready for megabrewers to start buying seats in places where their macro-swill market is being eroded by real beer, to put into place more middle-man distribution legislation that favors their product, up subsidies on their favorite adjunct, and ease tax-based incentives for small brewers. America’s official corporatization is here. And the fact that comes in a Budweiser glass, in Abu Dhabi, to be paired with a Moroccan feast is all I need to know.
There is nothing to see  here.  This is not the beer you were looking for.  Now go along and drink something else.
pours yellow copper. aroma is grain and metal pipes. drinks smooth and metallic with very light grain. if its free and i dont have anything else, i’ll drink it
I think I figured out why they keep the Clydesdales around....Hmmm yuck....

I’ve been surrounded by it my entire life.
 Therefore I’m used to its presence, just never interested.

 Dull, boring, inoffensive. Rice, corn, some metal. Small cereal malt presence.

 Clean finish. Good... onto something better.

[1/10] Straight from a bottle presented by a new acquaintance who looked pleased by his exotic purchase. Nothing like as bad as the last time I had it (when it tasted like the onset of the flu) presumably because it was fresher due to its increased popularity here now. There’s a empty corn/ rice  middle where the malt should be and little in the way of hops. But a lot of the ratings here are therapeutic rants: this stuff is rubbish but there’s far worse to be had.



[6/17] Can. Yellowish orange with a white head that’s soon a scant coat. 2 Some lemon and grass in the aroma but it’s pretty vacant. Texture is OK and carbonation is pleasant enough, but it’s very empty and a bit cardboardish when it it come to malt flavours. A little lemon comes though and at the finish there’s at least some bitterness. Expected not to have been independent enough, but no.

I took home a can of this to see if my tastes had changed or its taste had changed since the last time I drank some, which was around 1990. Nope. Still tastes like the can; thin, metallic, grainy, and mediocre. No hops, very little malt flavor; this is an American adjunct beer, the lowest common denominator of beers, and has about as much resemblance to anything substantial as Kim Kardashian has to Meryl Streep. Reliable? Perhaps. Reliably bad? Pretty much, yeah.
Bottle.  Light yellow with very thin and quickly disappearing head.  Waterly with limited character and finish.

Ah Budweiser, how I was fascinated by thee when I was younger and far more ignorantly impressionable. From barking frogs to cute dogs to mostly nekkid hot chics getting paid to endorse your product, I knew more about your advertising than the actual beer itself. Fast-forward more than 20 years later…I know far more about your product now, though your nefarious marketing ways haven’t changed at all. In fact, they’ve gotten sneakier and more nefarious than ever. You know the saying: bullies don’t change, they just get older. Budweiser is exactly the same. They may be celebrating 130+ years of business, but their bullying ways haven’t changed a bit, they’ve just gotten older. Add to that marketing genius which relies on the ignorant suckerability of the lazy masses who would rather someone else make their drinking decisions for them, and voila: an evil empire is born, raised, and flourished. But I digress; there is a beer review to write and the beer is the original progenitor of evildom: Budweiser.




~cue the frogs~




From his bottle to my glass, golden yellow grains settle in where no head is to be found, just a thin border of meager white foam. He swirls with no lace, unsurprisingly. Teasing his golden depths, faint esters of wonderbread, key lime, ears of corn still green and awaiting harvesting from their green husks finish with a hard mineral bite. Soda water comes to mind. My first quaff is much sweeter than I was expecting with sweet butter rolls and honey-glazed bread. There is no finish at all, just a residual wetness at the back of my throat which reminds me that I just swallowed some sort of liquid. Lemon and lime zip across the top of my tongue while wet bread offers meager weight to his body. Furthering our journey of the damned, a typical dank and slightly rotten finish starts to rear its ugly head. Whether a product of inferior ingredients, the lack of enough ingredients, chemical additives, an unnaturally fast brewing process and far too short lagering time…or all the above, pretty much all inferior macro lagers waste no time developing that rotten dank finish. A couple more quaffs and it’s a wash, rinse, and repeat of the same. The only thing that progresses is the growing unpleasant dank funk and so the reputable giant, Budweiser, joins his rightful place down my kitchen plumbing.




Ever wonder why the large majority of your macro lager drinkers don’t finish their bottle or pint? As they near the end and the arctic chill starts to wear off, their tastebuds awaken to the horrible swill they have been enduring and proceed to scream for relief. Unfortunately, the relief usually comes in the form of another freezing cold bottle or pint of the same. Habit. Marketing. Nonchalance. Ignorance. Laziness. The reasons for why people choose to drink Budweiser are many, but that doesn’t mean I understand them any more or any less. Okay, understand maybe I do, but accept I do not.
light malty,light yllow,clear, white foam, lightly bitter, lightly sour, short finishlight body, thin feel, fizzy, soft light harmonich.
Generic elephant piss to drink at parties and football games.  And a common beer we used to drink back in college.

This ultra-thin, watery, morbidly stagnate beer is pompous enough to call itself "The Great American Lager"? I call shenanigans. Budweiser tastes, of all things, like a fistful of salt being lobbed into a vat of pond water. Why this perfectly inadequate, borderline offensive beer is wrapped around the lips of many is beyond me. The next time I see one of these cans being coddled by one of my friends, no matter what the situation, I’m going to slap this bottle of fecal waste from their confused fingers. What a terrible, grotesque, impolite drink to give to free people.

Pour a cloudy, light yellow. Head quickly dissappears. Kind of a corn flavor with citrus hints. Weak overall flavor, except a not so good aftertaste. Imitation beer? This beer is only fit for a mother-in-law. I will never drink again
Pours deep gold with white quickly fading head.  Taste is corn with a little rice and hay flavor, maybe a bit of lemon? Not bad but not good.

Very light hop aroma which is difficult to detect. Something makes me think Czech, probably Saaz hops. Bright yellow color with a pure white head that vanishes quickly. Tastes of corn and rice. Quite bland but refreshing and contains no offensive elements. Thin and fizzy. Finishes crisp and dry. Far from a premium beer but it’s probably the best of the big American lagers. Cheap and easy to find.

Beer? Are you sure? 
Un-watchable head (thin and vanishing) and color (pale ugly-yellow), very unattractive at the first sight.
The best thing of aroma is its "easy-to-forgive" trait.
Probably you will have difficult to perceive anything similar to real malt.
Taste and palate not much better: weak bitterness, something seems corn. Carbonation is unbalanced and i can’t imagine how people can drink it directly from bottle. Water is more good and as refreshing as this one. A paragon for bad beers.

Ah ah ah...oddio,devo aver fatto una faccia incredibile quando la gentile signora che abita nel mio palazzo,dopo averle fatto un favore,me la ha offerta con la frase:"ora ti offro una buona birra,mio marito la adora...",mi sono quasi spacciato per astemio.Non ne ha azzeccata una,poverina,non è ne buona e io evito di definirla birra.Tralascio le considerazioni sui gusti del marito...una sola domanda:ma perchè la gente deve avvelenarsi la vita bevendo certe cose?
Io la devo recensire per forza,mi rovina la media e forse anche la reputazione(quale poi è da vedere!).

Clear golden color, perfectly sparkling with a fluffy white head. Light malty aroma. Supercrisp and fresh malt flavor. Easy to drink and easy to enjoy. This is a classic super refreshment, i just refuse to downrate it.

Pours pale gold with a small head that quickly faded.
Aroma shows cooked vegetables and not much else... Possibly some faint hint of malt.
Flavours show corn and something faintly herbal before a very weak bitterness enters.
Pretty highly carbonated and watery.
Pale pour from a pitcher, small offwhite head.  I prefer this to Budlight, but if given a choice I would probably choose Coors over either.  Relatively bland, nondescript flavor.  cheap.

We all know what it looks like.  Aroma is light malt, light hop (maybe) and light bread.  Flavor true to nose, a bit sweeter than desired for mass consumption.  And the hangover is terrible.  But, I still drink it often.
Not bad. Aftertaste is bitter. Feels heavy in the gut. I prefer Coors over Budweiser. A decent beer that I am willing to take anytime without any problem. But there are much better beers out there.

I have a hard time trying to understand why someone would ’pick’ this beer over pretty much any other beer out there. I’ve had it a parties and such, and I don’t think that it’s as horrendous as some will have you believe. But it is by far one of the most boring unadventurous predictable watery artificial-tasting beers out there.

Ugh.  What can one say about a beer that practically every adult in America has tasted??  If you aspire to nothing better, than this lager will work just fine.  Most of the people who visit this site desire much better from their beers.
Very pale yellow with a no head, slight sweet aroma, not much taste but what there was, was sweet and watery.

Crystal clear straw body with a fizzy, short lived head. Very light 2 row aroma, with some mild, fruity yeast esters. Faintest touch of floral hops in the background. The flavor is very clean and retains some of the malt character. Sweet throughout, moderate to high carbonation. Not bad compared to macros that actually use corn.

Almost colorless watery looking beer with a thin white head. Thin aroma of soap, tastes of corn and some light malts. Very watery. Abrupt slightly bitter finish. Would have expected more from the #1 most popular beer of the USA, but then again... We also have Heineken as our #1.

Poured from can into mug; fizzy white head that quickly disperses. Faint aromas of grassyhops. Light in body with flavors of rice,hay and malt. A very mellow brew thats quaffable, but by no means great.
Can.  Decent sweet aroma. Thats about it though. Taste leaves a bit to be desired. Almost goes down like water.
Blame it on my father, but I got something for this beer. Nothing special, just something nice about drinking a bud.

So the thread about the beer with the most ratings that you’ve never rated led me to Bud.  I went through a brief Bud phase in college, but otherwise I don’t drink this.  So, at the bar with no good beer, I picked up this tick.  Tick.  My input can’t change anything statistically.  This is a straw color yellow with a fizzy white head.  Light corn sweet nose.  It was served ice cold, and that is the only way to drink this.  Adjunct sweetness with a thickish mouthfeel that I have never liked in this beer.  There are many other crappy American pale lagers that are better.

Clear and slightly yellow not much colour. Tall white head.  Smells terrible like sweet corn and wet cardboard. Flavour is bland and disagreeable. Horrible beer nothing to it. Instead of the King of Beers, this is more like the king of shitty macro brewed piss water. Just plain terrible.

I borrowed a can from a BCM drinking friend so I could rate this. The can says to drink within 110 days of the born on date, and the BoD is from last December, so ts not fresh. Is this why I can’t taste hops ;). It’s actually a nice looking beer, a bit pale, but clear and with an impressive head (but most people don’t even pour it). Drunk cold, it’s weak brew. Drunk at all warm, the off flavors pop up. In a world filled with light lager drinkers, Bud kind of does deserve its popularity.

This shit,taste like dirty tap water with alcohol. I like my water clean and filtered with NO alcohol. Screw this drink. Had it once in a 710ml(24oz can)and in 1.18L 40oz bottle. Was better in bottle over can,but still suck’s 2 me.

Serving: 12 oz. can.
Appearance: Pale yellow with a foamy, white head.  The head is gone in seconds leaving no lacing behind.
