Aroma: Light nose with a bit of corn and grain.  Remarkably unremarkable.
Flavor: A bit of grain, corn, and slight bitterness.  Overall a bit of a watery mess.
Palate: High, aggressive carbonation that seeks to beat out any flavor you may find.  Light mouthfeel and medium-short, bitter finish.
Overall: Not the worst I’ve ever had, but close!

Let’s face it - this ain’t the best, BUT,this is the only beer I drink when I am eating Maryland steamed crabs.  For all of you who have never tried crabs the way we make them here in Maryland, you’re totally missing the boat! Speaking of boats, we go out on the water to catch our own, steam them ourselves and enjoy! There is something about the bitter Budweiser that just marries so well with crabs!

(can)  Very pale adjunct lager.  Flavourwise I didn’t mind it, not really anything to dislike.  Unfortunately the wateriness and just the image of drinking this US megalager just didn’t go down well with me.  Everyone should try this though.

Poured from bottle into clear plastic cup (on the golf course).

Pale yellow, minimal head, but very, very active. Why do so many Adjunct Lagers look kind of like piss; true Pilsners don’t.

Light grain and light hops; fairly faint smell.

Crisp and clean. Relatively dry malt and light (but fairly nice) hop balance, especially at the end. Not as sweet or corn-like as other Adjunct Lagers.

Fizzy, fizzy, fizzy. Way too overcarbonated. Light to medium body.

Refreshing and easy to slam, but would rather have so many other beers.
usual beer - if you dont know whats good then get this and start from there, taste like nothing but you will get the hang of it

Always a decent buy at teh grocery store that is better than most light beers.

Great American beer, goign to rate it as such.
Playing it safe? Go with Budweiser, it’s like buying somebody a popcorn tin on Christmas.

An American classic given a bad name by city-slicker beer snobs; giving a good name by Nascar loving countrymen.  There is a reason why this beer is known around the world, and a lot has to do with marketing, but the taste is not all that bad.  There is nothing better than a Bud on a sunny July afternoon hosting and BBQing on the grill.  This is indeed the great American standby.
Watery international lager, the only time it was somhow interesting was when i watch the superbowl 1996 and bud were the main sponsor.
(12oz bottle) Very plain pilsner taste, hoppy. the best thing this beer has going for it is its price and it gets you drunk.  I don’t think this beer is horrible but its nothing special.
Bottle, can or tap this is like half a beer. Recipe must say :Take one real beer and split it in half and serve way too cold and hope no one notices. Nothing "off " or bad taste is the only positive.
Typical bland beer.  Pours yellow with a hoppy taste.  Not good at all, only good thing is that it contains alcohol and slightly tastes like beer

Well, I swore once I wouldn’t ever give money for this so heavy’s eagerness to try it was a good thing for me. Italian version, brewed at Heineken Italia’s Massafra plant.
  Poured a yellow-gold body with a medium sized white head that went away at (you guessed it) a medium pace. Ho-hum dusty malty nose. Sweetish sweaty rice, some alcohol? Kinda drinkable, sweet fruity corny notes. Still, unimpressive and dull. No aftertaste - fail. Expected worse.... maybe the Italian version’s better than the norm? O.o

I know I know not a good brew but much better than MGD and in the can it seems to be better than the bottle.  Not really a pale not really a lager I call this a macro manu rex a sourus.  But fun at a party,,, Right?  Well I guess if someone bought me this beer I couldnt complain, atleast not verbally.

09/10 was the day I finally got my hands on a 0.33 l bottle of this on a gas station near Voghera, Italy. Sounds crazy, but you know, as in the States it doesn’t have really a good reputation in Europe as well, so it’s avoided by distributors pretty much, no matter it’s a huge brand. Wanted to try this notorious beer for ages! It’s the Italian version anyway... It poured pale yellow body with medium sized head. Aroma is like it was some Asian beer, rice, some honey and hay malts. Flavor is quite empty, watery, only with some honey malt in the background. Completely boring and one dimensional, but hey, it’s nothing unpleasant, drinkable like a water and completely fine comparing to some things I’ve been poisoning myself :)
Absolutely horrid. Tastes like someone urinated in a bottle and then carbonated it. Not even remotely drinkable.

High school, anchorman, quarters .First vomit, first hangover . The Bud Mud. 
Doesn’t even taste good at a baseball game. 
I do like the commercials though.

a good old american standby. although it may not be a great beer to enjoy purely for flavor. it is a great beer to crack and share with the guys. you wont break the bank, most people wont complain if you crack open and bud and hand them it.

Absolute swill. A golden, almost off white color, instantly dissipating head with no lacing to speak of. Tastes like someone put something in the water supply along with some booze and decided to bottle it.

12 oz bottle.  Aroma of rice and blandness.  Pours no head, no lacing.  Pale gold in appearance.  Tastes highly carbonated, somewhat sweet, extremely bland.  Every time I’ve "sessioned" this beer in my younger days, it’s given me the nastiest headache.  No other beer does this.  Is it the formaldehyde (aka embalming fluid) they put in it as a preservative?  Saying that this is the "king of beers" is like saying Ramen noodles is filet mignon.  It’s like saying Nickelback is The Beatles.  It’s like saying Tacoma, Washington is Paris, France.  And it’s like saying the star basketball player on your local fifth grade team is Michael Jordan.  I could go on with these analogies all night.  It’s not the king of beers, no--what it is is the king of mass-appeal mediocrity.

So... I think too many folks rank this beer by comparing it to a high ABV pale ale or IPA.  It is an American style lager and it is the finest example of the breed.   It is a uniform straw colored with good lacing for such a light beer.  It has a light hop taste and a very mild bitter finish.  This beer is perfect for tailgating, campfires, the beach and most other red blooded American activities.  I’m also amazed at the consistency of this beer.  It always tastes the same.
One of my favorite macros because of the buttery flavor. I don’t know if anyone gets this vibe, but I taste butter when I drink Bud.
Little more taste than other Macros, but not in a good way don’t know the flavor corn or something along those lines, but whatever it is I can honestly say I hate it.
Bottle. Almost no taste, carbonated, watery. Boring beer, something’s missing.
Better than bud light with a little more taste. Light color with a little foamy head. Not much for aroma. Not one of my favorites but not bad to have a couple
Poured from a bottle. Light gold in color. Head disappeared quickly. Adjuncts are readily apparent in the taste. Crisp and very drinkable, but by no means anything special. It is what it is.
Nothing wrong with drinking the king of beers.Its easy to get picky about beers, so I’ll give it the benefit of the doubt.
This is how beer should NOT taste like. or, it does not taste of anything. Boring boring and more boring. And it’s not because i don’t like lagers, because i do.
Very sweet, not the king of beers at all in my opinion but it is slightly more refreshing on hot days than alot of other beers, drinkable overall.

To me Bud is not so terrible and won’t kill you if you drink it. While its not what I prefer to drink if you are at an open bar and that is all there is I will drink it instead of soda, goes down like water but will get you drunk after ten of them and give you bud mud in the morning.
Bottle, ATP:NY:09.  Nose is light sweet malt, nothing else.  Flavor is very light malt & soda water.  No hop character.  100% boring but not really offensive.

Bottle. Light aroma of grain for the malt, cooked corn, paper and bile in the background. Head is average size, fizzy, white with good lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is sparkling clear light amber. Flavor is lightly to moderately acidic to start and finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is light, watery and has a carbonation between lively and fizzy. An old time favorite, but I still tried to be overly judgemental: It’s still a good drinker and still my favorite for making a Red Eye.
Golden, clear. White head. Malty sweet aroma. Mild flavour with malty sweetness. Lively carbonation. High drinkability, onedimensional, dull pale lager &#40but its better than carlsberg...&#41

A little bit of background on this: I’m in France, and can’t remember when I last had a budweiser (it was from a can, in someone’s car, at 2am, in North America, many years ago). After going through all of the good beers at my local French supermarket, and then going through all the bad beers, I was left with one last beer in wide distribution here that I hadn’t reviewed: "Bud", as it’s called, "Budweiser" to Yankee types. A package of six bottles is twice the price of Heineken, and even a couple of Euros more than six cans of Guinness. Marketing genius indeed, and being a sucker for punishment, I bought six just to remind myself of what it tastes like.
Poured into a Chimay chalice (I hope the irony is not lost on you) after being chilled only slightly in the fridge, this is the yellowest beer I’ve ever seen. Head is soap-foam like, looks a bit like a bubble bath. I think I picked up some corn starch in the smell, a little alcohol, but very little of anything else. Taste? I taste syrup, a little graininess on the back end, a slightly dry finish. I will give this one extra points for drinkability, and then take away even more points for being the most expensive, and worst tasting beer in my local French supermarket. Seriously, double the price of Heineken!? The marketers aren’t taking the piss, they’re trying to sell it. Ha! 2/1/3/2/2

Re-rate October 31st 2015: 

Well, it seems right to re-rate the classics and " kings"  of beers every so often, just for kicks and giggles. I found this 740ml can in Inuvik and while it’s -18 outside and there’s little else to do, why not aproach this brew again so many years later as I’m approaching rating number 2000 and see how my palate has changed - would I appreciate the same things or loathe it the same? There’s good ol’ hockey on the telee so I figger this is what Murricans do down there, suck down a 740ml can and watch the Red Wings trash the Senators. So the massive torpedo-style can pours a boring bad yellow with a foamy head that is gone by the time I’m done typing this sentence. The aroma is metal with vague hints of caramel and lemon, like they’re talking a few doors down in this hotel. Flavour is a vague hint of cornbread. There is this weak, cloying finish and mouthfeel that really makes me question the brew - I didn’t notice this before so much, and perhaps this isn’t chilled "enough" for Bud standards, but it really make the drinking experience difficult with those chemicals kicking back up on the aftertaste. Yes indeed - after more than six years my rating is mostly the same, 0.1 less in fact - there are redeeming qualities here in very tiny amounts but it’s still the landmark macro swill that all beer raters describe. We measure all beers against this, and luckily most of them in comparison are pretty darned good. 2/1/3/1/2
As much as I’d like to .5 this, it’s really not that bad.  Refreshing and a little sweet.  But the King of Beers?  No.  Just no.
BLAH, who really rates this crap on a website like this. No taste, no color, nothing good about this, except drinking on a hot summer day when it’s ICE COLD.

If there’s any flavour at all it’s a hint of dried-out straw mashed  in a wooden cask in  old sock-rinsing water- then  sucrose and  alcohol added, carbonated,  and chilled. Imagination aside, the reality is It’s a banal, uninspiring and soulless drink.

330ml bottle. Straw/pale yellow hue, with medium sized white bubbly head mostly lasting. Light aromas of grain, corn, rice, hay. Light flavour of grain, corn. Watery - like a watered down version of beer. The outstanding marketing of this beer is the only thing I admire it for.

I am not a big fan, but will drink a budwieser in preference to most other mass market beers.

Bud does have some malt flavor on the front end &#40even through all that flavorless rice&#41, and has a crisp dry finish.

Budwieser executes exactely what they are trying to do. Cheap, easy drinking beer.

That said I still can’t give it much of a rating, as you can grab a 1000 other beers that just taste better.

Resist rating mass produced america lagers but a nice old stand by, like today more than coors light, nice on a hot day and good session beer, watery, carbonated and lightly malted, no hop presense but for the $, ovearall a there are many worse.
Budweiser is really light, its taste is not that strong.. it is also very sweet. It is not bad in taste but i would prefer a stronger beer
Poured clear pale yellow, simple, thin,  grainy, corny.  Does rice add to the flavor?

The All-American beer &#40ok, all-Belgian as well now, and using a borrowed name originally from Bohemia&#41... this is actually an American icon, a sweet lager, and overall a very tasty macro beer. Can’t really add anything about it  that hasn’t already been mentioned here, I like it, and hangovers for some strange reason are not as bad with this stuff. Cheers!
There is a difference between american and canadian bud. I’m rating american bud here, which will score higher than canadian bud.  That is because it actually has some flavor, though not much.
Not much I can say that everyone else hasn’t said.  Plain, corny, grainy, appley, tastes like wood.
i dont mind cheap beers with little flavor but the little bit of flavor this beer had was offensive. It has a flavorless finish. nuf said

this "beer" is not even a beer.  in fact it is a malt liquor because of the fact that rice is used in the brewing process.  this is garbage, no need to rate, i cant believe i used to drink this stuff like it was cool.
Beer. American Beer. Very American Beer! Really good for beer burgers or beer can chicken

LOL I don’t even know why I’m bothering to rate this, just saw a bottle in the fridge leftover from a party, and decided, why the hell not? Pours yellow, head that disappears, no lace &#40whoever claimed there to be, is only fooling themselves&#41. Nose of nothing to me. Taste of nothing, even trying my hardest I can’t get anything out of this. Atleast it has some alcohol in it.

Not much of an aroma. Had a head but the beer was too yellow. Not much taste to describe. What little taste there was a not a good one. I am angry because so many drink it. This must be because its so heavily advertised or some weird people drink because of, not in spite of, its lack of taste. A disgrace to the name of beer.
Not sure what’s left to say here.  There’s no real flavor whatsoever.  It’s better than Bud Light, but it’s pretty bad.
Bottle, 330ml. A straw colour with a large head. A sweet, corn aroma. Almost no discernible flavour; maybe something vaguely sweet/hoppy lingering, but mostly resembles fizzy water.

[Bottle] In the interest of science, I went back to try this beer so I could rate it since it has been years since I have drank one. It has a very faint slightly sweet aroma, there was actually a decent white head on it when poured into a shaker, it pours a transparent yellow, palate is like drinking water. Flavor is boring and corny.  I remember why I Haven’t had this in years.
Very sweet beer, with no impressive flavor or aroma, but it is drinkable though.. okay beer, medium price, best in bottle, enjoy it freezingly cold

12oz can..born on date 9/18/08..opened 8/18/09...uh oh.  Big frothy head on top of a super pale yellow colored body.  Lots of fizzy soda-like carbonation bubbles.  Saazy adjuncty corn aroma..classic Budweiser.  Thin and corny, a little worse for the age probably.  I’ve always preferred the bottles myself.  Straightforward and inoffensive to the point of lacking any real flavor.  Probably on the same level as a lot of international crap Lagers, but still deserving of any and all negativity.  Thanks for making the world think we drink swill, Budweiser.

Can not believe I haven’t rated this beer yet.  Truly the first beer I have ever tasted... around age 5 thanks to my Aunt Hellen!  Just a sip as kid and I remember thinking beer is disgusting, why would anyone drink the stuff?!  No, Bud is disgusting!
Bland American lager. Will drink only if big glass of ice water is not available.

From bottle into special Budweiser collector’s lager glass Aug. 13, 2009.  Okay, being from the St.L area I simply cannot give this beer a bad rating.  Pours a medium golden with sizeable white head.  Moderate lacing throughout. Crisp taste, it truly does taste unlike other adjunct American pale lagers.  Truly a superior brew to Miller High Life and Coors.  "It is what it is" is the best thing to say.  What I have never been able to figure out is how Bud Light is related at all.  This beer has so much more clean, crisp taste than Bud Light, which is simply a nasty, tasteless flat beer.  Here’s to the King of Beers - SALUDE!
I didn’t like this beer at all. My overall opinion is that instead of purchasing this you can carbonate water by yourself and you would pretty much get the same result.
12 Oz can. Offensive fizzy yellow overrated beer. Made with rice. Tastes pretty much like you’d expect.. Macro Lager. Somehow it’s still better than Miller.
The most overrated beer in America.  Should not sell for more than 12/case!

The worse thing that can happen to you is going to a bar in Madrid and find some snob telling you that they dont sell Mahou because they prefer imported beers... and they give you a Bud! Well, its a refreshing thing, but not better than the local beers here
Bottle from Morrisons, 29th July 09. Pale yellow urine colour with a diminishing whitish head. Thin watery palate, rice aroma and sod all flavour. A beer drunk by those who don’t know better.

The best thing about Bud is that is available EVERYWHERE, usually cheap, and always cold.  Consistently mediocre but I can drink/guzzle a lot of Buds without too much of a hangover.  Strangely, the Bud brewed under license in Canada is even more disgusting (well, to me at least).

KING OF BEERS

Yeah, it’s not too shabby, but it’s not great by any stretch of the imagination.  I have a soft spot in my heart for this guy though.

Words fail me. The King of Beers - more like the King of S**t. Tastes like it was made in a chemical factory, not a brewery. Pale, thin, almost no discernible characteristics other than a nasty metallic sweetrness which I suspect owes its characteristics to flaked maize and rice, not malted barley. Truly ghastly. That this is the World’s best selling beer is a disgrace; drunk by redneck trailer trash and British chavs.
A fresh can in Slovenia. Pours yellow with a creamy head. Stood up very well against local pilsners.

I grew up sneaking Carling Black Label, Schlitz and Miller High Life from my dad’s cooler, so when I tried Bud the first time, I thought it was the best beer I’d ever had.... until it got warm, then it made me gag. Years later, while attending Oktoberfest in Munich for the first time (and seeing the light), I asked some of the locals, which American beers they liked and all of them said "BUDWEISER" in unison. I was flabbergasted.

The appearence is very pale, and the head is white but slightly thin.

The smell is of malt and barley. There is also a slight hop smell in the background.

The taste is crip, with a bit of a corn & rice flavor. A very light hop taste does try to poke it way into your taste buds but is slight at best.

I always look to this beer as the old standard. It is my first ecperience ever with beer and is always a beer that i will go to from time to time. Hopefully it will never change.
40 ounce bottle.  Clear yellow body, with white head. Smells like corn. Dry finish with what seems to be hop extract. Not a good beer by any means, but definitely better than light.

I’ve tasted a lot of microbrews that cost a lot more and taste just like this, but this is cheaper...plus it reminds me of childhood summer days at the lake, sneaking these out of our fathers’ big metal coolers...we figured they would not miss 1 or 2 but we always drank more. They tasted so good because one of the other fathers had a beer called Pearl Light; and we always had to end up drinking those, because I think the adults would drink the Bud first too. Even to beer neophytes like we were, we knew that Pearl Light was bad bad stuff. So don’t denigrate Bud, I tell you!

The american classic. Only in the USA could you can pee and make millions......course look at the success of NASCAR.....just kidding guys.Poured one finger of foam that disappeared in a matter of seconds. Looks and tastes like dirty water. Leaves a sticky unpleasant coating on my tongue
I actually think I prefer Bud light.  If your going to make a weak lager might as well make it low calorie.
Bottle. 5%. Plain, flavourless, clear yellow fizz. Great for NASCAR fans in 40+ weather. Not much use otherwise.

330ml Bottle at Prohibition, Manchester 21/12/2007
Hoppy aroma. Clear golden coloured malty and hoppy with a crisp dry finish.
Not sure where the fame came from.  Very sweet and bland if that is possible.  I would rather drink the light version.

So far this is the only beer that I have refused when offered by friends. But then again friends should not offer friends this beer.

A shame to call this beer and hold it in the same stature as the honorable nectar.

I am shamed even to rate it.

Had on draft and in every container possible &#40come on, I’m from St. Louis&#41.  Flagship pale lager from the biggest brewer in the world.  Light, carbonated, foamy head, and not a whole lot else to speak of.
341ml bottle at a friends house.  Any point in trying to describe it?  It’s a macro lager.  Enough said.

Big, loud, unsophisticated, knuckle-dragger beer. Bland, boring, flavourless fizz. Perfect for those long summer evenings when you’ve just finished nailing your sister and need a cold one. Perfect for drinks with the guys, after gang raping some chick at your frat party. I’d sooner drink piss from an old boot. Go America.

Into the breach once more my friends! Just to rate this old friend, thats all! O how this light golden beverage has ever lasted in the public eye this long is beyond me. Slightly better than water, this light yellow pour foams up like a glass of Aka-Seltzer and tastes just as bad. One of the old time beers when I did not know any better. I leave this to you my younger colleges .

Drinkable is the right word. This is an old standard that has more social impact than flavor presence. The label is the best part of this beer. It does have a beer taste and I do enjoy drinking this beer as long as the people I am drinking it with also enjoy it. Some thing goes for my Moped gang...
Can 500ml.Clear yellow colour with large white head.Aroma of hops and hay.Thin budy and watery.But hay its o.k to a grillparty.Overall weak but still better then water.

You are not my friend.

This Bud isn’t for me.  

You suck, you suck, you suck.

I USE TO DRINK THIS BACK IN THE DAYS BUT ITS BEEN AHWILE, SO TOOK A CAN OF BUD FROM MY FRIENDS TWELEVE PACK AND SET OUT TO REVIEW IT AND WHAT DO I THINK ABOUT THE SO CALLED KING OF BEERS? I THINK ITS THE PERFECT BEER FOR RED NECKS AND HIGH SCHOOL HOUSE PARTIES, (THAT IS ONLY UNLESS YOU DONT HAVE 40OZ’S OF MALT LIQUOR OF COURSE). IT LOOKS LIKE PISS WATER AND TASTES LIKE THE CAN IT COMES IN WITH A HINT OF SOAP LIKE CARBONATION. I LIKE TO COMPARE IT TO POP MUSIC, IT SUCKS BUT PEOPLE LOVE IT, WHATS WRONG WITH THIS WORLD?

Taste and smell of corn, though flavor is practically nonexistant.  Thank goodness even in bad supermarkets you can find some alternative.  Would only drink with no alternative available and in a forgiving frame of mind.
I used to like this beer. That is until I started to taste good beers. Watery and nothing to it. Not a choice drink.
At least this one is no longer american owned.  I only drink this to be polite.
awesome beer. definitly the king, no questions asked. this is one of my favorites.

Canned.  Poured bright golden with a surprisingly short-lived cap of synthetic white head.  The aroma picked up corn syrup and light pale malts with a hint of honey.. some grassy and faint floral hops present if you dig deep.. smelled clean and carefully controlled.  The flavor was along those same lines.. pale malts and honey at the core with grainy, mild grassy bitterness surrounding.. short finish with a little bit of tacky malt and dry bitterness.  Light-bodied and crisp on the palate with forced carbonation that worked in here.. balance was alright for what it was.. I don’t want another, but it wasn’t that bad.
Brutal beer.  No flavour, no aroma.  Thank god I didn’t pay for this.  I wouldn’t wish this watered down poor excuse for a beer.

I was at the bar the other night and a friend bought be one. Haven’t had a Bud in years, and now I remember why. This is ondeed one of the worst beers EVER! Would rather drink Old Milwaukee than this. By the way, I had two sips and left the rest sitting on the bar...

The Britney Spears of beers.  completely overrated and slammed down out throats with an unlimited advertising budget.   Any person who appreciates a half decent beer would pour this down the drain.  Sorry Bud, King of Beers?  Not even close.  I drank one again just to rate it.   Doubt I’ll ever waste my time and money doing that again.  Don’t believe the hype and marketing.  This beer is terrible.
Big fan of Budweiser’s consistently great taste and quality.  My go-to beer at any time.

After drinking a skunky Molson Golden ale this was great. Pours a light straw color with a good white head. nice carbonation. weak hoppy flavor light aroma, but all and all refrehing when its hot out and you get done mowing the lawn. This one has lots more flavor than their light style.
Bottles and cans...just clap your hands. Pours a pale yellow fizzyness with a fizzy white head. Nose is corn and grass. Palate is thin and fizzy, kinda burns the throat. Flavor is corn and grass.

After repeated samples, I’ve discovered that Budweiser’s appeal has a tendency to grow on a person.  The company’s fanatical quality control dedication guarantees that absolutely every Budweiser a person drinks will always be the same as the last one.  So, if one is a Bud fan, it’s a cinch that he’ll always be satisfied.  Budweiser is good to drink with boiled crabs or a big plate of spaghetti and meatballs.

RJT
can, thin yellow color with decent foam, aroma is malty enough, flavor has a dry sweetness, watery

Sometimes it seems that when people review American macrobrewed lagers, they do so in a manner that makes as much sense as comparing milk to Koolaid. The standards were never intended to be the same. It is what it is. No overpowering flavors, thin, refreshing, notes of grain-most notably corn and what tastes like rice, and not much finish to speak of. The aroma is inoffensive and is very accurate to the beer’s taste. Bud’s flavor isn’t effected as adversely as most domestics by cans, and in fact seems much better from cans or draft than bottled.

355ml bottle. Pale and pasty looking straw colour. Clear and well carbonated with a decent head of foram that settles. Corn and starch aroma and bland flavour. Thin bodied and watery with no real aftertaste.
not good at all... it just another shitty american beer.... king of beers.. hardly
A consistent performer.  Every now and then it is nice because I can grab a cold Budweiser anywhere.

"Budweiser beer number two in swell fest 2006, once again we have asked are waitress for the worst beer on the menu and this is what we got. The beer did have a big white pillowy head but it vanished quick that is one of the only good things I can say about this beer, the body is a very light golden yellow almost completely devoid of color. No aroma can be detected by me so it doesn’t smell bad just doesn’t smell. The taste is mostly grainy very watered down, it taste more like a light beer then a normal lager, it has the typical cheap beer bread after taste witch I hate. I guess this beer aint terrible it’s just not good there are way more flavorful and better choices out there for the same dirt cheap price."
Yellow in color with an average white head. Aroma is of grain and corn. Taste is grain, corn, and a very faint hop taste. Not aweful, but not good.

Horrible. The King of Piss. This is DISGUSTING. I hate this beer and the image they try to push. But there’s a million trailer parks out there.... Average head, no lacing. Yuck. Watery graininess and slightly bitter. Burning hot eye watering nose belch. Crap. Reminded me of a Laurentian Pencil crayon colour "Maize" for some reason. Note that this review is for the garbage they try to re-create in Canada. The American stuff is better...barely.
BOLLOCKS. Just drink water, that’s all this crap is anyway. You’ll probably get more drunk on tap water too. Avoid.
Honestly compared to some other light lagers of macro quality this one may be slightly better, more drinkable.  They use a little more than half of their asses with this one.

For some reason, I’ve been craving a Budweiser ever since seeing the new Star Trek movie. How illogical. Straw yellow beer  with a puffy white head. Aroma of grain. Flavor is weak but not bad – mild grains with very faint hops in the finish.
Bad.  Way too filling for a lager.  Tastes like crap.  My own piss tastes better.
Ha I guess this is a step up from Bud Light, but not really. Just the average watered down American macro lager.......
chiara schiouma non abbondante naso di cereali dolciastro in bocca watery zuccheri il luppolo quasi inesistente

Pours a clear yellow with a thin white head that dies out instantly. It has no real aroma - just a very minute hint of malt. The taste is of bland malt with plenty of fusel notes (but no ethanol taste). The texture is watery with lots of fusel oil. Bland, mediocre, slightly rotgut but not the absolute worst
Pale yellow, with a white head. Aroma is light malt, no hop. Taste is like the aroma. Very watery.

Can at home.
Clear yellow coloured with a small white head.
Sweet aroma of corn with notes of hay and hops.
Sweet flavour of corn with notes of hops and alcohol.
Hoppy finish.
Watery.
While not the best beer Ive ever had, its still a beer nonetheless. Damn decent after working in the hot sun. Smells like corn, looks like pee, and tastes mainly of barley and corn. Meh.

While being the flagship of my favorite domestic brewery, Budweiser is hardly the "king of beers." While not being bad by a long shot, it is typical of a macro-brewery brew. Aroma is straw and malt whit pale yellow color with thin to medium head. If you want a "medium" of every beer ever made, this is it. Medium aroma, medium body, medium taste. This average is probably why it is the best selling beer. Overall, a fairly good domestic brew with a fairly cheap price tag.
(can). Pours a yellow color. Small white head.  Minimal lacing. Light grain and light alcohol aromas. Watery/grain taste. Watery finish. Fizzy carbonation.

Pours golden with a small, fizzy white head. Aroma is of corn, straw, cheap and beer malt. Has one of the worst aroma that come out of pale lagers. Taste is of corn, straw, and cheap beer malt. Body is watery  and the mouthfeel is like water. Not much taste overall, so it’s hard to call it offensive. Hey if it’s cheap, go nuts.
Agree with mar. Very easygoing beer that tastes like water. Man if you want water just  get one with 50 cents instead of givin’ more for this shit!
oh man i didn’t realize i was missing out on such a good flavored water beverage.  looked like water with a yellow tint and a small fizzy head.  nose and flavor of corn and metal.

Clear straw gold pour with a light fizzy head. lots of corn and grain aroma and a touch of medicinal. Same witht the flavor. But, it sits so well on the palate, I dont mean its extraordinary. but satisfying. nice clean finish. very good for what it is.

Pours very light golden color with nice clarity. Head is nice at first but dissipates quickly. Appearance is perhaps the best feature of this beer.

Nose is very, very subdued with a clean grain/malty/toasty component.

On the palate the lightness in flavor is the most noticeable feature, with a constant struggle to enjoy the malt even though it is very cereal & grain like in flavor. The beer appears overly carbonated, but perhaps that is because the palate focuses on this due to there being nothing else worthy of attention.

Watery, light finish. Not offensive, but not inspiring in the least. Would prefer water without the calories.
Though i like quite a few AB Products, this is one that i am not too fond of. Maybe its that ’beechwood’ aging they keep talking about, i dont know. It just has never gone down good for me.
I don’t mid it. Basic lager with a distinct bland taste. Good for beer pong and flip cup. WHAZZUP? Watchin’ the game, havin’ a bud... True true.
can’t even drink this one anymore.macro beer that gives you a nice hangover,yellow appearence min head,watered down flavor...below average old american lager at best...
got free at baseball game not much to choose from this beer had almost no taste
Clear straw pour, low head and no lace.  Corny beery aroma. Corny tasty, easy to drink, this is pretty much the definition of average. Consume by the bongload, preferably while watching sports.

The aroma is very weak. But since it’s not bad, I can’t give it 1/10. The flavour is next to non-existing. It’s a beer which can be enjoyed a very hot summer day. Other than that, the beer is just boring.
Watered down, over filtered garbage.  I actually prefer the Bud Light, only because it goes down easier.  There is more body and aroma to Budweiser, but I do not even want to get into it.
12 oz bottle. what can you say about this one other than it is fresh from newark.... closest brewery and the beer is always consistent.... the macguyver of beers

This was the best they had at TGIF’s last night.  I guess the best thing I can say is that it is fresh?  Carbonated and uh fresh.  I think I tasted a malt in there somewhere or was it barley.  I think after drinking 20 pints someone out of a group of 100 might find a hop flavor lurking.  I dunno trying to rate this beer is like trying to do a handstand with no hands, not easy.  It is better than other swill I guess but eh it’s sad this beer sells so heavily.
Tastes like skunk, smells like skunk.  Skunk all around.  At least it has a better appearance than most American macro brews.
It’s a good beer that is very drinkable... Not much of a color to it though. Overall this beer is pretty good because of the drinkability

Overall Impression: 
The original "King of the Crappy Macro Beers" 

Sadly it’s one of the tastier offering you can find more places then that should be true...
It’s better than the macro lights. A watery pale yellow beer that you can drink like water.
Simply horrendous. No flavour, and unbelievably light. You might as well buy a keystone light if you’re willing to spend money on rubbish.
The smell of the beer is OK.  It is so pale that I can’t believe that there is a lighter version of this beer.  Is there any product that is worse at what it aims to be but sells so much?
Great session. Some corn flavor with lots of water to back it up. Easy and Slugable.

it really shouldn’t even be here. i usually get offered one once a year in the summer....it almost is refreshing...but to spend time really pulling teeth, finding something worth mentioning? true, it doesn’t taste BAD...it just doesn’t TASTE...it’s a soda for people who would rather not think they are drining a beer and just want a buzz. a few other macros out there still blow this away. yawn.

Bottle. Clear straw yellow body with a short white head. Thin aroma of corn, bit malt and slight hops. Very thin body. Almost no flavour of malt but a little metallic and I might sense some hops far away. So boring I almost fell asleep....
I’ll rate this because I’ve had one. Its thin, its basically taste-less. Its a Bud.
Old rating: This beer got a quite non-existant aroma and flavour. Only reason I give it 1 of 5 instead of an even lower score is that it’s drinkable and doesn’t taste bad.
I’ve always liked Bud.  It may not be the best tasing beer in the world, but it’s pretty good for a beer that is readily available.  It’s slightly more full-bodied than it’s lighter counterpart.
Pours a yellow bubbly color with a fizzy white head.  Taste is basically non-existent.  Generic "beer" taste is how i would best explain it.
Any beer with RICE being the 2nd largest ingredient is not a beer.  The beechwood aging is popsicle sticks.  Need I say more?

A nasty tasting American macro brewed rice beer. Aftertaste like a mouthfull of grass. I’ll never understand Bud’s appeal. They have a genious marketing campaign. Only slightly better than a light beer.

Bottle. Not really the king of beers. Maybe king of the macro’s but not a very good beer. Light yellow pour no head. Aroma is weak corn and grass. Flavor is smooth and crisp. Nothing really in the beer. Thin body.
Apperance; light yello, clear, no head. No Aroma, no flavor, nothing. Vater. I can’t belive I used 20 kroner to support this brewery.
Very filling.  Seriously, it is way heavier than any of the other domestics, and is very "bready".
Stick with bud light. Tastes just as bad but youll feel better that you saved on 20 calories per bottle.

[Look]: Very pale straw color with very small to no head. 
[Smell]:  Sweet rice aroma, hint of faint alcohol. 
[Taste]: Some sweet grainy, bland.  Very thin bodied.  Sweet finish.
[Overall]: Only thing I can say "King of bland beer".
Nothing special, pours a light yellow has a little more flavor than bud light but nothing great.

Bottle. Light gold with very little head. Thin body that makes seltzer water seem creamy by comparison. Flavor is that of stale cornbread with an unpleasantly sour aftertaste. I can only understand that this beer sells well because of those who need to get wasted on a budget but don’t prefer an extremely light beer. Label looks like it should be a pack of cigarettes.

Obetydlig, ointressant, oengagerad. Att ölen är tillverkad för en massmarknad går inte att ta miste på. Kärleken till hantverket/traditionen har begravts under marknadsundersökningar och kortsiktiga vinstkrav.
Pours yellowish. Generic bland lager. Doesn’t taste offensively bad, just not good either. Corn taste.

Unbalanced. Malt taste will not go unnoticed, but neither will the poor hops flavour. Not all hops are made equal. The fizziness turns me off too. Light body with tiny character. Yet somehow, it still scratches the palate. Not very impressive. Aroma is thin and lookswise, it’s only o.k.

330 ml bottle. Golden color, white head. Some wool and leather in the aroma. Malty flavor with some alcohol. Medium body, medium carbonation. Not the worst pale lager I’ve ever had, but nothing I look forward to tasting again either.
Obvisouly not complex and not too much to say about it.  Refreshing and highly drinkable beverage.

Thin. Not much flavor, color or head. Unpleasant aroma.  Bland.
Why brew with rice and corn?
Because it’s cheap.

Funny that I never rated this, but I suppose that stems largely from the fact that I never drink this. The exception was today, a couple cold cans in the middle of a frisbee tournament. What can you say? Generic yellow, thin as hell, ruinous taste. Tick.

The problem with this beer is finding something nice to say about it. I just don’t understand why people drink this. Its appearance is pale golden, clear, and highly carbonated with little to no head. Its smells like corn, but there’s no mention of it being brewed with corn, and taste like gas. It goes down very bittery. I can’t find one redeeming quality, and have actually turned down this beer when offered. There amusement parks are great though.
This used to be my go to beer, but now i am finding ones with so much more flavo that this is falling off the radar...quickly.
great for barbeques or getting drunk with friends. other than that, it tastes like shit and is gutter stomach rot.
Pale, nothing. I love corn, but not in my beer. The only reason that this beer is so readily available around and world and loved as well, proves most people don’t have a fing clue about beer.

No 684

Rated: 05.02.2009

Bottle brown, 330 ml, 11 P

Appearance: Pours pale, shiny yellow body, perfectly clear and transparent, body carbonation is weak, head is white, regular, foamy, quickly decreasing from small to minimum, nothing impressive.

Aroma: Gentle note of chalk, some poor quality, skunky hops giving impression unfreshness, sweetish, rice mixed with malt hiding at the background, nothing special or extraordinary but I was still expecting something worse, slightly mineral.

Flavour: Very malted rice beer, salt, carbonation, high saltyness is something positive for me when it comes to Pale Lagers however its far too wattery fake of beer or ’kind of rice beer’. Finish duration is short and smooth like water, really weak hidden alcohol as for such a wattery beer and 5% abv.

Palate: Body is light, texture is wattery, carbonation on palate is soft, finish feel is neutral, mineral, notes of rice, flat.

Recently moved into a new house and found a vintage 04 edition Budweiser in the fridge staring me in the face!  A little bit weary to try it but everyone insisted.  Took a huge gulp along with everyone else and to all our amazement this beer was actually better with age!  So to everyone out there try giving your buds 5 years in the fridge before having them to really enjoy them!

This is not the first time nor the last time I will drink Bud but it was definitely the best which is why I had to give it a rating.

This one poured a clear pale yellow with a thin fizzy white head that quickly settled to a wispy ring around the beer’ surface. No clinging or leaving any lace as the beer was sipped. The aroma is faint, being of corn, cereal, hay, and a very subtle innuendo of horse blanket. Could it be I’m getting a faint, distant whiff of the Clydesdales that pull the Budweiser? It turns out the same for this beer as for its ghost, Bud Light, which carries a very subtle innuendo of the same animals’ flatus. The taste is a chilled fizzy version of water in which corn on the cob was boiled followed by a watery aftertaste of corn husk ending with a very, very faint note of horse blanket. The King of Beers, huh? This is a genuine Beer of Fools. I’m all the sadder-Budweiser for having spent my money so foolishly on a sample of this swill and leaving such a lackluster report :’(
Instant headache in a can. Aroma of corn. Tastes like corn. I hate corn and I hate Budweiser.

Given a choice between this and water, I choose water. In my opinion this is one of the worst beers out there. Almost scored it one notch higher than Bud Lite but given that the light version tastes even more like water that is almost preferable. Why do people drink this stuff?

Umm, well, ummm, King of Beers hey? It had no colour. This in itself isn’t really a problem but it also had virtually no taste. It was fizzy, and, umm, it poured without too much fuss but other than that I’m struggling to find a justification fo the whole "King of Beers" thing.
Nothing going on inside the can or bottle. It’s cheap and it shows. Alright if your at a ball game and have no other choice, even then, it certainly isn’t worth the price you pay.

Good cheap beer.  Pours a light yellow with a good head.  Taste of malt and rice.  No hops, but it gets me drunk after about 8.  Its a good idea to pack lots of these with you and give some out to friends.  Funneling recommended.
Its a cheap beer...what else is there to say. Little aroma...little flavor, except for the typical rice/malt/tiny amount of hops flavor. Drink very cold, and only when desperate.

Found this old rating, great stuff: 12oz. can, born on 11/11/08, consumed on Korean Air flight from Vladivostok to Seoul.  Pours a clear almost fluorescent light yellow, moderate bright white head and lacing.  Aroma is rice, light malt, and something not quite pleasant, but not sure what. Flavor is more rice, light malt, and that’s about it.  Not profoundly offensive, but I’d rather drink water.  Give me a Baltika any day!

Occasionally satisfying, it is light for a beer but sometimes just whats needed. Pale golden body with little to no white head. Flavor is corn, slightly fruity - maybe banana, and clove. Unfortunately the palate is all but destroyed by the ever noxious over-carbonation than never lets one truly enjoy the flavor.

Bud heavy delivers in any weather.  I prefer a keg in ice under the sunlight.  Released into a party cup the golden head glistens in the sun.  Smooth water ale goes down without a thought of malt nor yeast.

This is basically like Bud Light, just slightly more flavour, aroma, and more alcohol. Still thin and watery. I drink this when cheap and not unpleasant are more important than something truly good. Certainly not the worst beer to have in social settings where you’re paying more attention to the people than the beer.

To be completely Honest I didnt think it was that bad.
Not a whole lot of flavors to pick up on, but definately better than some of the other mass produced beers out there. Not something I’d spend a whole lot of money on but not exactly terrible in my opinion.

Ricier than a tricked-out Honda Civic and chock-full of adjunk. This is the king of beers like Burger King is the king of burgers or Don King is the king of dons (i.e. it’s not).  Yellow appearance, fizzy white head, ricey on the nose and flavor.  Thin palate.  That’s all.

UPDATE 4/20!!!  Revisited my old "Bud" at a bar because nothing else was available besides stale old SNPA.  Yep, still awful.  Sweeter than I remembered it, but rice syrup is its defining ingredient.  Just saw "Beer Wars"...down with Anheuser-Busch!

Bottle:  I can’t say anything that hasn’t been said before.  A staple to many beer drinkers out there, most of whom do not know much about beer.  They do make some pretty fun commercials.  Overall, this beer is good when nothing else is around.  Six to Eight of these gives me a terrible headache.  Not a "go to" for me.
Carbonated Urine in a bottle...Im not really sure why this beer ever became popular
Occasionally good for quenching a deep thirst (gatorade probably would be a better choice).
It looks, smells and even tastes like a black-and-white silent film, I.E. BORING, but I grew up on this, and sometimes I just want a crisp and watery beer to quench my thirst, plain and simple.

473 ml can. 4.4% for Finnish markets. Finland.

Clear yellow colour with almost no head.
Weak corny malty aroma. Corny flavour. Boring. No taste. Too easy to drink.

Good beer. Easy to drink.
It is what it is. KING of BEERS.
I drink a lot of different craft beers. 
But bud is like an old friend.
Significantly more flavorful and better than bud light. Don’t believe anyone though if they tell you that this is the king of beers. When will they bring back Bud Dry... who knows.....

Split with Barrios at woody’s.  Pours a slightly darker yellow than budlight.  Nose is ricey with a very faint hop.  Metallic corn flavor.  This is one of my benchmark beers for rating purposes.  (ie: Is this worse than a bud?)
12oz bottle.  Pours a fading white head and golden clear body.  Smells of malt and fruity hops.  Tastes of malt with a faint hint of hops.
TAP, BOTTLE, CAN: slightly more body and flavor than most standard light beers, but still not good, grainy
Rating #700... ha!  Awesome.  Bud tastes like... Bud.  Slightly sour, super grainy, slightly sweet.  Very watery.  Some cardboard.  I don’t even know what to say... a Bud is a Bud is a Bud.

Rather sweet aroma. Mild malt and hops. Some citrus like a belgian tripel.
Pale gold hue with zero head.
Sweet malt flavours, rather watery but has that peculiar taste sort of like vegetables - Maybe that’s the rice? Very sweet yet watery. A tad of malt in the finish. Easy to drink. Rather shit.

Bottle at Cafe de Zeepost in Amsterdam. This is a fairly bad beer. I have drank it quite a few times in college and now paid up for ratebeer purposes and was laughed at by my friends. There is little taste, but definitely soap.

#1700  16 oz. Tall Boy from the Circle K in lovely downtown Benson, AZ -  Thats right boys and girls.  Its time to rate one of the worst beers brewed in the good ole USA.  I still cant believe millions of people think this is the greatest beer around.  Just goes to prove if you have a good marketing campaign, you can sell anything to the mindless and tasteless masses.  This beer is my least favorite A-B product.  I wont bore anyone with my description of this beer.  Its not pretty. The only reason Im rating this beer is to keep in step with rating BMC beers for milestones.  If I stepped on any toes, too bad.  You need to get a life and drink real beer.

24oz can as part of my Crappy Christmas solo tasting. I know it is the season of giving, but I would give crap like this to others... I am glad that the label tells be they use only the choicest rice...Straight pour. Pale yellow. Fizzy head that goes. Rice, slight burn because there is nothing covering the alcohol. A bit of selzter. Taste is all corn and rice water with a bit of cardboard, diacetyl, and DMS. A touch of cardboard. No skunk though. Fizzy.
2008 Bottle - aroma is skunk lager and malt...flavour is corn malt, sweet...people drink this because they are bored...I drank because I hadnt had one since college...meh
Pale golden yellow straw color with a finger of soapy head.  Bland and corn aroma is followed by a fairly potent metallic corn and adjunct mess.  This is one I wish had less taste.
Bottle. I cannot belive that people actually drink this. Just shows what good marketing does.
Out of can......little aroma......decent taste.....def not my fav....but will drink it if there is nothing else around. The brewery tour in St. Louis is pretty cool though....must visit
Corny, grainy aroma from adjuncts, fusel alcohol, just a poorly mass produced megaswill. Once again a perfect 5 for marketing though.
Bottle...  Poured looking like carbonated pineapple juice with a thin head that diminished immediately.  No aroma.  The flavors were like crackers and seltzer.  It is what it is I guess.
Absolute shit. I would rather drink mountain creek than this. Drink pabst instead.

Why me touring the US bases for beer. It’s amazing to me just how bland and tasteless the big american breweries’ beers are. I suppose that is what they are going for though, an appeal to the mindless masses of generic beer drinkers. I have friends who will only drink coors light, or bud, or miller lite. I just have to laugh at them, and pity them fo their self-imposed prisons of poor taste. The best thing going for AB is the clydsdales....and the environmental good deeds/public awareness that places like sea world take on. The king of beers? I think not. More like the unimpressive and unimposing boy-next-door of beers.
Bottle.  Extremely pale golden.  Faint aroma.  Watery flavor, with a hint of sweetness, and a tiny hint of malt in the finish.
Pouco encorpada e pouco saborosa. Suave e quase sem resíduo no paladar. Mas tradicional...

Pours a clear golden, from the bottle the tap or the cobra keg tap.  Aroma or sweet grain and malt.  Flavor is light sweet and slightly metallic.  I am hard pressed to believe that this is what the real Adophus Busch brewed.
Ass in a glass... for those really hard up for some cheap alcohol, knock yourself out.
Bottle and tap at different times.  Poured a clear yellow with a two finger white head.  Aroma of corn.  Flavor is thin and malty.  This is decent, but nothing amazing.
Plastic bottle at a hockey game...it was 2 bucks  a piece.  Pretty gross.  Not much to say...didn’t do it for me

This was my first experience with beer, and needless to say I’ve branched out quite extensively since first drinking the "King of Beers." While a lot of people will bash it for it’s watered down "basic" taste, I still appreciate it for what it is. I would recommend it to anyone, regardless of their tastes. I would never call this beer "amazing", but I think "horrible" is a bit extreme.
Sad to say that this represents american beer throughout the world.  Clear yellow pour, high carbonation with flavor added.  Can’t really call this beer.

Yuuuuuuuuuuuuk How can people drink this. A few years back I swore off beers like this but last night I gave bud a second chance. Now I can remember why I don’t drink this junk anymore. It’s lacking in flavor and character and it gives me a headache whether I’ve had a bottle or a case.

Part of a six can blind pale lager tasting with Blatz, Miller High Life, Pabst, Hamms and Budweiser. The "runner-down" aka second last in the drain pour contest.  Straw yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma of corn, sweet malt and apple.  Taste of corn, malt and fritos.  Astringent and awful but still better than Miller.

Pours neon light yellow with high carbonation, no head, no lacing. Aroma of yellow corn and grass and maybe some lemon. Light, watery mouthfeel. Long cardboard aftertaste. Metallic overtones bring out an instant headache.

Very little taste, very little aroma, very little to enjoy.  Only drink when there is NOTHING else available (which seldom happens).  They should take all the ad money they spend and develop a really good beer.

An American Icon attractive color but awful taste and what it does the next day is pure Mudweiser ... behind all the commercials, Clydesdale horses and promotions the self proclaimed King of Beers is a forgettable bust of a beer
Bottle.  Pours gold with a crispy head.  Smells sweet and grainy.  Tastes sweet and corn malt grains.  Hints of hops.  Has a little bitter to it.  Refreshing and drinkable.
A dubious beer at best.  It is better than Old Milwaukee, though.  Not by much.

Bottle. Nose is basically a bit of rice or corn, no malt or hops to discern. Taste is very light. Again, no real malt or hop character, just kind of that ubiquitous ""beer"" quality that defines Bud and other fizzy yellow lagers. It is, at least, not overcarbonated.

For all the hate this beer gets, it isn’t really that it’s bad. It’s more that it isn’t good... really, it isn’t anything much at all.
To quote the immortal Gordon Ramsey, this one ""tastes like the doggie’s dinner"". There is not any way I would ever recommend this thing to anyone, even my worst enemy.
For the price it is a good beer.  Also Bud is an American classic...i hope inbev doesn’t mess it up...the can is the best..it sucks that most young people drint bud light they are missing out

This is a beer that probably everybody has drank. You really cant go anywhere in the world without seeing it being advertised.

Not alot of flavor, but it does has some flavor. No real discernable hops or malt, mainly taste and smell the grains/rice.

I will drink it if I was in a pinch or at a party.

On tap at the Oar House London Ontario
I have never understood the appeal of this beer to so many people tastes and looks like water

12 OZ bottle, pours a very weak head. Carbonation is lacking. The color is a light yellow. Taste and smell overpowered by the addition of rice to the brew. Easy to drink, I would never buy it, but I would drink it if someone offered it to me.

This beer is America ! This used to be 2nd to Old Style , but since their move from LaCrosse Bud is king for now..... The taste is classic mellow American beer... American beer drinkers are all on this light beer kick? I don’t get it? They either don’t wanna get drunk or fat... But the light beer drinkers remain fat and drink 2-3 times as much light beer?.
Can. Weak malt aroma and perhaps a hint of citrus. Clear light yellow colour with small white head. Practically no taste - watery. Rich carbonation.

Delicous beer fabulous notes of nothing
tastes almost like fiji water with a hint of urine i really enjoyed this one

The Bud can I poured into a pint glass required a slow pour up the middle to release the excess gas.  Once it dissipated it had almost no lacing or head retention, and was quite pale.  Fermented rice dominates the aroma, but the malt and hop notes eventually came through.  No off-flavors in my sample, but not much malt or hop flavor either.  Those components balanced quite well.  Some high-alcohol yeast artifacts emerged in the palate, suggesting that A-B dilutes a much stronger beer.  Very little aftertaste other than a residual sweetness.  I have to admire A-B’s considerable brewing skills, but of course the recipe hits the lowest common denominator.
Worst example  of an American beer, taste like rotten hay and lawn clippings, smells even worse. Watery, fizzy mouth feel

hue is of yellow piss - tastes like hay, grass, and rotten citrus fruits.
Yuck!
nasty it suck why in the hell do people like this i rather drink  a old flat stale coors than this crap
This is an average American beer for lawn mowing but not for a relaxing evening on the deck.  I don’t think it is bad for a Pale lager if you like that kind of beer.

Can poured into a mug. Transparent straw yellow with a piss-froth fizzy head. No lacing, poor retention. Corn syrup aroma with a touch of alcohol. Flavor is weak pale malt base with a fermented rice sweetness. Completely inoffensive and completely boring. Goes down like water. Thin and overcarbonated.
"Bud Heavy" is great for a good game of beer-pong, but I wouldn’t want to sit down and drink it with dinner.
The ultimate American throw-back-a-few-during-slowpitch beer. Everyone knows what this one’s all about.
33cl bottle, very light, nothing more than a analcoholic drink like fruit juice. But fruit juice have aroma of a fruit. Water is a valid alternative.
Typical of any pale lager. Although, it is pretty drinkable. Pale yellowish color. White head for about two seconds.
Pale yellow, would be better off if it had no taste rather than its light cardboard flavor. On the bottom of my tolerability scale.

Pours very light yellow out of bottle. Head runs and hides faster than a model from a hamburger. Not much for an aroma, slightly sweet and almost banana-ish. Taste is just as faint as the nose. Watery. Not much going on, also slightly sweet and a touch of rice. Nice crisp finish. Not Bad, but not good by any stretch.

Oh, well... Can, bought @ Netto, Kolding.

Pours very pale golden with a small, fizzy, frothy, white head. Low duration. Aroma is sweet, some maize and brewing cereal. Very watery palate, lowish carbonation. Flavour is practically non-existent, some sweetness. No hops. Well, it’s not excactly ’bad’, it is just so poor, that nothing there anymore.
I had this as part of a pie and beer promotion at the Super League Grand Final at Old Trafford last night, it’s not as bad as I remember it and it has quite a crisp taste

This is Bart’s Beer bart@gsridgway.com .  Aroma is not fantastic.. the appearance is because I am here to get drunk.  Pour is slighlty darker than urine.  You drink Budweiser to get drunk there is not a lot of taste to budweiser - not an enjoyable taste to this beer but it is tollerable.  It is not about enjoyable taste, there is only one goal and that is the buzz or to get drunk.  Here is the deal and here is the overall view.. there is nothing wrong with the beer. it is not a bad beer it is just a Beer.  Personaly Bart would rather drink a good beer but he cant afford it.  Good times -THis is a poor man’s good time.

They don’t call it the king for nothing.  Like it or not Bud is a staple for so many events that other more interesting beers can not compete.  You can’t play pong with lambics. Getting hotties wasted doesn’t work with porters, he’s the king for a reason, everyone else is merely a subject in the kingdom
This is a good cheap beer that has a refreshing taste to it but not a strong one. Tastes like it is watered down and is only sorta good when it is really cold.

24 oz can at the beach today.  You know the golden appearance and watery pale lagerish aroma and watery fizzy palate, but I found this to be much better than I remembered.  It is still crap, but as I sort of forgot about it and it warmed up I was picking up some hops in there and a bit of a tangyness that was pretty refreshing in the hot sun.

Clear yellow, small white head. Tastes of fruit (bananas). The "Great American Lager"  that isn’t great or even American anymore. Maybe American style lager. I would hate for the rest of the world to think that our best lager is this beer.

The King of Beers is just that: an easy to drink typical lager. Nothing special just easy to drink. Pours yellow, small head, goes down smooth with a balance of sweet and bitter. Nothing special but not really anything bad.
Real-man beer. Taste ties to memories, so if you lead a boring life, you’re rating this one low. Americana in a can. Sack up.
Bottle born on 14AUG08. Pale yellow color with a weak head. Aroma of grass, skunk and corn. Taste is fruity, almost green apple like, and very corny. A little bready. Thin.

cereal, orange, clear, aminimal head, terible colourlightly bitter, light body, lively, astringent, dry
rerate. 10/7/11
can from UK , no beer colour, something between white and yellow...little smell from malt and cereal, no taste, absolutelly empty beer, no bitterness, light sweetness, astringed finish. dont know who can drink this s**t....terrible

Ok.. I’m going to give this an HONEST impression!  Here goes...

Slight nose of hops and corn.  Highly carbonated. Thin white head which dissolves quickly.  Bubbly mouthfeel of sparkling water.  Taste of grass & water and not much else.  Goes down easy.  Almost no aftertaste.  I can drink one of these so fast I’ll forget I drank it.  This is a good kegstand beer! (boy, those were the days...)

Appearance: Crystal clear, pale yellow body with a thin, fizzy, white head.

Smell: Light pale malt nose with notes of corn -- even with an entire pitcher there’s really not much there at all.

Taste: Weak palt malts with a taste of sweet corn and two-day old saltines. No real hop character or bitterness. Finishes crisp and watery.

Mouthfeel: Thin-bodied. Medium-high carbonation.

Drinkability: Pretty tasteless and empty -- just another typical macro.

Pours a golden color with a small white head. Aroma of corn, malt and not much else. Flavor is crisp, carbonated, corn, and very watery. Easy to drink but I really desire more in a brew than this offers.

Tawny straw-colored body that produces an abnormal amount of barnacle-like bubbles at the glass...tremendously effervescent... head is unsubstantially inflated early and rescinds to an uneven horizon... smells of corn syrup, sweet malts and through memory, stale frat keg metal... thin, pale and watery, with a bubbly final flourish... aftertaste is a short, lingering fizz... I’m still trying to taste the beechwood--until then, corn and water occupy the majority of the tastebuds... at the risk of sounding crude, this beer has always given me bad gas--and much worse after consuming a 12-pack at the beach, as friends at Wildwood 2000 will attest--Bud may be what is right and wrong with America: quick, easy, light, slightly artificial, consistent, gassy, and the popular choice for everyone from the establishment to the common folk, fathers and uncles (mine included)...

Color is very pale yellow with small white head. Aroma is corny  malty with some fruitness but all in all very mild. Flavor is mildly corny malty with some fruits. Palate is light-bodied and quite much, tingly carbonated.

This is not nearly as bad as the majority of major american beers. Aside from the headache that occurs nearly every time(once a year or so) i can genuinely understand how this beer could have come to be the king of beers(when made originally with quality ingredients).

From a can.  Actually, not as bad as I expected it to be.  What flavor there is was a little grassy, a little skunky, with a little sweet malt.  Mouthfeel is a little like a ball of cotton, and not in a good way.
The only positive thing I can say about this is that there is alchohol in it.  I suppose it is better than Coors, AB’s original and best beer, still rating this under a 1.

06.09.2008, 0,5l Can. The colour is yellow. Aroma and texture is thin, but there is a fresh fruitines I like with this beer. I like this one better than water!
31.10.2008 The Wharf Inn San Francisco, CA.

Like making love in a canoe!  (-king close to water).

mass appeal mouth wash.
Typical mass-produced American beer: low on quality, high on (bad) advertising. Still better than Natural Light and Coors, but still bad.
Clear pour with white head, pretty standard commercial beer.  Its decently priced, that’s a plus haha.  If your thirsty and don’t want water get this.

Pours clear, light yellow with thin head. Smells like bread dough, apples, and grass. Flavor is sweet, bready and slightly bitter to finish, with a strange soggy saltine cracker taste that is not pleasant at all. Palate is thin, but seems to have an apropriate level of carbonataion.

Bottle poured a clear pale yellow with a small lingering white head. Aromas of light bread dough and a hint of straw. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a watery finish. Flavors of a hint of bread dough  and a faint hint of citrus with a crisp clean watery finish. 

 WARNING!!!  Not recommended for even the average beer geek!
Horrible beer, one of the worst beers i’ve ever drink, I prefer to drink a diet-coce instead of this.

Pale beer with a white head that disappears, leaving no lacing.  Aroma, such as it is, is sour.  Flavor is slight sweetness, with a touch of green apple.  Finish is sweet.  Not bad, but not enough of anything to cause me to spend any cash on it.  It is yet another "refreshing" beer; I prefer ice tea.

I still have about eight cans sitting in my fridge from when somebody had left them over one night.  I will not touch this stuff.  I would rather go out and order a bottle of water than this.  Absolutely horrible.
Bottle. Very faint, watery and corny lager. Thirstquenching, but so is water...

can 33cl, bot in spain.
ar:pleasant but very faint.
golden with very small head.
flavor is sparkling mineral water with some hints of corn and honey. thin. aftertaste is same just fainter.

Finally I rate the beast! Poured a very weak yellow color with a small white head. Aroma was of lots of corn and some grassy notes. Flavor was much the same, lots of adjuncts and some iron and metal flavors. Blah!

My first ever beer that I tasted...drank a sip by accident from a bottle that my Aunt had when I was 5 years old (thought it was Coke). I gagged and spit it out. Now it is 21 years later, but I can only barely drink this. Typical mass-produced American beer: low on quality, high on (bad) advertising. Still better than Natural Light and Coors, but still bad.

This review applies only to the Budweiser brewed in Canada by Labatt, and has a higher alcohol content. I couldn’t figure out why Canadians would buy Bud, until I found out the difference. the Canadian version is quite palatable. Unlike its American counterpart, it actually tastes and smells like real beer.
What can I say, the new Budweiser adverts are as bad as this beer in itself!

I agree with Bbobb.  Good for brats too.  I would never buy this though.
It is cheap and thin and now that InBev is in charge I’m sure it will be worse.
Works just fine for beer can chicken. Can’t think of anything else to use it for though.

I love Budweiser because I have yet to find a domestic beer for the price that tastes as delicious as it does.  Not the world’s best beer by any means, but by far my favorite in the category.  Plus its the great american lager.
Warning - dangerous when warm, or cold, or frozen.  I could piss a better beer, but I couldn’t fill up all the bottles they would need to sell.
Tastes kinda like beer. Not really though. Bit too much rice. Don’t let this get warm. This is what beer bongs are made for.

A bit like mineral water but it seems to have passed its best days. Easy to drink, easy to forget. Here this loses its only use because of the two euro price tag, no excuse to buy this when you can get many better beers for the same price.

They have this beer free to take when you buy a case of beer at my local distributor. I always knew to stay away, but one day I picked one up since it was free. Its not even worth it when its free. Maybe someday if someone starts to pay me to drink it, I’ll have Budweiser again.

What flavor this beer has seems fake or added, I have found it to be a little more drinkable on tap,but  that sweet rice/metallic finish makes it just a so so beer,might be ok if FREE but I wont buy it.
Ah, here we have the beer for people who absolutely hate beer.  Mindless plonk for those who drink solely to get drunk.  There are zillions of suckers born every minute and this is what they drink!

oh ho-ray I have a free Budweiser, oh joy! 

Who drinks this stuff?

Thank god it’s free, I’d never buy this crap.

Just like bud light, what is this after taste ? Rotting flesh? Rabbit tirds? 

I have no clue how this stuff is still around, only thing i’m sure about is that I’m drinking a Budweiser, and I’m going to wake up in the morning and shit all over myself. . . .

Switching from Bud Light to Bud Heavy during the middle of a party made me respect the original a little more. The head is fluffier and the mouth feel is creamier. Not the worst beer on earth by any stretch.

One of my first beers, thought it was good.  Then my taste buds grew up and now I will only drink this if there is nothing else available.  It will do in a pinch, but considering how tasteless this is, I will choose a craft brew any day over this.
Watered down, tasteless macro lager, aged over some two by fours with rusty nails  Dry and overcarbonated

I don’t like the carbonation most of all. It reminds me so much of the soda taps once all the corn-syrupy gook is gone out of the bag, and the carbonated water still has the remnant tastes of the empty soda bag. They can’t even get a gimmick that says their water is out of a mountain or something.
What really pisses me off, is its pricing in the STL market. It’s up there with some much better imported beers around 11 per 12pack. The gall! They must be making a killing if you figure in their low transport costs. But at the end of it all, we know that  the company could care less as long as their goose’s shit has a gold-tinge.

Had to order it again.  Just to compare it to all my recent discoveries.  
Absolute embarrassment.  There is no flavor.  
It’s carbonated water with a speck of bitterness.  

I’ve seen bartenders poke fun at Bud by spraying a pint class 1/8th with any random pilsner and then topping it off with water. 
It tastes exactly like Budweiser.

This tasted like water with ’beer flavour added"  My least favourite of all macro world-wide.

Smell of bitter grass and corn, no hops. 

Malt water.
A definite thirst quencher that you can chug in the summer time.  It’s the kind of beer you drink while eating crabs or spicy food.  Otherwise, skip it.

I tried this b/c a guy wanted my opinion on it, I didn’t seek it out for sure.  It’s been at least 10 years since I had a Bud, so here it goes. I find it quite refreshing but not because of any flavor, but because of it’s lack of flavor and lack of anything that could be construed as harsh; consistency of water with some yeast, starch and malt flavoring.  It goes down easily for sure. I guess that I can understand it’s appeal to a broad audience.

Can’t believe this has a 1 on this site. The lowest possible rating (except, I suppose, a goose egg). Having lived in China for almost a month now, I can say honestly that there are plenty of beers far worse than this. Budweiser has a few things going for it - it’s drinkable, for one. It’s mildly pleasant tasting. Trust me, these are not universal qualities of beer. When I go out to eat here, and I see Budweiser on the beer list, I rejoice and fork over a little extra dough for the "imported" bottle. Lesson: don’t take anything for granted.

24 oz can from local grocery store. Slight pale malt aroma with some corn and a touch? of hops. Clear light straw color well carbonated with large fluffy white head that disspates fairly rapidy. Light pale malt and corn flavor with dry slightly carbonic finish. Hop flavor id practically unnoticable. Bitterness is enough to balance the malt. Clean, crisp, refreshing, tastless.

Can.  Very clear, transparent, golden color with a non-existent head.  No real aroma, I guess a little corn.  Sweet creamed corn flavor with absolutely no bitterness.  No hops whatsoever. Thin, watery, fizzy body.  No finish.
No, this isn’t good beer. But it isn’t horrible either! OK to drink once in a while.
only good thing about bud is that hopefully InBev can make it better. nowhere to go but up.

Appearance is spot on, crystal clear, good carbonation,  great straw like color for this type of beer.  Aroma is clean, little bit of hops but not much, little apple as well.  Flavor is sharp and crisp.  no off flavors.  expertly brewed, just not too terribly exciting.

On tap. Pale straw color with thin white head. Aroma faint - grain, little skunk and apple.  Flavor about the same. Palate thin and carbonated. Finishes dry. Very drinkable, not at all bad, just not a lot of flavor.
Faint aroma of beer. Faint taste of beer with carbonation. Truly tastes like a watered down beer.

Faint corn aroma. Pale yellow color with thin head. Hint of sweetness in the finish. Not much in the mouth but some corn and malt. Fairly crisp and lightly carbonated. Good thirst quencher if nothing else around - just follow it up with a decent beer because the aftertaste lingers rather unpleasantly. Rated this one just to be one closer to 100.
Can. Looks and smells quite neutral. Taste has citrus, corn and malts. Bit watery and tasteless.  Could be worse i quess.
This is like glorified mineral water.  No, glorified is the wrong word.  It is bland but a bit yeasty.  No wonder a foreign company owns them now.
gold blond coloured body with a white head a spicy fruity aroma a little spicy bitter watery taste with a wattery bitter finish

They don’t have Zeros as an option? Could someone change my rating to zero? The worst beer I’ve ever tasted. Smells stale, like a bail of hay. Invokes gag reflex on the palate. Made from boiled rice and hop extracts... say what? It say’s beer on the label but I can’t be certain it is, considering it has almost no malt in it. The packaging is pretty sweet. I’ve always loved the A-B logo. It’s truly American in style. Maybe the best label in the world to look at. Makes me want to pick it up and look at it. Too bad opening it makes me want to put it down.

There I was on a hot night, sweating profusely, and the only thing to drink was bud in a can, so with no cameras around to capture the moment, I popped one.So was the nose grassy, or was that the can? It was bubbly, with weak hop flavor, and I guess a malty finish, kind of hard to differentiate between the start and end of this. I  guess the finish was better cause it meant I was done. I guess it could be refreshing on a hot day, the first one was, the second one was a lot tougher to finish.

It never ceases to amaze me how some things that are so bad, become so popular.  I believe this simply represents the power of advertising.  This is, without a doubt, one of the worst beers brewed in the world.  Watery, bitter, unpleasant in most every way.  Quite honestly, I’d rather have water.

Forced upon me at a local Mexican Restaurant.  It’s really only benefit was that it was cold.  Clear pour with weak head.  Aroma of corn and mildew.  Tasteless, barely recognizable as beer.  Taste dissipates quickly.  It’s proof that massive marketing can sell a mediocre product.
Strait from the can on a florida beach.  Surely everybody’s had a similar experience with this mass produced beer
Everyone’s had it.  It has a bad rep, and it deserves it.  Little flavor to speak of.  I dread the day that I will come across a worse beer.

[22oz bottle at 49F] Budweiser is a clear, sparkling pale golden lager with a small white head that dissipates quickly.  There is a slight whiff of corn and perhaps lemon and hay.  It is light bodied and reasonably smooth, albeit a bit watery.  It is prickly on the tongue and the finish is a little chalky.  There is not much flavor here.  Anonymous light grain and a touch of lemon, maybe lemon detergent, are all that I could detect in this faint flavor.  There is no bitterness to speak of.  A shameful beer.

Terrible. beer. The king of beers my ass. This beer is worse than water. Tastes terrible and has no aroma or flavour. I wish that buweiser could never be bought so people didn’t think this was actually beer.
Again, I wish I could give this a zero... or a -2. Even when fresh this beer tastes stale and sour. Trust me, you don’t even want to know what I have to say about the light version.
Nice yellow color with frothy white head. Flavor is OK . Not too bad, but I don’t know if it’s the king of beers or not.

Alright...so this is one of the two beers all Americans start out drinking....and yes, its below us all.  But it is iconic and I do have fond memories of visiting the brewery when I was a youngster.  It doesn’t have much of any tastes.  I think though, that you can get a decent bottle now and again that is a little more ’fuller’ than the rest.  It’s not great on average though.  It is a bit metallic and it certainly doesn’t linger with you.  But I’ll be darned if you can’t find a better beer to watch the Cubbies with!  This is what we grew up with!

Horse piss?  Horse piss? Hell why would anyone degrade a beautifl animal like a horse by comparing swill like Bud to its urine.  Worse than horse piss.  END OF STORY.  King of nothing...except a shitty beer.
12oz bottle, not much taste...pours a piss colour yellow with a small but lasting head
Same as bud light but with more calories......and a little more flavor.......I guess
One of the only beers I’ve opened and have not been able to finish it.  I can usually grind through a bad brew, but this pushed my limits and I failed.

Pours a brassy, darker color gold with a fizzily white head. Aroma is dry hops, hay, corn and slight wet dog. Taste is also like chewing straw with a wet dog in the rain. Hops are a tad metallic, brushing and bittering the palate. This is America’s beer.
This is not a Budweiser beer! This is crap. Stick with a European brew. I really have no idea what AB was thinking when they named this beer.

From bottle.  Taste is of sugar, bread, and rice.  You know, I’ll admit that back in the day I actually used to kinna like this stuff.  These days, this brew tastes like pure calories and starch to me.  Well, could be a bit of sourness in there as well.

Once again at a Cubs game...and it was the choice between Bud Light and Budweiser.  Except, they were out of Bud Light.  So while drinking water I might as well have more calories.  Yeah, it is a macro, what else can I say.
