16 oz. can. Yellow with no head. Too sweet and metallic to even be a good lawnmower beer.

Bottled 33cl. It pours a pale yellow beer with a small white head. The nose is sulphury with notes of cardboard, onion and glue accompanied by lemon and lime. Sweet taste with notes of cardboard and lemon. Sour. Watery. Bland finish with notes of lemon and onion.

24oz can from a little store in Winters, CA. Poured a light yellow color with a huge white head. Smelled of corn an grain. Tasted like water with a little bit sugar added. No hops whatsoever, I don’t care what they say. Won’t be buying this again.

on tap. pours clear straw color with creamy white head. nose is well not much here, adjuncty, straw, grain. flavors is mostly adjuncty flavor some grain, a touch sweet green apple. very minimal hop character but some bitterness is there. who says BMC are clean actually flawless brews?? this is an acetaldehyde bomb PBR is way way better than this. Also, the heinie tall boy I followed this up with blew this out of the water. iif you must, serve this one on a hot day and extremely cold.
Bottle at ÅBF08. Mild grainy aroma. Very pale yellow colour. Small semi-stable white head. Thin flavour, grainy, faint hint of grass. Sour aftertaste.

I like this beer. The worst thing about it is that it does indeed smell like a urine soaked bath house. However, when one gets past that, one can enjoy this beer without qualms. It tastes like beer. Goes well with pizza, reubens, and/or baked ziti.
One of the most crapiest beers I’ve had. No character at all. Nothing stands out to me, malts, hops yeast strand... nothing.
bottle, tap, and can. What can I say that has not been said. It’s a real shame that the label is red, white and blue! Not the best rep. for the country I love.

Decent appearance for a lager. The ultimate blue collar beverage of choice, but let’s face it: at best, this beer is tolerable. Otherwise, it is very unimaginative and uncreative. Sure, it’s smooth and refreshing, even slightly malty. But the taste really goes nowhere. Far too watered down and thin, in fact most AB brands are very middle-of-the-road and uninteresting just like this one.

smells like corn-water.  i don’t know precisely what corn-water is, but it must smell like budweiser.  looks more like water than beer.  can’t taste any malt or hops.  good carbonation, but horrid biting aftertaste.  this is just a bad beer.

I’ve had this a bunch of times. I’m only rating it because in due time I’d like to know how many beers I have tried. This one sucked, always will, but I’ll likely have no choice but to have it again in the future. If it’s nice and cold, a few on a hot day aren’t so bad.

So what, I was crushing it with the Dude and I knew I was going to be double fisting it all night. 7 Dollars for a 16 oz. plastic bottle at the Oakland Athletic’s game. I start thinking about rating it. Aroma . . . beer. Appearance . . . it has one? Flavor: no, none of this. Palate . .  pass. The worst 7 dollar beer you could ever be bamboozled into buying.
Boring beer. Good only as a filler, a beer you drink to kill time in front of the TV or if you’re low on funds.

Can, 50cl. Pours a pale yellow, very clear, beer with a white foamy head. Aroma is pilsner malts with rice, without any interesting aromas. The flavor is uninteresting, a boring taste. Thin palate. Overall a boring beer, below average.
Pale straw yellow with a white head that held for a short time.  Very bland and without much flavor.  Watery feel with a hint of grassyness.  Not a pleasant taste.
Only called "the king" because of the gold cap.  Definately boring, but useful if your wallet’s thin.
Awful.  The nearest thing to fresh air in a glass you can find.  The most bland and insipid beer in the USA and there’s a hell of a lot of competition for that title.
buds ok, i know its not some fancy import but come on people, it is the king of beers, and i have drank with the germans

I agree with gonzo 46 and 2. You’re gettin whatcha pay for here. It’s not the worst. Wet’s my whistle. No bad flavors. Removed all that’s offensive. Like the McDonalds of the beer world.  A little bit of head. No lace. Ultra mild. Borrrrrr rinnnggggggggg.
Terrible. At least bud light and bud select have less carbs and calories to minimally offset their crappiness.

330 ml bottle. Pale yellow colour, with a thin white head that dissipates quickly. Mild, malty aroma. Very light and very watery mouthfeel. Not much flavour to speak of, some very mild maltiness. How anyone can call this "The King of Beers" with a straight face is beyond me.
Well it’s not the worst beer I’ve had but given a choice for anything else, I’d take it.

tastes very unpleasant, harsh and vegetabley. i had some after drinking an even cheaper beer and this one tasted worse. i had it once before and thought it was passable but i might have been too drunk to accurately gauge it. 

re:rate, what a garbage "beer" this is. very distinct, to the point where i am certain i could pick it out blind. just awful ricey taste and harshness with an end of rotten vegetables. ive had a lot of bad beer and this one is very consistent and always horrible.
[i] [b] Bottle around neighbours house 05-06-08 [/i] [/b] Bland, no flavour, utterly and totally forgettable, why?

Bottle, pour.  Light yellow body with thin fizzy head and no lacing.  Mild aroma with slight hint of honey and bread.  Taste is bland with only slight hint of banana and honey.  Doesn’t linger at all with no noticeaable aftertaste.  The king of beers has no clothes.

Let’s not forget that what you are drinking here is an American Pale Lager. If you’re expecting a huge aroma or flavor you’re drinking the wrong beer.  This is a backyard beer that’s cheap and consistent.
For the most part this beer is highly overlooked as a contender. Bang for the buck, you will never defeat budweiser. long live the king.
Cerveza facil de beber, suave, ligera. Recomendable para iniciarse en este mundo y para seguir en el.
Pours a nice head.Light yellow in color. Aroma grainy and bit of hops. What flavor there is is a bit of hops and grain again. Drink it cold for a thirst quencher.
Bar beer, nothing more, i only drink this when it’s 2 for 1 night.. Not much flavor a bit of alcohol, easy to drink. Thats about it
The worst beer I’ve tasted in my life.  No real flavour unless you enjoy drinking piss.
Botella. Comprada en supermercado. Nada, nada, nada. Comprar si no hay otra cosa.
Bottle, this beer is not a beer. It is almost like water with alcohol. No Body, no taste. You can directly put it in the toilet

The great American standard.  Nothing makes me happier than postin’ up on the beach with a cooler full of Bud.  Substantially better than its little brother BudLight and lightyears beyond its bastard child Nat Light.
I could easily have found more pleasure from this beer, if i had been plunging the bottle into my ass.
Not really a heavy taste but an awsume beer regardless. Great to kick back with a bud and watch the game

This beer has a weak malty musty smell and a very dry taste..  Has enough bitterness added to create an aftertaste that lingers sometimes way longer than wanted.  Drink a few too many and that aftertaste can be with you almost all the next day.
Your Atypical commercialized beer.  Very skunky smell & taste. Horrible aftertaste, typical in all budweiser beers.

My turn to review the world’s best selling beer.  From a Red Sox 2007 World Series limited edition 24 fl.oz. can. Born on date of 17 Apr. 08.  Lot code:  B 04 03 A1 AD 321.  Pours as a carbonated straw yellow with fizzy head that dissipates.  Smells of corn, grass, and metal.  A slightly heavier texture than watered down.  There’s a reason this is the world’s best selling beer.  No matter what the batch...no matter when it is brewed...Budweiser always tastes the same and there is something to be said about consistency. It was perfect after a long day at an amusement park with a group of seventh graders (which is what I did today)!  But I never buy it and only did so this time for a proper review and because the can was $1.99.  Just a typical American pale.

12 oz can. Pours a transparent yellowish hue with a head that dissipates like a soft drink. Aroma of corn and adjuncts. Body is very light, with a similiar taste. Watery, sickly sweet, and carbonated water. Finishes with that budweiser aftertaste I personally detest. Overall, a very poor beer.

i drink on july 3 every year because this was my grandpas beer and he died on that day. but it carries over on the fourth of july and thats about it for the year.so when i actually consume this beer it is for sentiment and patriotism. whats more american than bud? not even mickey mouse. an american staple that isnt disgusting but not a daily beer for me. hurts too much the next day.
Slightly better than Bud Light and some other macros, but I only drink this at outdoor sporting events when there is no other option.
Draft.  Poured golden yellow with a quickly gone white head.  Aroma is sour corn mash.  Body is similar with a slight apple juice contingent.  I fairly horrid beer.
At least it is better than Bud Light. Below average everything. Again, after the first taste, there is no taste as almost all American commercial beers are this way.
This is a disent beer. The only side effect of this beer is that you get bad shits
worst beer available in Ireland. Full of chemicals, tastes like watered down lager. Just goes to show what good advertising can do

I like this stuff just to sit around and  drink ice cold on a hot summer night -or day. It’s also the kind of stuff to drink at ballgames, watching ballgames, and on fishing trips. You can drink a lot, get a decent buzz, and not get overwhelmed. Banquet beer. It’s my Dads beer from the 50’s and 60’s. It’s ok for what it is - beer.
Very light tasting - drank alot on tap while visiting florida. Very refreshing whne ice cold on a hot sunny day - it is what it is a nice light tasting lager - not a bad beer for what it is.

Wow. When I was an early teen growing up I used to think this beer was decent as did all of my friends. After trying countless other micro brewed beers, this is at the bottom of the list. Just goes to show how advertising has a brain washing effect in to thinking a product is good or in this case "The king of beers". Nuff said.
Budwieser heavy. Tastes like crap and is way to filling. It tastes like I’m drinking straight yeast, but it’s ok.
Not very good in my opinion.  Just bitter and a flavor that seems almost a little dingy.

Piss in a can. Poured one finger of foam that disappeared in a matter of seconds. Looks and tastes like dirty water. Leaves a sticky unpleasant coating on my tongue. I Prefer almost any other beer to this. Probably the worst beer ever made.

Nice color is about the only saving grace for this lager. Virtually no nose, or flavor, probably due to tremendous carbonation. This is as fizzy as cola, if not more. One sip will fill you up, but not in a satisfying way. World’s best selling beer? Wow..

A good, almost tasteless alternative for a hot summer day, when you mostly need water for hydration, but want a minimal amount of alcoholic kick and taste as well.  Bud fills that niche well, but not much else.  Best taste in its category, although that’s not saying much either.  I’ve always liked the packaging though.  Definitely best in class.  Their advertising is always first rate too.  Hey, can’t blame ’em for trying!  Their sales figures obviously don’t lie.
I actually drank a budweiser yesterday due to lack of options.  Refreshing light lager.  Taste doesn’t get in the way of refreshment.

[207ml bottle from Asda, High Wycombe] My opinion might not be that valid, as I’m more of a real ale drinker and very rarely go for lager.  However, ever now and then in the summer when I want something unchallenging and thirstquenching I fancy one of the "world"/ pale lagers - and whenever this happens I find myself returning to Budweiser, as I’ve been disappointed with so many other pale lagers (especially the godawful Harbin and Stella Artois).  Ok, so there’s very little flavour (a hint of citrus, some slight malt), but it never makes any claims in this regard.  It claims to be clean, crisp and refreshing, and that’s exactly what it is.  For me this is one of the better beers in the style (although certainly not the best), and doesn’t deserve the bashing it gets purely for being made by what according to rumour is a rather amoral corporation. 

Despite the fact that I quite like the stuff, I do have to say that the whole "King of Beers" thing is pushing it a bit!
Really close to water color. Taste is really small with hints of corn. Maybe it’s refreshing but certainly not enjoyable.

Not the worst beer I have had. Has nothing to tell about, but the sad story of the pathetic quarrel with the chech beer company concerning the right to use the name. the chech beer has nothing to do with this carbonated watery piss

so if you are a beer drinker, you already know what this looks, tastes and smells like. this was my first beer years ago, it isn’t thaaat bad but it isn’t that good. quenches thirst and goes down quick. well there’s another beer rated!

I drank this in college. It certainly beats out the other domestic "premiums." The key for me is it must be in the bottle. It must be very cold, which is fine because there is no aroma, very little head worth comment and a  general corn and caramel coloring. Read: unaesthetic. but on a hot day at very nearly 32 degrees this beer is crisp and refreshing. That and there’s a nostalgic attraction for me.
Lager américaine à 4,9% très populaire, mais dur à comprendre.... Goût très fade et arrière goût déplaisant. Difficile de croire qu’on peut appeler ça une bière.

Bottle.  THE KING, as my friend perc would say.  I have this beer every tuesday night and you know what, ill keep having it at ringside in caldwell every tuesday night because for 5 bucks i can drink a pitcher, edit i can slug a pitcher and still drive legally.  Its a great dance floor beer to wild out with your friends.  Its crisp, refreshing, and easy to drink.  What can i say this beer sells for other reasons then propaganda and availabilty. i dont know what could be more sessionalbe when it doesnt fill you up.  I will say there are major downfalls like the number of times you visit the bathroom the next day but thats what you get for 5$ of punishment to your body. For what its worth its the real deal. haha.
Just riduclously awful.  It took me about an hour to choke this down, with food!  Tastes like fizzy water poured over rice crispies.
King of Beers eh?  Pours light golden with white head.  Smell of AB’s best.  Not really offensive and actually pretty refreshing.  Hey, it may not be a good beer, but worse do exist.

ok, if forced to drink macro at a bar, this is the one I choose. 

Aroma: huh, beer’s supposed to have aroma?

appearance, slightly more appetizing, with it’s blatant caramel coloring, than the pissy coors or miller beers....

flavor: ok, there’s a corn-syrup sweetener added, I can taste that, and I can faintly imagine I taste a little roastiness on there. If I squint my taste-buds.

palate: hah!

So, yeah, I can still maybe drink this....

Maybe
I mean, a lot of us grew up on this stuff I guess. The "5" is out of nostalgia, I suppose. But seriously, avoid this unless a small fire is raging and needs putting out.
im not even sure why I rate this beer as it is such a dissapointment. But it is another beer rating.

33cl bottle from Meny, Grønland. It poured a very light yellow color with a medium head that settles down quickly in the glass.
The aroma is typical lager-style, it doesn’t really exists and the flavor is as Monty Python so elegantly put it "f**king close to water". It’s a nice thirst quencher, but that is about it also.
More flavor than bud light, just not much going on though...occasionally refershing, i have had many worse beers
Just getting the generic crap out of the way in my beer ratings.  Better than Bud Light, not much of a compliment though.
budweiser the king of piss beers i dont know how this could be the best selling beer. TERRIBLE
"Bud Diesel" is a little better than bud light but it costs twice as much during happy hour at the bar so i get bud light.  a classic beer none the less and i like to drink it.
Sweet, malty, bubbly. Aroma and flavor leave much to be desired. Malt is all you get.
I agree with other raters.  The commercials for these macros are downright abhorrent.  The claims that they have body, smoothness, crispness, good taste, anything of the sort, are just disgusting.
12 oz bottle from a distant memory. Watery malty taste. Not much excitement. But it’s a tick.
Personally, I prefer the Select, but there is nothing like an original Bud. First beer my father ever let me try.
Noticed I missed this rating. Wow well wha can one say. It is a beer that everyone at one time has had, so you’ll know what you are getting, water down fizz.
I know a lot of people don’t like this beer but I think it taste great. Yea it doesn’t look or smell that good. Its a great beer to have at a playoff hockey cookout.
For mass marketed swill, it’s not horrible. Like most macro brews, there’s no real flavor or aroma. Acceptable in a bottle but not worth it in a can.
Good head,decent carbonation,straw colour,.Aroma lemon,bitter hops.Flavour is grainy,malt watery but drink if icy cold as a thirst quencher.Finish grainy ,malt watery.

King of beers? I dont know about that. The could mass produce cow shit and people would still flock by the millions to buy this peepee water. at least its better then its cousins. clear golden, watery malty and incredibly grainy.

I would rate it lower if I could. The TV ads about the quality etc.. really get my blood boiling.
I choose water. I see where some of the top raters claim it’s the top seller for a reason and number 1 in the US- so are McDonald’s hamburgers. Would you rate them 5.0 as well?
Honestly, Can I go lower than one?  The only thing that pisses me off more than the beer itself is the ridiculous commercials.  I would feel horrible having to lie to that many peoples faces.

The things I give this beer credit for are 1. it’s the beer that made me like beer
2. It’s cheap.  
But for my money, I’d rather have a Labatt Blue

Bud lite has 19.2 % of the market share, and budwesier has 12% of all beer in america.Its stats like these that make me want to move to europe sometimes. The problem with america isn’t liberal or conservative values, its not capitalism, its not lawyers, its stupidity. Taste like phlegm.

"shut up if you dont like it! its what jesus would drink... if he were alive... and american... and alcoholic.... "  shut the hell up and get a job so you can buy some flavor with your beer....  whore...

Really? Hmm.  Uh.  Well, Ill drink it if it’s the only thing they are selling at a sporting event, probably in a nice plastic bottle so I can’t use it as a weapon.  Probably better suited for bodily harm in the first place.  Pass.
Choke back a case and get drunk.  Typical keg beer for a college party.  Fairly cheap, easy to drink, and works quite well for beer pong.

Had my first Bud in a long long time.  The guy next to me at the Sox game bought it for me.  I’m NO fan of Bud, and probably haven’t had a BMC beer in 2 years, but this is NOT one of the worst 50 beers in the world. It’s far better than many of the cheap, crappy pale lagers in many parts of the world.  Although it had little taste to speak of, it was exceedingly easy to drink, which, for BMC swill, ain’t that terrible.

have to give it some credit for effort.  flavor seemed supplemental to natural processes.  as my scottish friend (david) says it’s a good starter because it’s like lemonade.  should this be classified as a lager / beer? is that a crime?  godes down well as a wine cooler.

Pours a very clear golden color with a medium white head.  Aroma is plain and dry.  Flavor is slightly bitter, but that’s about it.

12 oz. bottle.
Bright yellow, no head.  Very fizzy, no real aroma or taste to speak of.  Less drinkable than Bud Select, more drinkable than PBR, Old Style, or Milwaukee’s best

Rating 666:  Perhaps the very first beer I tasted as a wee lad.  We were living high on the hog in College if we had this.  Bottle pours pale yellow with a fizzy head and some spot lace.  The aroma is very faint.  The flavor is like fizzy water with some faint hint of industrial malt.  The palate is fizzy and cleansing.  There is a lingering thing that I just don’t want in my mouth.  Meh. Rating #666 Sound Treat -- It’s Raining Blood!!!
For all you Bud haters, at least get your facts straight before making comments.  Bud has never used corn in it’s beer, that’s a Miller thing.
I hate Budweiser.  Even many years ago when I drank swill and knew nothing about beer I still hated Budweiser.  It’s just a corn, grain, no hop swillin’ mess.  Their commercials are funny at least.
Corn, corn, corn! Bright yellow beer with no head at all, no bitterness, very watery taste with a thin body. Beer?
It’s not as good as Bud Light, it has a stronger taste to it, and it is too carbonated.

12oz can. Pours pale straw, clear, with a thick-bubbled head. The aroma is very weak. What little character exists is of yeast - not like esters or yeast byproducts, but of yeast. As in, take a whiff of a freshly opened pack of liquid lager yeast, and that is what the aroma reminds me of - except much more watered down. The flavor follows the aroma - it tastes like soda water into which someone poured liquid lager yeast. There is a slight bready character, but it is subtle. Hop character is nil. Sweetness is also nil. There is a slight bitterness in the finish, but it is very weak. The label says 5% abv - how can they package that much alcohol but so little flavor?!? The label also answers that question: rice. The mouthfeel is heavily carbonated and thin - like soda water. Overall, a very watery and flavorless beer. I’ve had many macro-brews that were far more flavorful than this. Next to an imported macro-brew like Heineken, it still tastes watery. Next to a flavorful beer? Probably more like club soda than anything else... I’m glad I didn’t pay for this can. I poured most of it down the drain...
Bottle.Yellow with thin head. Beery flavor and aroma. Not worth the hatred, not worth the time.
Terrible. Pale piss yellow. Piss aroma. Sour piss flavor. I think this is probably the worst of the big Americans

12oz can.   Yellow with a decent white head.   The aroma is quite faint, but not off putting, really.   The flavor is likewise quite light and lacks any real bitterness.   Not overly sweet, but the lack of bitterness kills the balance anyway, and there is an unclean aftertaste that gats a little nasty after awhile.   Not really too offensive, and clean in comparison for the style, but still a quite poor beer on the whole.   Now I see why I like bud light better, its got less bad flavor to worry about.
Not stellar, but the best of the macros.  It’s not bad, just kind of "there."  Watery with slight corn and grain tastes.  Virtually no aroma or taste that stays with you.
Not horrible, but taste like flavored water. A kind of beer that, if you can’t make your mind up, and just want to kick back have some suds, here you go.

And often marketed in the UK as ’American’s love this stuff, so should you’ kind of campaign. I can’t begin to tell you what is wrong with that, from both sides of the pond. Still better than Stella though. Then again so is my piss.

Like MGGD, this beer is best used as a device to blend into drinking environments where It’s hard to ask for "something hoppy"... like, for example,  at a bar that has tiny round windows and folks with large body art.

Sure... I could rack up a list of what’s wrong with Bud (the king... the big #1), but why waste 1000 words? At least it’s predictable. Weak flavored, over carbonated, and slightly nasty... but predictable.

Plus I like the horses... I hope one day to have a horse drawn wagon full of beer (even Bud!) delivered to one of my parties.

(USA) Very pale yellow color with a med-white head tha disappears quickly. This brew has a Corn/Pee aroma, kinda gave me a headache....lol. The taste was watery and just dreadful, Who the Hell loves this stuff ??? They say it’s the King of Beers, But i would say the  King of Crap.

Of the two giant US brewing behemoths, Anheuser-Busch and Miller, Busch at least appears to make some effort to brew a tasty and drinkable beer whereas Miller cranks out disgusting swill.  Overwhelmingly the biggest selling beer in the world, Budweiser is at least palatable, but does the USA a disservice by giving the rest of the world the impression that this tolerable but mediocre brew is a "typical American beer".  Absolutely no aroma, taste of grain and barley.  Finish of... water, I suppose.
Only good thing about it is that it goes down smoothly in a funnel.  Its aroma is barely detectable. A slight bitter flavor with a mediocre finish.

Slightly better than it’s competitors. Must be drank cold, non-existant aroma, low quality bitterness but at least it’s detectable unlike Coors. 

There is no situation where this beer tastes great but if fresh, it’s tolerable.
Very poor. Very weak taste. Watery. Awful. Can’t find anything good to say about it. Would score 0 throughout if 1 was not the minimum.

Wow I get to give my .02 about Bud.  Weak taste-it’s a shame this is the best selling American brew.  Oh well i’ll stick to a few of the better brews.  BTW my son used to drink Bud and Coors Light- funny when I gave him a Saranac or Yuengling he would comment "Dad you like those beers that taste like beer"  Today, I am proud to say my son also like beers that taste like BEER too.  Well it goes to show that there is some hope for th younger generation.
Popular, well marketed. lacking true beer qualities. Have another? Sorry I didn’t finish the first.
It’s cheap.  It’s everywhere.  It’s bud.  This bud’s for you, not me.  I’ll stick to the micro brews.

(Draft@Celtics game@TDBanknorthGarden on 3/28/08) Terrible. Pours clear yellow with a goldish tint that must be from artificial coloring. Thin bit of white head. Aroma of sort of sweetish corn but with a hint of dishrag. Mouthfeel thin and prickly. Flavor is of mass-produced watery corn maltiness with some bland, blunt cereal and paper. The Great American Lager.
You know the deal, lager, a hint of flavor, etc.  Can be really tasty if very fresh and on draft.  Usually this is a last resort as a step up from watery light beers.

Bud sucks.  Period.  You can taste more grain in this than the other big American beers, but that’s not saying much.  The alcohol content is high.  People that drink this a lot smell very bad when this comes out of their pores.  Overall, small hint of grain, big carbonation, a little hoppy.  King of Balls.  What more can you say?

I’m aware I’m not the first to comment on this, but calling this the king of beers is the biggest joke in human history. There’s just nothing nice or tasty about this beer, it’s an unappealing pale yellowish color, cardboardish aroma and a far too smooth taste, like drinking liquid corn or something like that. bah

Haven’t rated this yet, oh boy, here goes. Pours clear yellow and looks well yellow and clear. Aroma is light corn and cereal. Taste is slightly sweet and more corn and grains. A very slight bittering at the end. Beer. Whatever.

this is the best darn tall boy beer. haha. its a good enthusiaste starter. better than bud light or busch. it takes way to many to get drunk. AB has way better beers than this. I like AB. but not bud.

not to good beer, too start drinking then you would buy other than this, a bit creamy, refreshing,  watery but drinkable too the last drop... no after taste...party beer but that´s it. ps..why is it label " the king of beers " they should change it to the "king of lame beers".

...nasty rice water with added alcohol flavor.  Have had this many times, but not by purchase, it is horrible, and I never drink this unless there is nothing else there.  I hate this beer, and it gives you a huge hangover if you have more than 6.  One of the worst beers.
The best option at most ball parks or concerts. Not enough here to really warrant a home purchase however.

Pours like a fine wine, beautiful golden yellow. With just the right amount of head. Not the best beer out there, but somehow it just brings people together, and in that sense it’s a beautiful beer.

Queen of Cheap beers, the King being Pabst Blue Ribbon.
Thought Bud Light was better in my head but I guess this has a slightly more flavorable water taste.
33 cl bottle, in La Manga, Spain. Clear golden color, disappering white head. Only hints of sweet malt and bitternes, and extremely watery. This is not king of beers!
Hate this beer.  beer flavored water.  No wonder why most alcohols drink this.  Tastes like water that gives u a buzz

No nose to speak of, maybe just a hint of spice.  Not much head, yellow gold in color.  Some corn sweetness; light, light malts, faint bitterness, thin flavor, but balanced in the thin flavors.  Body was thin to medium, highly carbonated, crisp, with just a bit of a lingering spicy finish.
 Marketing makes this beer so popular. Based on taste, I think there are many more mass-produced options out there that go down better.  Just not a good beer.
Bottle. hey it’s better than bud light. Clear yellow, minimal white head. Flavor???????????? It has little. A typical American lager. Won’t be buying it again.
King of beers my ass. If you want cheap and shitty that will fill you up and make you feel like crap then buy it, but being 5% its probably best cheap beer that will get you going for the night.

Just rating for the sake of rating here. Out of a 40-ouncer this time, it’s just Bud, that’s all. It won’t kill you. Basically like drinling beer-flavoured water. As another put it, good to drink while barbecuing.

Poured out of a can very clear yellow in color with a marginal head.  Very sweet smelling and taste follows up with this as well.  Not much else to this beer.  Good beer to use for boiling brats since you wouldn’t miss out on anything.
Bottle: Yellow.  Sweet, grainy nose.  Plenty of rice and hype.  Try to avoid ingesting.

Paired with Michelob Light and Bud Light tasting.  12oz Twist off bottle.  Clear yellow.  Sweet aroma of a bag of uncooked rice.  This is truly the top of any pale lager, which as far as my tastes go....  is still at the bottom.  Most of all you would think that a company with the resources to the best ingredients in the World would truly make a superior product.  I guess not when you have the profit margin that they have with this product.
gross, gross, gross.  i’m not against rice.  i’m a cook i love rice, but not in a beer.  boo to the ’king" of beers.

Not much new to say here.  Pours very light yellow and clear.  Typical american macro smell - light on malt or hops.  Foamy white head.  Somehow this drinks a helluva lot better out of a can than poured into a glass from a bottle. Not much flavor this way (maybe it’s just in my head).

Compared to most beers I like it’s crap, but for American lager it’s par for the course.

When someone offers you a Budweiser, it’s easy to say "No thanks, pal- I don’t drink. My father was an alcoholic who always drank Budweiser in the Tall-Boy cans while wearing a wife-beater, picking his feet, and farting" Not suitable for contact with human skin.
Pours golden with a white head.  No aroma.  Not much taste either.  I grab one of these after a good night of drinking and I need some water to refresh me.
pale gold body a little white head. Little sweet aroma of grains. little sweet and little bitter in the finish. It’s not a beer for me.

Yep. 1. That’s how good the "King of Beers" is. Tastes like socks soaking in oxyclean, with a dash of vinegar and salt.  Horrible, horrible, beer ON SECOND ANALYSIS: They have added RICE to this beer, furthering the flavorless in this beer. For that stupid move, demote this shit even more.

Aroma - not much at all here some what corny.
Appearance - clean yellow body, some nucleation.  1/3" white head, falls into nothing.
Taste - very muted malt somewhat corny, but really hard to detect much at all.  Faint hops.
Palate - light body, thin texture, average carbonation, not much in the way of finish.-

Anheuser-Busch Budweiser -- 3/4/2008 from 12 oz. bottle . . .
  Aroma: Neutral; Grains faint, but slightly noticeable; Corn.
  Appearance: Clear; Light straw-yellow in color; Medium-size white head with no retention; No lacing.
  Taste: Lightly sweet; Rice; Some grains (though not malty in any sense); Hops never noticeable.
  Palate: Thin; Somewhat oily; Finishes somewhat dry and tart.
  Overall: Not the worst mass-market beer.  Though not really good, somewhat better than it usually gets credit for.  Acetaldehyde noticeable in the finish always gives S a quick headache.
Vintage 2006. Collectible christmas bottle. Wow! Poured yellow with white fizzy head. No aroma. No flavor. Carbonated water. Thats how I like!

given the amount of crap like rice in it, can we even call this a beer? how to brew budweiser:

take some fizzy water, stir in a pound of sugar, urinate into the top. shake and serve
I got this at a hockey game. It was either this or Bud Light. Never again. I’d rather have a Coke than waste $6.25 for this putrid shit.

I was once at a bar and ordered a Miller Lite, the girl next to me got a Budweiser... I never felt like less of a man! Budweiser is actually not that bad of a beer. Available all over the world, you know what you are going to get and can always get it. Even if it is not good at all!
a little better than bud light, but this is certainly a victim of false advertising.  This is definitely not the king of beers.

Not alot of anything, It is more flavorful then most of bud’s mass produced beers withj a slightly righ flavor, but it  stilltastes watered down. Best to keep in a can to avoid the aroma. I guess I would take one over an Imperial stout when I’m working outside on a hot day.

So bad.  Nothing really worth typing about...in short:

Pour looks good...clear, gold.  Aroma is of straw and faint grain.  Tastes like...well...water with a hint of malt.  Finish is hardly clean, lingering and sticking in the mouth forever.

Typical of an American Macro.  Gah.
You can’t always get what you want....and for being ’The King of Beers", it’s terribly disappointing. Better than Bud Light, but still skunky.

Tap at Paris las vegas. Sweeter corn malt aroma. A touch of hops but mostly sweet. Pours pale clear gold with a quickly disappearing white head. A little fuller bodied than expected. Mostly sweet corn on the tongue. A slight skunk flavor. Not as bad as I remember.
What can I say? The king of beers that sheep drink. Smells skunky. Looks watery. Tastes ok for what it. Overall, I hate to use this but “ it is what it is”.

Can 0.473 l, 4.4 %. Drank from can, but I suppose looks like any other of it’s kind (pale yellow). Very light flavor with a sweet backbone. No hops, no aftertaste. Can’t say it’s very refreshing either, as corn (?) gives a certain skunkiness to the flavor.  Overall quite balanced and easy, yet watery. For some reason Bud Light from tap was much hoppier than this and had a decent aftertaste. Bottle 0.33 l, 5.0 %. Noticably fuller than the can version. Slightly beefier in all parts with even a very small hoppy aftertaste.

Typical domestic American lager. Lacks most characterics of a great brew in my vocabulary. Weak stats across the board. Basically you’re paying for water with a slightly bitter taste and some alcohol content. If you have little money and little apperication for the great, true taste of beer, then by all means go buy some Budweiser.

This beer is a quality product produced to be the same taste every time. Kind of like McDonalds’ products. It may not be great but it’s always the same. It is also geared toward the frequent beer drinker and profiled to offend the least amount of people. Bland would be the operative word.  That being said, this is a corny, malty beverage with a minimal amount of hops. A really good beer for those who don’t really like beer but need to consume alcohol by a not unpleasant means. Pretty good ice cold at a kegger.
Terrible America should be ashamed of itself for porducing such a terrible beverage. I can believe anyone would drink this. However if you want a great case of swampa$$, then this is your beer.
Taste is pathetic, but it is alot better than budlight. They got the beachwood aging thing goin for them, thats about it. Ok to get drunk on
very golden, almost TOO golden. not a bad beer, but i prefer the hoppier ones.
Well at least it’s 5% booze, but besides that it ain’t good for very much but gettin drunk. Not leaving this in 40, can or bottle to just drink is awful
good pour and aroma to. like other american brews. it’s on the lighter side. but stil maintains a good crisp and clean taste.

Pint can.  Pours a light yellow color with a very thin white head.  Really low on both flavor and aroma and is a little watery.  On the positive side it is crisp, clean and refreshing.  Kind of an overrated beer as there are better macros out there that are cheaper.  However, it is not a bad beer to have every once and a while (when it is on sale) as it is clean tasting.

This is the absolute worst beer it has ever been my misfortune to drink.  I would sooner drink the sweat from my gym shorts than drink this foul beverage.  I would still have to contemplate death if I were trapped in a desert with nothing else to drink. Can sum this up in one word: NAAAAAAAAASSSSSSSTTTTTYYYY!!!!!!!

On tap and served in a tall lager glass.  The beer poured a clear golden with a quickly receding head of white foam.  No lace.  The aroma of the beer was made up of sweet malts, corn, and not much else.  The flavor was much the same, with a sweet/metallic note that became more present as the beer warmed.  Definately drink this one as cold as possible...you don’t want to taste it.  A 23oz glass was not easy to choke down.  The mouthfeel was light-bodied and highly carbonated.  The King of Swill!

Clydesdale piss. Nice head, Light sweet aroma. Watery. Best cold on a hot day. Clean finish, gives me a headache.  Still, I would rate it better than Coors or Miller High Life but that isn’t saying much.  If I was to be forced to drink another US Macro-brew, it would be Pabst Blue Ribbon.  "King of Beers"?  Time for a Revolution!  This is Budweiser... THIS ain’t beer!

Their logo is pretty awesome. I guess if you’re going to pee in a bottle and try to market it, you had better have some pretty eye-catching packaging. These guys have great business sense. Why waste time perfecting the taste when the bulk of the American public will swallow pretty much anything they can afford? I used to drink this when I was underage because I didn’t know what I was doing other than acquiring something that would get me drunk.

Tasted 2/15/08.  12oz bottle.  BOD 11JAN08.  Filtered with a dull fizzy golden hue.  Grainy rice aromas.  Light bodied and crisp.  Adjuncted.  Good effervescence.  Mass appeal but no real character.  Mild almost negligable hop profile.  Off-dry finish.  Thin.  What can I say, I’m a St. Louis guy!  Definitely not my favorite, but it’s the biggest for a reason.  Consistancy.

This is just like water. 
You could imagine that it is a person who dislike the taste of a beer who made this one.
How can you not like Bud.  I mean, Dale Jr. drives the car, Mason Minor drinks it with me, and seriously, how American can you be without a Bud in your hand.
bottle. poured a yellow color. malty smell. sweet crisp malty taste. not a favorite of mine.
This beer is deceiving. It looks way better than it is. I can’t stand to smell or taste the stuff but that doesn’t mean I wouldn’t.

Pours very light yellow with a light head.  Slight aroma.  No real overwhelming flavor.  Slightly bitter with a dry finish.  Probably best served as close to freezing temperature as possible so as not to taste it.

12oz can poured into a lager glass.  Why do I rate Budweiser?  First of all I’m from St. Louis.  Secondly, for completeness.  For good or bad Budweiser is an integral part of American culture.  Bud pours a distressingly pale yellow with a medium to light head that disappears almost at once.  The nose consists of corn husks and birch wood.  The body is very light, dry and has virtually no after taste.  The flavor has a hint of green apples and a very light touch of hops.  The flavor is pretty hard to find actually.
Bottle.  Well decorated label on bottle.  Very light dry corn / malt aroma.  Flavor is similar, pretty sweet actually with a dry finish.  Not bad for the style.
An example of how good marketing strategies pay off. Lacks any real flavour except for a barely perceptable hint of hop driven bitterness. Maybe try it, and then become a shareholder.
Well, it’s pretty unremarkable, but not offensive if you drink it fast and ice cold.  Pale yellow, little aroma - sometimes a little sour, fizzy, a bit of a grassy flavor, very weak mouthfeel.
Perfect for a hot day, although it’s nothing special. Pours a pale golden yellow, head dissipates quickly. Not a bad beer for cheap.
A triumph of style over substance. This has got to be one of the most dislikable beers in the world for anyone over the age of 21. Drink it, and regret it.
Pours clear, light yellow, little head. Aroma is kind of grassy. Light mouth feel. Some light fruity sweetness and a little hop bitterness to finish. Pretty lame.
Bottle at a bowling alley.  Not too bad with some Maker’s Mark next to it.  A very boring, uninteresting beer.. but drinkable, I suppose.

This beer pours with a little head and a light to medium golden head. It has a certain distinct aroma to it. The taste has some bite at first but dissipates to nothing after a while. After swalloed it leaves a sticky, malty, feeling in the mouth. Overall a very drinkable and filling beer.
tap.  Sweet all around,  slight funk,  boring.  Not bad,  just nothing horrible or great about it.
Can’t go wrong here. Goes down smoothly, this is my favorite widely distributed lager of choice. When I show up at the bar, this is what I typically go with.
24 oz. can.  Perfect for a hot day, although it’s nothing special.  Pours a pale golden yellow, head dissipates quickly.
let’s give a little more credit to "the king of beers" the stuff is pretty good especially for something as mass produced as it is.
Good Beer for the price. Being in high school a good beer for a great price is one of the top things i look for a beer. Plus available EVERYWHERE

If im Not in the mood to try anything different i’ll go for this stuff.
Sure its boring,
But who doesnt know Bud?
After all its the Most Boring Of All Beers.
I like the designs on the labels though :-)

I don’t understand at all how this is only 1%...hasn’t anyone seen that this is an AMERICAN LAGER and can’t hide imperfectons like those pesky craft beers? Really!! Seriously, we all know what this is and what this beer is about. Its Bud. I’ve actually never cared for Bud...too fizzy and carbonated for me, and too sharp. Whatever.
Better than most in its class but that is not saying a lot. Thin flavor with no body. Corn, water, and carbonation. Macro brew.
This is an example of standard American beer.  Clear and lacking body and flavor, it is easy to drink and a favorite of the masses, but not for the more educated beer fans.
Not a very good tasting beer, but there is much worse out there. Good beer for a college binge drinker but thats about it.

the great american lager bud has done alot for the beer iindustry they were the first to bottle beer so you could enjoy it a home for that reason alone i will give them a high 0.5  as i read this highest rankings i see a lot of 5.0s as u can see they drink way to much of this stuff if u smell what i’m cooking
My staple beer along with MGD for a long time. I think Bud has a little more of a distinct flavor though. Refreshing. Anheuser-Busch would still have my respect if this is the only beer they made.

Of the American Macros, this was always a decent one (considering the competition) since it has a little flavor.  But recently I discovered La Crosse Lager from City Brewery which blows this away (for a lot less money) as far as Pale Lagers go.  I enjoy a Bud every now and then, but for an everyday beer, La Crosse Lager is vastly superior.
Dads all time favorite, not mine.  What can I add that already hasn’t been listed.  Better than Bud Light.  Only thing worse is Old Mud!
Smells like metallic urine. Looks a bit like it to. Though, not a bad beer overall. I can drink this for days. And I have. The sum is greater than its parts.
this is one of the better everyday beers the everyone drinks.  at least it has some flavor.  still not very good
Sad that this is the worlds best selling beer.  I will drink this beer only if my other option was Busch...gross

I’ve always felt that when beer is aged on wood, regardless of style it is almost always a good thing. The word almost was added after the consideration that Budweiser is beechwood aged. I’d be lying if I said that I didn’t enjoy a Budweiser now and again, however a beer (in my humble opinion) that is best served out of a warm (not room temperature but actually warm) 40oz while swimming in a lake is generally, not so good.

Hard to take this seriously after so many outstanding beers, but, since so many Buds have found their way to my belly...
Very light amber color, no head, no lacing. Aroma of cereal and corn. Tastes of nothing really, perhaps cardboard, but nothing terribly offensive. Light carbonation, very watery mouthfeel. Always preferred this to Miller High LIfe.

Essa Pale Lager norte-americana produzida na Argentina tem espuma média, aerada e branca, de reduzida longevidade. Boa formação de colarinho. Corpo borbulhante, ralo e amarelo-pálido. Aroma: pão claro, leves toques cítricos de laranja e lúpulo pesado. Sabores inicial e final: leves dulçor e amargor; média duração. Paladar: corpo leve, textura aguada, forte carbonatação e final metálico. mais adocicada que a média brasileira, sabor ligeiramente frutado, boa opção de session beer pro verão, mas sem diferenciais.4,5s
Watery, bland/tasteless and pretty much just terrible.  I would give it a zero if I could

355ml can.

Pours the palest of pales with an average sized white head. Smells like cereal, dust and lawnmower clippings. Taste is very smooth but restrained to the point that there is almost nothing there. Sweet with corn and grass. Light watery body. Very easy drinking so I guess it serves it’s purpose as being a mass produced drunkening beer.
The standard beer for every college student.  Has a little more flavor than Bud Light but is also heavier.  Best when served ice cold.
complete crap. keep drinking this if you love country music and nascar. or only buy beer advertised in the super bowl

[Sampled on my beerspeech pr-stunt face-to-face with the czech Budvar.] As a pr for one of my beerspeeches I blindtasted thisone together with Christian. The Budvar we both swallowed, but we went almost vomiting when we arrived to The Bud. I think it explains all......(and much more people joined the speech)!

Very light pale color, watery, slight metallic hop flavor and a little corn.  It’s refreshing, I’ll give it that, but if I’m looking for flavor with my refreshment I’ll go elsewhere.  It’s a typical cheap, mass produced pale lager, so what do you expect?
VERY BLAND IT AMAZES ME THAT THIS IS THE WORLDS BEST SELLING BEER. IT JUST SHOWS HOW PEOPLE CAN BE BRAINWASHED WITH ADVERTISING. ONLY DRINK IT IF ITS FOR FREE AND NOTHING ELSE IS AVAILABLE.
It smells like skunk, looks like pee, taste like corn and goes down like any other big market beer. It’s Budweiser what else can I say!
Can. Appearance: Clear, pale gold, white head. Aroma: Very little, slight sourness. Palate: Very thin. Flavor: Pretty unpleasant, a little corn, slightly sour. Overall: It is what it is.

Low soft aroma.
Refreshing golden colour.
Bitter flavor with bitter notes.
No strong, no too bitter not original.
Nothing special to say about it.
"Drink a lot" beer (when you don´t mind what you are drinking).

Not really worth a true rating.  This is a beer made very well with very little ingredients which is why it is so bland.  This does not qualify as the king of beers.  Maybe it is closer to the king of bottled water.
Better than drinking a Bud Light, For an American Lager non-light this isn’t a bad beer. What i would drink if nothing better was offered.
some of the slogans arent bad the beer doesnt live up to the hype. watery and thin, poor taste and aroma. as far as this being  the king of beers... its time for a rebellion

Thin and watery with an artificially created head. Faint taste of hops that is nearly subdued by an ever present flavor of corn. Has a harsh feel in the mouth, like it is trying to dissolve its way through my tongue.

The bottle looks good, but the advertising slogans on the bottle are too arrogant. How can they say: We make the best beer in the world. Tastes not too bad, sweet beginning, finish a little bit dry. An average beer, but interesting if you drink it the first time.

Smells okay while cold and skunked when warmer with initial evervescent head.  Rice all the way.  However not too bad a taste for what it is.  Nice alcohol content.  Nothing offensive so I won’t put it below 2.5.  Drink while cold and for what it is.  Pull your noses down a little bit.
At least it is stronger tasting pee at 5%. I can tolerate on a hot day in Texas.

This was the first beer I ever tasted (the only beer my dad drinks).  I hated it.  But I hated all beers back then.  Once I got around to liking beer, I enjoyed Budweiser for a while.  As my beer palate got more sophisticated, Bud started tasting more and more like the first time I had it.  I am now back to hating it.  But, I still have one or two anytime I go to my dad’s house.  Taste like piss, but what can you do?  Definitely NOT the King of Beers.
This fuckin’ shit sucks. I don’t know why people drink it. I used to drink this when I went to CMU now I can’t fuckin stand it.

I had honestly never had one before (not too surprising considering my age I guess), a friend offered me some... Minimal aroma. Ugly yellow, with fast disappearing head. Very thin and watery, almost no taste there. Goes down without a fight, nothing interesting. I’m not surprised people drink a beer like this, but considering it’s the same as any buck a beer, why at that price???
Most definitely not the "King of Beers" I go out of my way not to buy this beer. Perfect for rednecks who should not be allowed to drink good beer.
BOOOOOO!!!!! Watery, tasteless and fizzy. No redeeming value whatsoever. Avoid this horrible, horrible stuff.
Watery as hell and nearly tasteless.  This represents everything that is wrong with commercial brewing.

This is probably one of AHB’s best brews. Tastes like beer and I dont get that gag feeling after taking a drink. I am not saying this beer is great but I think its typical mass produced beer only slightly better.

canette de 341ml.

bière blonde industrielle, avec une mousse chimique, sans grand intérêt. odeur de malt, maïs et autres produits substitut, en bouche elle est liquide, rafraichissante, elle est sans grand intérêt pour les amateurs. pour les journées chaudes. ressemble à d’autre (sic)
For the cheap American swill, its not bad.  If you want to get drunk cheaply this of MGD are your best choices, just don’t expect a decent beer.
King of uhhh....king of beers huh? mmmmm. not so sure about that one. Largest selling because of price..not because it was fantastic. If it’s free...go for it...just dont expect a lot.
Guess we all have to rate this one - suprised I never had.  If it comes between this and not drinking I’ll happily have one.  If just about anythng else is around I’m drinking that.
Budweiser (and all it’s derivatives) are brewed by a corporation that produces beer in order to fund its marketing department.  That is all you need to know.

Plain, barely-there taste. Very basic, and non-complex. Tastes like a combination of corn extract and urine. I don’t even know why I’m typing this. We’ve all had Budweiser. Hopefully we can all agree to stay away from it.

A great cheap beer that gives you exactly what you pay for it.  A very pale color, medium head and a slightly bitter taste.  Definitily not the best American lager, but is a good find in the cooler at the tailgate.

Pours a light, clear yellow with white head. Not much aroma here to identify clearly.....some faint toasted grain and faint hop notes, some card board and popped rice. Flavor has some toasted rice and corn notes, faint grain, some sweetness, a bit grassy, fairly bland. Light body and high carbonation. Overall, nothing much to say.
great beer if the only thing at a bar is cheap beer.  It taste refreshingly crisp, otherwise cheapola.  The King of Beers, hah

my favorite of mbc’s because a fresh batch is refreshing and it gets u messed up.  That being said, this beer is wildly inconsistent in flavor, and is probably just coors light with cheap sake poured in it.  This beer does feel pretty heavy at times but leaves you wanting another.  I notice a tremendous overhang after having too many of these.  It does have a pretty strong taste, which goes away after two or three.  I love how they boast about their choicest rice on the label.  Drink it if you are broke and need to be drunk.  Otherwise leave this crap alone.

ReRate:  I need to up this one a little after being on a PBR binge for a minute.  This stuff is way better than pabst.  Thats all.

ReRate:  Bud is clean, fool.  Why do i always come back to this?  it’s worth a couple stupid pieces of green paper i guess.  get it girl.  I’ll get back to you next time i drink this love water

Re-rate:  i bit in and had a newly packaged "michelob lager".  I kinda liked the beer.  still watery lawnmower refreshment, but not too bad.....  now everytime i sip a bud i can faintly hear that michelob hop in there....  i really love budweiser and I’m a IPA drinker when it’s available and I can afford it.  I think for the average worker in america, you really can’t afford shit to eat while you are at work.  You bring some broke ass sandwich and eat it at 10.  by the time you get off u are thirsty and hungry and this beer seems to relieve that and then some. FWIW Bud, Schlitz, Miller, etc actually made decent beers before the first world war.  Due to shortages etc they had to improvise ingredients replacing grains (malt) with adjuncts.  After WW! Prohibition ruled the day, then WWII.  Thus the age of highly adjuncted mass brewed American Beers was born.... thankfully Anchor, Boston Beer, and a few others gained traction, facilitating the American Microbrew movement and we again have high quality American beer.

the original, had predominately in bottles, not bad, easy drinking no taste, nice to slam and pour down your gullet. other than that, pass on this one.
Tasted at a relative’s house, yah, I know, I need to find better relatives.  Light yellow and lacking taste.  Not the worst thing I’ve ever put in my mouth, for whatever that may be worth.
12oz bottle: bud... i mean buttwiper. drink right from the bottle dont care to smell it i see what it looks like. covered in off flavors but its cheap so i cant be too mad.
not much to this beer but its cheap,  and your not to mad if it gets knock over

I’ve had this so many times, I’ve never thought until now to subject it to rigorous examination and review it.  Aroma is maybe some corn, devoid of most hops and malts.  BORING!!!  The appearance is the same old yellow as most pale lagers.  The flavor is ok, if you’re pounding them down near frozen in an attempt to get wasted fast.  Mostly corn, some malts, no hoppiness.  The finish is unpleasant, a little bitter if anything.  It is what it is, my friends.  Actually, I like the comment from  JeffMinde, who called it the Victory Gin of beers.  Right on the money.
It was a beer...made in the US...massly distributed...lots of people love it...glad I’m not one of them.

The Victory Gin of Beers. Budweiser is the best-selling and most widely-distributed beer on the planet. There is a reason for this, the "Not Too" Factor, as in "It’s not too bitter, not too sweet, not too dark, not too light, not too...and so on. As a matter of fact, if there was a pH scale for beers (let’s invent one and call it the bH Scale), Budweiser would be the Zero Point in the center. This accounts for its massive popularity, as it has something to appeal to everyone, or nothing to appeal to anyone, depending on your outlook.. 

Budweiser’s boast to be "The King of Beers" is deserved in market sales percentage and advertising dollars spent, but there isn’t much here that stands out as a beer qua beer against microbrews or even mass-production competitors. The best thing that can be said about it (and this IS something) is that the latest Budweiser you consumed tastes EXACTLY like the first Budweiser you ever had. The uniformity of the stuff is consistent, and in a consumer culture consistency outweighs many other factors. This is not an aficionado’s beer by any stretch, more like mildly alcoholic soda pop. It deserves its low ratings because it stands out in no category.

Best served in mass quantities at large venues like the Superbowl, the beer has about as much personality as the styrofoam cup it comes in. 

You’ll drink it because its there, and too often in many restaurants it’s the only it’s that is there.

I drank rivers of this in my youth, as did we all, but I hadn’t had any in years. The other night I went to a concert at the Lowell (MA) Memorial Auditorium and this was one of just two beers available, the other being Bud Light. Purely in the interests of science, I paid $5.00 (!) for a 12 oz. cup of Bud. Rather to my surprise, it was as bad--if not worse--than my memory of it. It came with a very thin, gauzy film on top. The color beneath this was a fairly deep yellow. The aroma was mostly very sour, with a faint hint of sweetness--that faint hint being the only even slightly decent quality the beer had. Flavor was extremely bland and very sour with a nasty, unpleasant aftertaste. The tail was sour and ugly, too, but it was no different than the rest in that respect; I guess you could say I got a ’smooth’ cup. Temperature was no excuse for bad flavor in this case; the beer was ice-cold. No doubt it would have been utterly undrinkable warm. The palate was as thin as rice paper and as watery as the Atlantic Ocean. It had me trotting to the loo several items to get rid of it, another Bud effect I recall from the old days. The kick was very mild. Boy, was this stuff atrocious. I have sampled a lot of mediocre pale lagers in recent months: Schaefer, Schlitz, Carling BL, Foster’s, Modelo, Tecate. I can definitely state that ALL of these are not only better than Bud, but MUCH better. Still, it’s nice to see a hallowed American brand like this fully justify its reputation.

OK. I know it’s bashed by every beer afficianado who’s ever lived! I’ve done it myself. Maybe it’s because it’s easy to hate numero uno. Then again, maybe it’s because the beer really gets more attention than it deserves. It’s your typical American lager. Very light in both color and flavor. What "nose" there is, is all hops and not much at that. It’s not even brewed with 100% barley malt for goodness sakes (I believe the exact percentage is 80%)! Rice is used as an adjunct! 
So, why then is this rater giving it a relatively high score? Well, when compared to other beers of it’s kind, such as Miller, Pabst, Coors, bottled water... well, it really IS the best of the other beers similiar. Now, having said that, ’scuse me while I go pop open a Konig Pils and sit back and relax.
Bottle/can/draught.  Somehow this beer seems to be everywhere in the world.  It’s on tap in Lux City?  Almost no aroma, watery taste and thin mouthfeel.  Pale lager with a touch of bitterness.

Ok, so it’s easy to bash this beer... I’m gonna do it anyway.  I’m not a big fan of pale lagers in the first place as I like the darker stuff but this isn’t even a good pale lager.  The color seems wrong and the taste, well, the taste is not good.  Very bitter on the back end.  I guess if a person was looking to get torn down this would do the job but why, people, why?????
The only thing worse than this beer is the companies sub beers (Ice, lite, etc)

As Bud is probably the most maligned and despised beer in both the RB or BA, I thought to give it round. I don’t know many people that didn’t start with Bud in their teens or in college, so I refrain from bashing it needlessly. My sample came from a cold can, into a glass, and it looked ok with many bubbles at first. Pale yellow in its facade, it didn’t look like much, but I reached for the pint glass and it had an oddly familiar syrupy aroma. With a slight grainy taste, the Bud had an unwelcome bite in its aftertaste. There was nothing to flourish and no magic waiting in the wings to save the moment.
Beer made from rice. Beer should NOT me made from rice. That is Unamerican! One in every five beers sold in America is Bud. Oh my god!!!!!!!!!!! Run and hide!

After about ten minutes of sitting in the glass it smells as stale as it would if it had sat overnight. Mild grainy-sweet flavor that isn’t as bad as I expected and finishes relatively clean in the mouth but not the belly. Harsh carbonation. It is too processed to ever be taken seriously. It leaves a strange burning sensation in my esophagus and stomach and feels toxic. I only opened this can as a joke during an NFL game and am actually thinking it’s not as bad as I remembered in the flavor department but still cannot finish the can. It actually gets worse with each sip and I’ve downgraded it since my initial rating.

Being of good conscience I could not let my rating of Budweiser stand seeing how I rated it by memory alone. I am here to reevaluate the King. 
With fresh (tall boy) can in hand, I crack and pour...... 
B E A utiful head! I should poor a Bud once a week just for the aesthetic pleasure of it. 
Medium longevity and a lacing that reminds me of a bubble bath. The beer itself  is a light yellow and crystal clear. Max points for presentation. 
Aroma? A wet beach towel you forgot in the trunk of your car from last weekend. 
Flavor: It’s very, very light and just sweet enough not to over ride the taste buds ability to sense the lack of flavor you just didn’t experience. 

You absolutely must try this. Pinch your nose and take a big gulp of Bud....... Without smelling the week old beach towel, all you get is fizzy, faintly sweet water!

Here we go - the king steps forward to be rated.  This was formerly the gold standard for American beers, and thank goodness that is no longer true.  I will brush away all past conceptions and observe.  Cool label.  Light color and foamy little head.  Slightly bland aroma, but not bad, with floral hints.  It is lightly fizzy and fairly dry with a light-medium body.  The flavor is inoffensive - light hops and corn, water.  This probably goes well with most foods.  It is not bad, but is not flavorful.  Could we call it the most average beer of all?  No - below average.

On tap at Mady’s Bowling Lounge in Columbia Heights, MN.  Pale yellow but had a brilliant white head.  Has a faint, sweet aroma.  Taste is very light.  Better than the Icehouse, Special Export, and Busch I also had yesterday night.

Go to a local distributor and try some imports beers and find  out that for a few bucks less and a lot less drinking you too can finally enjoy Beer.

Notes: From the can on the plane, this is what heppens if you ask for "a beer" on an Emirates flight from NZ -> Manchester. Piss-yellow, foamy, and way too fizzy. This was one of the very first beers I ever had.  ALthough hardly great, it is a decent beer, especially for a basic lager.  It has a simple but pleasant aroma of sweet grain and cooked rice with what may be a faint flowery hop element.  The taste is mostly lightly sweet grain but this is pleasant and lasts without vanishing as is the case with many others like Coors.  There is only a very faint hop quality and bitterness and there is a light, fizzy, mineral-water/7-up quality but the soft grain aroma and taste last.  It’s easy to drink yet retains some good flavour.
Whatever. Some sweet and bland maltiness. Watery. Might come in handy as a thirst-quencher, otherwise avoid.

BTW...I’m only testing out this system, so I thought I’d test it on the least deserving of beers. But this site’s strictures don’t give a person a whole lot of chances to get a feel for the way it works before jumping into the ratings, so pay no attention to this review...I’m only trying to exceed the minimum characters in order to see what my review looks like.

Growing up in St. Louis, you do get numb to drinking Budweiser.  Is is a good beer? No way if you are used to craft beers.  Is it the worst beer? After all the mass marketing, many say yes after getting bombarded by the infinite # of commercials, ads, etc. from Anheuser-Busch.  I am experienced enough to gone through worse beers (old Falstaff made in St. Louis, Hamms, Coors Light or Busch Light to name a few infamous ones).  If a craft brewer would make a beechwood aged Lager, it could rate as a decent beer with tweaking the recipe.  With the use of rice, lack of hops and the barest hint of the beechwood, the lack of overall aroma/appearance and flavor makes this beer barely decent (my St. Louis bias probably kept the rating a few tenths of a point higher).  Add the excessive mass marketing, however, and  you can get enough lemmings to drink anything.
