Brother-in-law (Timmy Time)’s beer.  I like the Taste and Aroma.  It’s not bold or over powering.... Except after two or three.  I get a terrible headache, and bloated feeling.  And I don’t smell very good the next day.  Always can tell the farm-hands who like their Bud beer the next day.

It is neither that good (as the sales suggest) or as bad (as some people suggest). It is simply a mass produced lager with little to praise. A light golden color with a white frothy head. The taste is pretty bland and somewhat fizzy, you can tell it’s made from corn and rice. Nothing special, except for the marketing.
There is nothing particularly special about this beer other then the funny commercials.
The Coca-Cola of beers - ubiqutous beer.  The best way to describe this is like its the Kraft Cheese of beer.  Misunderstood for what it is...good with water logged hot dogs at a baseball game.
I can’t tell the difference between regular Budweiser and Bud Light, and I question those who say they can.
pale should describe the shade you turn when you drink this. i hate the after taste. carbonated yellow #9 dyed water. the warmer this beer gets, the worse it tastes."

Not so bad. Its cheap and drinkable. You can drink twelve of these and still be standing. As someone else said, PERFECT for a hot day, drinkable and actually hydrates you as opposed to high alcohol content beers.  resiewdub and budweiser mean.  remember every soldier in every war died united because u deserve what every individual should enjoy regularly.

Well, it’s been said a lot here: King of Beers my eye!  Watered down, faint taste, no finish.  Which is a good thing because any lingering taste would be unwelcome.  In bottles, on draught, from kegs, in cans.

how pretentious to call themselves the king of beer! I think about 2000 breweries all over the world have more legitimate claims at that title than Anheuser Busch.

golden color, very watery/bitter flavor.
boring.
Gold colour, harsh carbonation, very watery. Of the little flavor there is i taste corn. Corn Syrup tanks out back of the brewery?
Good Beer very easy to drink on a hot day or just hanging out with your friends.  Long Live The King!
Golden Color, bitter taste, grainy carbonation, refreshing, ok to drink it when you are with a lot of friends

8/1/07 From the can.  Aroma is light, yeasty sour, corny, with slight green apple tartness.  Appearance is very pale yellow with moderate head retention.  Flavor is grainy carbonation with bitter balance forward.  Finish is slightly sour.  Mouthfeel is medium/low bodied with a medium carb bite.  Overall, somewhat refresing, but extremely plain.

What is this? This is pretty close as it gets to almost not even being "beer."  Watery. Obviously made as cheaply as possible. It’s not good, and has an unpleasant, somewhat chemical aftertaste. No flavor, no aroma, no palate. Refreshing on a hot day? probably.. but so is tap water.

Budweiser is so ubiquitous in America that you can really only say one thing about it: boring. Do I even need to describe taste or presentation? I feel like kind of a jerk for even submitting a rating.
Anyways, at this point, with the numbing bombardment of Bud advertising we receive everyday, the only remaining redeeming quality of Bud is that you can order it at any bar in America without having to worry about looking like a jackass because they don’t carry it.
No taste, a disgrace to all real beer. It’s better to just get Busch, or Milwaukee’s Best. Same terrible taste, but at least you get them dirt cheap.

[427-20070718] 473mL. Light grassy yeast aroma with a little vegetable. Clear, yellow body with a quick foamy white head. Metallic grainy grass and earth flavour, unpleasant aftertaste. Bubbly light body. There’s only one throne that I can imagine this beer reigning.
16oz aluminum / it really does smell and taste better than bud lite; just a slightly heavier version of bud lite, more acceptable.
can. taste is fair but somewhat skunnky. smell is differnt. fair for a mass produced beer.

355ml can. pour transparent yellow with a medium white head that dissapeared quickly. lotsa carbonation. no aroma at first, as it warm slightest corn sweetness came out. flavour almost non-existent except same slight corn sweetness. very easy drinking and light bodied. i remember when i used to waste money on this beer. very boring and not very good.

This is who I am; this is where I’m from; this is what I believe in when the day is done.  Well, not really, but their advertising is very catchy.  I don’t mind drinking Bud but it doesn’t have a whole lot going for it.  Except beechwood aging.
This beer is extremely carbonated and has a really bitter taste. A good beer to drink at celebrations or parties
This beer is crap! I use to drink this in high school with my 5 dollar lunch money. I grew up found good beer and never looked back!
Sweaty malt aroma, pale amber color, cardboard flavor. Well carbonated, but just awful in the mouth.

I woke up from a night of partying one morning to find a few of these in my roommate’s mini fridge.  I didn’t have work that day so I double fisted these bad boys and caught a decent buzz.  Next to no flavor, goes down like water. Not worth purchasing.  In fact, try to avoid this beverage if you can, unless you’re trying to be ironic...

The King of all BMC’s. A grainy lager with grainy aroma, taste and finish. I’ve never liked Bud, and this official tasting has not changed my mind. That being said, the new bottle was GREAT.

Had this in on eof those new 16 oz., thick, insulated, red aluminum bottles. Even on a hot summer day by the pool, this bottle seemd to keep the beer cold for an exceptionally long time, which was great since I was in no hurry to finish it. 

If only Bud could put a decent beer in this cool bottle!!!

I grew up drinking Bud (then I grew up).  Bud to me was the best of what was available in the hot, humid southeast US.  Man, I have quite an investment in Anheuser Busch and it shows on my waist, not bank account.  Boil shrimp in Bud, don’t drink it!
Good beer to pour over a steak, or to quench a thirst but not something to drink if your looking to have a beer.
Terribile, una delle peggiori che conosco; per fortuna sono anni ed anni che non la bevo. All’epoca era già l’ultima spiaggia. Addio, Budweiser.

Better than many cheap American macros but it does cost a bit more than the super-cheapies.  Best ice cold, of course, and quite drinkable.  Only within the realm of mass-produced American pale lagers can A-B even think about calling this the "King of Beers".  Even then, that label has to be purely based on sales.  It’s amazing what advertising can accomplish.  It’s OK for the category but if I’m on a budget I’ll save a few bucks and get some PBR instead.

Slight aroma, very pale, heavy carbonation, good head, not much lace, head was more fizzy than creamy, very mild flavor with a very slight bite, went down well, but not much body or texture.  Would drink if friend offered it to me, might buy in a pinch.  Not the worst beer I’ve ever had, better than many macros,but definitely not among my first choice for beer.
Crisp, Refreshing, no strong flavor, just normal, resembles mexican beers without the skunky smell, and not alot of carbonation.
Water in a bottle. A mainstream beer with no real taste. Drinkability is great, but nothing else is.
Nothing special in any way.  Crisp, but flat, with no distinct flavor and a watery finish.  Only useful for a game of beer pong.

I’ve had a lot of cheap beers, but this is my favorite.  I’ve had a lot of good beers, but I can still drink this one when the occasion arises.  I prefer it over High Life because its not so buttery, a little more crisp.  It has kind of a flat, corn, bitter (not hops) sort of taste.  Drinkable when I need to, but certainly not the worst cheap beer.

I have had two versions of this beer, the Anheuser-Busch brewed version in the bars of Memphis, Tennessee, and the "brewed in Canada by Labatt under license...." I’ll take the Canadian version hands down.  Sadly, the Canadian version sucks too.  For a beer that is as heavily advertised as it is, and sells as much as it does, the rating here says it all.  This is America’s finest pisswater (Labatt Blue is Canada’s finest pisswater).  It amazes me when I go out with friends, there is always one who orders Bud.  Take a gamble people, try one of the beers on tap you’ve never heard of....they’re great (with all due respect to Tony the Tiger).  This is one of those beers I will go out of my way to avoid.  Having it in your fridge is a great way to get taken off my Christmas card list!

A stadium moment, that’s all. Drank it at a ball game tonight. First sip is alright. But it gets all downhill from there. When you’re done, you feel you’ve drink something coming out of a polluted lake.

Amazing what you can do with rice, when you think about it.  Tastes almost like beer - or at least the cleanest tasting macro-swill, IMO.  Now if only we could get people who take that "King of Beers " advertising puffery seriously to spend an extra couple of bucks and discover what they’re missing.  BUY AGAIN? Buy, no. Accept when there is no real beer available, yes.

Very light, pale-ish yellow with no head at all.    Some sweet simple malt smell.  Too highly carbonated on first taste.  Just the mildest bit of bitterness, with  malty, corn, rice-ish sweetness following in the aftertaste.  Quite sweet actually, but the intense carbonation kind of strips the tongue making it hard to taste it after a while.  A bit harsh on the palate.  Not a great beer, obviously, but the worst part was the unusual headachy buzz this gave me.  Would rather drink just about anything else.

Very minimal trace of hops and barley but plenty of water.  -A corporate way to save money, too bad it’s not made in China.  Add insult to injury call it pale lager. I call it bullpiss.


 Thin and watery like skim milk. No taste. Not worth it.
Well I am not even going to bother writing a rating of this one.  not worth it.
The King of Be..........oh, nevermind.  "Bud Heavy" as many call it is a pretty lousy beer.  Corn and wet grains.  Better than its little brother, but not much else.
33 cL can. Pours pale yellow with a huge white head. Aroma is grainy, hay and a touch of grass. Flavour vague malty, watery. Finish has very little bitterness. Very bland.
xxx not a beer i ever recommend drinking.. but is not my friend.  cool commericals, and those have even been flaky as of late.
Yellow beer with no head. Watery and light. Sweet. No bitterness. A regular macro pilsen

It’s smoother than hell....HIGHLY drinkable....and very light in flavor and mouthfeel. I think they spend more on advertising and their fancy cans than they do in the product itself, but still...a decent American classic that, I wish, wasn’t going up in price like it is. I’ve been drinking it regularly for several years now, and I DON’T get the headaches or the poops like soooo many people have claimed to from Bud. I guess you need to suck it up, and build a tolerance to this swill??!! OR, if you have enough money to buy all the yummy micros out there...then just do that, and skip the Bud. My friend Robert Blevins married a bitch.
No good(yeah).  Better than any bud or miller(american of course).  It’s about the best taste at the resturaunts down here(Beaumont, TX).

Vintage 1985. Decaturstevo brought this to the tasting, and it appears that this bottle was aged in a horse shed. Dust covered, no label, and the cap was severely weathered. Why I opened this is beyond me. Pours golden with no head or carbonation. Flavor was quite interesting. Flavors of corn, caramel, and some faint biscuit were melded into some sherry like oxidation, which may have improved the beer some. Had this had carbonation and been cold, I may have actually liked this.
sucks balls no taste, not nothing, aweful.  sucks, sucks, sucks, why do people drink this beer?  no color, no taste, no nothing.
Bud is great for peanuts and a baseball game - that’s about it.  These posts and comments are great!
its bud. its crap, people give it to me all the time, the only thing worse is bud light, i cant tell the difference between it and bud select to be honest.
My mother told me that if you didn’t have anything good to say you shouldn’t say anything at all...........hmmmmm.... Nice can?  It’s better than Bud light?......Well, I tried.

16 oz can left over from an after-work cookout.  Born on date 25May07.  Looks like the urine sample I submitted for my last drug test, only fizzier.  Very weak sweet malt aroma, very weak sweet malt flavor, very weak watery mouthfeel.  Budweiser is the beer version of carbon monoxide:  colorless, odorless, tastelss, lethal in large doses.
On tap at the Rogers Centre - fizzy, light gold, adjunct laden, simple, refreshing.  That’s all.
Good cheap beer if you must go cheap.  Watered down flavor.  Not much better than Miller’s products...but better
The only use of this beer is for drinking games at college parties. Pours a light gold with a thin vanishing head. Not really much to say about taste, aroma or palate.

’the king of beers’.
sometimes i think that budweiser is the perfect symbol of the end of civilisation as we know it.
other times i just laugh.
this is tasteless in the extreme.
This is not even king of the macro beers.  What is there to say that hasn’t already been said?  No aroma, the color of urine, and very little flavor.  Use only in an emergency.
I hate this beer. It’s light brother isn’t that bad for bitter piss, but this is really bad beer. King of bitter piss.

I must admit...there is always Budweiser at my house....It smells like Bud, looks like Bud, tastes like Bud.  There is nothing special or mind blowing...just reminds me of college...so it is a warm fuzzy feel good beer.

An embarrassment to the United States.  There are so many good beers in the US.  How is this one of the most popular?  Watery, tasteless mess of a beer!  This beer should not be served in any vessel, but poured straight into the toilet.

I just can’t understand the popularity of this beer. I’m sure we have so many fine choices of beer in America that would represent our country in beer culture. I understand that not everyone can afford fine beer, but this is not even beer to me. It tastes like water!
This is a beer I don’t even enjoy drinking when offered to me for free. It lacks taste and character, and never satisfies
It’s a beer, it’s consistent, and you can get it at almost any bar. I don’t like it quite as much as MGD, but I will drink it if it’s there.

To call this "The King of Beers" is a disgrace to all kings... including King George, King Kong and Vlad the Impaler.  This is beer’s only redeeming quality is price... thus the reason I rated it a 7 on overall score.  Anytime a friend serves this "beer" at a party, it makes me want to punch that friend in the face!  And, the hangovers after a night of drinking this well water... forget about it.  You wouldn’t want to wish that type of pain in the head or stomach on your worst enemy.

Not bad.  I actually like the taste.  I think it might just be me, but whenever I drink anything Busweiser I just get a reminiscant feeling of eating corn flakes.  I really don’t get it.  but it’s good though especially for people on a budget.  Drank straight from the bottle

Very interesting beer to have tried. It gives you a good perspective of the powers of good marketing. It is much worse than expected. Very far from what I would consider a beer. Everything is bad; the smell, the taste, the finish. The only positive is that it looks like a very pale lager in the glass.

bottle.
Its amaxing how much this stuff sells for what it actually is.
Pretty amazing that it is possible to make beer into somehting as bland and watered down as this!
yeah, its budweiser.  everyone knows budweiser.   get a burger, or some wings or something, and grab one if you have to.  its served everywhere, and its ok.  (better than water with dinner)
yes, bud deisel.  the most popular american beer.  good frosty tatse but lacks so much to give it the status of a great lager.
definitely not my first choice in beers but not the worst either. bud light is the worst...lol. looks okay in the glass and in my opinion tastes best in a long neck bottle.

Very seriously the worst I have ever tried. I really wanted to give Budweiser the benefit of the doubt and have tried it many times (I even took the brewery tour in St. Louis) but the result is always the same...it’s just terrible. Anheuser Busch makes a few beers that are quite good, but I have no idea how this ever ended up the most popular beer in the world. I won’t even drink it if it is the only beer available, which it often is at Bud sponsored concerts, I would rather have water.

A 22 oz bottle with the trademark born on date. The beer poured a light golden body with a fizzy white head. The smell is of grain and malt. A good taste that is slightly bitter with a faint banana. No lacing but the carbonation is just right.

Canette de 12 oz oubliée chez moi par un des mes oncles… wooohoooo quelle chance :o) Arôme: Arôme de malt et de maïs. Apparence: La couleur est paille avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence d’un moyen col mousseux avec une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de maïs. Courte durée de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est mince avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Très légère présence d’houblon en arrière goût. (Rating #1050)
Tap in Tempe, AZ. After this beer I am really looking forward to go back to Belgium (people are nice but beer…).  Light yellow, very watery, I can’t be bothered…

For a macro-brew beer, I think Budweiser easily takes the cake.  What other beer can you get a tall can for 1.50, a 30 pack for 16.99 and enjoy each and every beer.  Of course this isn’t a beer to simply enjoy.  It gets the job done, taste great, and is quite light in my opinion.  By far the best Bud product on the market.  I’m ashamed of all the men that prefer Bud Light over this old fashion Bud.

Serves its purpose =p  This beer taste unbelievably different from can/bottle/draft.   
I think i prefer the can the best haha! Bottle = flavorless & Draft = bad/sour malt

Can, Bottle, Tap. Nice beer, I wanna know how the people hate this beer?
Clear gld color, nice taste and flavor, you can feel the barley aroma with some banana smell. The flavor is refreshing and good, with the midway of bitterness.

Cerveja clara, saborosa com aroma de cevada e algum aroma de banana. Refrescante a com o meio termo para o amargo, desce redondo!
I hadn’t drank this in years, probably wont drink for years again. Nothing I can say or do that someone else has already said. Horrible
i had one of these the other day, it was quite refreshing for about a minute then it was just bad. rice & corn, blah taste comes through too much.
Can:  Very strong alcohol flavor, bad bitter.  Watery.  Looks good though.  Does not go down to smooth due to the alcohol flavor.

Good old Bud Heavy. Adjuncty aroma nd flavor. Piss yellow. Very carbonated. Sweet and chemically. The only people that like this shit probably work for the company or are 75 years old. I mean, dont get me wrong. I would drink it if it was the only beer available and I was on a mission, but by no means will I ever purchase this crap unless I am under extreme circumstances.

Cannette. De couleur jaune pâle et transparente. Nez de grains de malt pâle, léger de maïs sucré et de riz bouilli avec des notes herbeuses gazonnées et des traces métalliques. Très mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture assez aqueuse. Très léger goût de grains de malt pâle légèrement croustillants lors de l’entrée en bouche suivi d’un léger goût sucré de maïs et de riz puis une finale aux faibles notes herbeuses (gazonnées) et avec de petites traces métalliques. Post-goût très court aux notes sèches, composé de traces herbeuses (gazon mouillé) et de traces métalliques.

King of beers? Do they honestly mean that? It’s cheap, crappy, and the low lifes of the world wear it on t-shirts they bought at wal-mart like the american flag. Obviously, as we all know, biggest doesn’t make it the best....

The Beer of the Big Brother of the Brave New World dominated by Amerika and Madison Avenue. Suck-suck. This almost baddest beer on continents, but maybe one more can better suck, also by Angsthouse-Butch. Underrated for its suckful. Not even palates feel good on he-man dicks. Flavor of blow. Second nose is of sellout. Second taste is of blandness; similar to pennies cut from the dollars of a brewing budget for profit. Aroma can also tend to business man’s bathroom handshake. Appearance is sometimes, and maybe some surprise for the piss of farm animal, with the overarching glow of stupid American industrial theory of efficiency management and hegemony. Overpriced at 25 cents per 8 oz draft. Would rather drink dirty water, but I must say this is slightly better than Coors.

Twist off cap bottle pours fizzy and yellow.  Head dissapears quickly and there is no lacing as I drink.  Flavor is malty and quite sweet once you get through all the wateryness.  Almost no finish.  Is this beer?
Unfortunately one of the worst beers in the world. It name is synonimous of poor beer. Only to drink it near Ecuator line very cold. No colour, no smell, no body. Nothing. Is bad between the worst...

ive never seen what budweiser actually looks like because i always drank it out of a can or bottle, but when i poured it i almost vomited - it was a light yellow urine color with a head resembling that of diet coke. aroma was not much better with a synthetic feel dominating whatever lager properties this beer has. the taste was very simple and once against very synthetic, the slight bitterness was the only thing i was even able to distinguish... this lingered on your lips and did not develop to much more aside from the mild alcohol and carbonation test... overall awful - no reason to pay more for this than beast ice or colt 45

I do all I can to avoid this beer. This beer is proof of how well advertising works. There is nothing good about this beer yet people still buy it. The only time I drink it is when I’m at the house of one of those people.

I was at the Cards game and had no other choices, I had to drink this or water.  Beer is still better than water.  The pour was foamy-white sitting atop crystal clear, light gold.  Aroma?  Not really.  Not as crisp and clean of a flavor as the Bud Select I had before this one.

Cans/bottles/Draft. Pours a clear golden body with large foamy white head. Aroma is crisp malt and light grass. Mouthfeel is light with lots of carbonation and notes of malt, sweet grass, grain and corn cereal. Basic lager.
Cerveja pilsen refrescante. Um gosto frutado gostoso, suavemente adocicado. Um pouco aguada. Coloração e espuma normais. Boa para os dias quentes.
everyone has had it. i just don’t know anyone who drinks it regular. apperance is typical of a american macro. i prefer it over MGD. serves its purpose as a beer for a hot summer day or with pizza.
Use the right tool for the job. Not a beer you would drink from a tulip glass, but fine as an ice chest beer on a hot day.

Bottle 0.33 L.
Pale yellow body with a small, fizzy, white head, fully diminishing with virtually no lacing.
Very light malty aroma, maybe with some hints of sugar and an unpleasant note of medicine.
Light bitter and sweet notes in the flavour.
Body is light with a watery texture; soft carbonation.
Not satisfactory at all!

Rated 12/2/05:  A standard American beer, better than most of the others around but too expensive for what you get. It’s what I drink when I’m golfing or at my old man’s house but that’s about It, hey I’m a Strohs man.

Bottle. Drank this under sufferance after a friend mistakenly bought it rather than a Budvar. It was as vile as I remember - grim chemical aroma and aftertaste, odd sweet edge and no hops in evidence anywhere. Abysmal.

What a hangover this gives you . All those bloody chemicals. Drank a box load at party, man did I suffer. Actually prefer it from a can, rather than a bottle.....re-rated, actually not that bad now - must be used to it1!!!
just to get you drunk or to get you through the nascar race. nothing to be proud of

I drank this at a party because there wasn’t anything else available. Appearance is typical of an American macrobrew lager. Aroma is malty and better than I expected, but not wonderful. Taste is malty and rather wan. Though it is zingy and jazzy in the mouth, it is not a memorable beer. Well, I had to try it after drinking craft beers for so long.
Water in a bottle. No flavour other than the chemicals used to produce it. Overpriced too. Coors is slightly better but almost as bad.

Can.  I thought this would be thirst quenching refreshment after a hot day gardening. Instead it was a sweet mess with lots of chemically flavours. Most of it watered the plants and I hope the slugs enjoy it before their watery graves. I’ve been generous with the appearance as I thought it was a fairly average looking can and the glimspe of a pale stream of liquid cascading onto the plants was fleeting at best.
I think I was being too generous with my rating. Puts the "pee" in pee-water beer.

All right! Who’s the wise guy who brought this to my tasting session? Oh well, a beer is a beer... Pours a light pale thin gold brew with a fizzy fast dissolving white head. Aroma, white wonder bread and some sugar. Taste is dry and too clean. Finish is flat. American’s best beer? Sorry to inform you guys but the "Emperor has no clothes!"

Bottle, 33 cl. Extremely pale yellow colour, small and short-lasting white head. Very weak malt aroma, but at least clean, except for a faint hint of corn . Did I mention that there is no hops? Extremely watery. Flavour has a tiny hint of sweetness, and a tiny hint of bitterness as well, thus making this is a balanced, but entirely meaningless beer.
King of What?  tastes like alka seltzer with beer flavoring added.  The best thing about this beer is the commercials and nothing else.

12oz bottle.  A slight hint of hopps but over powered by macro skunk.  Average sized quickly disappearing head.  Yellow and fizzy.  Flavor is all macro brew, chemical and unappealing but I’ve tasted worse.  A classic macro brew with a cool label.

Had this one at Huberts in downtown Minneapolis before a Minnesota Twins game. It was served in a plastic bottle so no aroma or appearance. Indeed it was crisp and clean, but very little flavor to speak of. Their ads claim a balance between refreshment and taste, but that’s not quite right. Still I prefer this to MGD or Grain Belt, if I am forced into drinking a pale lager.
how can people not like this drink of the gods. this beer is awesome for just about everything. from eating to just beer bash. this beer proves that we should bow down to the king of beers

King of beers my ass. Bland color with a lame bland taste. Old Milwuake is a better beer on all fronts then Bud. Very disipointing that this is the best selling beer in Canada. Ive been trying to highten my horizons of beer and from my beer drinking experence this is a low quality low taste beer. There is alot of cheep malt liquors that I enjoy even over Budweiser.
It is called king of beers, for me it has no taste or wathever. I visited the brewery and mentioned that they have to come to belgium for real beer. Real not my taste

they dont call it the king of beers for nothing. people who say it is bad beer are just used to their high-fallooting more expensive beer. sure there are lots of better beers than Budweiser, but for a nice good ol’ fashioned picnic or just a cold brew after a hard days work, this is heaven. Period.

Loaded with preservatives. Way too much carbonation. As to why a company would use rice and corn in their beer is beyond me.  This beer is notorious for turning people into beer alcoholics. Its cancer in a bottle. Period.
Not good. I hadn’t rated it yet, and my roommate brought some back so i tried it again. Not something you should buy. Watery, smells bad, not fun.

in bottle.
Brewed and bottle in Argentina.
Golden pale color, yellowish. Effervescent, and gaseous enough. Aroma to yeast, with something of citrus fruits in the fund. The flavor has an agreeable bitterness, something salty. The body is light and thin. It has a sweet finish, which it denounces some bad added.
Frozen well, and in a warm day, this beer can surprise it.
regular american pilsner on a weekend of bad beer choices (I could use a nice stout with frothy head and a caramal finish right now) don’t drink unless out of options
Please, no more Bud.  I would like to send those stupid horses to the glue/dogfood factory.
Giving thi substance the name "beer" is a joke.  No flavor, all gas.  If you try drinhing it at room temperature, it tastes like urine.

Why can’t we score lower than 0.5?? To me, Budweiser is the king of overhyped American lagers that lack taste (no offense Dale Jr.).    I couldn’t even drink this stuff when I was a poor college student...I’d save so I could have one Guiness Stout as opposed to 3 Buds....I’m getting ill just thinking about the taste of the very few Buds I’ve had.
Bottle.  Empty nose.  Slightly more body than the LITE version.  No bitterness. Completely unremarkable.
Bottle.33cl. It is absolut one bad beer, no malty taste what so ever, and no hop´s for that matter.

This beer has no enjoyment for me... it’s more like the king of water.  Drink a few of these and your stomach won’t feel to well in the morning, gotta love all that carbonation.  Once again a beer to drink if you can’t afford something better... but why not spend the extra $2?
There really is no reason to drink this beer. None. If you can’t shell out an extra two or three bucks to buy something respectable you probably shouldn’t be buying beer in the first place.
What can I say, this is the old American standby.  It pours a yellowish hue and just a standardized pale lager taste.  Overly carbonated.  Drink only cold.

well that’s done.....whatever happened to the bud dry! i don’t give a damn i liked bud dry. ooohhh screw you! i rate this for all the clean buzzes in the past. and all the stomach discomfort suffered over infused carbonation after a 2 hour grueling workout. runners beware!
Bottle.I got this only because I didn’t want to rate it from memory.Pale yellow.Watery.There will always be something better to order than this.I may never drink it again.Awful.

It tasted like dirty water. Discusting. Then again, at least it didn’t taste like rotten cabbage. Not that I’ve ever tasted a beer that has, but that would just be an awful flavor to submit yourself to.

The flavour is weakly sweet, a bit like flat lemonade, but with a wet bread/kitchen sponge taste. Virtually no bitterness and no body. An inspid beer.

Pours a clear yellow. “Darker” than some fizzy yellow beers, but that’s not saying much. To call it straw colored or amber colored would be a sinful lie. A sparse white head leaves no lacing at all. There’s a mild aroma that I will just call beery, and let it go at that. It doesn’t smell artificial.

The flavor isn’t quite malt. There’s a very light generic sweetness, that doesn’t need to be balanced with hops. Perhaps it isn’t balanced with hops. I don’t know, I can’t really taste anything that suggests hops.

Light bodied, very smooth, and no aftertaste

The commercial discription explains this beer perfectly.  Hype and volume but no mention to flavor or taste.  Consistently get headaches the next day from this beer.  It’s almost a carbonated water that sat close to beer in the shelf and picked up the taste from that.  Almost no head to this beer, pale in color.

Well, that time has come. Someone left a few bottles of Bud in my fridge, so I knew I had to give my old sidekick an honest rating, and that’s what I did. I should confess that I drank another, from the bottle, and it was somehow more aromatic. But this rating is from a beer mug. "Born on" 15 Nov ’06. I gave it an aggressive pour to help build the head, and release as much aroma as possible. That head was pure white, very frothy, and short-lived. I was shocked to see a few strands of bubbles clinging to the sides of glass, which was the extent of the lacing. The body is crystal clear, with occasional bubbles seen rising, and is the palest shade of yellow I have ever seen; I never realized how truly watery this beer is. Of course, Bud drinkers don’t give a damn about appearance, so I guess this former Bud drinker just never took notice. I very sincerely could not detect any aroma at first. After nearly sticking my nose in it, and inhaling so hard I got light-headed, I was able to catch the faintest hint of cereal, with a skunky note. Mouthfeel is thin and watery, as expected. The only thing separating this from water is the carbonation, which is actually just enough to keep it interesting. Flavor is...Budweiser. Everyone knows it, but it can’t be described. The best I can do is to call it "unique." Finishes lightly bitter, so I guess they actually do toss a handful of hop pellets in each industrial-sized batch. I noticed that some other raters, who gave poor scores, were yet rather descriptive of the aromas and flavors of this beer. I just don’t see it; this stuff is truly empty. My low category ratings are not facetious -- this stuff really is that weak. I once said I’d give Bud an overall rating of 10, just for the label. I lied...but I do still love that label. Rating this swill dropped my "Average Rating" below 3, so I feel Anheuser-Busch now owes me something. If they release a halfway decent beer, I’ll be satisfied. The best thing about Bud is the buzz.

beer pours a pale straw yellow, with a lot of carbonation and a suprisingly dense head that actually retains (well, not for long, but better than the coca-cola foam I was expecting) and leaves light lace. aroma is grainy, with a hint of green apple, and perhaps a light sulfer note. flavor is clean and fizzy, with some light grainy sweetness up front, and a dry, snappy finish. it’s good to pour some of the CO2 out of this beer, otherwise the fizz is so strong it almost burns the mouth. w/the CO2 tamed, it is quite easy to drink.
Genuine grain beer.  Fantastic!  You should buy a whole bunch of this stuff and get blitzed!  That’s why we buy beer, right?

Pours a pale gold color with a thin fizzy head that dissapates quickly.  Has a decent taste in comparison to bud light.  However, it still isnt a very great brew.  If you’re forced to choose between this and Bud Light, choose this one.

In case anybody is wondering, there are many beers that can be accessed "everyday", and some of them actually have flavor and depth. I don’t like this beer,  but obviously a lot of people do. In a nutshell, it has the same problem as most Americam macro-brews: it is just too bland. The German’s invented lager which was more bland than the beer-types that went before it. So in America, working on the maxim that more must be better, we made lager even more bland. And Budweiser is the archtypical result.
And I liked it well enough for a while, until I was spoiled by micro-brews. But unfortumately there is no going back now.

I used this beer at a recent beer tasting seminar, just to show people how bad it was compared to the other beers we tried. I taste corn and smell rice (stuff that doesn’t even belong in beer). Worst of all, my nutritionist wife says that it contains 100 additives adjuncts and preservatives. No wonder you get headache!
very similar to bud light, a little more taste, a little heavier, still nothing special

Pale, watery golden pour.  Lots of large, carbonation infused bubbles with a head that rapidly disapears.  Aroma of malt.  Taste of alcohol and corn.  Very little finish.  Tailgating or post softball brew only.
"King of beers" my arse. Second worst drink I’ve ever had the displeasure of drinking - second only to its brother "Bud Light". Avoid at all costs
Unbelievable that this is the king of beers.  Not bad on a hot day, served ice cold, bu other than that, no reason to drink it.

Budweiser seems to be a very bready but ulitmately flavorless brew. While it looks golden and bubbly, it tastes very little and often WAY TOO BUBBLY.

It is difficult to classify this as a beer, especially after drinking so many completely satisfying ales and pilsners.

But I must say, many a football game or party has started by these guys getting turned upside down a throat or two.

So, drinkability remains this beer’s only friend, as its flavor and palate have absolutely no redeeming qualities. Bland, bland, bland...but drinkable if you wanna get hammered. Yucko to me.

Bud is Bud.  It is not great but it does have its place.  It does leave a nasty taste of corn and rice in your mouth after a few.  I have found this beer to be better and more crisp when served ice cold or in the aluminum can and also on draft.
Bottle, This beer always has its place, so I am not ashamed to drink it, strong corn taste, light to drink, the colder the better
Golden light colour. Watery taste. And that’s pretty much all about it. There are better ways to get drunk, and definitely better beers if one wants to get a good beer.

Decent swill - more than 3 though and you build up the famous Bud aftertaste.
Arghhh.
Can. Light golden colouw without head. Corny aroma and flavour. How can Budweiser be so popular. Most of the Danish discount beers are much better.

I guess it didnt help that the born on date was from 2004 when we had the hurricanes run though in Florida- my poor guests had to stomach a case of this since then.  I guess its a good thing that they thought the Belgian beers tasted like crap to them and were too strong - they thought I was being a good host leaving them the Buds :-)  Also another time I offered a guy on my tennis team a Chimay (Blue) who then proceeded to spit it out - tell me I don’t drink those pansy beers - give me a Bud - I just laughed my ass off!  

This stuff is hidious!

Does the King even deserve comments?  The only think that amzes me is the shear volume that Anhueser Busch produces on a a daily basis and the ability to get to achive the exact same flavor.  My beer of choice when I want to get drunk.
Generic pale lager, but the flavor is stronger than most lights. Weak corny aroma, but nice malt flavor. Better than some..
absolutely nothing special ! watered down taste. bacause you deserve what every indivudal should enjoy what ? i dont think so
Poor excuse for a beer. Matter of fact I refer to this as swill and not beer. This is just plain bad.

I’m only reviewing this because, yes, I had one once and I’m still trying to forget it. Consider this a type of self-therapy. It was pale, had no head, smelled of corn and I don’t know what, and tasted like it had been filtered through landfill. Landfill and maybe some Willamette hops. Oh god please make it stop!
One of my least favourite macros.  Absolutely nothing special about this beer.  A flat beer with a skunky bitter finish.

REAL MEN OF GENIOUS.........Today we salute you Mr. I Have No Real Competition In The Drive Thru. You constantly hang around the gas stations and drive thrus selling yourself to people without taste buds and the poor souls who have no place to buy good ale.We in all the villages across america now have you to impose upon the cooler shelves.Bold, Crisp taste? I think not. Your like a fine stream of piss heading towards the water fall. You will forever decieve those who know not what a good scottish ale tastes like. So crack yourself open and enjoy being called the King of Beers because someday more establishments will carry tasteful ales and porters     Mr. I have no competition in the driiiiiiiive thruuuuuu.

It’s just not that great.  It’s not the worst...certainly not the worst.  But it’s just , ...it’s like water, some light corn-tasting malt grains, VERY little hop flavoring or bittering...what’s the point?  oh yeah, so people can drink lots for little, and get drunk.  dorks.

I thought this was a beer forum!!!!  Whats Bud doing here! Ok, now that I got all the jokes out let me say this, Bud is not all that bad. After a hard days work or when all you want to do is sit back and get drunk this beer is for you. When you want to enjoy a fine tasting beer look at just about anything else. Now for the good aspects, clean, crisp taste. Great head, no aftertast (had to slip that in). Bland overall, did I mention that its good for getting drunk? Well let me go before I get banned for spamming.
Pissy, thin, weak, nada, bad stuff with a stolen name! King of what????? what a JOKE!
For the Bud cheap beers, I prefer Bud Light to this if they are the only two choices. Very watered down; no specific flavor or taste to speak of.
Very watery with very little taste. Cheap beer for college students. One of the better American beers.
Is this really beer? Or a lot of water with a few hopps. Although its drinkability wins a few measly points.
Ill drink this one when I feel like puking.  Once you’ve had a beer, this ( budwiser) just does not qualify as drinkable.  If you have a choice, reach for something else.
Technically Budweiser is a beer.  Outside of how it is made, this is not beer.  It’s aroma, flavor, and palate are similar to that of artificially flavored bottled carbonated water.
Can’t stand this beer anymore, even at parties. I can’t see how it became the king of beers.
Take it for what it’s worth. If you are not in college or under 21 there is no reason to go here. Tastes like any other mass produced/marketed beers. Smells like a college hangover.

Taking this beer into context is the only way to really appreceate it. They are not trying to go for a unique or bold taste. It is an ok beer to get if you want to keep a group happy. Very light, yet still has the aroma and taste of hops.

For the style, it isn’t too bad; however, it’s a long way from the top. What I like most about this beer is the aroma -- subtle, yet you can still sense the hops. The carbonation is fitting for this style.
The king of beers? Nope, sure sucks. I only drink this beer flavored water when at parties or at some damn pub that doesn’t know what good beer is.
Your expected macro american beer.  Very little taste, very watery, seems to sell based on advertising and the fact that there is no flavor strong enough to be offensive to anyone.
This beer is the official beer of non-beer lover, it has absolutely no taste, beside water. I guess that most people who buy this beer are influenced by pub.
I only drink this if that is all there is.  King of Beers in sales only.  Drink only if you want a hangover the morning after the party.
I only drink this if the party i’m at is supplying.  its really nothing terrible if thats the scenario.
The only reason to consume this is for get drunk partying.  But I would rather skip the hangover and have a Bud Light
Hang over waiting to happen. I drink one of these and I am sick. Nasty stuff. Makes me quiver just thinking about it. King of crap. Avoid at all costs!
Corn, rice and water. what else? true to style but the style guideline were made after the beer was made. BLAH
Not a huge fan of Budweiser.  I definately prefer Coors or Miller over these products.

It’s bud, what do you expect?  It’s the most drinkable of the basic U.S. demostic beers, and hell, you can get the 18 pack for 10-13 depending on a sale or not.  I’ll get it when I just need something to drink on or I’m actually going to give beer out in friendship, cause who gives out good beer?

I don’t believe that all of the people who rate Bud that bad believe that it’s really one of the worst beers in the world. I think it’s a tasty fresh beer, not to drink at home with a good book, but at partyies etc.
In rating the Bud Select version, I discovered I hadn’t rated this yet! How many of these boring but somehow satisfying units have gone down at the ESPN Zone in days past? Who knows, but BORING!
Yellowish color. no head. not a very good taste. probably one of the worst macros.
473mL can from the LCBO.  Do people really drink this crap?  Worthless.  Drainpour.

Somewhat woody taste that you have to try real hard to taste, nice looking and nice smelling, but falls kind of sort in the end, maybe if it was like 2-3 dollars cheaper!..can be enjoyable with friends that drink it..

pours yellow with a two finger white head and light body. has a sweet small hopy cereal taste not much smell though. your standard get drunk partybeer. definetly better than any miller products but not the "king".
Very sweet tasting and golden gold in colour - horrible.  Is this the best you Yanks can come up with?
12 oz- pours a light yellow-little or no head. Nothing to detect in scent. Carbonated hops. King of all beers?
stolen name and a false beer.  Since i love beer, and review beer, i can’t really review it because it is not a beer it is brain washing.  However, it’s a great example of the power of advertisement.

Sweet tasting beer, but not for me. Although its high in volume, I can imagine thats ONLY because its carbonated. Deffinately doesnt deserve the title "King of Beers". On the other hand, it goes great with Blue WKD to make the Green Fariy (not to be mistaken with Absinthe) when mixed, the alcohol level does increase, which is always good, but its masked by the sugary taste, which after a while becomes sickly.

What the? Hello? Flavour?
Bland ,watery, nice looking bottle, thats about it. For an imported beer i was not impressed at all.
This ’King of beers" is pretender to the throne. Lord knows how they sell so much of it all over the world if people have ever had anything else. Don’t believe A-B’s propaganda, this ain’t beer.
One of the more disappointing domestic beers that is sadly all-too-common around these parts.  Disappointing.
Done giving this beer chances.  No aroma.  Tastes of corn and rice, that transitions to some wheat, and then a kick of alcohol at the end.  Really really bad. Pass
a ok american lager weak overall but you know what you get when you buy it made in the staes for the staes better than most pale lagers i guess enjoy it

Hardly any smell. The head was present and left quickly. Looks very light straw colored and bubbly. The flavor had a slight sweetness with little other flavors. A bit of pear maybe. Palate is watery, overcarbonated. Almost soda like. It’s mainly the typical lager palate that keeps this from a good lawnmower beer,

This is quite simply a bad beer. I do not know why they export this rubbish. Who out there actually doesn’t have better and cheaper beer in thier country? Just as Coors Light’s main draw is that it is cold, the main draw of this piss is that it sells a lot. How can millions of drunks be wrong? Well, the only way that I can drink this, if I so happen to have nothing else, is by pouring vodka into it. I actually thinks that the taste improves. Ugh.

Initial pour was light yellow with an average fizzy white head.  Body was clear.  Aroma was of grains and cereal with a light foral hint.  Dough and soap as well.  Taste was sweet.  Banana esters and hints of pears or peaches and something else.  Light watery dry texture with soft carbonation.  This is a good beer with and interesting flavor if served in the proper glassware at the right temperature and properly poured.  Overall an excellent beer.  Nice session.
Yuck, boring, yuck.  It’s water with hops in it.  It pains me to see people drink this stuff.  This one is the King of Bad Beers though!
if you are looking to pound beers and get drunk  try  pabst or natty  they taste better and a re cheaper
HOW DO YOU RATE SOMETHING THAT TASTE AS BAD AS THIS.0.5 RATING AND VERY GENEROUS WITH THE RATING.

typical american pilsner.  Very water, very little flavor, the smell is like vomit and the taste isn’t much better.  It’s not as bad as michelob ultra though.  Why this is the best selling beer doesn’t make sense to me.  For a slight step up you could get yuengling instead.

100th RATING!!.  I chose the KING OF ALL BEERS for my 100th.  its only fitting that the world renowed Bud be given this honor.  Did  you know that beer is good for you? It made Bud wiser. HAHAHAHA.  Im telling bad jokes becaue there is nothing else to be said here regarding this beverage.
An absolutely poor excuse for beer.  Grog has more character than this crap.  Its embarassing to come from the USA.  It is truely disappointing, sorry AB, you have to do better...

Easily one of the worst beers ever produced. Nasty, nasty swill. Not a true beer either, as they replaced the barley with rice. Name and slogan are stolen from the real Budweiser in Europe. Real slogan is ’The Beer Of Kings’. AB stole and reversed it.

This is the stuff the Clydesdales pee.

My homebrew clone recipe goes like this;
Pee in a bag of garbage and shake well.
highly commercialized...better off buying some cheap nattie or whatnot its not worth the extra pricing

Bottle (present from brother, bought N.Y) yellow color with little fast disappearing head. Slight malty and hoppy. watery & thin. Drinkable but doesnt have any great elements! (somebody is earning a buck or 2 here)!
Yes, it’s commercial and corporate all the way, but the light color, flavor, and fizz are barely better than other ones out there. Only buy this as a last resort.
i’m not quite sure what the point of commenting on this beer is...i think every human being on the planet has tried it.

I guess you have to review it. A wonderful testimony to the results of Prohibition, one of the worst beers you could hope to try. National lagers of third world countries must be better than this. You’ve got to hand it to their marketing dept. and wonder if anyone at A-B has actually tasted this swill.
One of the worst macro’s available.  Horrid corn bodies along with a pitiful malt ending.  Coors is far better than this shit.

I think this is the most over-hyped beer ever.  The name is everywhere, it claims that it is the King, yet...it is nothing special and tastes...pretty bad.  Yet, it remains.  People must like it...or they just see the name everywhere.

Given the opportunity I had to rate the "King".  Mild aroma of grains.  Appearance is pale yellow with lots of carbonation and fizzy white head.  Very bland taste with some malt.  Palate is very thin.  A boring but relatively inoffensive beer - just fizzy water.
Pale blond color. Carbonated water with a hint of beer flavor. Very thin head, no real hop or malt flavor, just beer flavored fizzy water.
Yellow colur, light body, no bitterness. No totally disgusting, but a boring beer.
Largest-selling beer in the world.  Woohoo.  All in debted to good marketing and manly imagery.
One in almost every five beers sold in the United States today is a Budweiser? Now that’s a real testament to the power of marketing.
Talk all the smack you want, but Budweiser is underrated.  Sure it’s not very beery tasting, and there are no detectable hops, but there’s alot worse garbage out there.  That’s my two bits.
Better than most macros, but thats not saying much.  Cheap taste, poor mouthfeel, but at least its inexpensive.
Pours very pale yellow with minimal white head, and heavy carbonation.  Hardly any flavour or aromas detected.  I won’t be trying this one again.
Bottle (330ml). Trying to copy the Chech tradition but unsuccesfull. Light body, almost no head. I still drink it in places i find no other beer.
Weak beer without real distincitive notes. Very mild and light in aroma and flavor.

This was the first beer I ever had. Thank god I didn’t quit after drinking this garbage. I think I’ll crack open a bud , sit by the bon fire near my truck and kiss my sister. It’s just about as bad as it gets.

This beer lacks any real distinctive elements. It is just there to get drunk off of. I can’t see why anyone would pick this as there beer of choice, flavour wise it is pretty much non-existent. You might as well be drinking water with an alcohol content. Texture, flavour, smell...it is pretty much lacking in all areas.
okay. better than miller. better than schmidt. better than hamms. better than olympia. better than rainier. better than pabst. better than rolling rock. better than molsen. it’s okay, i’ll drink it.

This is my rating no. 100, and as so many other raters I would like this to be a very special rating. This is an event to celebrate with only the best beer. What should I pick? It’s difficult so I let somebody else decide – yes I would like the whole world decide what is the best beer around. The number one beer of the world is as far as I know Budwieser from mighty Anheuser-Busch Companies. It’s been around since 1876 and is even described as “the king of beer”. Yes this got to be the one, so many beer drinkers all around the world can not be wrong. Hey, ho, - let’s go!

330ml bottle. Beautiful shining bright body, this got to be a pure product of only the finest indigents. Nice white head. The aroma is really nice if you dislike unwished fumes, because it’s almost nothing there. Nothing to dislike, so I assume this must be great. The flavor is also without any elements that may be disliked by the people of the world. Aftertaste is also quite special, nothing whatsoever. This beer is simply a cornucopia of nothing. A perfect beer if you enjoy peeing but dislike malt, hop, yeast and all this shit. A big cheer to celebrate myself and millions of beer drinkers around the world!!!

King of Beers my celebrated hindquarters!  This is barely a serf.  Dull yellow colour, like Clydesdale piss, no aroma.  It looked good when the barman poured it, but the head  decamped for St. Louis before I had returned from the bog.  Weak watery finish. I drank it quickly, (a friend had bought it) then bought my half, two Blue Paddle Pilseners.  Why anyone would drink this when they could get Blue Paddle is beyone me.
It lacks in taste among other things, but there are far worse things to drink.

My bottle apparently out of date by a month, don’t think it made a difference though.  Worringly clear yellow reminds me of something else.  Little head or carbonation.  King of beers without a crown (seal).  Very mild, if not nonexistant, aroma, taste and texture.  I suppose their goal was, like so many other pale lager producers, to make a tasteless bevvy, so they’ve done real well.
Bottle, can. Pale yellow color. White head. Aroma is ?? tast is ?? so close to water !!
It’s a macro, yes. But, does that really mean it is bad?  Great to drink when there is nothing else at the bar, but, as a home-relaxing-beer, no.

12 oz bottle-Finally got around to rating this beer when entering ratings from a trip to Colorado. Sometimes you go places where you just gotta drink a macro, it’s all they sell. This is the beer I grew up with so it’s my go to macro. Has a sweet, plesent unoffensive aroma & flavor. It’s not complex, but it does have a crisp clean taste, w/a nice finish.
A little more substance than its light counterpart. Cant says its any different from its competitors.
Pale yellow color. White head. An aroma that reminds me of wet cardboard. There is some ingrediant in this beer that gives me a headache even before I can finish the first glass.

I used to be entirely against american macros, but having been around the block a little bit I’ve grown a bit more understanding of beers like budweiser. It’s simple, it’s unoffensive, cheap and easy to find. It even has a fairly pleasing aroma. It tastes of very plain rice and malt. It’s certainly not the king of beers, but it’s a fine chaser and nothing to be ashamed of when you pick it up at the 7-11.
it’s bud light that’s been taking protein and working out.  it is still domestic swill, with more body, a slight amount more flavor and alcohol.
i am warning you all. do not buy. it is very cheesy. it is more like the cream of crap nevermind king of beers

Frankly, this budweiser has no right to call this bland mix of toilet water and yeast "The King of Beers".  Just a poor brew all around.  But, it is cheap so it is understandable why everone likes it.
(Tap) Pours yellow with a pretty decent head. Not much taste, but better then the light version. I’d still only drink it as a last resort.

Its really easy to hate this beer, but I’ve had this many times when I was solidly surprised by its mainstream appeal.  Back this up with a shot of well whiskey and you’ve started out a good weekend.  This is bar beer and when the taps and hoses are clean, it can be very refreshing an drinkable.  The haters know what they are drinking, but they should rate based on taste standards, not against microbrew ales with hand grown ingredients.  This is easily the best of the big three.

(33 cl bottle from Swedish Systembolaget) Light straw yellow color, small white head. Light malty aroma, faint sweetness as well. Taste is artificial sweet, can it be the rice? Mouth feel is small, it’s like a anorectic beer... Hog CO2 level, very low bitterness and no after taste what so ever.

Someone bought me a couple of bottles of this once the bud light pitchers ran dry at my Fantasy Football Draft.  The bottle of real Bud had much better flavor than the draft beer I had drank earlier.  Nice carbonation.  Still. no detectable flavor and zero aftertaste. If drank ice cold it’s as refreshing as bottled water.
its ***** water not beer! looks nice and refreshing but has no taste or body to it what so ever.
Bottle. One of the worst beers I’ve ever had. Even when I was broke in college I would pass this up.
The macro tour continues.  Hands down the coolest of the macros, too bad the taste doesn’t measure up.  Rice and sugar.  GO DALE JR.!  Sorry, must be a side-effect of drinking the nectar of rednecks.

The one that started it all, have had it every which way. My first exposure being in a Dixie cup my dad gave me when I was 5. There’s nothing at all positive to say about this beer, other than it gets you drunk after a case. It’s actually one of the few beers where I’ve had difficulty drinking. A friend describes it as "going down like lead," and it is just that. There’s no flavor, only thing as far as aroma is corn and aluminum. An absolutely disappointing beer from every vantage point, and the root of all evil when it comes to beer.

Bottle at Cafe de Zeepost in Amsterdam. This is a fairly bad beer. I have drank it quite a few times in college and now paid up for ratebeer purposes and was laughed at by my friends. There is little taste, but definitely soap.

Enjoy it more than the light version.  For a domestic beer produced for the extreme masses it’s still unique to others beers it rivals.  The beer I cut my teeth on.  I have some loyalty.  And very local brewer so it can be found around every corner.
Tastes like an unhopped beer flavored italian soda without cream.  No aroma, absolutely no hops and no palate.  If you want to beer bong four at a time this is probably your match made in heaven.

I so really, really wanted to like Budweiser when I first tried it, but sadly I went back to the bottle store and demanded my money back, and the time I had wasted opening a bottle. I was hoping for an American classic like Levi jeans or Zippo lighters, what I got was McDonalds in a bottle. This is probably the best way of describing it, certainly not as the King of beers.
How can so many people be so wrong? Stop drinking it, it only encourages them. Budvar is so much better.

The King. 

But its fucking rice. YOu should drink this while wearing a wife beater and driving a piece of shit car.

i could have taken the easy way out and simply left everything at a default of 1. That said there are worse beers out there. In the context of a guzzling beer it is spot on. No flavour, no body so you can really slam them down. Appearence is pretty poor, aroma non descript. Flavour is a mix sweet malts and little to no bitterness in the aftertaste. Not quite King of beers, more like Court Jester!

Goes to show you that a brilliant marketing campaign can make up for a very sub-standard beer.  Overly carbonated, very little if any taste.  Must be served ice-cold so you can distinguish it from urine.  A-B tries to pass this off as "premium" beer.  What a joke.  If you testified in court that this was premium, you would be convicted of perjury.  Worst of what America has to offer.  Avoid like the plague.  Made for people who like to get drunk and urinate a lot, but do not really enjoy good, flavorful beer.

This actually is a fairly good beer. Nice refreshing at night, enjoy ice cold or chilled. I had heard so mucho about it, but I really don’t think it’s so bad - oppositely very very very good. Does not have much taste nor aroma, but its consistence gives me the feeling, that I can drink a Bud everytime.

Draft - Can - Bottle. The same great beer.
mmmmmmm......mmmmmmm budweiser. Heh....right. Fizzy, fairly flavorless, and not really even a good choice for cheapo beer.

It’s a mass-produced American "beer."  I don’t need to say anything else.  If you are literally dying of thirst and happen to be lying next to a bottle of Budweiser, see if you can drink your own sweat first.
I had this on tap at Chuck E. Cheese. Very pale yellow with white head. Faint aroma malt, corn. Flavor is corn and malt.
Can.  Oh boy, that’s good.  Pale yellow, fizzy.  Wheat, grass aroma.  Funky, skunky.  Thin, watery feel in the mouth.  Nothing quality about it, but still - I won’t turn it away.

Simply put there is no reason to buy this beer.  Every Miller product is better, even if only slightly, in class comparison, so just get that instead.  This holds uber-carbonation to hide the skunk but she won’t go!  If this beer leaves icecold polar temperatures you have a rough task in front of you.  This is the worldwide king of beers...damn you damn you all to hell.

1) On a park bench on Arilas seafront, Corfu, August 2006? Vile sour vinegar aroma. Stale dregs left out in the rain. Not remotely salvaged by a late corny sweetness. The most inexplicably popular beer in the world. Sorry, but in the name of research I had to. 22316=
2) Fancy world cup emblazoned gold aluminium bottle watching Croatia Vs Australia, early hours of 07/06/14. Pleasantly anodyne sweet adjunct lager in the curryhouse style with Dolly Mixture, rubber and (overwhelmingly) basmati rice flavours. Nose a touch sulfitic and cherry stone streaked. Dead body with zero head when poured. The flavour is preferable to any number of European PLs sampled recently, so rating adjusted accordingly. At least this tastes of rice not beach mats, envelopes, loose change or sundried reef shoes.

Why not....  Clear golden pour with a fluffy white head.  Huge amounts of carbonated streamers coming from the bottom.  Aroma is pretty weak... maybe a bit of grain.  Corn comes out in the taste, not unpleasant, but not good either.  Pretty funky aftertaste.  For a couple bucks more you can do SO much better.
crap in a bottle, i live not too far from the columbus brewery and the beer still is no good, come on you know

24oz. can.  Pale yellow-gold color with a small large bubbled white head.  Sharp slightly sulfurous aroma of steeped vegetation.  Tinges of watery malt and cooked starch dominate the flavor.  These flavors continue into the finish, where they are met by a muted herbal bitterness.  Mouthfeel is thin, somewhat watery.

I once spent an entire evening listening to a Carlsberg spokesperson telling me how the greatest beer experience of his life was when he was at a bar where they had three taps of Bud, each wired to a digital thermometer and how great that was because he was then able to drink his favourite brew at the ideal temperature, not 2.4 C, not 2.6 C.. but 2.5 C. He then went on to rant about how great the 30 % rice was because it made for an extremely drinkable brew, and I kid you not.. how it actually made Budweiser the Riesling of the beer world. Furthermore, I just can’t get over the fact that the top label (at least in Sweden) reads something along the lines of... "We know of no other beer that costs so much to brew and produce as Budweiser"..

Not the best beer you’ve ever had, but lets be honest... you’re not looking at this site to get the latest review of Bud... It’s not worth describing because if you haven’t had an American MacroBrew, you are not a qualified beer drinker. This guy’s probably my favorite macro - good for chugging in mass quantities - I always stuff a couple ice cold 24oz in my backpack for hiking trips.  Speedway Stout wouldn’t be quite the same around the campfire!

Appereance: This beer pours a light yellow, clear, with a two finger head.

Smell: Very little aroama. hints of grain as it warms but it tastes better cold.

Taste: I had it very cold in a fozen pint glass. There was very little taste either good or bad. Slight hop bitterness with a dry, distinct aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: Very crisp and very thin. Ultra light!

Drinkability: There is NOTHING interesting about this beer to me, but it is not horribly offensive either. I would say that it is a fine fall back beer in a serious pinch but not one I’d choose for enjoying beer at its finest!

Hope this is helpful.
Cheers!

Bottle.  This is my golf course beer when it is hot out.  Pale yellow in color, thin white head.  Only drinkable when cold.  When it is cold, it is crisp and refreshing, taste is lacking and gets bad as it warms.  It is what it is.

Typical American macro-brewed crap. Tastes alright and goes down smooth when served very cold on a hot day, but other than that it’s nothing special. Certainly doesn’t seserve to be called the King of Beers.

Listen, it’s Bud-deisel, not something you picked up in a British pub. This beer, in its classic white and red can, is about more than what it tastes like. It’s Bud. You drink it with friends and you have a good time. It has a nice taste, but it’s gotta be very cold. You will also get some unwanted bitter after-taste. Budweiser ain’t great, but it doesn’t suck - and hey, throw on you’re red white and blue and grab a Bud.
12oz bowling pin bottle-An aroma of corn and cheap beer on golden color body with a head that retains itself pretty well. Taste of nastiness. Bad beer.

ok, not the most sophisticated beer in the world, but, i have had had much worse.  i’ve been to europe many times and have had plenty of micro’s worse than bud.  give it a break.  and if it’s so terrible then why is it the #1 selling beer in the WORLD?!?

Funny that all the 5/5 ratings are coming from the USA, can you say beer marketing...  You want something easy to drink, drink a cooler.  The only thing this beer has going for it, is that it doesn’t cost an arm and a leg, it compares well with other domestics, and when your a half dozen in, your taste buds aren’t as sensitive.

This is truely a pitiful beer. It is watery and weak with almost no flavour to it. I would rather attempt to get drunk off mineral water than ever drink this garbage again. A complete waste of the $1.80AUS that i spent on a bottle. If this ’King of Beers’ is the average for mainstream american beers then I feel sorry for every beer drinker in the US. Any australian beer (yes that includes VB) is far superior in every facet.
This is a classic example of how bad American beers are. Other than Abita, there are no good beers in the US. Can not describe this beer because of how bad it really is.
i shouldn’t need to comment anything except don’t waste your time or money with this "beer"

Re-rate- 341 ml bottle: While I still don’t think it’s fair to pass a beer off as crap just because it comes from a successful macro brewery, I must admit that my original ranking was a little high on this one. However, I still maintain that this beer has a nice roasted taste that is enjoyable. A bud on a hot day is still a good thing to me.
Piss.  The beer of the wanna-be jock.  I would rather drink saltwater from the ocean.

355 mL can:  Budweiser in the first percentile?! I’m not fan of any awful-tasting brew, or one which doesn’t live up to its style:  macro or micro, who cares, they all can be guilty! However, this is not tasteless (as many of you are claiming) and it does fit the bill of a pale lager. All these overly serious beer drinkers are getting me down!  Seems we love using words more than drinking beer?! Ahh!  Bud always has a distinct, pleasing roasted taste, maybe it is the rice, who knows!  How can this be written off as not serving any purpose (put your dictionaries away, no fancy adjectives for this brew).  On a hot day, a cold Bud is a good thing.  If you are expecting the body and palate of heavier lager, pilsner or ale, then of course you will hate it.  Goes down very smooth.

The aroma is that of cheap lager and brewers yeasts. Typical amber color with a small head that leaves small amounts of lacing on the glass. To sum it up, this is a very drinkable beer that I have drank many times and quite willingly so. However, for us beer geeks, it just doesn’t have any qualities that make me want to give it a higher rating. Great for getting drunk at a party or something, but terrible to sip, dissect, analyze and enjoy.
Of the big beers, I’ll give this one the best.  Looks the nicest with a dull amber color and fizzy head.  Still tastes like water though.
Bottle pours a light yellow with a white head that dissipates pretty quickly.  Extremely carbonated.  Tastes mainly of corn and rice.  A good "lawnmower" beer, and better than Coors.
Just as good as bud light for pounding but with more calories.  If it wasn’t for Dale Jr. who knows where this beer would be.
With Budweiser, you know what your going to get, and that’s a fairly bland, uninspiring beer. It’s drinkable, but you can certainly do far better.
Bow down to the king and all its marketing power. Who doesn’t like a little beechwood aging now and again? If you buy the king, he never lets you down.

How can such a bland beer be the King of beers ? Something wrong with this picture. Pours a slight yellow color with a fast fading white head that smells of a small amount of hops used with very little flavor with a slight afterbite.

First complete beer I ever consumed. Purchased by a passerby while my friend and I stood outside the convienent store. Came in the quart package and was drunk as we walked the streets of Orange,California that summer night in 1974. Decent well made american lager.

12 oz bottle waiting for Chinese food. pale yellow pour ,fizzy white head that leaves as fast as it can . aroma of malt ,maybe?. flavor of not much ,little sweet , very thin . hops ? dont think so . Like my Irish great grandmother used to say ..if Bud was Wiser he would drink water .  I think he is Gram .

Aroma is unfortunately, the epitome, to most, of beer in the US-it really gives beer a bad name-of course, most know this, but still it is one of the most popular beers in the world. its drinkable and cheap. for a pale lager its marginal at best, not horrible, but has a chemically sweet flavor of corn and rice and a vile aftertaste-  i feel that these types of drinks should be in a separate beverage catagory aside ’beer’ because they are made to be thin and refreshing, not flavorful
Can. Golden colour with a white head. Light malt aroma. Light malt flavour . Thin beer.

Canadian version brewed by Labatt.  Had it at my cousin’s for a weekend BBQ.  This was the only beer there so I downed a few straight from the bottle. While it is easy drinking there is very little flavour and aroma to speak of.  Very watery and thin.  RE-Rate: had it again at my cousin’s place at a party, tasted sweeter than I remembered.  Really not the taste you look for in a beer, more of a cooler than anything.  Bleh!

I had this at a concert last weekend, becuase they only had bud and bud light. Tasted like nothing in my mouth. I can’t see why somone would even drink this over a good wheat beer or whatever. I guess if you are just looking for a buzz, but heck, I want something that’s actually good for me. NOT this corn colored wiser stuff.

12 oz. bottle.  Drank on 6/9/06.  Very clear, very light yellow.  1 cm. white head.  Head goes away almost immediately.  Ring of foam.  No lace.  Aroma - not much aroma.  Faint bit of sweetness.  Flavor - light and fizzy.  Not much flavor.  But easy drinkin’ and refreshing.  Tiny bit of sweetness after the swallow.  Palate - light and watery.  High level of fizzy carb.  Overall - It’s Bud, the king of beers.  What can you say?  As far as BMC goes I like this and PBR the best, but it is BMC.
The king of crap. Little to no head, little to no flavor, little to no quality.
King of Filler.  This is nearly as corn loaded as Shiner Bock.  Little to no head.  Crisp, sans malt.  Pale yellow.  Is this worth a dollar at Happy Hour?  Eh... barely.
This represents everything negative about America and that happens to be a myriad of things.
I like lagers the least, and this pale domestic is at the bottom...0 to 10 is the difference between Bud and Guinness for me...Carbonated, watered-down taste is actually displeasing.
the wal mart of beers. i do not like bud in general, but i can stand for a good budweiser drunk about once a year.
What I drink when i’m broke and looking to get pie-eyed.  However, I recomend getting buzzed off of something that actually has flavor first.
I’d actually rather drink Bud Light than Bud just because I’d prefer less of this particular taste.
Vile.  Truly vile.  The disgusting odor of this beer makes me nauseous before the vile liquid even gets to my tongue.

first beer we sampled at beer school at sea world... um, yeah... sea world beer school... sampled 15 beers.... this one goes well with grapes and cheddar cheese... who would have thunk it, eh? talk about a bud and fine dining...

Big white creamy head shrinks rapidly into the pale yellow body. Clean sweetish malt aroma with a touch of grassy hops and apple. Taste is watery apple and faint malts. Aftertaste is watery and a bit stale. I wonder if I can taste the rice. Boring, watery, and faintly unpleasant. (0.5l can.)
Draught: Wow, it really does taste like nothing. Pale yellow colour with a short lasted white head. Slightly stale aroma. Boring alcoholic water.
Same as bud light but with more calories......and a little more flavor.......I guess.
Not that bad for just drinking, its not that offensive.  Although it is probably my last choice between bud, coors, or MGD.  Tastes like an american macro but with a kind of strange taste.

33cl bottle. Pale gold, lasting white head. I guess my major criticism of this beer would just be the lack of aroma and flavour. It is certainly not the worst mass produced lager I have drunk. Some pale malt and hop aroma. Light and fluffy in mouth with almost no flavour whatsoever. Bit of hop bite on end. Dull but inoffensive.

Can, pours a pissy yellow, very clear. Pure white head which fades into nothing in a few seconds having the beer look more like apple juice. Scent is of malt and corn. Taste is very much the same, barely any hops added to this beer. Just your average shmoes beer in the States. Something that comes out the same color as it goes in.
After tasting other beers, this one is just plain boring & one ill pass on every time. Even boring beers taste great next to this.

Tastes salty and goes down heavy. Looks terrible with its bubbly head. Bad beer that should come with a gun rack and a red flannel hat. RE RATE INFO: When tasting this beer fresh in STL it was better than usual. I give it a BIT more credit.
horrible. tastes like a drunk hobo’s urine. only good for college kids drinking games

16 oz. Can Clear pale yellow color with a fizzy white head.  The lacing is sticky if there was a large head when poured.  The aromas are typical of these macro pale lagers -- senior citizen convalescent center hallway, remnants of puke aroma in a rinsed out vomit bowl, ripe malts.  The taste is watery and has a sweet aftertaste of white grape juice that has been watered down to save money.  The feel is terrible - carbonation needs to be stronger to hide the poor beer quality and make it feel more refreshing.  It is also too soft and watery as a result.  Budweiser has never been the king of beers, not even of macro pale lagers.  Coors beats Bud out by far.
This is the basic beer to start your ratings from.I guess there is worse,but there are no minus scores.Light in all catagories.This is the beer I would use to trap slugs.

A mildy hoppy, and almost almondy taste sensation at first, that gives way to a wonderful flavor of beachwood in the backend.  Very smooth, very flavorful.

Had on tap at Pete’s Grill & Pub in Houston, Texas.  Will look for it again!
It is an average big run brew, not really a beer to savor, but drinkable on a hot day. I wouldn’t buy it, but the choice if Bud, or Coors, or MGD is your only option.

A beer with a cheap taste, i’m sure cheap ingredients and a mass production to feed the masses.  The people at An-Busch make this choice:Spend Money on either A.)Quality Ingredients and Brewing Techniques OR B.)Making a Bad Beer and Pouring all our money into Advertising.  

They obviously chose Advertising, the sick part is: It works.
Why am I rating this, oh yeah, I still have a case of it that I won at a bike race 9 months ago.  Ok so it is really good for making beer bread.   Mmmm beer bread.

can, shotgunned. Well, I didn’t really get an appearance on this bad boy since I stabbed it with a knife and sprayed the guts directly down my throat, but I can imagine that it looks like bubbly piss. This shit is offensive. I actually think Bud Light might be better because it has less taste. The nastiness left in my mouth was akin to munching on dry, uncooked rice and taking a sip of corn syrup, then chugging it with seltzer water. There might be some paper in there too. Revolting.
Pours a yellow color with moderate white head, very little scent, no flavor, but cheap and easy to drink
Bud is the king of the commercials but its product falls woefully short of delivering a good drinking beer.  They say it is premium but it is far from that.

If I hadn’t had a beer in a LOOOOOONG time and I was offered a Bud, Maybe I could get a few down. No taste, body, appeal at all. This beer shows everyone that if you spend millions telling people that this #$%^@# is good  they will believe you. "King of Beers?"LOL

A sad misnomer as a "beer." I would never have tried this one, were it not 1 of 3 sad selections in the fridge in a beach rental property that were for the taking. In fact, I felt obligated to try it since I’d never buy it on my own. Blah, blah, and blah.
bottle. very pale almost white color. big carpy head. all i can smell or taste are the carps. exept mabee for the sour aftertaste. its hard to imagine how anyone can label this beer "king of beers".
Golden yellow color and a golden yellow taste...  Watered down and grainy, this beer is certainly no king.
Draft. Pours yellow\gold with a large white head. Aroma of grain and corn. Flavor is corn, grain, and watered down. Thin bodied, nothing good.

it was 92F. yesterday, too hot for May.  stopped in at a graduation party for a friends daughter, went to the first cooler marked "Beer" and it was full of about 3 cases of Budweiser.  went to the second cooler marked "beer" and it was full of 2 cases of Budweiser.  so since it was hot and I was parched, I drank a Bud.  yeah, I know, I could have had water, but this was the first one I’d had in about 5 years.   my score speaks for itself.
Full of carbonation, a thick, unpleasant stink, and a horrible odor.  Nothing that hasn’t been said before.  Nasty stuff.

"King of beers" errrrr no not for me, no taste no aroma no colour.
