Not fit to use the name the Czech version kicks it’s butt.

Grim. The US’ most popular beer? Oh dear.

At least the beer lovers (including Americans) at this site know better...

Date marked bottle: Ran into this at a barBQ this weekend...a long time since I had a US made Bud. It seems to have upped its quality since I drank it in bordertown taverns in the early 80s. It is at least the equal in quality of the Canadian brewed Bud from Labatt....you know this beer really has an undeserved rep as a crappy cheap beer...It’s made about as well(or better)as any premium US maco and makes it clear that rice is used in the brew...this is a pale straw lager with a smallish cap that vanishes quickly to light surface lace...some sticky lace on the glass....heavily carbonated....very light aromas of grains, some smells of fresh paper ( rice?) and the signature granny smith apples...Acetaldehyde is always present in Bud I’m told, as a result of the use of beech wood chips in the aging/flavoring cycle; the chips deactivate the yeast before the green apple smell is metabolized by the yeast....still not an unpleasant odor one would classify as "off".....the rest of this beer is pretty straight forward and one dimensional...fizzy light body smooth but watery mouthfeel, grainy from 2 row malts, crisp-dry-clean character from the rice, fast dry/clean finish. The perennial pale US maco lager...that’s all it is and it fills that niche’ well....if you come at it from any other frame of reference you destroy your objectivity

Bloody awful. Too much carbonation, no taste whatsoever. Nice label though, but Budweiser Budvar kicks this poor imitation’s ass. Shame on you Anheuser-Busch for not allowing Budweiser Budvar to be sold under its original name!

Bottle from Hy-Vee Liquors poured into 20oz tumbler - Pours clear gold (lots of carbonation with a 2.5 finger weak looking white head; Not much of anything but a little of the skunkiness that so many people have described to the nose; Watery and boring initial taste; It’s not horribley bitter or anything; Again, boring backtaste that has a little malt and a lot of skunkiness; It’s pretty boring. WAY too much carbonation. It’s actually kinda burns because of the carbonation. Not as bad as some, but I definitely can find better. Like someone said before, it’s beer like this that makes me appreciate the really good ones.

24oz can, Jefferson City, MO.
Boring and SOUR. Belching commences almost immediately. Deep violent non-enjoyable, troubling belches. None of the claims on the can come true, except perhaps "finishes clear". 
Do they make that "drinkablity" claim about this one, also?

5-31-06
Tried another Ernhardt Jr. tallboy can.
This time I poured into a glass. Same pour and color as MOTOR OIL. Even smells a little like motor oil. Aged in plywood?
This one isn’t sour, but oddly sweet in the way that morning snot drainage is.
I can’t believe I drank this.
Nice feeling in the mouth, I suppose.

King of beers... right.
Tastes like watered down rubbing alcohol, looks like goat urine.
Overall I think this has to be my beer of choice. Over here in the US. we dont drink the expensive strong tasting beers. I like my american beer just fine. pretty much unreal. good party beer.

As you can see by my rating, I really hate this beer.  I would rather drink pee than this piece of crap!  But.....  It’s hard to say no when someone ask if you want one.  I would be rude.  Well, I figure might as well rate it since I drank it!  here goes:  IT’S HORRIBLE.  O.k... I vented, now back to your regularly scheduled beer.  Cheers!

Put 50 blind triangles out with MGD and Miller Lite- Only one person favored the Miller products

Unaminous though, Miller products smell like the lion house at the zoo

Tasteless,wastery, overfizzy garbage.  Little aroma, insipid appearance, minimal ’clean’ flavour, with a finish so short, you wonder whether one is actually drinking beer, or water with a tablespoon of beer added. No hoppy bitterness in the finish, and no lasting complexity after swallowing.  This is ’beer’ for people who either dont know how beer tastes (and dont know any better), or dont like the way real beer tastes, if the latter, then this is really sad, as good beer should be as complex and satisfying as wine.
Does sour mash mean anything to you?  I huess you have to sampekl a few bad ones to appreciate the good ones

From bottle. Urm... Bud. Weak aroma with a light colour that resembles a morning piss. Very waterery beer with no taste. Sponser of soccer sums it up for me.  Like a soccer hooligan, seen everywhere, in your face but with absolutely no class whatsoever.
Drank several times from bottle, can, and keg.  Not much too it, if you get a head its foam and makes u want to burp.  Overall not recommended unless you need a cheap diuretic.

Okay, it was an after work event and everything was MBC. It took me hours to water this out of my pallatte. The strength is that its cleaner than most peoples’ water systems so it seems more premium than say rolling rock or milwaukee’s beast. The finish is medium-wet and there is this slight malty cucumber-like flavor trying to send it flavor.
First beer I ever drank. very tasty light draft beer!! don’t drink it much anymore though!

Pretty ordinary US beer. Not exciting at all but it does quench my thirst on a hot day.
It’s unfortunate that the name is stolen from a good beer.

Bottled.
Thin and sour with vegetable-notes.. Extremely pale. Too much carbonation.

You’ve all heard the joke, "how is budweiser and sex in a canoe similar? They are both fucking close to water". Well, it’s almost true. I guess traces of hops can be traced in both aroma and taste, but no meaning in trying to specify all that. You all know what this beer is about.
lives up to the name king of beers.  although a small head and no aroma, the flavor is exquisite.  a delightful must for american beer drinkers.

If you like headaches, if you just don’t care, and if you consumed several of your good beers... this is the back up for you!  I hate to end negatively, so I’ll say this... I always liked the sort of malty smell of this beer (and the fact that my brother had Bud Man on his dorm-room door back at Rutgers).
Been avoiding this beer every chance I get. I am not a beer expert by any means, but this stuff has always been bad. If you just want a cheap brew please explore the many other varieties out there.
It’s not great, but come on, it’s not bad tasting like some beers I’ve had.  It find It’s actually quite drinkable so I’d rate it about average.  More flavor doesn’t always equal better flavor.

Where would we be without this beer in our teens and college days.  Let’s face it, it is an entry beer.  Meant to be the first if live in the US.  If you don’t really like beer, you’ll drink this one or one of it’s other big US beer buddies.  If your only goal for drinking beer is for the buzz than this bud’s for you.
This beer tastes just like PISS!!!!! If you want real beer please don’t drink this
fizzy yellow water....I’ve had my share, but am not proud of it.  Awful burps.  Bad bitter off flavors.
King of beer my ass! This stuff sucks and always has. Just goes to show that mass marketing can sell just about anything to the uneducated masses. What I drank before I new what good beer was.
The Applebee’s of beer.  There is nothing to dislike here, but there is nothing calling me back either.
Hey at a smoky bar or a sporting event.  It works but if you are serious well then lets get serious.

I love budweiser. Don’t get me wrong I understand it does not stack up to good craft beer, but I love it anyway. I think to apreciate Budweiser you have to grow up drinking it, kinda like vegimite. I was in Europe for awhile a couple years ago, and after awhile I really started craving it. 

I don’t drink it all the time, but it is worth a permanent spot in the refrigerator. .
The beer that every beer lover loves to hate, but lets be fair.  They didn’t get a 51% market share for nothing.

The only reason that i drink this beer is if i am really really drunk and have nothing else to drink, or i am in someone else’s house and this is all they have.  For the love of God, buy something better.
watery, poor tasting beer, good for those looking for a quick drunk...better of keg or in bottle? does it really matter?
Indeed this is the king of beers, when it comes to quantity sold. This is an American beer. "You’re either with us, or against us." ;)

It is only good because it is american.  It may be the king of beers sales wise but not taste wise.  Very watery, little head.  Its as if they took a decent water and mixed it with some seltzer water.

Hmmm, like a salmon trying to find its way back from the deep ocean to spawn in its birth river you really have be looking pretty hard to detect any sort of flavor in this beer.  Unless carbonation is a flavor. Anheuser-Busch is No.1 for something though, worlds largest producer of bubbles.
First beer of the day.Little aroma, looks like ----, flavor almost non-existent, I think there is a hop finish, but maybe not. What’s the point?

I feel obligated to rate Budweiser higher than Bud Light, but no higher than necessary. It’s really not a very good beer. The taste really isn’t very good. But in my experience, after about three beers, I can’t taste anything anymore. So start off your evening with some Newcastle, Sam Adams, or Southern Pecan, and finish with Budweiser. Your tongue will never know the difference, but your wallet will.

Very clear pee yellow, label is nice and so is appearance, the carbonation is good but that is it, everything elsa about this beer is crap. If this was the only beer around I would always be the designated driver
All I can say about this beer is that I cannot even finish it because it tastes so bad. I guess my trips to Europe have spoiled me.
the most popular beer in my apartment. there is nothing you can do to avoid this mediocre beer so you might as well just drink it.

On tap and served in a pitcher at Jeffrey’s Sports Bar and Grill Suwannee, GA.  As almost everyone knows Bud is a light straw color and perfectly clear.  It has decent carbonation and a mostly dissipating head.  There is almost no aroma, but what there is hints of corn.  Taste is slightly sweet and nothing else.  However, if I had a $1 for every Bud I’ve ever drunk I could buy this: http://www.kegs.com/alpac.html

Ok.... well here goes... It pours a light straw into the glass... Nose is almost totally unnoticeable... A hint of sour grain is all.  Flavor of corn, corn, corn, with a side of corn.  It tries to have a hop contingency toward the end of the pull, but gets lost very muddily.  There’s no complexity at all to this beer.  The mouthfeel is thin and extremely processed.  It seems quite obvious that the "King Of Beers" got its reputation from quantity sold, and not quality of product.
Sometimes taste watered down but overall decnt beer the appearance is great and the aroma is good, the flavor is suspect and definately has nothing but a mild wheaty tast

Came back to this to see how it compared to the different kinds of beers I’ve been trying lately. I can see why I left it. Pours a light golden color, looks like a lite beer. Generous head and tracing -- surprising. While it’s cold and crisp, it tastes like nothing and leaves with you with little to go by when rating.  I’ll drink a cold one on a hot day if there is nothing else around, but I’ll stick with the Natty Boh at almost half the price and twice the quality.
Pours a clear golden with a white head. Not much in teh flavor or aroma  just an everyday swill beer if you can’t get anything else.
It stinks!  This beer tastes like swill, looks like swill, acts like swill... and... well, it’s swill!!!

Bottle, draft, can  Pours a clear gold with a fizzy white head.  Just like all the other macros.  Aroma is a little hops and corn.  Watery texture and high carbonation.  Tastes well this is beer like your dad used to drink.  Just pick up a case and pound them on the weekends.

12 oz bottle, again out of the singles bin at the corner bottle shop.  Everyone knows what this beer smells like, looks like and tastes like.  Piss.  (OK, it’s not THAT bad.  But "King of Beers" my ass. ) Notorious for bad batches (or, to be kinder, bad storage) and giving its unsuspecting drinkers severe cases of the brown drizzlies.  Like all AB products, avoid.  (Update: had to re-rate, simply because there’s no way this stuff, bad as it is, is worse than Milwaukee’s Best Ice, which is pure dreck.)

Draught. Clear golden color with bubbly white head. Aroma and flavor are similar and include weak sprucy hops, corn, and cereal grain. Body is thin and watery. Not a good beer, but not as bad as many people have rated it. Having said that, It will likely be another 10 years before I drink one again....if ever.

the other worst beer that i have ever had.  literally everytime i drink it, i get the absolute worst hangover the next morning.  this is the only beer that i have thrown up to.  To put this into retrospect, i drink 15 year old beer when it is available (Becks, sam adams, wolfbrau) and i feel great the next day.  Now how bad is that.  has far too many inpurities to make it at all enjoyable.

Crisp and watery.  Metallic.  Very skunky and sour in the back.  Corn and other gross adjunct flavors.  Really lingers in the mouth, making me want to take another sip just to ger rid of the disgusting flavor in my mouth.  This is a good bit worse than I expected/remembered.
You know, this is that bad.  I dont like supporting bud, but if I have to drink it, you wont hear me complain too much.

This rating is in honor of my neighbor who never fails to offer me a cold Bud when I am out working in my yard.  This beer has a stale smell that is similar to dried athletic shoes.  It is the color of butter and has a thick white head.  This thin beer flows through the mouth depositing a sweet nutty taste which mildly bitter upon swallowing.

Ah Budweiser. Like most people this is a beer that I have had a number of times - though I can say with pride that I have never paid money for one. As such I have always gotten my money’s worth. As I have a number of relatives that work in a Budweiser brewery this beer has been around me a decent amount. First off I have to say that this is a very pretty can. For however little I may think of this beer, the can design/label is beautiful. Sampled from a 12 oz can this beer pours a pale yellow with a large soapy white head that fades fairly quickly. The aroma is a slightly bready sour tang. The flavor is dry and a bit bready with a sour macro finish. An uninspired though not horrible beer.
When all else fails and all of the world gets blown up and all that is left is you and a bottle of Budweiser, go ahead and drink it.  You’ll probably die anyway...
This is a beverage that should be handled with care due to the fact that it gives you a massive headache.
Canned. Medium head with short duration. Pale pale pale yellow- almost watery - and amazingly that is also the way it tastes :) . It is still decent tho.

Far from the King of Beers, but if ice cold draft it will do on a hot day. Still my fav is heavy stouts, but you can’t allways get what you want. Beechwoody flavor stands out, but hops and malt get left somewhere in the backgroud. Passable, but not near what the ad says.
Highly overrated beer, I’d pick it over most mass-produced American beers though.  Far from King of Beers.  Light yellow color, and very little taste.  Why would you want rice in a beer?

Pours well, nice head, but doesn’t last long. Not much nose. Crisp, but no malt flavor, tiny bit of hops. Like most American megabrews, best when served very cold, when it can be a nice thirst quencher.

Very average with not much to recommend it. Strictly a beer for events that require mass consumption. In our circle this is merely a beer extender, ie a beer that you drink after you run out of good beer.

Everyday light gold with shy aromas of white rice, wood and a sneaky hint
of malt. Overcarbonated. The bland, watery flavour features sticky rice and
an alcoholic sweetness. Drink only as a last resort.

Not a ’good’ beer just as a twinkie isn’t ’good’ food. However, sometimes it’s what you need. Usually, oddily sweet with a strange ’rice chex’ cereal aroma that blends into the bottle. I prefer it to other ’mainstream’ beer. The comment about it being ’cidery’ is true. You don’t realize it until you’ve had quite a few. Man, hilarious...he/she reminded me of that ’appley’ aroma.
This is the best Overall Bud product.  Its the only one I will drink.  It makes up in taste for not having a good color or good pour.

Not much here.  Cidery aromas (that’s right, cidery!  there is a distinct appleyness to budweiser and I’ll maintain that position no matter how crazy people think I am)!  No head to speak of.  No hop aroma.  Very, very, very, very pale straw color.  Body is almost non-existent.  Consistent from bottle to bottle, but not much else to say for the king of beers.
Bottled. Clear golden in colour, no head. There is a minor wheaty scent in the aroma. The falavour has a mild malty / watery taste. "Fu**ing close to water"
Bold, pungent aroma.  Dark brown body with a huge brown head and white feet...oh, wait, that’s the Clydesdales.  Now if Anheuser-Busch could brew a beer like that....

who can resist giving the "king" of beers a rating of at least a 2? granted, a  piss-water beer, it still sells in the billions for a reason that goes beyond marketing ... it gets the job done at those picnics or beach parties that demand the bottles in the bundles that come at a relatively inexpensive price. i do, however, wonder what the queen tastes like ... tasteless, i apologize.

hey well what can i say its budweiser no aroma not much of a taste but it does have ABV so it isnt that bad i think pouring it in a glass makes it go down smoother i give this one 3 empty beer cans out of 5.

Bottle. Well, I guess you have to rate Budweiser at some point...so I will get right to it. The comments I have read absolutely crack me up. Nothing spectacular about Budweiser, but a solid, consistent product. I find it refreshing and I don’t mind the taste at all. Is it even in the same class as Brooklyn Lager? No. But, is it piss in a bottle? No. It lacks a difinitive aroma and does not provide much stimulation to the palate...but I do pick up the beechwood flavor. Again nothing special - just a refreshing, cheap, consistent product, that I will grab ice cold when at a barbeque. Everyone seems to bash Bud, and its all in good fun, but I have a feeling that many who put it down, drink it on a consistent basis.
Long lasting, horrible aftertaste.  Highly carbonated.  Someone should try and sell thei piss as Bud products.  It tastes the same and they could make a lot of money off of it.

Pours aan almost transparent grass yellow with a medium head that vanishes quickly. Medium grassy aroma with lots of cornstarch. Lively watery taste with lots of cornstarch. Thin sharp body. Horrible aftertaste.
Clear yellow color with a thick frothy white head. Aroma of light malts with strong notes of corn and wheat. Strong flavor of corn and wheat. Very carbonated.

It’s nearly clear and smells like morning breath.Tastes like water, corn and cheap sake without even a hint of barley or hops. But hey, I’ll give it nostalgia points for being my very first beer at the tender age of 11 at which point it tasted like sweet freedom. At least now I’m free to drink real beer.
the last time i had one (cant remember) but I remember it  tasted something like water and piss

yes, this beer is better than bud light. however, that is not saying much. i would still rather have water than this beer. the only reason this would ever come into contact with my mouth again is if i needed to get really drunk...and at my age (60) i don’t really need that.
Budweiser is fu**ing next to water, making love in a canoo and all those crappy jokes.
Budweiser is piss beer. Buy Miller instead -- it also isnt great but is much better for a cheap American beer.

Argentinian licensed version: Pours a very pale yellow lager, clear and lively carbonated with a medium fast dissapearing head that leaves almost no lacing. Aroma of grains, not clean and a little weak. Flavor is initially sweeet with almost no bitterness and a lot of water. Very weak palate, not much to say. This is supposed to be a thirst quencher not a beer. By seeing the score I think this is probably better than the american version.
Typical American lager, a pale gold beer with a thin white head, definately not the "King of Beers" as my nephew from whom I got the sampler believes.

This is the famous Budweiser beer...
I drank so much of this in college I memorized the paragrah on the label and won money reciting it.  There’s something about "the King".  Even though there’s really nothing special about it, countries all over the world that brew vastly better beer sell more Bud than anything else.  Who knows?
OMG GREATEST BEER EVER! AM I RITE GUYS?!?!?!?!!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!

I am not sure why people shoot down this brew so much. My usual is a Stella Artois, but the price often makes me have to go to the domestic brew. As a cheap regular beer, I can’t find a fault with the golden brew. And let’s face it, no man in his right mind will argue that a Bud is better than a Harp, Stella or Bass. But as a regular drinking beer, it works, with no bad aftertaste, an above-average palate and a distinct pleasant taste. Call me crazy, but I can’t shoot down the King of Beers.
Its bud.  Everyone knows what it is and what it isn’t ( a good beer).  But I’ve had less flavorful macros than this.

Actually knocked back a few ice cold cans of Bud at a friend’s house the other night, and I have to say in all honesty, I enjoyed them. I think we all know what this beer is, and if you take it for what it is, even a beer geek can drink a Bud every now and then. I don’t  think anyone will argue that this isn’t a well made beer, but that it is bland and boring for the simple reason that is its intent. Its brewed to appeal to the majority of people who don’t have a real passion or love for beer, but just something cold and refreshing to drink. I won’t be going out and buying any Bud, but when given the choice between Bud or no beer at all, like was the case for me, the Bud worked.

Well obviously this one is made for the masses who could care less about flavor, and are more into getting wasted. I hadn’t had a Bud in many years and while having Thanksgiving at my in-laws, I was asked if I’d like a Bud. Not to seem like an ass, I said sure. Popped the can open and drank. Nothing. Nada. Nil. Zip. Again, I hit the can and same. But of course I could burp a blast of corn breath that could melt plastic. Anyways, as usual nothing good could be said about this stuff. Stay far far away, let the ignorant masses buy the swill for the PAARRTTYY and get wasted on the crap. Leave the good stuff for us.

Has pale yellow colour. The head is white. I can´t say this one has any characteristic aroma and taste at all. Just little sweet and has a watery feeling. Tanx to my brother who brougt me this one all the way from the U.S.

12 oz Bottle, 5% a/v
Pours a brighty cheery gold color with a good amount of carbonation. White head that dissapates rapidly. Nose of fresh grain and a bit fruity. Tastes clean and crisp if not watered down. Pretty decent for an unassuming beer drinker, or for a break when your out cutting the lawn. Better then I expected
La bière typique pour l’Américain typique. Allumer, transparent, pas la valeur le temps.
pas fort comme biere, trop commune et trop utilisée dans des partys... manque de gout...
Pale lager.  There were no offensive flavors.  I’m not very clever and this is all I could come up with.

Ce liquide peut flateur dans ton les sens, n’a, avec le recul, aucune qualité apparante...pourtant apprécier de la vindicte populaire américaine, cette bière en a garder les propriétés : inodore, incolore et sans saveur! Je lui donne 4 pour son effort!

n addition to this already light less flavorful beer.... they also cut back on hops to save money (more water less grain) but try and make the end-product innocuous to the casual drinker. The change has been a gradual one, taking place in small increments over many years, so that most consumers would not notice the difference. These practices are followed up by huge, multi-media, marketing campaigns that attempt to sell brand image rather than beer flavor. They run these large marketing campaigns because they know without them they would sell a single drop of their funny tasting version of bottled water.

Yellow, but with a decent head at least. Compared to fresh water, it has a little malt aroma and a touch of DMS. Thin, sweet flavour. In all fairness, it’s as good as any rice beer for chili-heavy Asian food.
Nothing incredibly bad or good about this beer.  No real offensive flavors, but not really much of any flavor.  Does have a strange sour aftertaste
Just a typical Pale Lager. There are only a few that stand out and this is not one of them. It taste great only after 12 or so, if I can remember....
The King of beers. The self proclaimed King of beers. Stop drinking this crap make it go away!
OK beer but horrible aftertaste.  I guess this is what you get for a mass produced beer.  Everyone has seen and tasted this beer so no point in writing a description

This beer will differ depending on what medium delivers it to you. In the can, it doesn’t have a taste. On tap, it just tastes like beer. In the bottle, poured between two breasts or buttcheeks of a stripper it tastes like gold! Or better yet, it tastes like AMERICA! But as we say in Canadamaroon: Hooray! The party begins with the Budweiser beer! I drank enough of this stuff to turn my eyes yelllow. It’s that good. Forget al that expensive, pretentious hippy jock tough guy red neck beer, Budweiser sums it all up in one bottle. It’s not that good actually.
How can this be the best selling beer in the world.  I really don’t know how any one can say that this is the king of beers.  Everything about it is bad accept it contains alcohol
Roy des bières...   point de vue des ventes seulement, pas pour son contenu. Un goût non présant, l’arome de céréal extremement légé, consut pour le "party".

Bright yellow color, with a soft foamy white head, floral hops, shy fruity note in the aroma follows through on medium-bodied palate with a fruity pale malt, with some sweetness notes, leading towards a very low hop bettering finish.

Aroma - no thank you, Appearance - very pale, flavor - excuse me?, palate - thin and watery, overall -   this is no beer. That’s probably why it’s the no.1 best selling beer in the world, most beer drinkers don’t like the flavor of a beer they just want to get wasted...

Born on October 19, 2005, Happy 2 month anniversary, bottle of Budweiser!

Paley-pale, palest of the pale yellow, and crystal clear, head starts thick, then slides down to a negligible ring, always bone white, until it’s a shallow pool of bubbles.

Aroma: bright, sweet, then empty. Far-off echo of hops, but mostly vegetal, with a switch of straw. Corn and rice, you bet.

Taste: Wetness crowds the scene first in here, lots of water in this. Thin bodied, ...and I’m searching and scratching for any real kind of flavor. Water and corn, plus fizz...?

Harsh carbonation, very active on the palate, extraordinarily fizzy all over the tongue, and that’s not a good thing. To me, anyway. I’m wincing as I drink, and I have witnessed plenty of people toss it back without trouble. Relax, relax...

Dull, dry finish. Nothing resonates in the memory, or the mind, but neither was anything supposed to...knock ’em back, set up all over again...why worry about taste?

There’s nothing really wrong with The King of Beers, but neither is there anything good about it.

Crisp, yes. Refreshing...maybe. The carbonation bugs me too much, I’ll take water instead. Smooth? Maybe, but at what cost? I could use a little flavor...hello, malt? Hops? Drinkability? Mmmm...not for this cat, I could drink it, but I’d be so bored, my soul would shudder and thoughts of self-ruination would rumble in my brain.

Good thing there are plenty of other choices.
But, if you dig it, hey, knock yourself out. Don’t let me get in your way.
Bottom line, its an american beer for american people. Its an all purpose beer to either drink at a wedding, office party, backyard barbeque, or for a fun game of beer pong.

The ’heavy’ version of my favorite light drinking game beer.  I leave this to football games and drinking games only.  I wish it tasted better,  because you can get it freaking everywhere.  But it is back in the C- category in my book.  And I’m pretty genereous.

This beer will give you a headache, guaranteed. Many more off flavors than Miller and Coors. For some reason, the Brits pay the same price for a bottle of Bud as for a pint of Guinness. It’s trendy over there.
Some beers are made to drink others are made to chug. I only drink bud if i am playing drinking games.
Not a bad beer, but again, for an American beer this isn’t that bad.  Gives me a headache the next day.

This is the beer that broke me and my high school buddies in. If we had the money(because it is expensive) we were drinking these things all night. Watery, boring flavor, but still my favorite as far as cheap american water-lagers.

Budweiser, simply put, is a beer man’s beer.  This lager’s taste and aroma is just slightly above adequate which in turn makes it a near perfect median in which to judge other beers.  Budweiser was the first beer I started to drink regularly as a young adult and still to this day provides a safe and satisfying last resort whenver i’m lost and wondering what to drink for the night.

Pours a golden color with lots of white head.  Aroma of grains and corn with some hoppiness.  Meant for drinking and drinking a lot in one night.

Comparable to Miller in quality and color and only slight differences in taste... blah blah wheat blah blah rice, etc.

Typical beer for non-beer drinkers.
Far better than miller...not really a high quality beer.  meant for drinking, and drinking lots...lots of carbonation.  quenches ones thinst - gets one drunk.
Can.  Well now doesn’t this beer taste like a soft drink or what, moreso than any other I’ve come across, highly drinkable with all the commercial additives.

So the night after I make my dad try a few of my crazy homebrews he comes in with a couple bottles of budweiser.  I’ve never had Budweiser before I say... he replies, "Don’t be a snob, I had your fancy crap last night so you have to have some real beer tonight."  I still had to pour it out into a glass, which ruffled his feathers a little because real beer is drunk right out of the bottle!  This rating has little to do with the beer because this beer had little to no flavor.  I get a bit of adjunct in the nose with some vegetable. The flavor is less offensive than the nose...just the slightest hint of something...do they use malt in this?  I really tried tasting hops, but couldn’t find any.  I’ll remember not to make my dad drink anymore homebrew if this is my punishment.

Bottled. Brewed by Stag in England. What irritates me most of this one, is the statement on the label, "we know of no brand produced by any other brewer which costs so much to brew and age." This is probably the biggest lie ever presented to mankind. Pale golden with a white head. Light malty aroma and flavor, with some hops to finish off. Watery palate. There’s nothing offensive of this one, except the label, but why do we bother drinking it? Eerh, we don’t. Rating: 3-2-3-2-7-1.7. (051229)<br /><br />Can. (brewed in USA) It pours a pale golden to yellow body with good carbonation and some chill haze. Minimal white head. Actually, more a thin layer of bubbles. Weak nose with a fruity touch, something reminiscent of a blend of wet, cheap cardboard and cooked rice. Thin, fizzy body with flavors going the same way as the aroma. Some bitterness towards the finish and actually gives a sweet impression. It’s supposed to be an easy drinkable beer, but I actually find it challenging. Mostly because of the carbonation level, but also because of it’s lack of flavor and aroma. Not disgusting though. (081129)
Not as bad as some of the offerings from Bud, but this one will pick your butt with a headache of epic preportions.  Drink with caution.
Pours a fizzy crisp golden yellow.  Aromas of corn, minor hopping, and not much else.  Flavor is bland american lager with almost no hops.
Can.  Had one of this at my parent’s house on Christmas.  I don’t understand why so many people HATE this beer.  It truly isn’t that bad.  Way better than Miller.
Budweiser is the alright considering it’s a domestic beer. Goes down easy and gets you drunk, what more do you need?

crap. nasty. gross. icky. retchid. horrible. repugnant. vile. Unpalatalble.
Miller is better.
last time I had one I threw up..Don’t eat on a full stomach unless you want an enpty one.

This ain’t no Pawtucket Patriot, but fricken A...It’s gets you drunker than a drunk guy being drunk at a drinking contest.  I remember that one time when I got wasted before I went Scuba diving in Hawaii, and puked in the respirator at about 15 feet underwater.   Or that one night I drank so much I blacked out and Cleveland and Quagmire had to bail me out of jail because I was humping that light post.  All good time I attribute to the king of beers.  Oh yeah... GO PATS!!!!!

My overall impression is... this is crap, but it could be worse. I’m not quite sure how, but I like to hope so. Pale yellow color, head is too foamy, white. Palate is thin, watery. Taste is mostly corn, some alcohol, but not much else going on. Finish is watery.
Did they forget to put in the hops and malt? It’s got absolutely no flavour. Just another tasteless alcoholic beverage to come out of America.

Bottle-Woo hoo!  The 1565th rating of the brew, what can I say, had it at my boss’s Christmas party, so it received so some bonus points.  It does tasted better in the bottle than in the glass, wonder why?
Little aroma, but to much carbonation.  Light in color, malty flavor with watered down taste. I think miller brewing company has them beat.
What can you say about this beer.  It’s horrible sitting at home, or at a bar, but I have drank it at baseball game before.  Over carbonated watery junk

Watery and mostly tasteless, but it’s not as bad as the mega brewery light beers.  At least it doesn’t taste downright bad like an MGD.  It’s drinkable, just not worth the bother except as a means of alcohol delivery.

Long-overdue re-rate from a Phillies-branded 24 oz can ("born on date" 01MAR13).  Nose sweet, corny, lightly floral.  Very pale clear golden with a head that completely dissipates in about two seconds.  Taste lightly sweet, less corn, none of the cereal qualities of Coors (which I recently had), pleasant floral tones, relatively clean.  Fizzy-crisp light-medium  body smooth.  Just a very inoffensive pale lager, it’s hard for me to rile up any negative emotion about the actual product.

RE-rate. Originally rated 0.5. The flavor is very subtle. I originally thought this beer was incredibly bland. It is not at all. There is a complexity and perfect balance. It is not a beer enthusiasts beer, but a beer drinkers beer.
This is definitely NOT a $10/ six pack brew, but that’s not what it’s supposed to be.  For a mass produced lager, this isn’t terrible.  It’s a good, inexpensive beer to get drunk on.
I have drank better tasting dishwater. If this is the King of Beers why is beer popular at all?

People are far too hard on this beer; just because it’s sold by the train load doesn’t make it bad. Fresh, it’s a very refreshing drink; in the context of the backyard barbeque or football game, it’s quite enjoyable. It’s not complex, it’s not a beer to sit and think about, it’s just a good beverage!

The only reason I give it any points is simply because it’s a beer and not water. it looks like urine, it tastes marginally worse and the only beer I can think of that I would less like to put in my body is michelob. In these days of strong national pride Budweiser should be disgraced at the bad reputation it’s given our wonderful country.

Horrible american piss water.  The urine yellow soda water was only a dollar for a bottle at Moe’s southwestern grill.  I want that dollar back.  It’s not natty light bad, but does taste sour and is too filling for such a weak beer.
Piss yellow color and a mild malty flavor. Watery finish. A beer to be drunk ice cold. At least it’s not Miller. A tailgating  beer when comsumption of mass quantities is called for.
Okay, this used to be my favorite beer, until I started trying micro-brews.  Now I find it to be very watery, with the flavor of corn and rice.
Years ago i think genesse used to advertise "Doesn’t taste mass produced".  I used to wonder what that meant.   Now I know.

24 oz. can at the St. Pete Forum.  Poured out a golden color with a foamy, sudsy, quickly disappearing head.  Not much aroma maybe a little grain.  The taste is a little sweet with some corn and a slight bit of hops.  Pretty thin on the palate but not a complete watered down disaster like the it’s cousin Bud Light.  Not my normal beer of choice but usually one of the better beers at a hockey game.
Bottle. Well not as bad as expected. It tastes like water with alkohol, and it looks a bit like beer. Must be OK on a very hot summerday.
there is no reason to ever speak of bud. it has it’s place and is an excellent thirst quencher.

(Bottle 33 cl) Pretty much no colour - more grey than golden - head is pretty much absent. Now I know why most people drink it off the bottle - because it looks so disgusting. Beers brewed with rice don’t necessarily have to be horrible, but this one has a weird, sticky and very unpleasant sweetness. No body - no bitterness - no beer? 020401

I figured I would give this a shot as I haven’t had it for years.  As soon as I had the first sip I knew why I avoid it.  There isn’t even that much of a taste to talk about.  I find it amazing that people actually think this is a nice tasting beer.  There are worse, but not many.

I wish it wasn’t so but this is nothing less than an inferior iimitation of what beer product is supposted to taste like.  This is crap, if this is your beer of choice, maybe you should be thinking about the depth of your intellect.
If you think this is great beer, God bless you, I wish you well, You’re going to need it.  I wouldn’t waste a Sunday’s football day on this dreck.

Ok, the only reason this is the ’King of Beers’ is because 90% of people that drink beer do so just to get drunk and they don’t care what it tastes like. If they stopped to check they’d find a tasteless, aroma-less, commercialized bottle of cow urine. Yeah, sometimes the truth hurts.

Poured this to compare to the AB Brewmaster’s Private Reserve. NO comparison! Pours a urine yellow with a big fizzy, loose head. Aroma is a bit of malt and hop, rice and a strange chemical scent. Flavor is more of the same, a bit metallic, too. Pretty poor. I can’t believe how much of this I drank when I was younger, and how much it repulses me now. Still, better, IMHO, than the Coors and Miller counterparts.

Brewed and sold since 1876, this beer is the largest-selling beer in the world. Budweiser has been the world’s best-selling beer since 1957, and is distributed in more than 70 countries. Budweiser leads the U.S. Premium beer category, outselling all other domestic premium beers combined. In fact, one in almost every five beers sold in the United States today is a Budweiser.
A drink complete with pump. Could be a heart or some other internal organ. Or it could be a reference to external devices. Or an action connected with the drinking of this liquid.
Can’t stand it, least favorite beer of mine by far.  No redeeming qualities.
Its just not good. Bland, boring, doesnt taste that good. What could be worse? oh yeah Bud light!

very white head, plenty of carbonation, and a not so attractive thin yellow color.  Some slight sweet aromas that are masked by the old barn aromas.  Not much flavor here.  Tastes much the same as the armoas.  In their quest to please everyone and not be offensive, Budweiser has made a sub-par beer.

Bottle: It is the KING of beers for goodness sakes.  Pours light yellow.  Served cold it can really cut your thirst after you’ve cut the lawn.  But so can ice water.  It is a crisp, higly carbonated, mass-produced beer.  Not bad on a hot day, but not a beer gem.  The King? Pfffft...far from it buddy

I had this "beer"11 years ago in the u.s.,..I turnd the bottle 3 times to be sure that is was no spring water after "best before"
Later I  trid it another time,....wors
And today and this is the last time!!,...unbelieveble pour.

Bottle: Straw golden, lacing bleached head; some citrusy notes in the aroma, cardboard and well hidden traces of malts too; initial citrusy taste, light bitter flavour, slightly fruity (citrusy) finish; extremely light bodied and a bit sticky; not absolutely undrinkable, but pretty watery.................
the king of beers-this lager has a taste that is not that notewothy.Its the advertising that sells this beer.
Not worth the bother.  Any commercial beer like this is, for the most part crap.  Drink a microbrew instead, much healthier for you.  The horses are good, though.
Well, it is good for a hot day or a barbecue I guess.  But I wouldn’t drink it.

OK...Im rating this. Pale yellow lageer with a creamy white head. Adjunct corn and sulfur in aroma. In mouth, lightish malt, no hops, a metallic finish, mineral water body....refreshin!...yup its Bud...Canadian style.
if I could rate this lower than a 0.5 I would but the site doesn’t let me. the only thing worse than an ice cold bud is a warm one. King of Crap if you ask me
It’s the King of Beers! Well, the king of crappy beers. How about something with some taste? I’m not in high school anymore.
Very little tase and flavour only reason people drink this junk is becasue of the advertising... whenever I am in a bar and see people order this I cringe! Nasty Stuff!!!

Bartender, you got something better?  This beer is brewed about 30 miles from my house.  I know people who actually work at the brewery.  This beer is an example of what a huge advertising budget can do.
Just as good as bud lgiht, but in a canit has this metallic, unappealing taste.  However, I cant really talk shit, I have drunk this stuff for years, and Im a bit partial to it.
Just another mass produced, watered-down beer that manages to sell a lot by having lots of money to market itself...
i don’t know why they call it the king of beers it taste like crap but hey they don’t know what good beer taste like anyway.
Absolutely horrible! I’ve heard it said that Budweiser tastes like horse pee, but that’s an insult to horses everywhere.
clydesdale urine plain and simple.bud needs to spend money on ingredients not advertising.
They put King of Beers on the f’n label for a reason.  I prefer Bud Light, but Bud is totally tasty.  I would definately drink this regularly if I didn’t care about becoming a total fatty.

The King of Beers baby! I actually tried bud Lite before Bud. One day all they had was Bud so I tried it. Pretty damn good! Excellent actually. Not being light didn’t really hurt it at all. They dont call it the King for nothing. Quintessentially american.
Bud is not bad considering most European macro beeers, such as Carlsburg, Carling, Nastro Azzuro, Stella Artois (UK), Kronenburg, SKOL, Holsten Pils. It’s a nice change once in a while.

I can’t stand this beer.  It’s like club soda with beer flavoring.  If I want a cheap crappy watery beer I’ll drink Corona, which is at least pleasant tasting water, and I get a lime wedge with the deal.  Bud:  No aroma until the beer left in the bottom of the glass gets stale, ugly pale piss yellow with a touch of green.  No flavor other than the terrible bitterness in the aftertaste.  Palate is like drinking alka seltzer.  I’d rather not have a beer than have a Bud.  Avoid this like the plague.

The fact that this is one of the top 5 selling beers in the world is proof that Anheuser Bush cannot be making everything wrong. For me it is also proof the average beerdrinker is not necessarily being an epicure or a beeradvocate in reference to this fabulous website.
Not adhering to the "Deutsche Reinheitsgebot" is rarely a sign of quality and the use of rice is here obviously made for economic reasons rather than in attempt to enrichen taste.
As someone put it, this is rather water with an infusion of beer taste than a beer itself (tastewise not with regards of it’s ABV).

Draught.  Most of the popular beers in the world are essentially *not* beer.  This swill pours like carbonated pee with a small white scum of a head.  It smells sugar sweet with a bit of sour grain which gets nasty and vegetal as it warms - and it does warm, as this plonk doesn’t encourage one to finish it quickly, or at all.  The taste is of sugary apple juice with some creamed corn added for flavour - it’s a weak, spineless, sugary pitiful excuse for a beer - but hell, it’s miles better than Bud Light.  Shudder.

I love bud.  Cheap, completely American, satisfies no matter the mood.  Sure there’s a million other beers that taste better but you can never go wrong with this King.  Of course, don’t confuse this with bud light which tastes like water.
College beer.  We used to recite the anthem on the label before we downed them.    It’s an image beer.  Nothing more, really.

It’s average, goes down well, the bottle makes it look more like real beer than it is. Draught in pubs tastes very watery and sweet but real good, nice to have it in a pint. Heck its just beer, dont get so opinionated, it must have done something to be drunk everywhere in the world, things dont just get worldwide by doing nothing. Blame advertising or whatever but you have to have something to advertise else you dont make money, my girlfriends dad was a strict bitter only drinker but he likes bud, why? cos it tastes alright!
It looks fairly nice, but that’s about where the goodness ends. Thin, watery, with a metallic taste lacking any true malt character. A little hops bitterness in the finish.
I’ve had worse however this beer is not a good beer. There is just no aroma, no hops taste. This is a good beer for people who do not like the taste of beer

the greatest beer on the planet, it symbolizes America and all it stands for. i love this beer and i think it is a true man’s beer, one who loves football and women. If you are a girly man stay away, this is for red, white, and blue bleeding Americans
Very tastefull beer. Not the best beer that I have ever drank but very close to the top.
this is a decent beer not close to the top but any means but far from the bottom

After drinking good beer, this is one beer that is almost impossible to drink.  The head has no lacing or longevity, but this is just as well since there is no good flavor to keep in the beer.  Vinegar and metal finish.
It’s a decent beer, but it too thick of a beer to be an american beer. Now if you want a good thick beer go with the irish.
the only reason people drink budweiser is due to the media hype not the taste of as in large parts of west virginia only thing there carry
Tried in can, bottle and on tap. Refreshing drink if anything else. Incredibly thin and watery. A true product of marketing hype. Would only drink again if given can for free.
This is beer for people who don’t like beer.Heavy marketing makes this available everywhere, but there is always a better beer avialable. I’d rather go thirsty!
For what Bud is, it’s really not that bad.  I prefer it to the other American macros, and on that level, I think it’s pretty good.
Bottle. Watery flavor, bitterness on the end. Best thing about this beer is the appearance, which is quite pale and light.

bottle 33cl, some hops in the aroma, not much. Thin palet, here and there some malts. dry finish. In search for some richness in the beer, didn’t found it. This is definitly not one of the better lagers I tasted.
Bottle 12 oz. Clear amber color with moderate head that diminished quickly. Small aroma. Light to medium body. Little to no flavor. Little better than cold water with alcohol.

My dad let me try this beer as a kid.  Even then my underdeveloped taste buds told me to stay the hell away from this swill.  Overuse of rice and corn grains have rendered this mockery of the pilsner-style into a tasteless blah-fest with no body.  The only reason I gave the appearance a 2 is that I didn’t see any mice in it.

The king of beers. When I was a young child, my mother would rather fill my bottle with this pale lager than breast feed. This scrumptous delight pours deep brown with a creamy white head. When a can is cracked, one becomes overwhelmed with the aromas of fruits and a Cape Cod high tide. A can of Budweiser is like a naked frolic through a meadow on a brisk, October morning. Or perhaps a Megadeth concert on a warm Long Island summer night. I pour this shit on my cereal.

First beer I ever tasted. Acquired a can from the fridge (was teenager) and drank it in the backyard. Didn’t really like the taste and it gave me a big headache. About the same now. Little taste. Somewhat refreshing after mowing the lawn.
Almost, but not quite passable. The taste of water filtered through the detritus of roast barley with a bit of hops tossed in. It’s almost possible to drink this beer without retching.

I have never been a big fan of Budweiser.  I remember in my youth at family picnics mixing this on draft half & half with draft birch beer.  Actually, that was quite good but mostly because the birch beer gave it any palatable quality whatsoever.  Maybe it’s the beechwood aging, but Bud has always giving me headaches.  Then again, maybe it was just my body crying out for me to drink some real beer, dammit.

Bottle. Watching a friend’s band play in a basement bar and this was about the only thing that wasn’t "lite" and thus resembled beer. Some perceptible light malt flavors, watery. Not as corny or pisslike as the spectrum of light beers. There was enough varied cigarette smoke clogging the air to make me thankful I wasn’t wasting a good beer.
What hasn’t been said about it?  Clean tasting, not much else. Very little flavor. Bland and boring. Shows most people don’t like the taste of beer.
Plain, nothing at all special about this beer.  The only thing going for it is that it isn’t completely terrible.  It’s drinkable, so that’s good at least.
Surpassed only by Bud Light for worst beer ever made.  You must really be hard up to be drinking this stuff.  Gag.
Horrible beer. Head that disapears as fast as you pour it, and absolutely very thin body, no distinctive taste. Flavored water.
Not very good, not even in the general macro line-up, I would choose most beers over this
Has single handledly ruined the image of american beer and the name of budvar (the great czech beer). Not much good to say about this beer except that it is cheap.
Looked like piss, might have been an improvement if it tasted like piss, instead it had no taste.
I wish that there was a lower score, I believe that this is the worst "beer" in the world, and I have been around the world. PBR me ASAP
Can. It’s pale piss colored, smells and tastes of...nastiness. I can’t believe people actually consent to drinking this stuff.

Looks like it’s been mixed 50/50 with water, solid head though. No aroma, no flavour. It’s not horrible, but it is indeed watery and completely tasteless - no signs of malt, bitterness, whatever. Ain’t repulsive, but it indeed tastes like it consisted of water in 50%. Drinkable if there’s nothing better around.

This really is one of the worst things imaginable. I thought I’d hit rock bottom with Old Milwaukee, but this beer trumps it. It is hard to believe that this beer accounts for 20% of all beer drunk in the US. WTF.

What can I say?  It sours my stomach if I drink it.  It’s too carbonated.  I don’t like the hops they use.  There’s little or no character to them.  If anything, it proves what superb marketing can do with not that much to work with.

The classical Bud. Very generic and unremarkable. Not much to notice except a limited bitterness and some floral aromas hard to distinguish. Nothing to rock your world but not as bad as a lot of people say.

Sampled from a 0.473l can. Lightly malt aroma, with some faint hop notes. Probaly fizzy and yellow body, with a very smallish white head. Light flavor, light corn, faint hops. Very clean flavor, this beer doesnt tastes bad its just so flavorless.
Better than bud light. Not much more to say. Thin, watery. Miller light has better ads.

Sampler from Beer School at Sea World San Antonio. Poured yellow fizzy with a white head. According to the A-B propagandist, this fine American Lager is world class, and ales are just cheap ways to make beer. Ummm, yeah. At Beer School, they pour 2 samples of Bud. One "fresh" (within a few days old, kept refrigerated since bottling), and one "old" (kept warm for a week). Guess which one tastes like "Bud" you buy from the store? Yep, the old one. Nasty, skunky, funked up aftertaste. The fresh one would actually make a refreshing lawnmower beer. But, I’m not gonna go out and *buy* it to drink it. LOL.

oh yeah, the old bud. I used to drink this stuff all the time. Great beer when your at a bar you’ve never been to and don’t know what to get. Although, no character, taste, or palate. Always a decent backup, and thats how i like it!

wow another dissapointment by anheuser-bush probably one of the worst beers ont he market if i had to choose i would porably brink pbr before this beer but in its defense if all you want to do is get obliterated for cheap then here you go.

I do not believe of being able to write a comment about this beer...bad!

io non credo di potere scrivere un commento riguardo questa birra...cattiva!

I rated the impression higher than the rest becasue I am truly impressed that they can actually market and sell stuff that tastes like piss. Either they have marketing gods or the general public is a bunch of conformists who do whatever tv tells them (the later is more likely). Anyway this is terrible, if its cold it takes some of the nasty bite away, but it is still bad. The taste has really nothing there but maybe stale malts. Have no idea how this can be called the king

It has a nice color, and is very smooth.  A classic American lager.  Not too much alcohol, and has a nice hoppy flavor.  Very easy to drink.  Does not pour with much of a head, and does not have a strong after taste.  If you are going to drink mass-market-American lager go for this one, MGD, or the High Life.

Is this a beer?  I can not believe that it is.  No, it is a beer-skunk flavored water.  With bubbles.

Lots of bubbles.  
Something’s wrong, I think.
Boring pale lager ... very little flavor and similar to sparkling water. This is proof that most people have not taste.
you get what you pay for. which isn’t a whole lot. watery, pale piss color. no head. bitter aftertaste.  good for mass consumption drinking games.
really, no need to ever be drinking this unless it’s dollar beer night or something of that nature.
craptacular. water,y flavorless, nice tinny after tase wonderful skunk piss aroma and color.
its to over hyped its definaly not the king of beers to watery no flavor  might as well put a  alcohol in water
Bud has to be the worst beer in the world.  It’s so watery and bland, but with a strange bitter aftertaste.  Even thought it’s cheap it’s still not worth the money.

Light pale urine yellow with a thin dissipating white head.  I think there was some citrus in the aroma and flavor, but not sure.  Very watery and carbonated body.  The best thing I can say is it was very cold on a very hot day.
ummm... let’s see.. ok to drink in a pub if you are a college student, cheap and easy to find!

I rate this actually a few notches lower than its cheaper counterpart BUSCH.  Drinking Budweiser is an excercise in imagination, as it makes you want to imagine what a beer is really supposed to taste like.  Nothing special to look at in a glass, decent head, decent color, decent aroma.  Overall the taste seems to be steeply cultivated in the mundane so that ANYONE can drink it.  There is absolutely nothing unique about the flavor of this beer.  For the price, not bad...but Busch is the better buy if you’re shopping for an anheiser product.  Budweiser beer suffers from 2 major flaws in that drinking more than 3 causes a terrible headache, and drinking more than 6 is likely to have you sitting on a tiolett in agony.  Is this poison?  I should be able to get a reasonable buzz without getting a headache and the shits.  But without fail, everytime I’ve given this product a chance, it slaps me in the face.  The king of beers is an overmarketed middle of the road product with little to offer but flu symptoms.

OK, everyone has tasted this beer. We all know that it’s a light beer (in taste). It has become so "homoginized" that you can barely classify it as beer. What it really is, is alcoholic water. When you go to a bar in a "down home" area, this may be your beer of choice. But, absent those restrictions, "Stay away from this beer"! They are only everywhere because of a "vast" investment in advertising, and squashing of micro brews. Leave the Bud alone, go for beer from a real "Meisterbrau".
Yawn yawn yawn. Yawn,  yawn yawn -  yawn. Yawn  yawn,  yawn yawn yawn yawn. Yawn yawn, waste of time.

More like damp air than beer. This is so light on flavour that moments after the first sip I found myself absentmindedly wondering whether I’d tasted it yet. Pours a pale watery yellow with a short now-you-see-it-now-you-don’t head. Aroma is mainly wet dog and faint adjuncts. Fizzy soda-like body. It’s sweet, with no discernible finish. Of course, it’s very clean tasting, but then so is soda.

Bottled. Brewed by Stag Brewing in London.  Pours a very pale yellow colour with a lively carbonation and a nice foamy head which leaves some lace. Aroma has vegetables and adjunts. Tastes a bit sweet and corny, but is otherwise very bland. Has no noticeable finish. No offensive flavours. Body is rather light, but I´ve experienced worse. There are worse beers, but this is more like sweetish water.  The appearance is not that bad either, especially the head. Maybe it has to do with it being contract brewed in England? Otherwise, crap!
Tastes like artifical and makes me sick. I wonder what they really put in it. Too bubbly, watery and commercial for my tastes. Maybe if you are short on cash and just hafta get drunk but otherwise...

King of Beers my ass! Of the big three - I like this one the least. I’d take a Miller or a Coors Light 1st but of coure I’d rather not have to pick from any of them. Luckily in Phila you can always get a Yuengling Lager in a pinch and not have to resort to this.
Not much can be said about this beer, if you can even call it that.  Very ricey, lots of fillers not much flavor.  Very little to this "beer".
I wonder why this beer is so popular, since it has hardly no flavour, no aroma, no head, no nothing

12oz bottle - Pours pale golden with a short white head.  Aroma of rice and corn.  Not much there.  Flavor about the same.  On the palate it is very much like drinking a glass of water.  This beats bud light but that is about the only thing it beats.
Like the very very clear color and aroma. The rice is the secret of best selling beers

Well, I used to drink this all the time, especially at family gatherings.  Haven’t had it since I’ve joined ratebeer until this weekend. (family wedding)  It is most defenitely remarkably bland.  Flavored water, like many have said, is a good description.  I can’t rate it as low as many others have however, too many good memories.

i cannot belive i havnt rated this before fuck man. Oh well, i had 4 last nite and it just dawned on me how much corn this has in it i have nothing to say about this, it is not worth thinking about, though slightly better than miller, hehe!

KING OF BEERS MYASS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  WHY RICE? I don’t understand what rice is doing in this beer. You know, there are worse beers than this. The first taste isn’t all that bad, very crisp and refreshing. It is too bad they don’t come in 3 oz bottles! It basically has little to no color and very little aroma. As I said the first taste isn’t all bad, but each and every taste after that is a little worse. It is balanced though,  as I wasn’t able to pick up on any real malt or hop flavors.

Well this is a huge commercial beer and for a huge commercial beer there is one thing you have going for you.  You are able to replicate the same (Crap) stuff all over the world and be very consistant.  I hold up my dirty glass of crappy beer to you.
A grainy aroma and yellow in color.  Has a white head that is very short in duration.  A weak grain like flavor that leaves very little on the palate.

Poured the 16oz "bowling pin" bottle into a tall wheat glass.  Clear light yellow in color with a big frothy white head that quickly diminishes to nothing.  Aroma of grassy hops, DMS, and a sour bready aroma.  Lots of adjuncts here, rice and corn for sure.  Effervescent with alot of carbonation.  Leaves a stale cardboard taste in my mouth.  My hope is that someday people will wake up and realize this is a horrible beer.  But as long as people continue to buy things based on image, this will be popular.
basic, light appearance, dry finish. Its one of those drink as fast you can beers.

I had this beer tonight at the local bowling alley.  on tap served in a plastic cup.  just a little bit of that stale frozen vegetable smell and not much else in the aroma.  taste is light and thirst quenching, sweet and not bitter at all with no after taste.  to me this is less a beer, and more an alcohol delivery device with a less than pleasant yet inofensive taste.  If you drink enough of it fat chicks will look rather sexy.  DRINK AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!

Alright beer.  Nothing to complain about here.  You have all seen it and tasted it so I won’t describe it.  Good if you don’t have many choices, bad if you do.  Don’t waste too much time with this stuff.

My Favourite Lager, ok maybe it is piss like but its great on a hot day.

Brilliantly refreshing and easily drinkable which is what I want most of the time.
A great name in beerland but it has no taste, smell bitterness. But the refreeshing rate on a sunny afternoon will be high. The average of 1.39 is much too low for it is not yakkie.
bads taste, massive head. skunky and bitter. great if youlike hangovers too.

Slightly more colorful than most of it’s mass-produced counterparts.  But  I honestly don’t know how anyone can actually drink it.  It not only is watery, but the little flavor that is there is very unpleasant.

The King Of Beers? In Annheuser-Busch’s imaginary world perhaps. Nice looking girls in the commercials, but what we got here... looks okay, but tastes dull, vaguely unpleasant feel and taste, boiled-out faint grainy aroma, weird chemical, stale-vegetal aftertaste. I drank this out of necessity recently, only to question the necessity at all. A-B please rename this beer and/or return the Budweiser name to its rightful historical owners in Cesky Budejovicke. It just bugs me that you are so insensitive to beer culture and Europe’s ancient heritage in the Czech Republic that you’d appropriate their product name and then ban their using it. At least let them distribute the real Bud as "Budvar." Anyway your Bud drinkers have only a taste for watery beechwood-aged rice water so why would it confuse people if you at least allowed "Budvar?" Too much lawyering is bad karma my friends.
a true embarassment to american brewing, we drink it more than water.  why?  the same reason 50% voted for that monkey bushie. insane in the membrane
how this beer is the worlds best selling beer has me beat its bland and not all that good the best thing about this beer is its ads

The palest straw colour, almost white. Spritzy white head that dissappeared quickly. Garsyy aroma, sweetly chemical tatste. Desereves that bad rap it gets.

See waht happens when you run out of beers to rate!!!!

It’s Bud people, what do we expect?  Not full of character, and has little aftertaste.  Great after a team game of your choice with a bunch of buddies outside or along with a BBQ cookout.  Deceptive if consumed in 12 packs.
Just an awful, flavorless beer with no distinctive qualities.  For as little flavor as this beer has, they must’ve injected food coloring into the vat to give it an extremely pale yellowish/brown.

Like a limp penis. Makes Miller taste like fine cognac which ain’t exactly a compliment. Of the BMC, this gets an F. At least Coors has some (not much) character. The exact opposite of every other beer: the 6th tastes worst than the first.

Looks like used motor oil. Well used. Doesn’t taste a lot better. At least it doesn’t smell like motor oil. Not sure what they smoked this with--old cardboard? Bleccchhh.  I’ve had better homebrews. far better.
Very similar to nothing with a hint of rice.....and carbination.  Hey at least its not as bad as Bud Light.
Nice bottle, nice commercials....and that’s about it. It’s actually a good alternative to water, but I would pick any other beer than this.
(bottle)  Blind tasted.  Poured pale yellow.  No aroma, flat on the palate, and it had an unpleasant bitter taste. A true shame.

I’ve done it!!! I actually drank the stuff! Got strange looks because I wanted it in a glass - as if it were a real beer!    Extremely pale gold, virtually no head. Nose: absoletely none. NONE! Taste: yes. There is really some background malt taste. I HAVE to be honest, there is some taste here, that cannot be obtained from pure water. Fully attenuated rice beer. MF: "light" doesn’t come even close. Ohmygod. Please don’t make me say more.
Pretty tasty.  Great can/bottle designs. I recommend the bottles............

as jeff foxworthy would say.  You know your a redneck.... if you drink budweiser the &quotking of beers&quot  Hey there has been some bad monarchies in the past.  This is just another one.  anyway there are worse  beers, but not many.  I would usually go for a water before i have to tap into this stuff.
Good everyday beer, nothin fancy, goes down smooth, is refreshing, and is affordable. sounds good to me
The is a great beer.....if you’re at a NASCAR race and your only other choices are Busch and Busch Lt.

Oh the "king" of beers....Only if you have never had another beer. Mass prduced swill. To be fair, the color is kind of nice, palate is not horrible. but the flavor is drab and dull and bitter. This is the beer that’s at all the gatherings, and that is the only place I drink it, and only when it’s free.

Of all the awful high-volume beers, Budweiser is the least objectionable to me.  Goes down way too easy in mid-summer, especially if very cold.  Not fond of that aftertaste; like chewing a mouthful of pennies -- thank God it goes away almost as soon as it registers.  A weak and thoughtless beer, but not a bad Gatorade subsitute in a pinch.

It poured the same weak color that it always does. The head was a nice fuffy white. The smell was bready and that was about it. Taste was bland. Hops were bearly noticable. It was like lite malt and nothing else. Mouthfeel didn’t suck and the carbonation was a little strong. Drinkability is low. I dont know why but Bud and Bud Lite always gives me a headache. Now I should point out that I live in Utah and the Bud we get here is no stronger that 4.0 ABV. But I doubt that would make a whole lot of difference.
For a cheap macro beer it’s kinda tasty.  Filling though.  But it has an actual beer flavor.  I drank mine out of a 40oz bottle duct taped to my hand.

This ain’t bad beer. There are two negative aspects of Bud - ricey as all get out, and makes you feel like you got kicked in your skull if you pound more than just 4 or 5. The same can be said for MGD. Out of MGD, Coors, and Bud; Bud is the easy choice for me. Best flavor by far of the three, great aroma versus the urine-tinge of Coors. The only better beer of its type is Michelob, which is Bud’s upgrade package. Undisputable King among the 3 cheap-ass macros.

OK.  So, I’ve definitely had Budweiser before.  I wanted this to be the time that I rate it though.  I thought this would be the best possible circumstance to be drinking Budwweiser.  I thought that maybe being at a Bob Dylan and Willie Nelson concert would somehow improve my experience of the beer.  And I think I was right.  I think that the awesome music distracted me from the lack of hops.  I only barely noticed how ugly this draft brew looked in it’s sixteen ounce plastic cup, how weak and uneven was the head.  This is a really bland beer.  It’s pretty highly carbonated.  And has the faintest flavor of earth and grass.  Although somewhere behind me someone was smoking pot, so, I think that may have impaired my judgement of the flavor a tad.

the king of beers?  This brew has nothing to it, no taste, no colour, nothing.  

All it has it has is too much carbination
Very pale with lots of bubbles.  Decent head that disippates quickly.  Mild mild aroma  of hops, corn taste, no real off tastes but very light.

From the bottle at a party, no choice:  Pale yellow and fizzy with a bright white head. Aroma is light grass and lightly soapy. Flavor is lightly sweet with a hint of corn. Palate is thin and watery. Drink ICE cold and watch out for the headache...it’s the rice.

I know, I know, a 15?  Hey what can i say, its a great beer.  People give it a bad rap, but if it was the swill that most people say it is, why is the the most popular beer in America, and perhaps the world??  It is subtle, and not overpowering.  Its a regular lager, good to drink on a hot summer day or at a BBQ.
Even when I was a wussy beer drinker I hated Budweiser.  What’s there to like?  The flat taste?  The near-complete lack of hops?  Just a terrible beer.
Horrific...I tried Budweiser for the first time a few months ago (when i turned 21) I was surprised that a beer that sells so well tasted so watery and flat...
Used to be my daily drinker until my taste buds evolved.  Smells of light malt,corn and rice....ahh adjunct heaven.  Decent to drink when you can get anything else but that’s it.
A good beer but not more. The Budweiser taste like water but you can got drunk more easily.

Watery, thin, virtually tasteless. A mass market flop. I’ll drink water if I’m thirsty and Bus is only other choice.

This Bud’s NOT for me.
Nasty nasty stuff.  I like me some PBR, but this is pure damaged rice, nasty-ass swill.  Nasty nasty nasty nasty nasty (is that 75 characters yet?).

SLIGHTLY better than Miller/Coors/Schlitz and all the other tepid beers mass produced in America, this King of Beers is because it’s King of Sales only. Typical of why everything in America is watered down in taste and afraid to stand out as unique. How can so many people drink this stuff, not to mention the thousand other varieties that they’ve come up with?

As a native St. Louisian, I’m embarrassed that this is the beer associated with my home town.  I can’t figure out whether it’s popularity says more about the power of advertising or peoples bad taste.  It’s almost criminal that so many people associate this liquid with beer.  I only drink at the ball park when I’m very thirsty and there are no other options.  It’s less harsh on tap, but not better flavored.
if this was these only beer on earth to drink, i would commit suicide. wish i could find better beers as easily as i can find this
All i can say about this "king of beers" is that it is the "king of diarrhea" in my experiences..stick with bud light.
An attractive label and packaging hide a very average beer. Corn syrup color and flavor. A testament to marketing if this is truly the world’s #1 beer.
Very light and fruity. Typical american macrobrew. I almost wanna say i taste banana. Boring crappy beer best left to the young ones just starting off in the world of beer.

Proof, Proof my freinds that if you tell someone that somethings good they will buy and defend it to the death.  A-B does all it can to crush the craft beer movement in the world.  In fact on a recent trip to Ireland, all the kids there were happy to pay 6 Euro a pint for it, in the land of delicious stout. The only thing I have good about this beer is fond memories of high school and beer pong.

After the International Night Of Swill earlier this week, I swore that I wouldn’t have another lousy beer for a month or two, but I was out tonight at a club where a friend was playing and was given a drink ticket on the way in. The beer selection was pitiful, so I figured I might as well use my freebee to tick off a rating rather than let it go to waste. Amazingly, I don’t think I ever had a Bud before tonight, and I doubt I’ll ever have one again. Colour is a very light yellow. Very active carbonation, almost frightening really. Aroma of plastic & water that rice has been boiled in. Flavour is pretty much non-existant - when I started, it really seemed like I was drinking tonic water, and once it warmed up, I got just the vaguest hint of something beer-like. The popularity of this beverage is a sad testement to the declining tastes of our culture...

why is this the worlds most sold beer? if you watch coronation street {carefuly} you can now see a bottle on the "Beer sponcer Shelf" in the corner shop. Strong flavour concidering all the corn. light bubbles, mild malt, watery, skanky after taste. Worthless.

You guys in the United States should realise that this is what most Brits think of when they think of American beer. This cold, fizzy tasteless substance is the main beer ambassador of your great country. Please keep it for yourselves and send us more of that Sierra Nevada. A few of us over here know you brew great beer over there.
Ah the king, big taste of corn and sugar, all the best things for a brew.  So this requires more characters these days eh.. I dont think I like that very much.

Free can, so I figured I’d rate it for S&Gs. Wow, it’s been six years at least since I’ve tasted a bud. Served slightly chilled. Pours a pale, pale, totally unsaturated brass color reminiscent of pre-flush pisswater. Seriously, it looked *exactly* the same in the toilet! Absolutely crystal clear. Fluffy snow white head with impressive staying power leaves tattered sheets of lace. Mild noble hops in the nose compete with metal shavings, stale corn flakes, fresh-cut 2x4s, and sulfur. Flavor borders on imperceptible... mostly mealy apples (Rome, specifically) and (!) vomit (!!), traces of sulfur again, saccharine sweetness, and balsa wood dust. Palate is light, gassy, and actually a little greasy. Persistent aftertaste of latex and decades-old vanilla poundcake sticks in the throat like a loogie from hell.

Pale blond color and overly carbonated head that leaves a lace on the glass.  Aroma and flavor is bar beer nothing more.  I still like the unique oak flavor and am a Bud buyer when I plan to have several on a hot day.

This beer is watery swill that is pretty easy to get drunk off of.  Little in the way of flavor.  This beer is also evil, it gave me a hangover from hell and made my roommate put his head through a coffee table.

The "King of Beers".  A King that I like to keep around.  Very nice, and doesn’t bust up my wallet too bad.  Remeber what happened to the last King that tried to take too much money from Americans (we all know what happened to him).  It just doesn’t matter if it’s 8 in the morning or one of the healhier times to have some drinks.  I’ve said it and I’ll say it again.  I would take a Bud bottle on any day at any time over any other beer.  It just does it for me.  I love you, Budweiser.

Budweiser is generally underrated and poorly thought of.  It could be much worse.  The simple flavor and crispness make it the best selling beer in the world, plus they’ve got wicked marketing.  It beats Coors Light.

Are you pressed for cash?  An underage college student?  Or do you want to drink a beer purely out of thirst?  If you can answer yes to any of these questions, then you may drink this beer in good conscience.  If none of these applies to you, drinking a different beer would seem in order.  
   Yes, their commercials are entertaining, but we’re not talking about slick advertising campaigns now, are we?  We’re talking about the liquid inside the bottle.  And as such, there’s not that much good to say about it.
Not a bad beer if your only other choice is Bud-Light.  As an aside, I could not believe how many English people in London ordered this while in the pubs.  It was mind boggling.

Very carbonated head,  Very clear yellowish color.  Tastes like a typical swill beer and not even a good one.  But everyone loves this beer or hates it.  Since I don’t go on the internet and try to find the latest NASCAR standings.  I’ll stay away, but if there’s nothing else there I’ll drink it.
yeah, not a good beer. too watered down, but this is because it is so mass produced. cheap as hell and if it has a good use that would be for bbq’s (marinate)

hate it. well I guess I might like it... If I lived in a trailer park, had 7+ kids from 3 different women, and drove around a Ford pickup truck. but i don’t qualify for any of these options, soooo I think I’d rather go on the wagon than drink this beer
I can’t take this crap beer at all period anymore not even when it’s on sale at a bar

In Germany you get this beer under the name "Anheuser Busch Bud". The biggest brewery in the world. Why? In Germany nobody likes beer from the USA because its mostly like water - like this one. Who drinks such a "beer"? This brewery brews as much as all german brewerys together! But they really don’t know how to make a good beer. Armselig.

Absolute Shit! I’m dissapointed to see this ale on a web site that includes some of the most delicious ale’s across the world. This is water! This is nothing! Anyone who can appretiate Bud as a true ale, should have their ratebeer account cancelled! Gross!
In the bottle at Kingston Mines in Chicago.  Cold, thin and watery.  Nice chemical head.  Slight aroma of hay and rice.  Cold and drinkable.  Good with barbeque.  Bad with everything else.

America in a bottle.  This is the lowest quality beer you can find at nearly premium beer prices.  Think about it... does that not smack of Corporate America?
