Like many raters I’m sure, Bud is seen as an "obligation" on our rating path. Here we have a beer very representative of America and big business -- the most powerful beer company in the world -- yet Bud is somewhat of a cornucopia of what can be bad in a beer. The aroma is powerfully malty but with a nasty tinge of skunk generally reserved for green-bottle imports. The color is awful light pee yellow and there is absolutely no head -- the only thing that delivers from the lowest appearance rating is the subdued champagnelike carbonation. The flavor is simple cheap malt and is definitely tolerable. But Bud has a raunchy, watery mouthfeel that somehow is cloyingly syrupy at the same time, conveying a horribly acrid finish to even the least discerning palate. If one is able to handle beer this bad, may as well get a high gravity malt liquor and at least get a little more reciprocality for the effort. My RateBeer "Jury Duty Obligation" of rating the world’s best-selling beer is hereby fulfilled.

Two reviews for the price of one! I had an opportunity to sit down with glasses of Bud and  Bud Light side by side. They were so similar, I can just copy and paste my review. Both were the exact same very-pale yellow.  Both heads were pure white and quickly diminished to ring, although the Bud Light started much stronger. Both smelled of buttered corn and cardboard although the odor was more intense in the Bud Light. (This is not a plus.) Each tasted like sour seltzer water, but the Bud Light was a tad more watery. Neither one really offended my palate, although I’m sure that the thick, phlegmy sourness at the back of my throat can be attributed to both.

Here’s the thing...objectively Bud is not going to win any awards from beer connoisseurs, but...there’s a nostalgic element here that cannot be dismissed.  This beer was at the center of my personal development.  Back in the day I had a lot of good times with a Bud in my hand.  

After all, this is the famous Budweiser beer. I know of no brand produced by any other brewer which costs so much to brew and age. Their exclusive Beechwood Aging produces a taste, a smoothness, and a drinkability you will find in no other beer at any price...or something like that.

Anyways...history matters...personal histories matter.  You can’t forget that.
This is a better beer than most people give it credit for--it’s got a very nice, smooth taste for a mainstream beer.  Easy to drink,  MUCH better than Coors/Miller.

Oct, 2002: Many years ago when I was young, spotty and constantly randy, I had a Bud because it said ’beer’. Not one to enjoy lagers I was quite stunned that this was called a beer. I couldn’t finish it. I never drank a Bud again. Until today. I was curious. This is the most famous beer in the world - the most popular beer in the world - and the one with more contempt poured on it’s little crowned head than any other beer in the world. It’s the beer used as a yardstick for bad beer - ’The Budweiser of Russia’, ’As bland as a Bud’, ’Almost as bad as a Bud - if that’s possible!’, etc. I was obviously curious. It had been many years since I’d had that other Bud. A distant memory remained, but the memory can play tricks. Also, I had drunk a number of lagers or blonde beers since then and found that a few were quite palatable. I was curious. The colour is not encouraging - the urine sample of an anaemic ant on it’s death bed would produce something with more body. Anyway, the nose, the smell, the aroma is disappointing. There’s nothing there. It’s not bad, it’s not good. It’s just not there. But the taste was rather surprising. Honey, butter, fresh grass, smooth, creamy, a fizz, quite pleasant... Lacking distinctive character, maybe... or maybe not. I reckon I could tell a Bud from a Corona or a Moosehead. Don’t get me wrong - I don’t think this is a class act. I don’t even think it reaches the heights of an average beer. But it aint a dog. It’s more of a bitch, and when you’re desperate... Well, go for it behind closed doors and don’t tell the neighbours. [1.8]

 Aug, 2003:I was just given this in a customer’s house. I had difficulty finishing it. I wasn’t paying attention to the butter flavours, I was just struggling to get it down. [1.2]

Rancid, mass produced McBeer.  If no other choice available -- drink water.

The reason they have clydsdales in the commercials is because horse piss is the main ingredient.  I just don’t get it.  Why is this the best selling beer in the world?  Why???  Look, I have no problem with the style.  I like lagers.  They’re great in the summer.  But why in the name of God does this company insist on using corn and rice as a fermentable?  There is really no hop profile to speak of.  I mean, yeah, there’s hops in there, but they serve as a bittering agent instead of a flavoring agent.  Nothing special in that regard.  This beer has a very offensive sweetness to it, and it is very watery and fizzy.  I’m sure if AB wanted to, they could make a decent lager.  But no, they insist on brewing this instead.  My advice: Get rid of the corn and rice.  Use all barley.  Use two or three different types of hops, and use a good yeast strain that will lend flavor to the beer.  Charge an extra 50 cents a sixer, I don’t care.  I’d probably drink it.  Just don’t patronize me with your stupid commercials trying to convince me that this is the "Great American Lager".  I’m not buying it.  That distinction goes to Blue Paddle or Noble Pils.

This is Ratebeer isn’t it? This should be in the tonic water category. Talk about hard to drink, soapy and flavourless starchy beer which ranks alongside methylated spirits as a beverage.  Not beer at all, but an advertising campaign aimed at idiots. King of beers, Ha...

The best-seller status of this beer describes fits.  If you’ve ever thought that everyone around you is a moron, think of that rating.  The beer has no head, a crappy aftertaste, and is the standard on which most bad beers are rated.
I can’t believe I used to drink this as a teen, no flavor, no head ,tastes like wet white bread! It seems like they just pump this stuff out to keep Americans drunk! I’m glad I discovered good beer.

this beer reminds me of yellow jello in it’s color, with white foam. the aroma is a littel fruite(alittle) and there is a wierd smell that i can’t put my finger on. The beer goes down real easy, it just slides over your tongue and down your throat . there is no bitterness or bad taste to stick to your tongue.

as of flavor: what flavor? very tastless, with a bit of lemon and hop... abit(just a bit, very little...) mixed with water.
like my pappa says: dishwater=Budweiser.
overall i give this beer a 5.. and then i’m being very kind. i give it a 5, cause i think the color is very cool(not that inviting... but cool none the less.) well.... all this beer left me with was a head buzz.... and that’s it folks...

Bottle: Good foam, a little hop in the aroma, but not the best I have smelled. Feels like water in mouth. It’s the first beer I have tasted with so little flavour. This beer gives me no beerexperience. I could aswell drink a glass of water, but the beer did’t taste bad either, a + for that.
Not very good.  NOthing remarkable about this beer at all, lacks the wonder, the spectacle, and the pageantry of a true king.

Can. Big Can. Good aroma, but watery. Not alot of corn detected, but it was definitely there, with some hops. Pretty watered down. Nothing special, just your generic, run-of-the-mill macrobrew. Good carbonation.
Nothing complex here.  Bud light with a hint of flavor.  I’ll get it only when faced with a choice b/t it or Bud Light.
A classic, but nothing great. Cheap...important to me. I’d drink it to continue a buzz, but not for it’s flavor.

Very light and bland in colour and flavour, except in the ’malt’ department. Lots of sweetness but no flavour complexity - where are the hops?? I presume this is due to the sugar adjuncts added (ie. rice). Gassing and head very average.

nastybeer or should i say flavered water
how could they call this beer. i wonder why its the numberone selling beer
If this is the King Of Beers, I’m friggin’ Ozzy Osbourne.  This stuff is only slightly better than drinking your own regurgitiation.  "Born On" date?  I’d rather see the death date stamped on it.

This reminds me of a joke, which is apporpriate because this is a joke of a beer.  The jokes goes like this.  Do you know why Budweiser is like having sex in a canoe?  Because they are both f***ing near water.   My apologies.
Good beer if your lookin to get drunk for cheap or quenching your thirst when eating pizza.  My favorite draft big distributer beer.

Bottle:  Well, the roommate left me another glorious beer to rate.  Without him, I would never have access to the macros of the world (obviously I would, but I’d never plunk down the $6 or so for a 6-pack), so here goes.  Aroma is lightly malty with light sour apple.    Pours an incredibly pale yellow with an okay white head that’s gone in a minute.   Flavor is lightly malty and light apple.   No suprise that’s it’s rather watery in taste and in texture.  Very dry.  Basically, lightly flavored carbonated water.  Slightly better aroma and slightly more taste than Bud Light, makes it slightly better than Bud Light.  Just another beer that falls in the category of, no taste is better than bad taste.

What gets me about Bud is that it really isn’t that damn cheap.  A 12 pack of bottles cost 9 bucks.  PBR tastes better than this crap and I can get a case for 10 bucks.  Selling cheap beer is fine, but selling cheap beer at a premium pisses me off.  Conclusion:  Schmidts, PBR and Milwaukee’s best taste better than this crap and is WAY cheaper.
Lamest beer ever!, I can’t say anything worse than other have said I think, but the only interesting fact is that contains rice.

Good God this is putrid.  This beer single handedly proves that with a big budget advertising campaign, you could bottle urine and people would buy it.  I think Bud is the reason why there so many people who say they don’t like beer - they base their opinion on crap like this.  Ah well - anyway, it pours a sickly pale shade of yellow, and is very fizzy.  Aroma is weak, and flavor is bland.  What flavor there is isn’t pleasant.  It is drinkable, if there is absolutely nothing else around, I suppose it’s better than drinking water while watching the game - but just marginally.

Nothing good to say here.  One of the great mysteries of the universe why so many people will buy so much beer that is so bad.  Just say No! .. (0.5) ..  09/13/2007 ..  re-rate ..  ..  looking through some of my old ratings and making a few corrections.  I originally dissed Bud a little more that was appropriate.  This isn’t good, but it is drinkable.  Had several of these at Whitey’s Fish Camp Bar on a hot day after a motorcycle ride and they went down ok.   At least a little better than Millers/Coors/Corona . (1.1)
How this became a top selling beer is beyond me. Maybe thanks to the aggressiveness of American marketing..

Haha, what can I say about good old bud that has not already been said?  I really have nothing to say ... every comment beneath me sums it up.  Sadly enough, I have liked this beer twice in my life ... when I was already bombed.

This is bad beer but its actually drinkable i just dont enjoy it as much as other beers.  Has a little wheat flavor and is very cheap and usually always on sale.  The sales reps i met are cool and not assholes like Miller.  Although the drivers of the little trucks are some of the worse drivers on the roads, i swear no wonder they dotn have stickers that say hows my driving beacuse they dont give a rats ass.

Bottles kinda cool, even if you see it all the time.  Better than some give it credit for, still nothing ide want to drink very much of.  All in all ide say you get what you pay for, for the price this stuff is not bad.  I am disapointed by bud’s new 24hour fresh beer idea.  Does the stuff skunk that fast?
I’ll give it this:  The flavor doesn’t ever seem bad, like some other mass market beers.  It’s generally very drinkable.  It’s just freakin’ boring as hell.
I actually prefer the Light version. After two or three Budweisers, the headache already begins to creep in. Another beer that only tastes right at big barbecues and family reunions.

I never though that I would be saying this but I am so lookng forward to this beer.  You see, I just had a Sam Adams Triple Bock and after dumping about 3/4 of the atrocity, I am looking for something cheap, bland and crappy to cleanse my pallate.  Bud rises to the top just for that.  Large white head with decent carbonation.  Aroma of corn flakes, carbonation and a bit of hops.  Color is a very light pale gold.  Flavor is light and crisp with a bit of corn, malt and a nice dryness from the hops.  Finish is dry and crisp.  Not as bad as I expected but that could be because of what I just drank before this.
Most over-rated beer ever! Hard to believe so many people buy it Terrible after taste, watery flavor. Yuk!!

This is what we , in Texas ,call river beer. It has no other use, but to be put in an iced down cooler ; that is put in an innertube ; that is put (along side you) in the Guadalupe River and aids you to relax while floating down the stream for a long adventures 12hrs.
The first beer I ever tried, at the tender age of six (hey, it was only one sip!). Never really been a fan... it’s okay if it’s very cold, but otherwise... yuck.

Watery yellow color with thick head. Clear smell, though not much to it. Light weight with lingering sweet finish. Much sweeter than I remembered it to be. Flavors of slightly sweet water. King of Beers? maybe it was ths sympathy award.
This is a strange beer.  It smells and tastes (I assume) like urine.  However, it starts to grow on you.  It’s easily drinkable and affordable.  However, it’s not that great of a beer.
Pours out pale yellow with a little head.  Very light, sweet, lack of flavor.

"King of Beers"?  Try "King of colored water with a little bit of carbonation"  I actually refuse to drink this stuff unless I am at Yankee stadium with a hot dog in the other hand.  I think the wax cups that they give you give the beer a little better taste.
(actually had this out of a keg last night) i felt like i had gone back in time to my freshmen year in college. left party to go to another that was stocked with decent booze.

Bottle: Poured a clear golden beer with almost no head. I won’t surprise anybody by saying that there is no aftertaste and general aroma is very weak. Pretty much the only thing I could pick-up was some sweetness. I personally don’t care about this but I got to admit that this the perfect macro beer, i.e. no taste, no head, a little bit sweet for that extra refreshing feeling – everything that people who don’t really like beer but still drink it like to see and taste.

Had this in Rhode Island on vacation, because it was in the fridge.  The smell was awful... like something someone ejaculated.  I would have preferred no taste to what I did taste, which was mostly skunk.  This beer is nothing short of an insult to the intelligence and taste of the beer-drinking community (although if you actually believe it to be the king of beers, perhaps your intelligence is not being insulted...).  My uncle once knew someone from the Czech Republic who, after drinking a Bud, asked if it was "limonade".  That speaks for itself.

Wasn’t going to bother rating Bud, but
what the hell? It actually doesn’t have a
bad flavor. It just has NO flavor. I guess
that’s better than some other macros
which are hard to drink. Tastes crisp,
clean and refreshing, although so does
water.
Is the water in Fairfield, CA worse than anywhere else Bud is brewed? And what is rice doing in a beer? They actuallly brag about it too! Amazing.

Bottle from local bodega, wow can’t belive i haven’t rated this yet, what can i say that ain’t been said. yellow and fizzy,faint rice flavor brewed for the masses, not us, sleah.not much better on tap,
The original world classic. Has many imitators but Budweiser is the biggest seller for a reason.
Bottle. Thin and fizzy, flavour is vague rice and some malt. Not nice, very poor.

Draught.  Slightly sweet aroma and flavor.  OK, now for the bad stuff.  Fizzy head, pale piss colored.  Aroma is stale and weak.  Flavor is similar, with cheap ass rice malt very evident in flavor.  Hops????  None in mine (note, if you have homegrown hops available, they really spruce up the flavor if you drop a bud or two in one of these--kind of the same way that a lemon might work for other beers).  Better yet, discard the ingredients of a bud draught, substitute your favorite other beer, and the taste is much better.  Moreover, since bud is the "king of beers," they are priced way too high for what they are.
Did they put any beer ingredients in this? You can taste the rice and the bottle cap strongly but other than that it is fizzy water.  Yes, I have tried it and no, I won’t be repeating the experience.
The B in BMC.  I prefer the MIller products to the Bud, which is odd since this comes in a brown bottle and the Miller comes in clear glass.  Old habits are hard to break.  Typical Macro pils.
Pours golden pale with fizzy white head.  Has typical macro swill aroma.  Flavor is of like crappy malt and something else, maybe rice or corn.
Sometimes it simply tastes pretty good...if it’s hot enough outside.  A bit bland with a small amount of taste that allows it to beat most of its mass produced NA competitors.  Good for tailgating!

Bottle. Aroma:Sweet spicy bananas. Very weird, but thats what i got. Corn
Appearance: Urine yellow, thin almost nonexistent filmy white head.
Flavor: Dry corn, disgusting bitterness.
Palate: Carbonated to all hell, thin and watery. Drain pour after half of bottle.
Grew up on this beer and for a long time didn’t know better. The head fades fast but it does go down pretty easy. Nothing stood out. But they have awsome advertisements and you can find it anywhere.
Frothy fast disappearing white head, pale yellow body. Weak aroma, little hops and corn. Typical thin lager flavor, blah blah blah. Could have been worse, but definately not worth writing home about!
On tap at Canada’s Wonderland.  No hints of any flavors.   Drinks smoothly enough but not even in a beer fashion.  It wasn’t even a decent compliment to my chicken fajita

Bud is like a five dollar hooker. They both look good but theres no substance to either one. I feel bad the next day with both. Bud is all about hype, advertising, and image. Bud is NOT aout flavor and great taste. Bud always gave me massive headaches and typical hangover symptoms. I hate this beer about as bad as I hate Corona but not quite. "King of Beers"....weeeee thats a knee slapper.

On tap at the ballpark.  Bad beer at ballpark prices!!!  Why not shell out $8.50 for  a quart of Bud?  This beer left no memory of anything remarkable.  Slightly better than the Miller High Life of yesterday.  The game was good however.


Rerate after a blind tasting with MGD.  Clear, golden colored with a very fast fading white head, no lacing.  Aroma had just a hint of rice in it, which helped distinguish from the MGD.  No real hop aroma.  Very even keeled in malt/hop balance, not much of either.  While this isn’t a very exciting product it did not deserve the 0.8 total score I had given it before.
Harly any flavour or aroma. I guess you must be very thirsty to enjoy this concoction. A beer to wash down your stomach real quick, but tasteless really..

I’ll say one good thing for Bud and that’s all I’ll say. I goes down smooth. Maybe it’s the water and lack of kick...but it can’t be denied. Especially half way through a disasterous round of golf. Not much variety on the golf course, but I know bud will always be there to lick my wounds.

I’m not a fan of Budweiser at all.  I’ll take Yuengling over it hands down at any time.  But if it must be drunk its not really pitiful.  I just don’t understand though when people swear this as their "favorite beer".  Thats like saying McDonald’s burgers are your "favorite burger". But to each his own, right?

Yes, it’s a rather flavorless pale lager, one of what I refer to as the Southside Sports Bar Beers.  Folk drink it to get a buzz.  But, hey, this is what I grew up with.  My folks kept it in the fridge all the time.  I have a sentimental attachment.

From my Father’s refrigerator - most likely won via shake of the day. Likely my first Budweiser since the ’82 World Series (It’s still a painful memory). Light straw color, much lighter than I remember, even though most would have been straight out of a can, bottle or plastic glass. White fluffy head. Sweet compost aroma - check born on date - 7 May, 04. Light fizzy feel. Dry white  vinous flavor with a touch of malt late. It has been some time since I have had a macro, but this seems more like a fizzy dry wine than a beer.
Bottle. Watery, bland, and highly overrated. The only positive I can think of is that it is consistant. You know what you are getting every time you drink one.
Straight from a 24oz. can. I think it’s the rice and the beechwood aging that make this beer. Is rice even a good beer ingredient? Must be, they seem to think so.
All right beer, not too watery like other American beers. However, I do suggest a bottle as opposed to a can.

I really cannot comment on this beer due to the fact that the FCC will soon take ownership over the Internet and I do not wish to receive a $200,000 fine.  So here are my tasting notes: This beer is yellow and fizzy...this beer comes in a brown bottle...

Now the last time I had one of these, me and the friends had a 12 pack of it, and a 12 pack of Warsteiner.  Now, the later of the two is no miracle of brewing magic, but its definately a beer someone put some time into making respectable.  Budweiser boats of using the choicest rice for the beer.  I think its safe that the only redeming quality is that there is a prescence of alcohol.  Otherwise it would be weedkiller.
Golden color, light very weak aroma, watery taste, light body, light very watery finish. not beer.
This is the good american racecar beer..So why not have one, I mean whats the worst that could happen, it tastes pretty good.

Not the worst beer I’ve ever had, just the most popular of the really bad beers.  It’s a sad statement indeed that this is the most widely consumed beer.  If the only beer in the cooler is bud I’ll usually opt for a soda.
If bud is the king of beers, then whoever the queen is must wear the pants in that household.
Virtually no aroma.  Not very good tasting. I only enjoy a Bud if its ice cold and right out of the bottle.

Little aroma, extremely watered down.  Not nearly as good as the comparable Coors Original and I won’t even start to compare it to micros.  On the plus side, has a very appealing head.  However, I have heard rumors of how A-B might be accomplishing that and its not to appeasing.  Not worth the jacked up price A-B charges for Budweisersince they see market it as "The king of Beers" and the American public has yet to wise up.
for some reason when i have drank this, i would always get this horrid headache, yet another cheap watered down beer, no need to call it "king of beers".  not worth getting.
another poor bottled beer which emerges from over the pond and insults the growing range of micros popping up in the US. its made with rice!! nuff said.
pours a light yellow color with plenty of head.  Has no taste or flavor what so ever nasty hangovers the next day.
not the king of beers, but rather the commoner of beers. i drik it every now and then, when im low on cash. it is drinkable, and will get the job done.

Why does Bud say they are "premium"?  Premium only when you can’t "afford" anything better. Another beer made out of rice. If I was dirt, dirt poor (or a fool) I would buy this beer. King of Beers is truly an insult to actual good American beers that are our there.
I don’t find anything good about this beer, tastes like slightly flavored water. I don’t buy this beer, and I never would.

The only thing this beer is good for is playing quarters and other drinking games. This is a bottom of the barrel kind of beer. Tastes like watered down beer with hints metallic flavor. "The Peasant of Beers" that was greatly repressed.

(Bottled) Very pale yellow color with a smallish head. Sweetish, very clean and corny-malty aroma. Rice-corny-malty, slightly sweet flavor with hints of pear-fruity, aromatic hops, but no real bitterness. Slightly acidic finish. Light-bodied, sweetish palate with somewhat fizzy carbonation. Clean and reasonably refreshing, but very boring.
Aggressive carbonation with metallic behind it. Some bitter sweetness hit me and that’s it -where’s the water.  Easy to rate on ratebeer.

Well it was free. I split it with the wife so I didn’t have to drink the whole sorry stubbie. Her palate is not the best ie. she will even drink VB without complaint!  but threw this sad assed beer down the drain.  Light sewer aroma, presents as a very watered down gold colour with minimual head, flavour is of adjuncts (corn!) and watery urine. How could any company be proud of something like this? Could we have zeros for palate and Appearance please? It doesn’t deserve 1.

Was forced to drink this "beer" at a family picnic.  It was the only non light beer available.  To call this the King of Beers is shameful and embarrasing.  That 70 other countries in the world think this is our best beer product??  What a joke.  This beer sucks.

I never understood why this beer is so popular, after sampling many Ales and Lagers, I can taste that this beer is inferior. My friend and I bought a six pack of this and we could barley drink it.
IT s got that unpleasant sweetness that doesn’t work.  Corn and Rice do not work well for a beer. I doubt I’ll buy this beer again.
"King of Beers"?! More like the Jester!!

PS My friend gave me the rest of the six pack, he didn’t want it
Biggest selling beer but worst beer i have ever had.Easy drinking ,like water,Do not have a character.More like a cola than beer.
Golden color with a white head. The taste is corn and water. Boring and not worth your money.

I drink this at the bowling alley, and decided to actually pay attention to what it tasted like.  For what is trying to be, a pale lager, it might actually be fine, but there is way too much corn flavor.  I will probably never drink Bud again.  There are simply far too many better beers around to waste time on something this bland.
Yup, I tried it.  I’m surprised that I got to be my age and don’t remember ever drinking this before now.  Pale golden, white head.  Some faint maltiness, no hops.  Super thin body.  Crappy.

I am re-rating this as I had a better chance to evaluate it correctly.  The appearance is paler than many light beers, but extremely foamy head (dissipated quickly).  Taste profile is almost non-existent.  As the common macros go, this would be one of my last choices.
If I wanted to drink sake, I’d buy it in the bottle. The rice taste is horrible. Stay away.
yum... or i mean....drunk!  that what this shit is for anyway.   will not buy on my own terms.  money problems or not, this is no good. on any plateus of beer.
The day was very hot. The Bud was very cold. I was very thristy. It went down much better than I thought it would. Oh and it was free. :)

Budweiser is nothing special, but I dont think it’s the worst pale lager.  The popularity alone of this beer gives it some credit, although i think I’d rather saw my own leg off than drink one of these ever again.  :-p

Update 7/28/07 Ok so i was forced to have one again at a red sox game recently.  RIght on tap, piping cold, rediculously fresh,  and it wasn’t as bad as i had remembered.  The rice filler is just too much...but i actually could find some nice points in this beer.  up it goes a little.

When i was touring the brewery in STL they have a tasting area........ it was so fresh that it was crisp.. its smell is that of corn. and its very palatable. now i go for a pint at this place called THE PINES.

i hate bud and most a/b products
this stuff gives me a headache
almost every time. bud is always 
my last choice bad flavor 
ok aroma i guess evcept when stale

Large can into plastic cup, Wrigley Field (Chicago) 7/2/04.  Ok, it might have been that I was at a Cubs game, but I don’t really think so.  Over the past couple of weeks, I’ve had some crap beer (Bud Light, MGD, Coors, Leine’s Amber Light, Singha), but this was not one of them.  I don’t even like lagers, and I found myself pleasantly surprised that this didn’t suck as much as I expected.  It was even somewhat luke-warm, and instead of the skunky ass taste that macros usually get when warm, this one tasted ok: I got some definite caramel malt, very very slight hopiness (if it were more hopped, I would say this is almost good), somewhat watery but some body and fuller mouthfeel than expected.  If I’m ever forced to have a macro, I think Bud might be my first choice.
not much to it.  i think most who like bud buy it out of habbit mostly.  some say it tastes like water, but most times i would prefer the water to this stuff.

The fact that the King gets a 2 percentile rating is a testimonial to the priggishness of this crowd. A Bud is more than its tangy taste. It’s a symbol of American male barroom bonding. Drink yer 1516 Old Double Malt Schliflitzenhassen over in the corner with Lance. Bartender, gimme a Bud!

Well it is allegedly beer, so it deserves a rating.  Pale golden, coarse carbonation, and a white head that falls away to nothing very quickly.  Aroma has a hint of malt with a predominant cideryness which is quite un beerlike.  Thin on the palate, and it tastes a lot like it smells, very insipid and completely without character..... the worst part is that I believe that there are some worse than this...

graduation party from the can brought back memories of my youth and how I thought this was good beer boy was I naive back than but I guess when you are young and want to be cool you will do a lot of stupid things . I made the mistake of not drinking this fast and it warmed up to about 45 degrees yuk but still better than bud and busch lite

330ml brown bottle from an ice-cold 4-pack.5% Vol. Poured a clear whiskey and soda colour. White fizzy head. Faint sugary aroma. Too sweet to be crisp. Faint lager & lemonade flavour. No malt no hops no alcohol. OK mouthfeel. Sweet finish. Slight skunk right at the end. The World’s best selling beer. What can you do ?
If you’re buying this NOT because of taste or general satisfaction and ONLY because it’s cheap swill....well fine, I suppose you have a point there....
This beer is not that great tasting, but has great value since it is pretty cheap.  A little bit dark, but has nice falvor.

Draft at the brewery and days old - oddly enough, if you can get this beer so young it is actually drinkable.  Minimal malt in the nose.  Appearance was typical Bud.  Very pale with a white, white head.  Fizzy.  Flavor had next to no hops and just a hint of malt, but did not have the normal, awful Bud aftertaste.  It really reminded me quite a bit of Spaten Premium Lager.

I’ve had this beer in Korea, Japan, Panama, and the US. The US version is the best of those, but still not outstanding. I recommend not letting this sit in the fridge for more than a week, after that the taste goes way downhill.  If you plan on putting your money on Bud I think you should consider some other cheap american beers instead.
Has a lot thicker of a taste than bud light, but still a crappy beer. I wouldn’t drink this if I had to pay for it. Re-Rate: I wouldn’t drink this if it was given to me for free.
Why is this beer so well selling??  Never liked it.  Although it’s 5x better tasting in Europe - different beer over there?  Weird.

Nothing too special here.  My favorite American beer, but i prefer Canadian or German.  Can get too bitter when warmer, but it always looks like the King in a glass.  Crisp and sharp, minimal aftertaste.  Merely OK
Thin, lacey head.  Rice and beechwood sweetness in aroma, almost tasteless to the palate with notes of rice and a crisp, sharp finish, no aftertaste.  Forgettable.

Overall disgusting beer. The aftertaste for lack of a better description reminded me of sweaty gym socks. That strange aftertaste seems apparent in many American macros for some reason. Absolutely disgusting, watery, sorry excuse for a beer. I refuse to spend even a dollar of my money on this and I’m proud to say that I’ve never personally purchased this before. Kind of faint sickly straw colored. Head quickly dissipates leaving a pretty weak looking beer. No wonder people drink it in cans; so they don’t have to see how sad looking it is.
Blah, but better then coors light. This is standard avround here, but is better then soda water.

Good descriptive word for this beer:  anemic.  It smells like rotten fruit.  Has the slightest phantom of hops.  People who voluntarily consume this have not ventured far from this shelf of the grocery store aisle.  Though I am proud to support American products, this life is too short for me to waste it on bad ones like this.  Very good propoganda for this one (bud bikinis, shirts, flip flops, baby bibs, you name it) it’s all hype.  It says one in every five beers sold is a Budweiser...but please...the masses are wrong in this one.
An average American Lager.  One of the first beers I ever had.  It’s relatively cheap and easy to get because it is everywhere.  Low on cash and want to get trashed pick up a case of bud.
tastes better than some, um, costs a lot less for a 30 pack than I’ve spent on single bottles

Sour malt aroma.  Pale yellow with small head.  Sweet barley malt flavor wtih mild hops finish.   I have refused to buy Bud ever since I was in Atlanta and heard a guy talking about just drinking his first can of Bud and said "It was so good, I licked the can out.".
Pale color, high carbonation, sour  flavor, no head of substance. This beer is awful.
Bottle/Can/Draft - so called classic American beer.  Yellow in color with a thin shortlived white head.  Some hops in the aroma.  Too much carbonation.  Easy drinking, but not very exciting.

This beer is a snapshot of America. I think that it may very well be the first beer to pass my lips. Similar to the cigarette industry, Budweiser manages to find its way to children at an obscenely early age. Just like American culture of consumption, violence, misogyny, intolerance, arrogance, and Don Ho. Sure, I’ll admit it: I am all of these things. I am American. It is my destiny to deliver my beechwood-aged culture to every freakin’ square inch of this planet. And guess what? EVERY FREAKING SQUARE INCH LOVES IT. Are my tears those of joy or of heartache? I really don’t know. I just know that I miss those little animated Bud Bowl bottles playing their own little superbowl on the TV during timeouts. Just like those little artificial wars that we bring to our heathern neighbors across the oceans. It’s our game. It’s just a game. It’s just a beer. Lighten up! Hey, that’s not a bad idea. Maybe a Budweiser Light? All the same catastophic demise, but with less CARBS!!! The king is dead, long live the King.

Short lived head of white foam, crystal clear, pre beer drinking piss yellow!  Typical green apple aroma with hints of sulphury yeast. Very light grainy malt, and no hops!  Flavor is pretty much the same with more of a sulphury yeast finish & aftertaste.  Bland, boring, tasteless.  Light and watery body, high, biting carbonation.  Not much else to say.  Always very consistant, then again, so is reading a phone book!

Budweiser reminds me of past times with my family. Being Irish, this is all they drink. And they drink alot of it. Anytime, anyday and anywhere (even in airports). For a full flavored domestic brew this is about the best. Easy to drink, cheap price and availible everywhere. If a full flaver domestic beer is what you choose, than get nailed on this stuff. Trust me!
Classic redneck beer!  Not a terrible beer, but not good. Smells like Amercian beer.  Tastes like American beer.

this tastes like garbage. i cant believe people actually say its the best beer they’ve ever had. these people are on crack. its probably the only beer they’ve ever had. of course i also cant believe that i got the bud headache.......
Ummm, I can’t think of anything to say about this beer other than it does actually taste better than Special Ex and Icehouse.
This beer ..., wait, why even bother to drink it or write about it?!  Opps I need 75 characters.  Not good, not good, not good.  Did I make it?

Beer #9 in my lager marathon. Keg. The UK version manufactured at the old Watneys swill factory in Mortlake. As this was my 9th beer of the night, my drinking pace had slowed considerably, which gave this prdoduct plenty of time to warm up and display its adjunct ridden aroma in all its glory. Otherwise, thin grainy and soft. No finish whatsoever. Awful. Next and last was Grolsch.
Ice cold, bottle, plain, beats bud light, not terrible, not good either, marketing makes the beer
12 oz. can:  smells pissy, looks like dirty water. tastes like piss and dirty water.  reminds me alot of ruination...
This beer, is..............is....................f$%king....b^*s%it...the shi^^(est beer i drank in my life long exeprience.... cheers
Great commercials.. fantastic advertising.. worldwide acceptance.. oh yeah.... tastes somewhat like beer... lot;s of people like it... not me.

Born on 10/10/03. Avg white head above a clear vitamin B piss yellow body. Light aroma. Decent, non-offensive taste, though it is watery. I don’t know what it is, probably rice or something, but it isn’t bad at all. 

Two hour later follow-up
I just smelled my glass and it smells slightly better than urine. The final little swallow was cardboard urine. Better drink this shit ice cold.

This is the #1 selling beer in the world for a reason…… because, most of the people in the world are a bunch of uncultured, and uneducated MORONS!  

 Pours a Crystal clear golden body, actually, a decent rocky white head. The aroma is sweet.. the corn and other shameful adjuncts are most obvious. Sweet flavor.. Truthfully, it taste like sweet corn with spray butter on it… It’s actually very sad that this beer is the #1 beer in the world…. Very- very distressing! Finish shows a touch of hops.. crisp and clean… very pathetic!

What can I say that hasn’t already been so eloquently communicated?  We grew up with this stuff, were bombarded by their intense round-the-clock marketing, we bought it and drank it by the cases.  What in the heck were we thinking?  If shear volume consumed was the prime rating factor then this crap would be the big winner.  The only reason I rated it higher than the lowest rating is ’cause each and every first sip never made me wretch.  How’s that for a back handed complement?  Suffice it to say it’s like the venerable old cockroach.  It’ll still be here after we’re all dead and gone.

Since when was Budweiser a "premium beer"? One has to wonder how it became the "king of beers". It’s not even king of the crappy beers ... that has to be Coors Original. Poor, watery, thin, tasteless lager. Yech.
this is better than bud-light. has a ’little’ more taste but not much.still pretty week. now i know why my dad put salt and olives in his. anything helps.

Aroma = Bad / nothing.  Appearance = Piss-yellow.
Flavor = Nonexistent.
Palate = What palate?
Overall Imp = ummm...  coloured water?
There’s enough poor reviews on this that I shouldn’t even waste the time.  There’s just nothing to it, it’s just there, blah flavor, aroma, etc. etc.

Plain ol’ piss american lager. Seriously, I hated this stuff before I liked good beer because this shit always gave me a headache. Pours golden with a white head. Tastes is very mild and boring. I’d go with Miller Lite instead for a decent shitty beer.

Not good or bad. This is probably the most purchased beer by posers and wanna be’s. It is a beer that people drink more from habbit than from their love of it. As i said not good but not blatz. The headis like tissue paper and in a blind taste test none of my friend could choose it from old milwaukee so that can’t be saying much.
Pretty good for a macro.  This and Miller’s offering are my favorite macros.

One of my least favorite beer ever. If it’s free, I’ll drink it.
Otherwise, forget it.

This beer is good for a barbeque or some other event where one doesn’t care what they are drinking as long as they are drinking.  It has little flavor or anything, but it doesn’t taste bad.  It just doesn’t taste good.

The only reason one should drink this beer is if he or she has no other choice of beer. For example, like being at a  concert or event that only sells this brand. It’s sole purpose is for intoxicaton at events like such. It is overpriced, and has no flavor. Typically you are better off with something cheaper like Genny, or Bush.  The flavor and quality between these beers differs little.
Budweiser is my favorite of the big beer companies. It has a decent taste that goes down smoother than, well, Miller products. It is light in color, a pale yellow. Overall not bad.

Very pale yellow (not far from clear), with an an almost-nonexistent white head.  Aroma is sweet with the slightest hint of hops.  Flavor is lightly sweet up front with the very lightest flavor of hops in the finish.  Very thin and watery.  Overall, significantly better than Bud Light, and this really hits the spot on a super-hot day (which might be why I’m being so generous right now).
Why do people buy this? It has to be the glossy advertisment promising hot girls, cars and a super fun time. This beer reeks of rice, filler and puke. Bud is not the king.
Beechwood bubbles give me a headache and make me urinate too often. Taste like soap and rice.  Must admit to dinking worse beers, but not many.

Did someone leave the tap on? How dumb are drinkers to buy this soap? The saddest sight I've seen in an English pub - glorious summers day, great range of English beer, tourist buys a Bud. Well, at least you know what you're getting - soapy water with the most cunning marketing campaign that alcohol has ever seen. If they can get people to buy this, they'll buy anything.
Bud Light with a kick, which makes it the king of beers? you got me? Imagine how nice it would be if Unibroue had millions to advertise? Well, they may now....

The color is like 1/10 of a lager and 9/10 water, and it's poor head diapears quickly. There is none aroma and taste. A soda water without citrus tastes better. "King of beers", must be "King of realy bad beers".........
The worst of the big 3 American Standards.  Carbonation overides the beer taste.  Not horrible, Bud Light would be a better choice, Miller Lite even better.

Everyone knows the label, the name and the clydesdales. While it is not a great beer, it does do the job. Smooth, not too bitter, faint aroma. Everyone seems to hate on it, i don't know why, it isn't the number one selling beer on earth cause it is no good. I guess it is most beer geeks are just jealous. It is an above average beer. I enjoy it on race days, fishing and just hanging around with the boys and a beer that is that pratcial is a great thing. It is the King.

Bottled: The day has come. I rate the "King of beers". I don't have much to say about it, that haven't been said. It's not as lame as others point out, but its not a good one. Light yellow coloured. White quickly diminishing head. Ligth malty aroma. Flavour is metallic and has some vague hops notes. Dies instantly on the palate as many of these american standards.
Obviously not much of a beer, but out of the big three (bud, miller, coors), this is my favorite. Rarely drink it, but the southern in me comes out sometimes.
Pale yellow 23oz draft at the Atlanta airport.  No head, bitter chemical bite.  I later found a pub that was serving Sam Adams Lager.
Can.  My father-in-law loves this stuff!  Everytime he visits, he ends up leaving some behind.  I sometimes drink it after mowing the lawn.
I don’t get why people think this is good.  It’s overpriced, overadvertised piss.  It’s decent on tap, but would never pay for it with my own money.  I’ll stick with Burger or Hudepohl
Classic thurst quencher.  Cant beat an ice cold bud on a hot day....in any other case this beer sucks.
I think this is a very good beer. I'm not a pro drinker so I don't have a whole lot to compare to, but one of the best I've had.

Never liked Bud when I drank just to get drunk 20 yrs. ago, still don't understand why people buy it. very little taste, to carbonated...even for American Domestic beers.I would rather drink....well, just about anything.
This is the opposite of tylenol.  It may have something to do with the beechwood.  This is an excellent example of poor american standards.  Good beer though for raising hell and getting arrested.
So this used to be my favorite beer...many memories had (or lost if you will) with Bud.  I’ve moved on, but a good cold Budwieser still hits the spot.  Watery and bland enough to drink all day.
Pale coloring with negligible head. Prominent yeast flavor with strong corn notes. Watery feel. Refreshing beer. Cheap and easy to drink. Bottled is superior to canned.
This beer has no taste whatsoever. I would rather drink a bottle of water than an american standard.

For the amount of hops I have seen them put into the vats, you'd think this beer would have more taste.  For presentation, you have to admit nobody does it better in a can than the two-stage painting process, though.

When you have some of the great beers, and go back to this, you wonder why you ever drank it. Yuengling remains my favourite American beer followed by Gordon Biersch's Maerzen. As a sidenote, I do believe Budweiser, in a can, was my first actual whole beer that I drank all on my own (not just sips I mean). I had it when I was about 17, I think. Ha! I didn't buy it or consume it publicly in odd-lawed America though, so you can rest your sweet peepers from so accusingly gawking. Besides, it's been well over two years and you couldn't try me for that anyway. Budweiser has an unpleasant soapiness to it, I note...perhaps a slightly corny taste (take that how you will), but I agree the malt and hops in it just don't do it for me. If this is the King of Beers, give me the Queen of Beers [Warsteiner, die Koenigen unter den Bieren]. It's superior in every way.

Ah yes, the so-called King of Beers.  Has a definite sweetness, but an undistinguished, confusing sweetness where you're not sure what the intended flavor is.  Good for those certain occaisions like hot summer yard parties or the bleachers at a ballpark.  But its a few steps too far that it carries the categorization as the all-American beer.

I figured I'd start my second 100 with this shit.  I call it Clydesdale piss, and I still can't believe that so many rednecks worship this swill.  It's not cheap, either.  Yuengling lager is much better, and much more affordable.  I get a kick out of seeing Augie Busch the fourth saying on TV, "We use nothing but the finest ingredients."  Yeah, corn and rice are real fine ingredients, Augie!  Try telling your wife that when you give her a cubic zirconia bracelet instead of a diamond.  As for the born on dating, Busch acts like this is such a great thing.  Honestly, I think skunked Bud tastes better than fresh bud.  At least the skunked Bud has some flavor.  There are hard working people in this country out of work, and the Busch family are billionaires.  Something is fucking wrong with this picture.  Wise up, people, wise up rednecks, and wise up NASCAR fans, stop buying the bullshit (and Clydesdale piss) that Budweiser is selling.  F#ck you, Anheiser Busch.

Don't tell anyone, but I like this beer. There is just something about it that makes it go well with hot and spicy foods. Maybe it is the fact that it has the consistency of water. After the first one (served very cold) your tongue adjusts to the rice flavor and it goes down well.
It's better than Bud Light...Is that a compliment. Probably not. Lacking everywhere. Watery...but tingly.

Looks exactly like water as it's being poured.  Very pale yellow color.  The head doesn't look half bad, though.  That's gotta be the worst smelling beer ever.  Smells like stale piss and malt.  Tastes just as bad.  This is definately a beer to be drank cold (or not at all).  I don't even think I can finish it.
Smooth palate.  Best served cold.  Rice adjuncts strong.  Clear and filtered.  Metallic aftertaste.  Leaves me needing hops.  Just does not gratify me with malt or hops.
man!! this bring back memories of teen life..i dont know why i like it b4 but know it taste like piss in a bottle its like water to me.....

Bottled and tap. Very light in colour and with no distinct aroma, this is really nothing more than water with a hint of rice. To its credit however, it is drinkable, but largely due to its lack of taste.

Oderless, tasteless substance.   With that said, if it only had a hint more of malt and less of the adjunct sweetness they would actually have a respectable product, taken for what it is, an American Standard.  I do have some respect for them for being able to consistently make the same thing.
Only 1 "valid" reason to drink this beer.  On a hot hot day 100+ degrees and beer is ice cold, it goes down clean and refreshing.  Other than that this beer is just like drinking water
Predictable.  Big head.  Wet.  Distinct dry rice hints.  Just what you would expect from the #1 selling beer world wide.
First beer I really started drinking.  As I have been able to taste better imports, which I now favor, I lose interest in buying these.  Fiedler's is the way to go for quality pilsner flavor.

Bottle (sampled: 12.03.04, best before says 11.03.04)
Looks like pear cider. Pale yellow with vanishing white head. Dazzling aroma. All you feel in your mouth is carbonation burst and lame rice flavor. No aftertaste.
Bland with absolutly no head.  Tastes like badly flavored water.  The only reason to drink this is if your 16 and trying to cook cool!
The flavor is similar to chewing on an ice cream stick. Why would you want to drink that?
It's Bud, what can you say? Strictly middle of the road, not extremly good as some claim, or the worst beer on the planet as others contend. Strictly ok.
Yellow with frothy white head.  Heavy malt aroma.  Bitter with a metallic finish.  Fizzy palate.
Can i say headache city? The retchid smell of this beer just makes you want to go in a  cave and hide.Aftertaste of corn and cheap hops.
Can't go wrong with a fresh Budweiser in your hands. Its distinctive tastes represents what a beer truely is
Drink when you need to get drunk and you look in someone else's fridge and that's all they have to steal.

adjunct and floral hop aroma.
looks like a watered down pilsner, high carbonation.
sweet/floral hop, slightly adjuncty flavour.
thin with just about no bitterness, a hint of bitterness in the aftertaste.
boring lager, next..

Well, what can I say that hasn't been said already. I could say that this beer was a perfect 10, but I won't. This is my first rating, so here goes. Sample- 22 oz draft beer. Sometimes it smells like stinky feet, and sometimes it smells like rotten vegetables. I'm not quite sure which is better. The head was almost non existant, but was trying to make an appearance. I got multiple tastes when I had this draft, but I'm not sure of what those tastes were. Perhaps it was a taste similar to eating raw wheat from a farmer's feild? I'm not sure. Aftertaste? Hmm, yeah it was there, and it tasted like......BUD! No suprises there. Only good thing about this beer I guess is that after a few, you still get that "I've been drinking beer" feeling. Thanks.
it's bud light not watered down.  Cheap, but fuck it; it taste alright.
Rice hop beer. This beer has little to offer in terms of taste and quality.
To experience the sweet, you truly need to taste the sour.  Nasty smell, nasty flavor. I'll drink it when it's free, or when the piss poor beer selection in my town offers me nothing better.

I don't think I've had a beer with so few redeeming qualities. It has almost no taste going down, although afterwards it will leave a definite funk in your mouth. Its alcohol content is too low to be a good "chug-and-stumble" beer, and it's way overpriced besides. It gets a 3 for appearance because I like the classic-style label. That's about the only good thing I can think of.
Light and full of carbonation.  A good American Standard but it is far from being a favorite of mine.

I'm a homebrewer and microbrew nut. Very rarely to never do I buy
big chain beers. Recently I had a party in which I bought an aray of beer. Very few people showed up.The ones who did ate all the food and drank little alcohol. So I had
two bottles of good wine
and 3/4 of a case of various beers leftover.
I had a six-pack longneck bottles of Budweiser. I wasn't going to toss it out.
So I had a beer. Honestly, I haven't had
a bud in 10 years. It was good. Light overall
but with a creamy finish
from the rice. No corn in here and you can tell. The best of the rest in this style.

Sample - 22 oz. Draft. Don't even get me started on this one. I've had a long standing gripe with Anheuser-Busch about their sub-par beverage offerings. This one was a freebie, so I had to drink it because I needed the rating. Anyway, this beer is about the most overrated beer on the market. Pours without forming a head, little to no lacing at all. Color is a pale straw color. Little to no carbonation. Taste is as thin as it gets here - nothing even to trigger a response in my brain to say that it tastes bad or good. It just tastes like nothing. Aftertaste, nothing. I can't even say that the beer was refreshing, because I still was thirsty after drinking it. If you honestly, honestly have to have an A-B American Standard, Busch is a better choice because it has everything Bud does not, and its cheaper. However, there are little to no redeeming qualities there either. Just about any other beer would "King" this one.

Blech. The absolute worst beer I've ever had. King of bad beers. I suppose I could drink one if it was almost freezing, but I like to enjoy beer. I honestly don't understand guys who say they "love beer" and this is what they drink?
ICK! Brewed with corn! Typical white trash American "pilsner". Also, an uncalled for abhorrent violation of the Reinheitsgebot!

The best thing that I can say about Budweiser is that it got me through high school and that alone gets it a higher rating than Bud Light. Other than its mass production I cannot imagine how they dare call this the king of beers. I recently drank some of this swill on tap in the hope that maybe I wouldn't be completely dissapointed -- I was! All I can say is: NEVER AGAIN!

No body, no taste, almost uncoloured unless you sit under a blacklight in a strippers' club downtown Montréal. No parallel is to be done with its czech homonym. The truth about that product has to be told: THIS HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH BEER!!! The king of beers? No. The king of crap and imposture!
This ones is far worse than any CUB beer. I liked even the Fosters Lager better than this one. It was like toilet water gone wrong! Never again unless stuck in "Death Valley" on a 50 degree day.
Nauseating aroma, yellow appearance. Bland watery flavor, I try not to keep it in my mouth long enough to figure out it's palate.

This was my first beer. Didn't mind at first, but as time went by, I realized this is nasty, watery ,bland and very weak. Pours a really pale yellow (if it were any paler it wouldn't be any color at all), foam lasts only a few seconds, aroma is of adjuncts--burned rice, corn and tastes like crap.Aftertase like coming out of an ashtray. Blech!

Appearance isn't horrid, but there's nothing special about it either. Smell... well that's the thing: sometimes it smells bad, and sometimes it doesn't smell much at all. Taste leaves soemthing to be desired. Mouthfeel sometimes feels heavy and unnatural... not a beer I'd consider drinking on a regular basis.
Yellow with a white head not too much flavor or aroma. What can I say, I'll drink it when I'm getting it for free.
One word to describe Budweiser, BAD. Causes instant headache. I'd rather have no beer at all.
Everybody loves to hate Budweiser, but miraculously they keep selling it and selling it.  Can't screw up an American original.

Their banner slogan is actually kinda funny. Buy one and read it. Not even pale. Looks like water. Tiny sud head. No aroma. Basically just for pounding back. It's non-offensive, unless you really like beer. I have yet to find a beer where they have put such little effort. Recently I was on the internet and found the recipe: Club soda - NaCl + 1/2 corn alcohol = great beer. King of nothing. Believe it!
Let the truth be known (however), for some reason I will never know, (sigh) it's hard (cough) to make a beer do what it doesn't do. E mail me.
This is just such a boring beer. I cann't find anything exciting or special about it.

Looks like a beer in the bottle and the quantity of commercials about the beer make it sound ligit. Once you taste it, however, it is just depressing. I agree with the previous rating; it's sour. We have a difference recipe in Canada, but once you go stateside it gets closer and closer to water.

Almost no head and it's a pale yellow. The aroma isn't so bad, even if it's a bit dishwatery. A bit sweet and sour also.

The flavour? What flavour? It doesn't taste bad, but then it hardly tastes at all.

Well warsteiner is the queen of beers and this is suppose to be the king? sounds like a pair of mixed up transvestites to me.  if you can get it fresh from the brewery its tasty otherwise, stick to becks!

So obviously Budweiser is not the best beer around.  It has a pale yellow appearance and no distinct aroma.  Yet, how is a beer that is so common supposed to stand out as high quality.  Well i guess it can't since its tates is below average compared to the beer people should drink and us beer experts enjoy.  I still will give it props for being better than Miller/Coors or any other standard dead in the water light beer.  It does have some hops to it and some malt, but nothing to get excited or even luke worm about.
I don't know what kind of twisted person would dub this beer king but it's more like the court jester. Terrible aroma taste and palate - don't bother.

"Premium" compared to what?!  The aroma, appearance, flavor, and palate of this beer are not distinctive at all, and only marginally different from the other macro brews.  Still better than malt liquor though, unless you're trying to get drunk.
This was one of my favorite beers until I discovered micro brewery's and discovered what beer should taste like. Not horrible but not far from it either.

the first premium beer i drank as a youngster.  wow, that was before foreign beer and today's micro-brews.  bud is water with a bit of carbonation and a smidgen of malt and a pinch of hops.   i rated this one so high for the memories!

I was young once. I
thought as a youth beer is great for camping and keg parties. Well i'm not a kid anymore, and the headaches aren't as fun as they used to be. The taste of Bud is ok these days if I'm in a swill mood , but thats not very often. So in closing if there is only domestics on the shelf i seem to grab it.

This is tingy, thin, and not easy to drink.  The most terrible beer I’ve had thus far...

Re rate:  I had Bud Light and it is worse.  Re rate:  I had Bud again and it is worse.  I just can’t decide which beer will be the most terrible on my list.  Well, then there’s always Busch...

in las vegas these beers rate supreme, all these white trash people with out taste buds. love all the big brewers and is mostly what you find on tap everywhere. definately not one i would choose at the bar, if i must i would prefer bud light. which is still a stretch.  however, this beer does  have its place in history and for its american lager style. which fits the norm. stay away from it unless its near freezing or have a coffee or a slurpee instead.

I still find it amazing that people think this crap is great.  However, in the bottle, it can have a creamy quality that is kind of nice.  The price (and my concious) makes it a beer I'll never buy, but will only accept for free.  I nearly cried when Bud became one of the two main sponsors of the WilliamsBMW F1 team

I made this at home once by soaking white bread in some very old tonic water I found in the back of my truck.  If you've ever driven by one of the massive Bud breweries and wretched at the heinous mouldy grain stench, then you've had the ultimate bud experience.  Alas, I've had worse.

A-B is going to spend $24 million on Super Bowl advertising this year.
The money would be better spent trying to make this carbonated pottywater taste a bit better.
AWFUL. It seriously tastes like bile. I couldn't drink more than one of these, even if it was free. Gross. Worse than Corona, if that's possible.

1 is about it, folks.  It saddens me to see Bueweiser sink to this leval.  It uses to be a decent beer.  Hell, back before the days of imports and microbrews it was the king.  Today's product is watery, no taste, no head or lacing,sorta riminds me of climbing on a Mexican whore with two condoms wrapped around my pecker.
Yellow fizzy, sweet, crappy.  Ummm...alcoholic water.  This beer is truely the king.

I'm told that there are two beers in every pub in Ireland... Guiness and Bud.  That being said, I have had this beer in bottle, can, keg, and probably the old plastic beer balls.  I don't mind this one, but I rarely drink it.  It has a nice golden color and a good clean crisp mouthfeel when enjoyed cold.  A little sweet on the palate with not much aroma.  It is an all American beer, and lots of people prefer to bash it because of that, but the whole world still drinks it.  I don't look for it when I'm buying, but I have no problems quaffing the King.
Little flavor but clean finish.  Only drinakble when cold and when very thirsty.

clear and crisp beer..total USA beer ....

more taste would be good.

if we wanted water ...we would ask for water
The king should abdicate...  There is nothing regal about Bud- it's beer.  That's all.

The lowest I have rated for appearance(1), just looking at puts you off but the things that you do when you are hooked on this site. Stale hops aroma, very little flavour perhaps some rice and a very little head must make this a small crown for the "king of beers".
Pale gold with whitish head. Very little aroma. Very little flavor. Best served very cold--it numbs the tongue. Can't imagine why it is the world's best selling.
Tastes like shandy.  No discernable flavours, but it is fizzy, and you can undoubtedly drink a lot without too much effort.
Slightly worse than it's light cousin.  The rice and corn flavours and aromas really come through on this one.  Great for chugging when your already sauced, but that's it.
Drank lots as a kid. Damn if beer cans could tell stories....overall a pretty weak beer.
Its like an old friend.  Buds always been there for you.  And time and time again its just the right thing to drink.  Hard day? this buds for you.

Its the King of Beers not for its flavor or what not, but for its selling ability and popularity.  Been the best seller forever.. Probably for its heavy deep taste, and higher than average alc. content.  Not a bad beer in a bottle and ice cold..

[draft at Fat Tuesday in the Pittsburgh International Airport - Moon Township, PA] Hardly any aroma. Pale yellow with little head and little carbonation. Heavy malt taste with very little body behind it. Overly watery. I do not know how this is the King of Beers.

This is not a beer lovers beer.  That is unless you are a bud fan.  It pours a pale yellow with little to remember it by.  The thin chemical taste is nothing great.  It might be good for a back yard bbq or something on a hot day.
Goes down smooth out of a bottle, but out of a can it sucks, its got a nice color and not a bad flavor either, although its hard to describe the taste.

Somehow, someway, the king of beers eluded my rating list for quite some time. Until now, I finally hunted it down. Bottle. Pours a brilliant golden urine color, sparkling and big carbonation. Glows like liquid sunshine. Aroma of grass, hay, one hop, just tingles the nose. But the taste, oh the taste, corn syrup sweetness matched only by the best Belgian ales. Sticks to the entire digestive tract. Only real beers contain corn and rice, get with it guys. And now for the official review: Total crap. Minus points for calling itself the king of beers.

Finally had to try it.  This beer looks weak; thin and pale yellow with a quickly subsiding head.  The flavor though isn't as bad as beer snobs joke about.  This is richly malted beer, but you can tell it's mellowed with corn.  I've had much worse beers, although this is pretty bland.
Growing up I drank alot of this beer because it was cheep and I didn't know better.  Lots of carbonation and very little flavor.Not offensive, a simple beer.

Anyone who is anyone in the United states atleast grew up on the piss so pay it it's due...if not for bud you never would have made it to rate beer.  What else you gonna drink while grillin or tailgaitin
Much better than its light brother, it actually has a flavor that can be savored
Everything I expected, and less! Watery, almost devoid of flavour. My real question now is this - how the heck do you make a LIGHT version of this?!?!?!?
When Budweiser made all their beer in St. Louis the beer was much better. Still I like the beer, it has good flavor and doesn't leave a bitter aftertaste.

um.  4 of every 5 americans are idiots.  the other 3 drink something equally as bad.  good for drinking while bowing to the corporate gods of mainstream america, listening to metallica and gagging on the arrogant ameri-fascist interpretation of patriotism.

Wow--15 months on the site and this is my first rating of this beast.  Gets points for being in my law firm's refrigerator.  Loses points on appearance, aroma, flavor and palate.  As a beer geek who likes light lagers, one might think I would be a little more forgiving of this one that most.
dire, watery, overpriced (at least in the UK) piss. An example of style over substance.
Say what you want,but this beer is extremely drinkable ice cold and with food(mainly summer grillin'). One of my  favorite adjunct-laden macroswills. (but not a Labatt's Blue)

Not even the King of Swill. Adjunct hell. the King of Aftertaste?
Actually it's drinkable if its ice cold and your at a AZ Cardinals game sweating your ass off watching the most pathetic franchise in the history of sports stink up the field...but I digress........ yeah it sucks.
When I was in St. Louis, this became the only beer I drank, because I couldn't find my Blue.  This beer was drinkable, although I could taste the beechwood.

Recent re-rate. Not as bad as I once thought. It is just bland and inoffensive more than anything. Less sweet than a lot of pale lagers, it is drinkable, but not desirable. Smooth with a husky finish. The nose is grainy with a little bit of wood.

Crisp clean nose, and an efervescent tickle to it, but not much in the way of aroma--maybe a hint of saaz or tetnanger hops.  Bud is incredibly clear, with a very light golden hue to it. The first taste is light, very bubbly, and with very little malt presence.  This is perhaps the most widely drunk beers in the world, so it astonishes me that its rating is so low on this site!  With Bud you get what you get--the ultimate in low gravity, non-offensive brew!  You can say what you want, but after mowing the lawn of a hot summer's day, Bud goes down really smooth.  Besides, I wouldn't want to spent good money on an expensive import if all I'm gonna do is chug a couple of bottles anyway.
When they say hundreds o millions of people can't be wrong, they underestimate the effect of marketing!  I drink Bud because we can't get good beer in Montana--DON'T LET THIS HAPPEN TO YOU!
yellow in color, very little head, very faint hops and some malt. ..........
Too much water and very little body, aroma and weak taste. Could not be recommended.

Pale clear yellow.  Nothing for the nose.  Crisp,Thin,Light body.
No destictive flavor other than water.  I just don't understand how this is the best selling beer.

This "beer" is so light in colour i thought it was champagne. It also has no carbonation, no flavour, nothing on the palate, no aroma (maybe a faint whiff of roses). It is sugary, sweet, thin and watery. What is it supposed to be?

One i grew up with and still have around the house. Cant believe i used to like this crap. People constantly bring it in, so for free why not. Only buy if im low on money or dont wanna pick out a fine beer. Served ice cold tastes like ice water. Depends on the situation if i like this or not. "King of Beers" just to lure you in asap.
Why do my "friends" keep serving me this crap?  At my house they get good beer.  Some people will never learn.
The Beer of choice for millions, not bad, not good.  should be called a lite beer, little taste, fairly smooth and clean.
this is a good beer for a hot day....or a raniy day for that fact.the all american beer.
Had this at a wedding so I could review it.Looked ok, but thats it. No aroma,less taste than a light beer,strictly for rednecks who want to get drunk slowly.
Its crisp and clean. Neutral aroma and flavor. Very clear in color. Much better tha bud light.

I gave a few extra points for being "free" (would anyone actually buy this???). And I didn't want to make this # 100. Part of the free cases given to Bud employees. Neutral aroma. Neutral flavor. Light and clear. Better than Bud Light. What do you expect? Its a Bud.

Draft. It was a buck a draft, so now seemed like as good a time as any to rate it. Have to give it some points for being the proper color, I guess. There actually was a slightly fruity hoppiness to it, and I actually could taste the beechwood. But way too many off flavors, adjunct and DMS tastes, and besides, next day I have a pounding headache. There. I’ve had one. Now stop shoving that Lite at me.
this beer is horrid the only good thing i found for it is when using my crock-pot cooking pork..very very bad beer again why is it #1?

Ahhh the "King of Beers " what a treat ;-)
Horrid looking urine coloured beer..should never be poured into a glass.
Smell is non-existent  like water..neutral.
A very water like taste nothing at all somemalts for a nano second then its fizz water  with a tonic bitterness.
Watery as heck and over carbonated.
terrible beer..I have no idea why its so popular.
lovely blend of water, blandness and funk, which i'm thinking is the rice.  why would anyone buy this crap other than to make fun of it?
Fried Catfish?  Pour some in the batter before bringing to a boil and enjoy a good light reisling with the fish after cooking,
The king of beers. No.  No.  No.  It doesnt taste.  Is there any hops, any malt, I know there is water.  cheers

Mild hay and creamed corn in the very low aroma. Sweetish flavour with no bitterness. It’s slightly sweetened carbonated coloured water. Poured to a full but rapidly diminishing head on a golden body with good carbonation.  Canned corn aroma and flavour emerges and strengthens if allowed to warm at all.  Bottle.
Never fails to disgust.  There's a plus though:You can use it as bath water.
drank this beer off the tap last night and it was very bland. the colour/appearance is the best part of this beer. the taste is nothing special. water-like and very little flavour.

Straight out of the can, and even worse than I thought it would be.  Somehow I had never tried this back in my crappier beer-drinking days.  How could something with such little flavor manage to taste so bad???  All I taste is a hint of bug spray.
The king of beers is perhaps the worst of beers.  Nothing good in here at all. No flavour, chemical taste and watery texture leave this beer a complete waste of time.
Not sure how or why I ever drank this stuff.  Taste is reminiscient of Coca Cola. Stay away.

If you're going to drink an American Standard, Bud is expensive, tasteless swill.  You'll be much better off drinking Lucky Lager, Falstaff, Pabst Blue Ribbon or Mickey's.  All are cheaper and better tasting, imo, than Bud.  But don't take my word for it!  Read on...

Living 100 feet from the brewry in St.lou I guess I have to rate this. Very pale and watery.  You can almost taste the corn. Goes down smooth though with little taste.  Best for drinking at sporting events where you want to get loaded quickly.  A footnote to my Bud review is watch out for the hangover the next day.  You drink 12 of these i hope you don't have anything planned for about 24 hours.
Just a thirst quencher, but I'd rather drink water.  I use it to rinse glasses during tastings.
Really light, pretty thick white head, almoust no lace. Very light and mild nose. Light and watery beer.
And they call this beer the king of beers....  Use this one for mop up duty.

Clear pale yellow body with noticeably thin viscosity. Very little character in the aroma. Very vague malt presence. Engineered to be bland. Flavor is shallow and weak with sweet notes and very light bitterness. My theory is that beechwood sucks the flavor out of beer. Thin, watery, spritzy body. Insipid, brain-dead, flaccid, and low-class. One of the most insidiously marketed products in the post-Industrial era. I have a vision of a world where we see a commercial with 4 frogs in a swamp who say: "west", "vle", "ter", "en".

The good...it's relatively cheap ($11/24pk in my area)and consistantly bland.  Color is light golden with a mediocre head.  Not a terrible beer, but with sooooo many other good options to enjoy (and bad ones to experience) why go with the King of Beers?
Well, at over 1000 ratings, I guess it's pretty much given that this beer sucks. If I were to drink any BMC, I'd have to go with Coors original. Though I'd probably just buy something better anyway.

Avoid, unless there is no Blatz available!!

Not too bad.  But certainly not a Blatz!
What can you say. This is an American Standard and it is here to stay. It is the King of Beers. Something that you drink when you want to say you are American.
Mass produced, full of adjuncts with only the least expensive trace of true beer ingredients such as malt or hops.  'Tis truly swill.
Bud.  Weis.  I love frog legs; don't you?I also love ratings more creative than mine.  See 'krisbierjaeger' for the lowdown on this swill.
Piss in a bottle.  Only thing it's good for is its commercials, which are always hilarious.

The king of beers-do me a favour!!! bland unispiring lager beer that helps the younger generation get into beer because of its ultra refreshing non descript taste- its too pale and if poured(i recommend you drink it out of the bottle) its flat totally overated only good on a very hot day

DMS...DMS...DMS...DMS what's shakin?  DMS...DMS...DMS...DMS awww sheeeeeeet.


Seriously, tonight I quenched myself with a Budweiser, the first I've had since at least February 1, 2003 (the day I joined Ratebeer).  It wasn't very good.  But, I quickly moved to a bar with Oktoberfest, so the night wasn't so bad.
As far as standards go, I've only had this a few times but I don't like it. Has a weird flavor. Slick marketing though.
A beer you have to try because of its legend name. Lacks anything special. Very drinkable but has little flavour.

King of Beers?  I guess they can say that in the US cause we never had a monarchy.  Infinitely generic, Infinitely forgettable, this brew must be served near frozen so your taste buds are frostbitten from the Bud. Flavor? What is flavor to this beer. i have not been able to legally drink very long..... the first thing i did was to stop drinking this swill
i can naturally produce yellow water that tase better then the king of beers

12 oz bottle, pils flute.  Bottle states that it was brewed for the Cartersville, GA brewery's 10th anniversary.  Yeah, it was still yellow and fizzy.  But here's what suprised me: no cooked vegetables, no DMS.  Maybe they left out the nasties for their own brew?  That said, the aroma and flavor was very light.  Pearish and fruity aroma and flavor.  Little bit of an unclean finish is slightly hidden by the carbonation.  Watery and slightly dry med-light body.  The bottom line is: it wasn't horrible.

Insipidity. This word says it all about this beer. If you dare call that yellow stuff a beer. Budweiser, "the king of beers" ? In France, it's a tradition to chop kings' heads off, and this one deserves it !
Believe it or not the imported stuff into Australia is 5% alcohol and there are worse beers going around than this. Having said that I tried a few while in the US not so long ago and wished I hadn't

Does anyone actually like this stuff (can't call it beer!)?  I can understand if you drink a certain beer A LOT, you might come to enjoy it but oh man is this bad!  Its so bad I rather have a Canadian.  Never again will I willingly let this touch my lips!

This curent version of this brand is the result of a pure profit over quality plan in the late 70s early 80s
which they slowly lowered the amount of malt and hops in the beer and replacing malt with rice till the sales start to drop and then kicked the malt and hops up a bit which stablized sales and it been that week rice water since then
I have't the slightest idea why this is the largest selling beer in the world. It's somthing to drink other than water. I'd just as soon drink water.    The King of Beers. Not!

This is probably one of the the worst beers out there.  I have no idea why it is popular.  All I taste is water and few cheap adjuncts.  It was the only bad thing I can say about a terrific performance by the Dead this evening.  For drinking swill, Genny is loads better.
Damn, doesn't this rating system have minus numbers? I will give Budweiser a single notch better than awful, though... it's too bland to even offer a bad taste! "Bud" is not worth my drinking time.

What more can one possibly say about this beer? That can sure is pretty and same color in as out.

DUDE!  mikelob dry is seriosly, like, the most awesum beer ever.  Seriosly, I drink this stuf all the time.  Ther's nevr a bad time to drink mikelob dry ... The Emperor has no clothes!!! The King lives on Fantasy Island. Simply a travesty that this is considered the King.
