Greatest beer ever.  Never mind the negative comments you read.  After all there is a reason that it is the largest selling beer in the WORLD.  I love it and love to get a buzz from bud.  You can find it on sell between $11-$13 a case (check your sales paper).  All Hail The King of Beers!

I'd rather have a Pepsi.  I've spent time working in a liquor store and it sickens me how many people drink this.  I've heard many a hillbilly proudly refer to this as the "king of beers" as it so lauds itself on the can.  If they only knew...

I rate this fairly high for a commercial brew, because it is in every sense a working man's brew. This can be sipped-- or chugged-- in any situation, very nice on a hot day, when you're painting the house, or even out at a bar (after you've had a few already). Compare it to a micro brew and it's nothing, but it scores points for versatility.

A few months agomy husband, btown brewer and his cousin went on a tour of the Bud plant in Manchester. When they got back the told me that they weren't allowed to see where the beer was actually brewed because that part of the plant was under construction. I let them in on a little secret that my Daddy told me when he quit drinkin'.
It's rat piss. 
Do you really expectt hem to let you see the room where they collect and carbonate rat piss!?! I think that says it all. Yuck! And I take offense at anyone labeling this as a womans beer, not even blondes are that dumb, well most of 'em anyway
Way to much carbonation.  Gives you the burps and the farts.  This beer is for women because it basically tastes like water.

Had a free 1/2 keg of this one last week.Smells like corny beer but thats the rice folks.Too much carbonation in this one at times.It's a piss golden lookin' beer.The flavor is drinkable but the rice makes it somewhat tasty(eww)What palate?
Pale yellow with a quickly disappearing head. Soft but also almost tasteless

As ordinary as beer comes. Tremendous marketing but adjunct ingredients detract from overall impression. Usually the cheapest and most widely found beer in U.S. bars and restaurants but if you can afford better then invest.
Bud has nothing special to offer. A little malt and a little bitterness. It is like lots of other massproduced beers. Perhaps a little more soft than others though.

Certainly no king in this malt free, hop free rice induced swill.
My neighbour loves it ,but there's no accounting for neighbours.. Cold water will do thanks.

In all honesty this beer is not worth a shit.  I am a cheap bastard!  Having said that, I have no problems paying a bit extra for a good product.  Bud is simply overpriced beer because the Bud marketing team causes it to be.  I think every jerk out there that only drinks Bud or Bud Light should do a blind taste test with other cheaper American piss-water beers, they would probably find a new favorite. It seems to me that lots of Bud loyalists are programmed, uninformed consumers that are afraid of branching out and trying something new. I will not say Bud is horrible but I think there is much better product for the money you will spend.

The King of BAD beers. It is almost tasteless and too carbonated. I can imagine people around the world ordering it and saying "WASSUUUP" as a bad joke. What´s going on here? Do they try to be more American or something?
Great with a bowl of Peel and Eat shrimp.  I have always fpund that you can't go wrong with an original such as this.  This beer is best straight from a can or perhaps from a can to a frosty mug.
Re-rate: I can’t understand how this is the most popular beer in the U.S. That corn/rice mixture ain’t workin’ for ’em. That being said, it’s better than most cheap beers out there.
water with a disgusting and somehow bland corn rankness, yeehaw only worth rating when my rating dont count

Actually, I disagree with most of the reviewers.  In a blindfold test, I am sure Bud would one of the easiest of the common UK draught lagers to identify.  However, "kind of beers" it most certainly is not, and it sickens me to see people in UK pubs ordering pints of Bud thinking it is something special when it's not!  I've never even tried genuine USA Bud, because the stuff in the UK is brewed here and can't possibly be the same as the genuine article.

Pretty much an attitude beer people drink cause it doesnt taste much and goes down well (okay okay, just to follow the trend). The wheat nose was the most interesting part for me. Water texture in mouth, no aftertaste to speak of.  I heard it was pretty expensive in Northern Europe like a luxury imported beer, made me laugh (read cry)
This beer is not made from "choice" anything.  If I was trailer trash this beer would be my god, but I'm not.
No color, no head, no taste. Good when cold to quench thirst, a decent aftertaste actually, consisting of pine wood and hops, but it later gave me a headache after only one.

much of expensive for a beer without taste (brakfast beer), but avaiable everywhere in the word which is kinda sad.

Same complaints as the others. Ugly yellow. Lots of adjuncts. Thin bodied. And the commercial description makes my blood boil.
Bottled, Pasteurised. Thin yellow colour with big head. The advertising is greater than the product. Fizzy rice beer with sweet sickly flavour. I've had a few of these and they never get any better.

This beer poured a large white frothy head with small bubbles that quickly diminished. There was no lacing with this beer. The body was clear and yellow in hue. The carbonation was fizzy. The aroma was somewhat fruity. The initial flavor was moderately sweet and the finishing flavor was lightly sweet and lightly acidic. The mouthfeel was light, thin and watery.
King of Capitalism is more like it. Great go and make a lot of money just don't false advertise. Bud is not beer.

An okay beer for the price I guess.  There are both better and worse beers in the same price range.  I only drink this if I'm at a restaurant and the beer selection is very limited.  Even then I sometimes order soda instead.
Re-rate: I had this beer after the Bornem Triple and Double. Man, it sucks.

Not a very well made beer. Almost no head to it when poured. Has very pale color to it, definitely not the beautiful golden hue that all pilsners should have. Also has a very weak taste to it. It's sad that this beer is the #!1 selling beer in the world.
I don't like it.  The taste is too strong it a bad way.  No aroma.  All this in spite of it appearing ok.  Just sad that this is one of America's most populars beers.
not bad for a cheap beer. but ot's a dime a dozen.  I'm not gonna go into the falvors too much because if your on this website to look at budwieser you've got to try some more beers

same dry urinary taste as it's cousin bud lite but with a little more kick than the lite stuff. not stronger than it's evil cousin bud ice however. i'll drink it with some pretzels on my porch or if i'm too broke to buy something better. hey - i drink it at home alone - so nobody else can see me.
only had this beer once and i'll never drink it again.one of the worst beers i ever had.
The only thing worse than bud is bud light and that isnt saying much, thats for sure
Great for chugging, though harsher than Coors. All I've got to say about that.
Good lord who the hell drinks this? This is NOT beer. I would rather drink, well... water.
This beer has very litttle color, even less flavor and outsell every beer in the world! Why do so many people drink this crap?

I have made it my mission to stop people from consuming Budweiser...if a friend or loved one drinks this crap, please give them a case of Yuengling.  It's all about baby steps.
I live a mile or so from the Ramlosa spa, and to tell the truth, their world famous mineral water is more full bodied and has a more lasting taste.
Nothing to say that hasn't been said, and everyone knows what this tastes like.
Not dissapointing but nothing to jump for; slightly sweet and good to clear your palate. I'll take it if there's nothing better.
Not too bad. Better than Bud Light. Has some flavor, more of a "chill beer."
a "sweeter" beer.  Goes down pretty easy.  Is a little gassy if you chug it.
poured it in and it came straight out and then i pouredit back in again and did that a few times
like two tickets to paradise.... if paradise was a place named baghdad. GO S.S.N. 716

I went straight to the brewery for this one. No, seriously, where's the beer? And the flavor? Body? Head? (looked like the foam from an effluent pipe. scummy.)Anyone?... Hops? Oh, I give up. It's gotta be the rice. (The only time rice should be used with beer is wrapped around raw fish and dipped in wasabi and soy sauce) Strangely, there was actually a very slight creaminess.
I don't know why I like budweiser, I just do. In the spectrum of American beers it is probably one of the better widely marketed domestics. Not the king of beers, more of a viceroy.

Holy piss in cup!  until today i've never had a Budweiser or Budweiser product.  now i know why.  I went on the Bud brewery tour at their Merrimack, NH plant.  the only reason i gave it a 2 for flavor and for aroma is because there was a creamy undertone in the beer and i had to count that for something.  i can't see why peeps would actually choose to drink this fetid slop.

Well bud is by far the average mans beer.  Average taste, easy drinking, its good for a day of watching football or going out to a sports bar.

Sigh.  Unbelievably pale in color.  White head that is somewhat frightening in its ability to not deviate in size.  Smells like rice and something a bit... processed.  Tastes, just barely. P-A-L-E golden. No aroma. Sour flavor. Dry finish. I will N-E-V-E-R have this again.

well well.. had 6 of those at a promotion party earlier this night.. "Spitty´s" rating of this is just on target. Junk beer that sells well due to good marketing.. it was a hot day, I was thirsty and it was free...
Yuck.  I never have liked it and never will.  It is what you drink if it is free and ther is nothing else.

Being young and hearing all the "King of beers" slogans i couldnt help but try it.To be fair, its refreshing on a hot day playing some football. I think its a beer caught in limbo, its rubbish, but it sells well. Just shows what good advertising can do to a bottle of water!

Keg
Ok, I had it! Well, it's not the worst one; light malty aroma, some body, light sweetness. The final is really watery. I hope I will wait again 10 years before drinking it again, but at least I was not disgusted.
Classic tasteless mass produced swill. Only good on a hot day after doing yard work. And it has to be really cold.

A good porch beer. (sitting on a porch in lawn chairs for hours downing cases of beer.) Haven't found any other use for it.

Really not a bad beer at all, especially considering the volume in which it is sold.  Decent color, good price and a pretty good flavor for an American standard.
Not bad and compared to other "bud" beers it is not nearly as watery. For being cheap and easily found it hits the spot when in a pinch.

Not a great beer, but not awful either.  It's a BMC (Beer of Mass Consumption) and can perhaps share the title with Pabst as the beer of the blue collar worker.  Doesn't fill the mouth with a bevy of flavors, it's content as the perfect reward after mowing the lawn.
does the trick when the trick needs to be done.  my beer of choice when i want a beer cold and delivered immediately.

This beer sucks.  I wouldn't use it to douse out my balls if they were on fire.
Why do people still bother with this stuff?  Just because it is the largest selling brand I suppose.  Try a bottle of it followed by any half decent European lager and you'll see for yourself.

This is the first beer everyone has.  Its great after a long day or to watch tv with.  Plus it gets you drunk!!
For a Amercian beer I guess not to bad. Rice and Corn to replace barley? Not a good Idea.

If you are into beer drinking for the taste avoid Budweiser. The best thing about this beer is the fact i live close to the brewery so most of the time it is fresh. Its great when you have an Aussie beer and still know its at least better than Bud. Save your money from trying to boot out the real Budvar and brew some good beer you jerks

Bud is bud, certainly any beer rater would be remiss not to rate bud. It's an average beer that's very drinkable but definatly not a "king of beers"
I actually like bud light better, I guess watering this stuff down is for the best.

The "King of Beers". Ha! What a joke. If Bud is the king of beers, I'm a monkey's uncle. This watered down pig swill isn't fit to
drink. I've had it in bottles, kegs, and cans, and it all was terrible. Who drinks this shit? The aroma, if you can call it that, is of
rice & burned corn. They use rice & corn (says so right on the label) because rice & corn are a lot cheaper than malted barley.
No hop aroma or taste for that matter to speak of. A fizzy, light straw colored nightmare in a can. It tastes of rotten vegetables,
and it'll give you a hangover that would kill any ordinary horse. They should ban this stuff, because it is one nasty beer in my
book. I personally never developed a taste for mega-swill, thank God. Save your money, buy better, not Bud.
Truely the King of Beers...at least among the mass produced American breweries.

The global infection of Bud, has reached London’s city bars and is now commonly stocked in the fridges alongside the other bud - Budweiser Budvar (Czech). Thanks to the miracle of marketing and the fact that its name can be spoken regardless of your IQ or intoxication, Bud has secured its place in plebeian culture.
Fizzy yellow color, quickly dissipitating foamy white head.  Aroma is slightly fruity, but mostly unappealing.  Body is sugary and bland, finishes quickly, actually never really starts.

If you don't like to make decisions because they hurt your brain, this is they beer for you.  Also, continue to have your music force-fed to you by the major labels and make sure to believe everthing you see on television.

budweiser smells bad and leaves you with bad breath, but it is cheap and is definently a good value, you can't go wrong with that

In my opinion, the best session beer available when you just want a "cold one" or several, and are not concerned about product differential. This is the beer of the masses. Its light body and balanced taste makes it highly drinkable in quantity.

I like Bud....

OK, I am taking my RateBeer.com ratings seriously. I will even rate a .... ugh, must I say it, Budweiser. It has a mild fruity to no aroma. It has a head of fine bubbles that disappears quickly and body with a watery weak light yellow color. You can taste the carbonation in you r mouth. I look at the glass and bubbles are still rising off its bottom. I belch after the first taste. I can still taste the carbonation on my front teeth. The flavor is weak to non-existent. Definitely a no-character brew. There is no real flavor to speak of. There was very little lacing on the side of the glass. I belch again. Must I drink more of this swill? OK, I finished the glass and just had to come back and add one more point. I did get a buzz off this beer and for a cheap drunk; I had to bump up its rating. After all, it was only $0.89.
I dont understand why everyone beats up on this beer. It goes down a lot easier than Miller and isnt as bitter. It isnt great but ill take it over a lot of things.

"The King of Beers" it certainly isn't, but you know what to expect from a Bud--nothing out of the ordinary, a standard corn 'n' rice brew, but it's consistent, and it works when Cousin Louie is barbecuing at the trailer park.

Had from bottle March 27, 2003 at The Gas Lite, Santa Monica
After finding my original destination was full with NCAA fans and there was no NTN to be had, a friend and I traveled down the stree to the Gas Lite where they had $1.50 bottles of Bud and nothing on tap.  Since we were just there to play NTN and not to drink, we ordered a couple Buds, got some great popcorn and played for a while.  It's been quite a while since I actually had one of these abhorrent specimens - absolutely no taste whatsoever and a fizzy, yellow appearance.  It's no wonder this is the best selling beer in the world - it's easy to drink because it's just water...those that don't care about flavor can easily down quite a few of these and their very low ABV.  To each his own - this is definitely not my beer.
Its all been said before, I would rather stay sober than drink this.  Not a good beer.
This is a fair entry for an American Standard.  Watery, no real "beer" ingredient flavors on the palate.  Typically bland.  Don't expect much from any beer that lists rice as an ingredient.
Everybody seems to like to knock this beer, but, while it's certainly not "The King of Beers," I think it's decent.  Tastes like an average american standard.   Always availible.

Ive yet to rate a crap beer in a "serious" manner because I see no point, but I'll do a test run with Bud - Appearance is light yellow and looks clear when you pour the beer. You can see through it. Aroma is faint some corn in the background. Flavor is mostly water but nothing terribly offensive, sweet corn, rice, possibly a hop or 2 at the most, and some beechwood aging. Palate is water and more water. Smooth - Ok it sounds stupid to break down the finer points of a Bud so I'll go with "Typical American Standard not as bad as the Beast, but not as good as many others, it's ok when it's all that's around and you dont want to think and drink at the same time" Ok thats better!

I love Budweiser.  I don't know if its the taste, or all the good times I've had drinking this shit.  Everyone I know makes fun of me because I would rather drink a cold Bud, than just about any micro.

pretty tangy/sweet/watery beer flavor.

The plastic cup that awaits you appears to mock your nobility. The Clydesdale that brought you to me surely has let you bare its marking. The cup makes its way to my lips so that the muscular froth flows to my awaiting lips as if dripping straight from a branch of a birch tree. My buttocks tremble in anticipation. Liquid, yes, golden liquid of the gods I am yours, take me.

I think people--as in not the kind of people who write beer reviews on the internet--like this beer because it is exceptionally light on the palate w/ carbonation at about the maximum level before it starts getting hard to drink. I am the kind of person who writes beer reviews on the internet and I still like it though and for pretty much the same reasons. The rice gives it a distinctly different texture than other American beers and there is that oft-noted hint of apple to set it apart as well.

"No one ever went broke underestimating the intelligence of the American public" said the great Baltimore sage H.L. Mencken. Budweiser is material proof of this quote. What amazes me is how AB owns the market lock, stock and barrel. For this, their marketing staff have to be given credit, for how can such crap be so well received. One thing is certain........they don't drink this swill. It is the best con job since knotty pine paneling and Bose speakers. In my rural area, all rednecks drink only Bud.  Bring something else to the party and you'll be severely ridiculed or possibly face violence. Offer another lousy beer or a quality one, its all the same. It is like religion or patriotism gone real ugly.  This doesn't speak well of my locale, however I know the same is true elsewhere. The "10 oz" Bud is the local favorite.  They think it has a superior taste to the 12 oz can. Rednecks and blue collar folks deserve better, but then again maybe they don't. I've seen mention on this website of Bud being a cheap beer. I don't find it very cheap really, but maybe demand is so high here that it is priced accordingly. Interestingly, if you talk to old-time beer drinkers they'll tell you that they wouldn't piss on Bud in those days.

Aroma is quite light, quite in character with its pale whitish-gold color, which distinguishes it from most of its American macrobrewed brethren.  The flavor is also more appealing than most mass-produced products.  Though not really distinctively hopped, it has a mild and pleasant bite, and counterbalanced by the presence of rice malt, which is certainly a preferable adjunct to the more heavy-handed  corn overtones present in  competitor mega-brewers' flagship products. One admirable aspect of A-B's operations is the remarkable consistency of a product brewed in twelve regional plants.  This is a very respectable mass-market product, several cuts above the swill it is so often characterized to be.

Re-rate:  I wanted to do a back to back today between this and Miller High Life (I am bored).  This brew pours from the bottle a sparkling pale golden.  The 45 second average sized head is white and frothy and has piss-poor lacing.  The nose is so clean and neutral it is almost undetectable.  I got a hint of yeast and perfume.  The sweet light flavor is somewhat cloying and very very shallow.  The sweet finish is gone in the blink of an eye.  The light watery palate is very fizzy and finishes slightly dry.  Doesn't hold a candle to Miller High Life for someone on a budget. *Original Rate 2/28/02 5-1-2-1-7; 1.6* This is what you drink when they have nothing else on tap 'cept Bud Light. I almost laughed when I poured this, it had the appearance of a yellow orange champagne.  'THE KING OF BEERS' this is not.  A quickly diminishing small frothy head.  Looked like it belonged on a cappucino.  I tasted a hint of something, it might have been malt.  I tasted mostly bubbles.  Little irritating bubbles.
It's Bud - nothing more, nothing less. A good party and concert beer. It’s quantity not quality where this beer is concerned. Most can go through a 12er of this like a fish through water.
Yuck! Watered down - too much carbonation - just plain yuck! If I'm going to go with a mainstream light beer, I'll turn to Corona. Bud is just nasty and a waste of your time.

Head is initially small, fizzy, white, fully diminishing. Body is clear light yellow. Trace aroma (some grain and DMS). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic. Light to medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. Sweet seltzer with a gentle whisper of cooked vegetables for its bouquet.

The beer after its pour from the 12-ounce brown bottle sets in the glass an unclouded light yellow with the head modest in size, frothy in texture and the color a bright white as it dissolves quite quickly the lace a thin sheet. Nose is malt and clean, fresh with the start lightly sweet with fair to middling rice profile, the top skeletal in feel. Finish is stern in its acidity, the hops apropos to the style, dry aftertaste, it is what it is a “mass produced beer”, and at one time many years ago, it was my beer of choice.

Easy drinking, very little flavor, cheap, cheap, cheap.
Good only for a quick buzz.

courtesy of Ric Jackman; labelled Anheuser-Busch B as the use of Budweiser brand is forbidden in Switzerland; brewed by Stag (London) - clear and very pale golden-yellow colour with a firm and persistent bright white foam; light notes of butter and corn (those are getting stronger and quite disgusting while the beer gets warmer); crisp and clean palate? sure, but desperately tasteless; no bitterness and a soft and creamy corny watery bland aftertaste - the brew every beer geek loves to hate and the perfect symbol of what beer should not be; and this beer doesn’t taste better even when offered by a former NHL 5th overall draft pick :-)
Better than Miller, or Coors. I fill my cooler with this when I go fishin, or other occasions where lots of canned beer is appropriate.
